Summary: We did quite a bit of research for our Disneyland trip (we stayed at the Fairfield 10 years ago and it was fine), and we kept seeing great reviews for the CCI so we booked it a few months out. We are SO happy we did! What a charming, friendly, convenient, clean, and pleasant place to stay.  Our vacation got off to a rough start with a surprise blizzard in Vancouver that almost cancelled our flight. After a long day of frustrating travel my credit card wouldn’t work (even though it was empty and I had advised the bank of our travel dates). As I was standing barefoot outside our room at the CCI battling my poor cellphone reception and long hold times, a CCI employee came over to me, smiled, and placed a small rug down in front of my feet to stand on—it was such a much-needed,
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Third Visit - Everything was Great (except the shuttle changes)
Summary: This was our 3rd visit and the first since the refurbishment.  The new rooms were great.  Breakfast was still great.  The pool area was still great.  The grounds were still beautiful - even for February.  Housekeeping is still a tad slow (we left our room one day for 11 hours and came back and it still hadn't been serviced), but I give them a pass on that one since I suspect they are understaffed like many hotels/motels.  My only issue with the new changes at the Candy Cane was the change to the free shuttle to the park.  Before the refurbishment, there were 2 busses each hour which was very convenient since it meant you only had to wait a max of 25 min or so if you just missed a but.  But now there is only one bus each hour which makes it very difficult if you have someone who
Room tip:
Housekeeping is slow. Sometimes rooms are not serviced until 4-5pm.
Also, you can load on the...
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hooked on the Candy Cane Inn!
Summary: I switched our Disney vacation package last minute when I saw there was an opening at the Candy Cane Inn!  So glad we did.  It is an adorable, quaint property - the landscaping and care they take to the property is evident everywhere.  The trees, paving, flowers, vines make you feel like you are in an oasis.  My boys loved the breakfast selection and I loved the ham and cheese croissant!   The shuttle/trolley was a highlight of our trip.  It leaves on the hour to Disneyland and returns from the park 15 after each hour.  Bring cash to leave tips for the drivers.  There is plenty of seating.  The only time people had to stand was the first shuttle after fireworks - there are railings to hold on to for taller people.   James was a fun and entertaining driver.  He played Disney
Room tip: 7-11 next door is super convenient for snacks etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: 5 stars for the closest boutique hotel to the Disney gate!
Summary: This hotel and all of its special attention to its guests is absolutely unbeatable! All of the little details in the rooms and the property itself are perfection. When we arrived for my grandsons 5th birthday they had a little gift waiting for him in the room, he was beyond excited! The delivery of a continental breakfast to the premium rooms is so convenient! (No throwing on clothes to have hot Freshed brewed coffee at your specified time) FREE PARKING and FREE Shuttle to Disney! AMAZING! Employees made sure we had everything we needed and did it with a smile❤️ cannot wait to return.
Room tip: Free parking and free shuttle to Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary: Been staying here since the late 80’s and it is still our go to hotel. The remodel is absolutely fabulous! We stayed in the smallest room there this trip and it was absolutely perfect. I don’t have one single complaint. From the comfy beds to the very substantial breakfast offering it was a great stay. If you don’t want to walk the two short blocks to the parks James will take you in the new trolley. Magic Key holders get a discount as well as AAA and a few others. We will be there again next month.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just returned from an amazing stay at Candy Cane Inn. The renovation was beautiful. From the grounds to the front desk and the room to the breakfast area, we couldn't have asked for a better experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and everything was new. The decor was cute, whimsical and modern. The property was well lit, clean and very safe with security on the premises.   The continental breakfast was well stocked, delicious and excellent way to start our morning before heading to Disneyland. Short 10 minute walk to the park entrance or take advantage of the complimentary shuttle for service every hour to and from the park. Thank you for making this a memorable first Disney trip for my kids. We love the Candy Cane Inn and will be back
Room tip: Very close to Anaheim Garden Walk and lots of dining options to use Door Dash or Grub Hub.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were so relieved that the Candy Cane Inn finally reopened a month before our visit.  Everything was really lovely.        We had one small maintenance issue, but by the time I got back to my room after mentioning it to the front desk, maintenance was already attending to it.        I really liked that the breakfast buffet served Chobani yogurt instead of the cheapo runny kinds you usually see.  They also had Gala apples (I think) instead of Red Delicious.  Nice details.      We were in a ground-level room near the back and it was plenty quiet at night.        We felt that for the convenient location, nice breakfast, pretty rooms and immaculate ground, the price was a good value.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel. I'm pleased to hear that the minor maintenance issue was fixed promptly and I sincerely apologize that it happened. We take great pride in our breakfast and I'm glad you enjoyed the quality. Thank you for your review. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is a beautiful property, and a 10 min. walk from disneyland. They even have a free shuttle if desired. This has been completely remodeled over the past 3 years. THE staff is very accommodating and friendly. The cleanest, and nicest place we've stayed and at a great value. HIGHLY recommended!
Manager Response: Hi, thank you for the wonderful feedback. I'm pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our newly remodeled hotel. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: The perfect choice for our Disney vacation
Summary: We stayed for 6 nights for our Disney vacation. The recent renovation was beautifully done and the entire hotel is fresh, clean and very warm and welcoming. It’s a perfect complement to a Disney holiday.   Our room was very nice and clean. I only wish there was more space for clothes as the 2 drawers were not quite enough for my family if 4 so we had to mostly live out of our suitcases. That’s my only negative comment for this review, but I figured that was worth mentioning.  The shuttle runs on-time, every hour and is a quick 5 min ride to the park or you can easily walk 5 min to the park entrance. We timed our walk with our 3 and 5 year old kids and it took us exactly 5 mins. The shuttle was a nice option if you need to give your feet a break and the shuttle schedule was easy
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wish we could have stayed longer! Charming, friendly hotel within walking distance to the parks.
Summary: The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were beautiful. We stayed in the premium queen bed room-decor, bed, bathrooms- everything was clean and pretty. This was our 4th time staying here. It’s within walking distance to the parks. They have a great breakfast. Although we didn’t utilize the pool, it looked pretty and inviting. I would highly recommend candy cane inn !
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great service! Awesome room (I suggest upgrading to the premier room)--spacious, clean and comfy beds. Ten minute walk to DL; although, there's an adorable, old-school trolley. Complimentary breakfast.  We got two premier rooms for under the price of one room at the Grand. Still the best value, for sure!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just got home from Disney and we ended up staying at The Candy Cane Inn for the 1st time.   I was a little shocked to see negative reviews here and while I can't comment on how prior guests reservations were canceled etc I can say that I know ALOT of guests love this hotel as also shown in pre-remodel reviews and are excited for them to finally be open after a headache of permits they had to wait for which was out of their control!  With that said I would like to share my review here from my actual recent stay on the property.    The CC Inn came recommended by a group I'm in and definitely did not disappoint! Their rooms are beautiful and fully remodeled, staff was beyond amazing and we had a absolute fabulous stay. Huge shot out to Mark for being awesome and helping me book a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay/ Percy location
Summary: We absolutely loved our stay. We were there from 12/29/22-1/2/23 We had stayed here in 2020 just because Covid and were so excited to book again.  After a long wait they finally opened back up.  The renovation was done very nicely. The lobby area is very nice and clean, our room was clean with new beds, wall decor, new bathroom fixtures and nice bedding. Our room was very quiet. The breakfast area was nicely redone and breakfast was good. There was plenty to choose from. The pool was beautiful and the landscape and parking was nice. The best part of the whole stay was the great customer service, from check in/ out and great service at breakfast, the amenities of free parking and shuttle are so nice. We only used the shuttle a couple of times but it was nice to know it was always
Manager Response: Greetings, Thank you for returning and for being a loyal Candy Cane Inn Guest. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay in our newly renovated hotel. Thank you for the positive review, we will make sure to share it with the staff. We look forward to many more visits in the near future.

Summary: Very impressed with the newly renovated inn. I had booked this 2 months ago not knowing if their opening date would get pushed backed. I stayed from 12/27-12/30. Huge thank you to Mark who called me to let me know the room I originally wanted was available and he assisted with changing the reservation. All staff was very attentive and pleasurable. Very short walk to Disney with reassurance of a shuttle if I did not want to walk. Breakfast was various selections of items from cereal, donuts, toast and breakfast sandwiches. Rooms were reasonably priced, quiet, beautifully updated, colorful, and  roomy for the 2 of us. Plenty of tables in a covered area or by the pool. Pool/spa area is beautiful as well. Landscape is clean and appealing. Definite 5 star and look forward to staying
Manager Response: Greetings, Thank you for staying with us and for taking the time to leave such a detailed review. Mark is one of our top agents and I'm delighted to hear he provided excellent service. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We were so grateful that Candy Cane Inn opened back in time for Christmas. We've had many great memories with this place as our family has grown. Let me just start out by saying that this place did a great job renovating. Not only did the place get a fresh new feel, but it also kept all the things we've always loved about the place: great breakfast, heated pool and hot tub, friendly staff, and premium rooms that come with those extras that make you feel pampered. Candy Cane Inn also has a new shuttle bus to deliver you to the happiest place on earth: Disneyland. They will also pick you up and take your tired feet back to your room.  The front lobby has some beautiful glass doors for their entry, happy & friendly staff, and fruit infused water & coffee.  The rooms look great with
Manager Response: Greetings, Thank you for sharing your experience and for being a loyal Candy Cane Inn Guest. We are very grateful for guests like yourself that have supported our family owned hotel over the years. Glad you enjoyed our Premium room and the extra amenities included. Not only are we magical but we continue to be a great value. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I feel I have to comment on the negative posts.  We have always enjoyed our stays at Candy Cane Inn. We were excited to book for our upcoming trip in November.  I was disappointed when a few weeks ago, they informed us that DUE TO A SITUATION BEYOND THEIR CONTROL they had to cancel our reservation. We were given plenty of notice. It is a well known fact that Anaheim is difficult for businesses to navigate through.  Sorry but I find it unlikely that anyone was not notified that they had been denied the necessary permits to reopen. The notice was probably sent to your spam box.   Hotels around Disneyland were so gracious when the parks closed and in most cases refunded non refundable bookings.  This was not a case of overbooking or losing a reservation.  If the hotel was unable to
Manager Response: none

Summary: To anyone who books this place be careful.  I booked this hotel October 4-7 2022  This hotel never send me a confirmation number or even email me that they had canceled my stay… When i called to confirm my stay nothing was said about the construction… or even they had canceled my stay.   We get there and everything was shut down due to construction/ making sure things were up to code….The people there didn’t know I was not informed. My granddaughter was crying and ask if we have to sleep outside in the dirt… All they said was we’re sorry for the inconvenience…I even asked where are we to stay at now.. no answer. My daughter was trying to find a place for us.. We had to stay with my son and his family at their hotel till we found a place.   What can you really say about this
Manager Response: none

Summary: Visiting Disneyland on a cross country road trip with a 3 year-old in September 2022. Was driving through Wyoming with spotty phone service when I received an email canceling the entire reservation. It blamed county inspectors and took no responsibility.   Was able to contact a specialist in Anaheim hotels. They told me there was nothing available for under $1000 a night near Disneyland. I eventually was able to book a hotel in another city. Not the walking to the park Disneyland vacation I was looking for our 3 year-old.   The hotel didn’t even attempt to help us after stranding us 2600 miles (over 4000 km) from home. I had heard for years how wonderful the motel was and what great customer service they had. This is no longer the case.
Manager Response: none

Summary: DO NOT BOOK HERE!  This hotel just cancelled our reservation that we made asthey are under renovation and their reservations are completed. They just sent an email today and our reservation in 12 days.  Now we have nothing!  They listed some available hotels in the area that they looked into but they would require us moving hotels twice during our reservation!  NOTHING is available for the dates we need around there now that it is this late!!  And all they offered was a 50 credit if we come back another time!   WHAT A JOKE!!  Such a disappointment.  Obviously my family has been looking forward to this holiday for a long time and they just ruined it!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fun Place To Stay & Close To Disneyland
Summary: What an amazing place to stay, lovely spacious rooms, full on breakfast by the pool and quick walk to Disneyland, I just loved it and have recommended Candy Cane Inn to all my friends. They even have a shuttle bus to take you to Disneyland if you like.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our room  at Candy  Cane Inn Was Amazingly  perfect  You  walk  in   beds  felt  awsome   the  bathroom   had  a  mirror    shower  table  to eat on  refridgratior  great  for keeping drinks  cold .  Got up early  ate breakfast  got dressed  went to Disneyland  got  there early  went on  alot of rides  had lunch  around 2 pm  at the  plaza inn   ate chicken  . The goal is to  go  early as you can  get  to the gate   we  got  on the rides  early did not have to wait  I will go again when It opens  this year  Cheryl
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The trip that COVID cancelled, twice.
Summary: This review is going to be a little different.  We were scheduled for a school choir competition at Disneyland.  It was cancelled due to COVID.  The hotel staff were amazing.  We had a Girl Scout trio planned for end of summer.  No worries, can you put our deposit on the future reservation? Yes.  Yesterday I had to cancel the room again.  I can’t tell you how genuinely nice the staff were with these changes and final cancellation.  While we didn’t get to stay as planned. The service I received will definitely bring us back on our next trip!  Thank you Candy Cane for being a bright spot during such a dark time!
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you for taking a moment to share your recent experience. We are grateful for your kind words and are delighted to hear about your positive experience with our staff. Our hotel staff genuinely care about providing the best service possible to our all of our guests or future guests. We hope to accommodate at another time. Thank you.

Summary: Stayed at Candy Cane now 3 times . We will be back. Love this place , always clean , comfy beds , very quiet and so close to Disney and lots of nice food places in walking distance.  The Breakfast is absolutely fantastic by the pool , great way to start the day..  Highly Recommend Candy Cane if you are visiting Disney Parks are only about 5 min walk or there is a courtesy bus ..
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: When things go back to normal, book this hotel
Summary: We stayed here for ten days from the 23rd February, we had a large room with two queen sized beds that were a bit squeaky but comfortable, the pillows not so great but we found the pillows in many hotels uncomfortable. Having timber floors made the room feel larger, plus they were clean, the whole unit was cleaned every day very well. The bathroom was a toilet and shower over the bath, I judge a hotel a lot on its linen and towels, the Candy Cane Inn use excellent products. There were two things that we were not so thrilled about, the extractor fan in the bathroom was SO loud, we had to wait for hot water to come through the pipes, which meant wasting some water whilst waiting for hot water, frustrating but not a deal breaker. Having a laundry was fabulous as we were traveling
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Really beautiful and so close to Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed our stay here, the grounds are beautiful, staff is super friendly and it is only a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. We didn't use the free shuttle but it was nice to have the option. Very close to a convenience store if needed. Room was clean, just enough space for 3 adults and a child. Continental breakfast was fresh daily (coffee is super hot!). Very nice pool and jacuzzi. Beds were comfortable, our only complaint was terrible pillows. We stayed 4 nights. We have stayed at on and off site hotels and for the price would definitely consider staying here again( and bring our own pillows). The recommended Karmel shuttle to airport worked well.
Manager Response: Hi, Kreynolds626 Thank you for your kind review. I'm happy to hear that you enjoyed our rooms, grounds, and breakfast during your stay. I sincerely apologize about our pillows being terrible and I will make sure to share that with my housekeeping manager.  I'm glad to hear that your airport transportation with Karmel Shuttle worked well. Thank you for staying us.

Summary: My husband's birthday was on the 22nd of February, and we stayed at Candy Cane Inn for 3 nights.  When we came in, my husband had a nice birthday card on the night stand, (from the manager) with a cookie goodie bag; so adorable and so cute! We always stay at Candy Cane Inn when we do come with our annual passes to Disneyland because it feels like our home outside of AZ.  Our room this time had the most comfortable area in the corner on the bottom, with nice new flooring, super comfortable beds, and hot showers.  I noticed new packaging on the toiletries and it looks really high end.  I always love the ice machine because its so fast and mega crushed for our drinks.  Plus yes, the room is always 100% clean to the max.  We love the shuttle so much because after a 12 hour day at
Manager Response: Hi AZRebeccaG-B, Thank you for staying with us and letting us be a part of your husband's birthday trip. I'm pleased to hear he enjoyed the birthday gift. We thank you for your review and look forward to many more pleasant visits.

Summary: Perfect location - great price - walkable - will come again. The breakfast was adequate for a breakfast buffet. We never used the shuttle but we saw lots of people on it - so that’s an option if you need it.
Manager Response: Greetings DaisyBlue999, Thank you for choosing to stay at our property and for your kind review. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This hotel is a gem!  We stayed here midweek. Very quiet, and very clean. It's on the same side of the street as Disneyland main entrance, 7 min. walk.  I'm 79, no problem for me to walk it.  Breakfast OK, the usual continental stuff, but had ham and cheese croissants, one of which went into the backpack for lunch at Disneyland.  BEFORE YOU GO to Disneyland, check out the gift shop in the hotel lobby, because they have much the same souvenirs as in Disneyland for PENNIES i.e., Mouse ears head bands for $6 vs $30 in Disneyland (!!!).  Key chains for $2.50 vs $6.  Free parking a bonus.  Very accomodating staff.  AAA discount.
Manager Response: Greetings janR5700YK, Thank you for staying at our property while visiting Disneyland. I'm pleased to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to the entrance  and that it only took you 7 minutes to walk. We also have a complimentary shuttle that takes you to and from the parks every half hour for those who prefer to save their feet. Thank you for your kind review.  We look forward to accommodating you and your family in the near future.

Summary Heading: Our go to place for Disneyland
Summary: Having a family of young adults who LOVE Disneyland we have made many trips there. After staying at most of the hotels in the area, we no longer go anywhere other than The Candy Cane Inn. Staff is great. Rigo has never disappointed us, Always taking care of our many changes and requests. Rooms feel like HOME and the grounds and pool are kept up as if they were part of Disneyland. Location couldn't be better. in the shadow of Cars Land. Throw in a breakfast that has yet to disappoint and there is no need to shop around. Great experiences each  visit and we go over six times a year. It's comforting to have a go to place so we can concentrate on maximizing our visits to the Happiest Place on Earth.
Manager Response: Greetings 468brianb, Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for taking the time to share your experiences at our hotel. I'm delighted to hear that we are your hotel of choice while visiting the Happiest Place on Earth. It's always a pleasure to assist you and your family and I look forward to seeing you soon.

Summary: I've stayed at the Candy Cane Inn many times, from a couple days to a week.  It is a very old, very conservative inn on the same side of the street as Disneyland.  It takes about 5 minutes to walk to Disneyland from the inn but there is a shuttle every 30 minutes.  There is a continental breakfast near the pool.  The bagels are good and there is fresh fruit.  The pool and hot tub are very clean.  The rooms are clean and everything works in all the rooms I've stayed in, but this inn has been around since Disneyland opened and I talked with one of the maintenance guys the other day and he said he has been there for 27 years.  I can't say enough good things about the Candy Cane Inn.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for choosing to stay at our property during your visit to Disneyland. I'm glad you enjoyed our complimentary amenities and the cleanliness of our rooms and property. We are very lucky and proud to have a wonderful staff that has been working at our hotel for many years. Thank you for your kind words and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This resort was the perfect distant to Disneyland Park. Our room was ready early in the morning (around 9 am) which was a pleasant surprise as we were thinking we would only be able to check our bags. We were upgraded to a premium room which gave us a welcome basket and the option the have the free continental breakfast delivered to us via room service in the morning. The room was spacious and comfortable. Can’t beat the free breakfast and free parking. Overall a great experience and I wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again.
Manager Response: Hi ClairefZ6850YW, Thank you for staying with us during your visit to the Disneyland parks. We are glad you enjoyed our premium room and extra amenities. We are very grateful for your kind review. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I have to say staying at the candy cane is like bring home!!! All the staff are incredible....but our favorite at the front desk is James S.!!!!!  He is always friendly and helpful and goes out of his way to make sure your trip is epic!!!! I just celebrated my 50th bday and I wouldn’t have wanted to stay anywhere else!!! ❤️❤️❤️
Manager Response: Hi Stacey22497, Thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel during such a special celebration. I will make sure and share your praises with James and the staff. We are pleased to be your home away from home and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This hotel has a great location and maybe has great rooms unless you end up in a room facing the street on ground floor. The receptionist said it shouldn’t be too bad when I asked to get another room. In actual fact it’s not just bad, it’s extremely bad! In addition to the street noises  you hear all the People walking past, it’s kind of they walk past your bed which we found scary.  A very disappointing stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this wonderful hotel! The grounds are absolutely gorgeous! Pool and hot tub were a welcoming place to relax after a day of walking at Disney. Everything is so clean and well taken care of, it feels like an extension of the Disney parks level of detail! Breakfast had a lot to choose from even for my picky little eater. The best part is that when I was checking in I was asked if I was a AAA member and that dropped our nightly rate by $10 ... I would’ve completely forgotten to even ask about the discount being that we were so excited to be there and start our vacation. I really appreciated the check-in staff because it didn’t feel rushed and that small discount saved me almost a $100 ... thank you! The reliable shuttle bus to the parks was
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank your choosing to stay at our property. We take great pride in providing excellent customer service and I'm pleased to hear you experienced it during your stay. I'm glad you and your family were able to enjoy our complimentary continental breakfast and shuttle. We thank you for your review and hope to see you soon.

Summary: Sadly, I have to revise a previous glaring review.  This place is definitely not keeping up with the times, though their prices are. We have stayed here for years and years, and I think that our last time will indeed be our last time here. Partly because our family is getting older and our family of four can no longer fit in these rooms.  Even the deluxe room that we rented this past trip does not provide what we need.   The parking lot has seemingly been made to accommodate more cars, however, I am wondering if this was done by making the existing spaces smaller.  We have an SUV that even when my wife guided me in, did not fit between the lines and we were literally over the line, making every other space around us that much smaller.  If you drive a compact car, like a smart
Manager Response: Hi Phyrman21, Thank you for staying with us on your recent trip to the Anaheim Area. I'm sorry to hear that our Deluxe Room did not provide your family of 4 the space needed. We do offer larger Premium Rooms with 2 queen bed which also offer some extra amenities.  We are in the planning stages of a room renovation to maximize space inside the rooms and provide all the necessary upgrades. We hope we can accommodate you and your family in the near future.

Summary Heading: WHAT A GEM VERY CLOSE TO DISNEYLAND
Summary: Great  property, great service, quiet and close, 10 minute walk from Disneyland. Easy checkin, had a premium guest room, was at back of property and offers turn down, they deliver breakfast from a menu you place on the door before you go to bed. Quiet, clean and well kept, and very friendly service... FREE PARKING>>>Small gift  shop on property, and has a very large gift and accessory shop right next door, that has about everything you would need if you left something at home or needed more goodies...We loved this place so much it will be our disney hotel destination in the future.Thanks Candy Cane Inn
Manager Response: Hi George S. ,  Thank you for choosing to stay at our property and for taking a moment to share your great experience. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We had a great time at the Candy Cane Inn for our daughter’s 4th birthday. Check in was delightful and we were able to check in 2 hours early. I do not understand the bad reviews. the carpet was clean in our premium room and the staff was always kind and thoughtful. The pool and jacuzzi was fantastic. Our breakfast great and brought to our room in the cutest basket. There was no noise that was bothersome and we slept well in our comfortable beds. We are loving (at this very moment) lounging in our room after 3 days of walking through the parks. We used the shuttle almost very time. It was always on time. Thank you Candy Cane Inn. We were there in 2013.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for staying with us during your daughter's 4th birthday celebration and for taking a moment to review our hotel. I'm pleased to hear you enjoyed our premium amenities as well as our complimentary shuttle. We hope to see you soon. Thank you.

Summary: Beautiful, older property, very well maintained. The staff is wonderful, friendly, and honest. The beds are comfy. Love the location and the shuttle, which is great after walking 14 hours at Disneyland. Pricing is reasonable. Our favorite place to stay!
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for your kind review. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for two nights between Christmas and New Years and found this classic motel to be clean, comfortable and incredibly well-situated. The grounds are impeccably kept and lush with gorgeous landscaping.  The free parking was available to us the morning of our check-in day and for the remainder of our check-out day which meant we could enjoy the parks on both those days without worrying about finding parking.  The walk to the main entrance of the parks takes about 10 minutes, and the free shuttle is reliable and very useful after a long day of walking in the parks. The room (#268) was well appointed with a flat screen tv, coffee maker, ironing board and though it showed subtle signs of wear and tear, it felt spotlessly clean and very well maintained.
Manager Response: Hi, Thank you for staying with us during your Disneyland trip. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to accommodating you in the future.

Summary: After returning from another wonderful stay at our favorite home away fom home I discovered that I was missing some of my credit cards & gift cards.  After searching every place I could think of I realized that I must have left them in the safe in our room. I contacted James at the front desk and he told me that he would look into it and get back to me.  A couple hours later James let me know that, as I expected, my cards were in the safe. The cards were mailed back to me priority mail. I didn't think I could love the Candy Cane Inn and all the staff any more that I already did but I do.   Thank you James, Rigo, Nick, Danny....all the service staff, the shuttle drivers... I love you guys!! My sister and I will never stay anyplace else.
Manager Response: Hi Lisa V, Thank you for sharing your recent experience on tripadvisor. I'm pleased to hear that your items were found and mailed to you right away. I will share your praise with the staff members mentioned. We thank you and your sister for choosing our hotel during your trips to Anaheim. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: BEWARE of deceptive information provided by their Booking people
Summary: I made the reservation for this stay months before my trip, having quite a lengthy discussion with the individual booking the stay. BEWARE of the information you receive! I was told the hotel had a view of California Adventure Cars Land and you could see the nightly fireworks show from the balcony of your room. First of all, there are NO balconies with these rooms. In fact, there are no windows even facing California Adventure. The only available view from ANY room is of the hotel parking lot. What they call 'your room balcony' is the outside walk-way that runs the length and width of the hotel in front of ALL the rooms, just like a Motel 6. If you want to see the fireworks you need to walk to the corner of the outside walkway and peer between the rooms to see the fireworks in
Manager Response: Hi Kaylah394,  I want to apologize for the inconvenience experienced during your check in.  It is not our intention to mislead or provide false information to our guests. I have addressed this with my team to better communicate our great location to our guests.  I am glad to hear that you were able to enjoy our Premium amenities like turn down service, breakfast delivery, and our shuttle. Thank you for your review.

Summary: I have been meaning to write this review for a while.  We stay at the Candy Cane Inn every time we go to Disneyland and we love it!!  But I just really want to make a special mention of the bus driver, Mr. Fred.  My 6 yr. old grandson is very shy and has anxiety issues, but he bonded with Mr. Fred so much!  Mr. Fred was just so kind to him and really caring and sweet every time we got on the bus.  My grandson even wanted to have his picture taken with Mr. Fred our last night.  Please tell Mr. Fred how much we appreciate his kindness and we hope to see you all next year.
Manager Response: Greetings! I'm delighted to hear that your grandson enjoyed his experience on our shuttle and even bonded with our driver Fred. Fred has been with us for over 15 years and is a favorite among our guests. We thank thank you for sharing your experience and look forward to your visit next year.

Summary Heading: Why have we never stayed here before?!
Summary: We just spent a week at the Candy Cane Inn during the middle of November (right before Thanksgiving). I honestly cannot say enough great things. We visit Disneyland every year but have never had the pleasure of staying here and we cannot figure out why! We have always paid MUCH MORE to stay at properties that are farther away and not near as lovely.   First I'll address the usual suspects. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous! The rooms are lovely! (they are updated and super duper clean- I love the hard wood floors). Beds are comfortable and everything is nice and quiet- although you can hear the fireworks at night but this is fun for the kids. The pool area is fabulous! Clean and just the right temp. We truly enjoyed the hot tub each day of our visit. The breakfast gets a
Manager Response: Hi Amanda H. ,  We thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel and we are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay. We take great pride in maintaining our grounds, providing clean rooms, and delivering great customer service. Thank you for sharing the breakfast tips. We do offer breakfast delivery to our Premium rooms for our guest convenience. Our perfect location makes for a brief walk to park entrances but we also provide our shuttle to and from the parks for those days you prefer to avoid the extra steps. We thank you for your review and hope to be your hotel of choice when visiting the Disneyland parks.

Summary: First time here and would highly recommend. Have visited Anaheim a number of times and previously stayed somewhere else for most visits but was disappointed last time with the lack of customer service. So this time we decided to change and chose The Candy Cane Inn. We were happy right from the time we checked in and the good experience continued right through. Courtesy bus to Disneyland timely and efficient with friendly drivers especially Cesar. Thanks! It is also not too far to walk if you want. Hotels in this area are always telling you how good they are and most aren’t. But the Candy Cane Inn lives up to their claims. Only one thing they could fix is the breakfast area. Only 4 tables inside and on a wet day nowhere to sit. We chose a package that allowed us to get room
Manager Response: Hi Richard K, Thank you for choosing to stay at our hotel during your recent family trip. We are delighted to hear that you were impressed with our friendly and accommodating staff. We appreciate your feedback in regards to the seating arrangement as we are always looking for ways to improve. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: If there were more stars then 5, Candy Cane Inn gets them. It's just such an awesome place to stay when visiting the Disneyland Resort or anyplace else in the area. Most importantly, it's so comfortable staying here. Rooms are always fresh and clean.  Parking is included. It's convenient to get to Disneyland.  You can walk or they have their own shuttle  that serves the Candy Cane only.  It runs twice per hour.  They have the best included breakfast anywhere.  This is not your 'typical' continental breakfast. They have hot /cold cereal, muffins, crescents, bagels, toast. Also hard boiled egss, cheese bites, yogurt.  And now they have ham/cheese crescents.  Coffee, tea, juices, milk.  Fresh fruit. Just so much to choose from. Have a nice relaxing breakfast by the pool, great
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for leaving such a wonderful review of our hotel. We are grateful for your repeat business. We thank you for staying with us and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Our stay at the Candy Cane Inn was fantastic! Comfortable and clean rooms, friendly staff, great free shuttle service that was always on time, and a good breakfast. Everything was well maintained and the location is perfect.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for staying with us and reviewing our property. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is our second year staying at the Candy Cane Inn. Wish we had found this place sooner. We stayed in a premium room Nov 10-15. Checked in at 830 am, they held our luggage and our room was ready by 300. It was clean, and in the back which is away from the busy street. We love the premium room. It’s comfortable and big enough for our family of 5. Beds were great- had a restful sleep every night. Room was quiet. Ordered breakfast the night before and it was delivered every morning. Food is so yummy. Lots of choices to make everyone happy. Free shuttle ran all day,but walking to the parks was about 10 minutes.  From the minute we arrived everyone was courteous and professional.  Will be staying here every year for our annual Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your experience. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay in our Premium Room and glad you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and shuttle. We look forward to your annual visits!

Summary: We stayed here 6-1/2 years ago when we brought our grandson to Disneyland and we loved it. This time we brought our granddaughters (and their parents) and it was even better. They had room 247 and we had 250, which was the same room we had before. These are premium rooms and you fill out a sheet at night with the items that you want for breakfast and what time to bring it. That is huge when you are trying get it together before another day at the park. The housekeeping staff is great as are the front desk staff. They even have menus for placed that deliver to the Inn. I doubt that we'll be returning to the area anytime soon, but this is where we would stay.
Manager Response: Greetings! We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the extra amenities provided in our Premium Rooms. Thank you for choosing our hotel once again and for sharing your experience on Tripadvisor. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great for Disneyland and the Convention Center
Summary: I first stayed at the Candy Cane Inn in 2014. The place has definitely improved since then. I am so happy to see it improving each time we return.  The staff has always been one of the best parts and that continues.   The rooms are well maintained, the beds were firm but comfortable. Nice soft and fluffy towels and lots of them.  I had a room with two double beds and it was a reasonable size.  The bathroom was also a very reasonable size and, even better, it made good use of the space. I never felt cramped while using it. In the past, I didn't like their soap/shampoo but what they are using now was perfect. It had a very neutral scent and I used all their products for the whole trip.  The included breakfast had great coffee. The food choices were all the breakfast basics...
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your experience on tripadvisor. We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed your stay and the location of our property. We are conveniently located near the Disneyland Parks and the Convention Center. We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience and are constantly making small upgrades to our rooms and services. We will improve the bathroom lighting during our planned room renovation next year. We thank you again for leaving a thorough review of our property and hope to be your hotel of choice for your future visits.

Summary: We were planning a family visit to Disneyland and looked at all the hotels within walking distance.  We normally visit Disney World and stay on the property.  We looked at that in Anaheim, but the options were limited, so we ventured off park.  We are delighted that we did, because we found the Candy Cane, which delivers all the atmosphere and experience of a Disney property at a fraction of the cost in Anaheim.  First, the desk staff were fantastic.  We all arrived at different times over 2 days, yet we had 3 rooms next to each other.  Considering the guest turnover they experience, that had to have taken some extra effort on their part and was most appreciated.  We had not even asked for that as it seems to be an impossibility at most hotel chains these days.  The
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for choosing to stay with us on your recent visit to Disneyland. We are delighted to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay as well as the hospitality of our friendly staff. We pride ourselves in providing a welcoming environment to all of our guests. Our continental breakfast provides many options for our guests to begin their day and we're glad that you enjoyed it. I want to thank you again for staying with us and for providing such a detailed review of our property. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We've stayed here many times and this time did not disappoint. The breakfast is good and fills you up for a full day in Disneyland, and the rooms & grounds are very well kept. The staff is also so wonderful, friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for staying with us and for leaving a review of our hotel. We hope to accommodate you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Great choice for a Disneyland visit
Summary: I stayed at Candy Cane Inn 20 years ago with my then 4 year old daughter and remember really liking it for it's proximity to Disneyland, dedicated shuttle and good breakfast.  Well I just stayed there again with my now adult daughter and this hotel is still awesome.  Our relatives all stayed on property, and some of them walked farther to the turnstiles than we did.  For a fraction of the cost, we enjoyed a very nice, quiet room with plenty of drawers, shelves, and bathroom vanity space for 2 women, a very quick walk, like 10 minutes or less, down the same side of Harbor Blvd. to get to the parks, an extremely reliable shuttle when we didn't feel like walking, really friendly staff, free parking, and a really tasty and plentiful breakfast.  I was in heaven and don't want to stay
Manager Response: Hi Jennifer S. ,  Thank you for choosing to come back and stay at our property. We know you have many options and we are grateful you chose us once again. We are pleased to hear you enjoyed your room, location of our hotel and our continental breakfast. Thank you for sharing your recent experience and for taking such wonderful pictures. We hope to see you back soon.

Summary: We love staying at this place so much that I almost don’t want to write and talk about it in fear too many people will bombard it. It’s a small quaint hidden treasure of Disneyland. We love the peace and tranquility setting this place provides. The staff is wonderful (especially James). He’s been here for years and always willing to help! They have always been so good to us guests. Sandra works in the dining area and is always so friendly and smiles. I like this place so much that I don’t ever look to find any other hotels so if Candy Cane is sold out, we just don’t go. They give you an incentive to return ($10 off per night) within the following year. The beds are comfortable and the pool is nice. I like the ambiance of the pool with the soft music ... my kids really enjoy this
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for sharing your recent experience and giving a shout out to our wonderful staff members James and Sandra. We take great pleasure in providing a tranquil environment for families to enjoy. We are glad you and your family enjoyed your stay and we look forward to your next visit. Thank you.

Summary Heading: As always, a very relaxing stay
Summary: I've reviewed this property a few times, and it is always a pleasant visit. The rooms are small, but if you're there to spend time at Disneyland, then all you need is a bed and bathroom.  Also, the hotel offers a decent breakfast buffet. I would call it an expanded continental breakfast.  The service is very personable, especially the shuttle drivers. Nearly everyone on duty is friendly and happy to respond to a hello as I pass them by on the grounds. The access to the parks is very easy either by shuttle or on foot.  There's a Walgreens and a CVS pharmacy nearby for your needs, as well. If I had one thought to bring up is that the management is not visible, nor do they make themselves visible during your stay.  I'm surprised that the manager on duty doesn't make an appearance
Manager Response: Hi Mr. Carlsbad,  Thank you for staying with us once again and for taking the time to share your experiences. We are grateful that you continue to choose our property while Visiting the parks. Thank you for providing your valuable feedback as we are always looking to improve upon our guest experience. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: I really liked the staff at Candy Cane Inn, they were all really nice and helpful. The continental breakfast was ok with enough options that most people will be able to fine something suitable. The grounds are lovely and quaint, and even though our room was on the ground floor and close to the street it was still pretty quiet. But... The beds were an issue and the hotel intentionally made this the case. I noticed my mattress felt like I dipped into a hole everytime I was on it, and as someone who likes soft mattresses I was surprised at how much it bothered me. Upon investigating I found that the hotel had put brand new mattresses upside down so I was laying on the spring side of the mattress. I am guessing the hotel does this to prolong the life of their mattresses, but these
Manager Response: Greetings! I want to sincerely apologize for the error on our part of leaving one of the mattresses upside down. It is our goal to provide a comfortable goodnight sleep and we are sorry that this was not the case from the beginning. We are glad you were able to enjoy your stay and found our mattress comfortable after the issue was corrected. We thank you for your feedback and look forward to your next visit.

Summary: My mom wanted to celebrate her 80th birthday in disneyland.24 family members packed their suitcases and traveled to California to create memories.four family members decided to go without mother knowing.we showed up at the Disney park, surprising mom.candy cane inn is so awesome.the breakfast by the pool,food was so delicious, swimming evenings after returning from a long day at Disneyland was so relaxing.the rooms was spacious and clean,we all slept well.the palm trees everywhere😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍😍.the employee s at check-in are delightful and the gift shop,my grandson loved.thank you for making our memory of mommy's 80th birthday complete!!
Manager Response: Greetings! We are grateful that you chose to stay  at our property during such an important celebration. We are glad to hear you enjoyed our serene environment and helpful staff. We hope to be your property of choice for many more birthday celebrations. Thank you for your review.

Summary: Love staying at this quaint motel.  Always, clean, comfortable. and usually affordable. Look forward to staying each time I visit Anaheim and Disneyland.  Close walk to Disneyland and has a very good continental breakfast.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for being a loyal Candy Cane Inn Guest and sharing your experience. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: What not to love? Lovely place, nice comfortable beds, pleasant staffs, good breakfast and the free shuttles.  The shuttles are always on time,  it's only a short walk to/from Disney if you want to walk. Plenty of restaurants and convenience stores around the hotel. I recommend this place to all my friends and family!
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for staying at our hotel. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Repeat Customers - because this venue is great
Summary: We are a family of four, travelling together with a motor vehicle.  We have our favorite rooms and request this when booking.    We use our AAA and repeat customer voucher to obtain best price each visit.  Rooms are clean and fresh, comes with a small fridge and microwave oven, flat screen TV and (new this year) an alarm clock with a USB port (yay, I no longer need to bring a conversion wall plug ever again!).  Parking: Free (with authority displayed on dashboard).  Security: In the middle of the grounds is a security hut.  At times (I saw a person sitting in this area and monitoring things.  We've never had any security issues with the unit, motor vehicle or other at any time.  Breakfast: New this year was the ham and cheese croissants (yum!).  All the other usual continental
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for being a repeat guest of our hotel and for sharing your review. Security is very important and we do have an overnight security guard patrolling our property to ensure the safety and security of our guests. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed the ham and cheese croissants which were added to our delicious breakfast this year. Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Rooms were clean staff was friendly breakfast had a great variety they had their own shuttle to Disneyland that ran every 20 minutes or so They also rented skooters for less than Disneyland did We enjoyed ourselves very much
Manager Response: Hi, Thank you for choosing to stay with us and sharing your experience. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Best Value for Disney visit I could imagine
Summary: Repeat visitors like many, now just me and husband, so pleasant and convenient. The walk to the park front gate seems shorter than walk from Disney Paradise Pier. The free shuttle takes about five minutes twice an hour in each direction when my feet were tired. It’s not a resort but it’s a pretty tropical landscape not jarring asphalt like many offsite properties. The rooms are fine, the continental breakfast is better than most, the pool and hot tub are shady and enjoyable, and the staff are very accommodating and helpful. We rented a scooter for my husband at the front desk on arrival, he drove to the parks each morning, and skipped the horrendous Disney line and cost. Ask for a first floor room if necessary. Free parking and frig is a rarity elsewhere. Can keep your car the
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review of our hotel. I'm pleased to hear that you are one of our loyal repeat guests. We strive to provide a pleasant stay and  excellent customer service to our guests. Our convenient location is just a short walk away from the main entrance but you could always board our shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to and from the park.  We take great pride in being a family owned hotel and creating a "home away from home" environment for our guests.

Summary Heading: Third visit here and still great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised by an upgrade in our room which provided us with a DVD player, turndown service nightly and a breakfast basket to our door each morning. The staff is great here—so nice and friendly.  The hotel fee includes free parking, free breakfast and a shuttle bus to Disneyland. They also accept AAA for a 10% discount.  We enjoyed the DVD player and the breakfast delivery saved us a lot of time in the morning with 4 of us to get ready for a day at the park. Would highly recommend!
Manager Response: Greetings! I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your complimentary upgrade and the extra amenities offered in our Premium Room. I hope you enjoyed one of our Disney Classic Movies in our Blu-Ray/DVD Library. Thank you for your review and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: MOST CONVENIENT HOTEL I HAVE BEEN TOO!!!
Summary: The hotel is a very good deal for families visiting Disneyland. Free continental breakfast that offers a great variety, free parking, and their shuttle is a leg saver. Beautiful grounds and courteos staff. First time staying and will definitely come back.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for sharing your experience. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This is our second visit to the Candy Cane Inn and it is still our favorite hotel in LA, one of my favorite hotels of all time and definitely among the hotels we stayed at in our 3 week road trip across the US.  I called in advance because we knew we wanted to stay here, and we requested a green room because I am sensitive to scents.  They are true to their word and very accommodating. The room was beautifully unscented, fresh, and the sheets were great.  And I love being able to open the door for more fresh air, although it is not necessary because even though this hotel has been around for some time, the rooms are up to date and fresh. We had a very quiet and very comfortable sleep. We very much relax and enjoy ourselves here.  More things we love about Candy Cane Inn:
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for sharing your recent experience here on tripadvisor. I am delighted that we were able to fulfill your request for a green room and you were able to enjoy your stay at our hotel. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This was our first time staying at the Candy Cane Inn and if we return to the Anaheim area, this will be our go-to place. The previous review by jimsig tells you all the details so I will not repeat. The rooms and property are immaculate! The staff is very helpful and friendly. Shuttle drivers were awesome! We were in room 237 and could see the fireworks at night. The property is quiet, too, so you can rest up for your marathon days at Disneyland! We stayed for four nights and never regretted our choice of hotel.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for choosing to stay with us while visiting Disneyland. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: This was our second stay in 2 years at the Candy Cane and it was another great stay.   After you stay they send you a $10 per night coupon off of your next stay to use with in a year.  I had to call to make my reservation but I was able to use that and stack a AAA discount of $10 a night to get $20 a night off the rate.  We booked a Standard 2 Queen Bed and I called a couple day before arrival to request a room on the second floor so we could easily see the fireworks and it was granted.  We were in room 225.  James was great at check in as was the rest of the staff when ever we saw them.  The free shuttle to Disneyland (on the hour and half hour) and back (at :15 and :45) is a big plus though it is just under a flat 10 min walk if the times don't work out.  Parking is free.
Manager Response: Greetings! Thank you for taking a moment to share your recent experience for fellow travelers to see. I am glad you enjoyed the location of your firework view room. Our onsite reservation team does a very good job in honoring requests and are here to assist with booking your reservations or to answer any question you might have during the process. We are glad you enjoyed your breakfast and thank you for the travel hack, we will make sure to share with others as well. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: We stayed here three nights for a visit to Disneyland. It is an older property, but well taken care of. It was incredibly convenient to the Disneyland parks (walking and taking the shuttle). Breakfast was good as well. The room and overall property were very clean. We thought it was a good value for the price and the convenience.
Manager Response: Hi,  Thank you for leaving a review of our property. We are glad you enjoyed your stay and we look forward to your next visit. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Outstanding Place To Stay For Disneyland California!!! Great Value!!!
Summary: The best hotel on or off site at Disneyland!  A 5 star in price, comfort & staff!  We have been staying here for more than 20 years & is just the best.  I have rarely found a hotel where they try so hard to make sure your stay is perfect.  They take the stress out of hotel worry!  I especially highlight JAMES at the front desk, always willing to answer your question, to assist, to offer a smile & a hello!  The best!  All of the stall are just brilliant!  The price is very reasonable, the beds super comfy, the room sizes work nicely.  A great value no matter how you look at it!  Super shuttle service, for free, good breakfast, nice pool, kiddie pool & hot tub for relaxing.  As close to the Disney gate as you can get.  STRONG RECOMMENDATION! Ihave no interest financially or
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best place to sty near Disneyland
Summary: I love this place. I could live there. It's quiet, the rooms are clean, the free breakfast is great, the pool is well maintained and the flowers and plants that are everywhere are gorgeous. It's an oasis of wonderfulness in Anaheim. Why anyone would want to stay in a huge chain hotel tower instead of this beautiful, quaint, cozy, clean motel is beyond me.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Our favorite hotel in the Disney area
Summary: We have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn a number of times and have never been disappointed. Rooms are pleasant and very clean and comfortable. Mini fridge is included as well as a safe. Price is reasonable for the area, grounds well kept, and free parking! They have a lovely pool area where they serve breakfast every morning. Breakfast is good with a number of choices. There are restaurants and pharmacies in the area surrounding the motel. And one of the biggest perks—it is within a 10 minute walk to Disneyland! They also have a shuttle to run you to the parks although we never took advantage of this since we always walked. We will stay at the Candy Cane Inn again next time we visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Greetings and thank you for taking a moment to share your recent experience. We are very proud of our breakfast and we are delighted to hear you enjoyed it. Our location is perfect as we are a short walk or ride on our courtesy shuttle away. We look forward to your next visit. Thank you.

Summary: I recently stayed at Candy Cane Inn at the suggestion of a friend.  It did not disappoint and exceeded my expectations. I am a frequent Disneyland visitor and have stayed at many of the area hotels and motels in the immediate area...including Disneyland Hotel and Disney's Paradise Pier.   What I really loved most about Candy Cane Inn was it's friendly staff, immaculately clean rooms and it's well taken care of grounds.  The Candy Cane Inn is an older property but has been well taken care of and updated. Candy Cane Inn has a lot of charm and a staff that is caring and personable like only a smaller property can offer.  The Candy Cane Inn has a complimentary shuttle that drops you off and picks you up at Disneyland and California Adventures entrance (even though it is only a 10
Manager Response: Hi, Thank you for recently staying with us as we know you have many options out there. We you enjoyed our staff and service as we pride ourselves in delivering excellent customer service and being attentive with our guests. All of our baked items served in our breakfast are fresh and delivered from local bakeries early in the morning for our guest to enjoy. Thank you for sharing your recent experience and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and location is perfect!
Summary: Assuming you are in Anaheim to visit Disneyland, this is a WONDERFUL location.  A shuttle to the park and hotel every 1/2 hour, or it's a 10 minute easy walk.  There are places to eat and Starbucks within 5 minute walk.  We had room 105, right next to the bus stop, very convenient to the pool and hot tub.  Great hot tub after walking all day. The staff and bus drivers couldn't be more friendly. The rooms and hotel are older but super clean!  The mattress on one bed was a bit worn but no worries the other bed was fine. Location and price and the staff are all great reasons to stay. We didn't notice noise except for kids yelling when they got back from the bus, parent's fault not the hotel.  You can see the fireworks a little from the upper rooms.   ''
Manager Response: Greetings,  Thank you for staying at our property. We are glad you enjoyed the location of the room as well as your stay. Our mattresses were replaced recently but we have addressed the issue mentioned Thank you for letting us know. We are grateful for your time and providing your feedback to our property. We look forward to accommodating you in the near future.

Summary: We stayed for 5 nights to do Disneyland. I stayed in the area ten years ago and was glad I found the Candy Cane Hotel! The room was clean. Beds are super comfy !! The breakfast was a fantastic start to our day, they even let us grab a few things before opening because we had a magic morning. We enjoyed the pool every afternoon! The shuttle bus was a god send after a looong day in the parks!  I will be booking again for Feb 2020.  I also found the laundry to be fantastic to get our washing done !!
Manager Response: Hi, Thank you for sharing your recent experience on tripadvisor. We are glad you enjoyed our guest laundry room and our breakfast. Although our breakfast hours are from 6:30 am to 9:30 am, our wonderful staff will setup earlier for the early magic morning guests.

Summary: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in a mid-tier room located on the first floor towards the back of the hotel (Room 139). The room felt a bit dated and was unfortunately located in the corner of the complex so received very little natural light. Despite this, the room was very comfortable, immaculately clean, and spacious. I liked the wooden window shutters and upgraded wood tile floor. The one complaint we had about the room was outside noise. We could hear the full conversations, hair dryers and carts/suitcases of our neighbors and passing guests and housekeepers. Quite annoying and felt like we had little privacy based on being able to hear the neighbors convos.  The breakfast was great - really high quality baked goods. It was a little carb heavy, some additional protein
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I have been staying at the Candy Cane Inn for the past 18 years and I realized I have never done a review.  I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel.  My daughter said it best on our recent stay "this feels like home, and the staff feels like family".  We started staying at the Candy Cane in when my daughter was 3.  She is now 21.  I would first like to mention the staff.  While there have been many new staff members over the last 18 years there are staff members we have known for almost if not the entire 18 years. From the manager Riggo, to front desk staff James and Dorothy, the shuttle drivers, and the housekeeping staff, etc. Every staff member is so incredibly kind and helpful.   They always go above and beyond to help in any way necessary.  I have
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have actually booked this hotel before and chickened out because the pics online made it seem dated and I was worried it wouldn’t be very nice. Boy was I wrong!!! The grounds are impeccably kept! It’s beautiful!  The check in was very fast and the people were nice.  Our room was beautiful! It was VERY clean and very comfortable!  We loved the wood/tile floors instead of carpet.  The layout of the room was great with the bathroom being around the corner from the bedroom.  The fridge was nice and cold!  (We love our diet cokes! :))the breakfast was so good! We love the ham and cheese croissants!  It was a treat eating breakfast by the pretty pool each morning!  The housekeepers were very efficient! We like to go to Disneyland early and come back to the room for a mid day
Manager Response: Greetings Brittandkell,  Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us and I am delighted that you enjoyed your visit. Cesar, as well as the rest of our stellar staff, thank you for recognizing their hard work and service. We are truly thankful that we will be your go to hotel for you Anaheim resort visits! We look forward to your next trip with us!

Summary Heading: beautiful property right next to disney
Summary: The candy cane is right next to disney, yet they have a free shuttle that runs every half hour to and from the park. After a lot of walking at disney, this is a life saver! The rooms are clean and well stocked with towels. The pool area is filled with flowers making the stay more resort like. Even with a lot of families with kids, we didn't hear any noise! For breakfast there are donuts from local bakerys that are out of this world. The parking is free (you are given a pass to display on your dash). We went to an Angels game during our stay. The stadium is about 3 mile away. When you pull out there is a cross walk, so traffic always stops and you can get out.
Manager Response: Greetings Mary H,  We here at the Candy Cane Inn strive to provide each and every guest with the best service, product and best possible stay and we thank you for recognizing that. We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope you had a great time at the Angels game! We do appreciate your kind words and look forward to seeing you again soon! Thank and have a wonderful day!

Summary: Our stay at the Candy Cane was absolutely perfect. The motel is quaint.  The rooms were impeccably immaculate. The free continental breakfast was fresh and delicious. The staff was friendly and helpful,  The free parking and the shuttle service to and from Disneyland amazingly convenient. The treats in each room were a welcomed surprise. Our grandchildren so enjoyed the freshly backed cookies. Thanks again for helping make our vacation a memorable one!  Carol H
Manager Response: Greetings Carol H,  Thank you for your kind words about our hotel, staff and amenities. We are so grateful your family enjoyed their cookies and their visit here. We hope to see you folks back real soon. Thanks and have a delightful day!

Summary: We took our daughter to Disneyland for her birthday and everything was great. I'm sure there are fancier places to stay but I prefer a low key environment and don't want to feel as if I'm entering an apartment building! The cobblestone driveway and fountain greet you as you enter and they by far have the most beautifully maintained grounds with flowers everywhere and ivy. The staff is among the nicest I have encountered in Anaheim and I have stayed at many other Hotels previous. It's a real family feel and they make you feel very welcome.From the convenient location you can choose to walk to Disneyland in 8 minutes or take the free shuttle which runs every half an hour. The same guy has been the driving the bus each year we are there and it's like seeing an old friend!

Within walking distance of the Disneyland Parks or the option of using the free shuttle service every half hour ensures your visit is hassle free. The rooms are clean and comfortable and enable time to relax after a full day of excitement...there is a pool if you feel like a refreshing swim. Convenience stores are located next door to pick up a late night snack...overall a perfect place to stay!

Although it's waking distance, the best feature of this hotel is the free shuttle service to and from the parks. It's an adequate hotel overall, but I would rather pay the same or less and stay at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel for the same or a cheaper price. I know this hotel has long time followers, but it's really just adequate overall--nothing exciting.

Countless independently operated motels thrive here too, most notably the cleaner and more-charming-than-usual Candy Cane Inn which offers nice but occasionally noisy rooms, and a courtyard pool at bargain prices. Loved the free breakfast, just enough variety that my family did not get bored over a 7 night stay. Summary Heading: Great Hotel at a Great Price
Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for the first time from Feb. 6-10, 2016.  Really can't say enough good things about this hotel.  We usually stay at Disney hotels at Walt Disney World in Florida.  During our one prior trip to Disneyland, we stayed at Disneyland Hotel.  But when a work trip took me to southern California for a long weekend, I brought the family and looked for a hotel within walking distance of the parks (so the family could go to the park while I had the rental car at work).  We settled on the Candy Cane Inn after reading online reviews.  I have to admit I was a little nervous, as I had read about some less than savory hotels around Disneyland.  I was very happy, though.  The grounds are beautiful, with flowers everywhere and not a speck of litter.  The staff were

Summary Heading: Reasonable and convenient location for Disneyland
Summary: We've stayed here many times over the years. Clean. Friendly staff. Free parking with no resort fees!! (As it should be if you want to attract guests!) Great location for Disneyland. Stayed here with children and also adults only...either way we had a great time. Close enough to walk to the park but love that free shuttle as we get older. (Also, the fact that the shuttle is owned by the Candy Cane Inn, you are just going to and from Disneyland...You are not going around to 4 or 5 stops and taking 30 to 45 minutes to get to the park or back to your hotel.) Rates are somewhat reasonable during weekends and vacation season. We really appreciate it when they run off season/mid-week specials. Those of us on fixed incomes can make the budget go further...and maybe stay an extra day!

Summary: This was our second time staying at the Candy Cane, and once again we were very pleased with our experience.  It is a well maintained property -  I love all the beautiful flowers and the nice pool area.  Our request to be put in the back of the hotel (away from street noise) was honored.  Breakfast is included and is perfect to load up before a busy day at Disneyland.  Location is also very convenient -- walking to/from Disney is no problem (ten minutes) and they also offer a shuttle every half an hour.  There are many other restaurants nearby, as well as a convenience store right next door.  For our family vacation, the Candy Cane was ideal!

Summary: I recently stayed at the Candy Cane Inn during a quick trip to Disneyland. We were four adults, no kids, and loved the hotel. It's clean and very convenient and the rooms all have doors that open to the outside. Staff at the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly. The free shuttle was a great service although the hotel is so close to the park we also walked in less than 10 minutes. The free breakfast doesn't include hot items such as bacon, eggs, pancakes etc... but has lots of baked goods, yogurt, hard boiled eggs and pastries/toast/bagels. The pool area is also very pretty and a great place to sit and relax. The free parking was also a great service as we rented a car nearby for a day.

It is so nice to have a free light breakfast by the pool before heading to the park. The laundry room is convenient and there is an ABC Store right next door for drinks and popsicles on a hot day.

Breakfast can be a little crowded but for the price, I don't mind. The front desk is always super friendly and accommodating. I am super picky about the section my room is in and they always work with me. James is a total boss, always good to see his friendly face behind the desk. The convenience factor to the park is a huge selling point. Literally one light crossing

Some sort of filter really needs to be in placed for the water system. It is so foggy and you feel sticky all day long! Hopefully you guys have that fixed next time we make a trip!  Thanks!

Summary: It's a pretty little place close to Disney and California Adventure. Only a few blocks to walk, but at the end of the day when your feet are crying,"No more!", there is a convenient shuttle to ride. The drivers are very personable and pleasant, as are the hotel staff. I usually look for a kitchenette, as I have many food allergies, but I know Disney is very accommodating in that way, so we got a basic room here. They have a morning buffet, but I am allergic to wheat and dairy, so it wasn't for me. my partner enjoyed it, though. I also am allergic to coffee, and they had hot water and no tea which was a little disappointing. Next time I will remember tea bags, as it's such a small thing. All in all, it was a great little place to stay!

Summary Heading: We'll stay here again in the future.
Summary: Location is perfect. We walked to California Adventure in no time. We got the tram back at the end of the day. Very convenient. Check in was a breeze. The lady at the front desk was polite and efficient. The room was clean, comfortable and roomy. The shower was good. We didn't hear too much noise outside though we were surprised initially that it is a motel style property. The exterior is very pretty with blossoms and greenery and a small outdoor pool. Breakfast was decent although for gluten free folks like me it's high on the gluten with all the breads etc. I brought my own food, but my fiancé was fairly happy with his. The price was right for us and if it continues like this we'll be back.

The breakfast consists of bagels, donuts, pastries, hot and cold cereal, bread, Apple and orange juice, hard boiled eggs, cheese cubes, fruit, hot chocolate, tea, coffee, and various jams, butter, and cream cheeses. It's a five-ten minute walk to DL entrance. I was even GLAD that I was there rather than locked into one of the expensive on-site resorts. No part of this was a sacrifice. They even let me park there for free after I had checked out so I could spend the last day before going to the airport at the park and not trying to find some parking. Summary: Every January I go to Anaheim for a music convention. I always stay at the Candy Cane Inn which is within walking distance of the Anaheim Convention Centre. The Candy Cane is perfect for me. Plenty of free car parking space as well as a self serve laundry. This hotel is perfect for families who want to do DisneyLand which is close by. When I check out, I always make a reservation for the following year.

This is a family run hotel, built in 1957, and you can tell that the owners care about their property. I will return.

There is a convenience store 1/2 block away for those late night needs.  I used an ECV (electric scooter) while in the park - the Front desk would put it away at night and charge it.  In the morning, it would be waiting for me in the parking lot.    I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Summary: First thing I tell everyone about the Candy Cane Inn is that it is a family friendly, down home place to stay. I've been staying there for 15+ years and I won't stay anywhere else! The rooms are clean (maids are wonderful), grounds are beautifully maintained and the staff is cheerful, helpful and knowledgeable about all things Disney. Each room has a mini-fridge, safe, hair dryer, coffe maker, etc. There is a small laundry room on the premises and there is no parking fee. Best thing is they have their own private shuttles to and from the park. Discounts for AAA, AARP, AP Holders and Active Duty Military!! I can't say enough good things about the Candy Cane Inn. 5 stars in my book!!

Summary: This is the second time we've stayed at the Candy Cane Inn in the last year, and it retains the convenience and pleasantness of our last visit. Free buffet breakfast, guest laundry ($1.25 per wash / dry), free shuttle to and from Disneyland (although it's quicker for most people to walk), pool. There are hotels closer to the parks, but this one is manageable.  Cons (your mileage may vary): Wash basin is outside the bathroom Not as convenient as some hotels if you want to bring the family back for a mid-afternoon break. It's quite far from Downtown Disney (although you can go around the other way and avoid the lines at security) Wifi is slow at times

Summary Heading: Love this place. Great location, great service. Free shuttle to Disney, Free Breakfast!!!
Summary: Love staying at this place. Never disappointed. Has free shuttle to Disneyland that comes every 30 mins, very friendly staff, free continental breakfast. Would recommend to anyone going to the parks!!!
