Summary: This was our second time at the Candy Cane Inn.  As on our previous visit, we booked a premium room - we feel it is well worth the extra money to have our breakfast delivered and we use the late check-out on our last day when we have a late flight.  Our room was clean and comfortable and the grounds and pool area were still as beautifully kept as on our previous visit.    We will definitely be staying here next time we visit Anaheim - wouldn't consider staying anywhere else!

Summary Heading: Our favoriate place, even more than home
Summary: Another year and more stays at the CCI.  My son and I were there in February for 4 nights, September for 4 more, October for 2 and November for 6 nights.  It is one of our most favorite places.  At times I think my son likes staying there more than he does going to Disneyland.    The staff is wonderful. They are professional and work to accommodate our needs. We are greeted with smiles when arriving, when we attend breakfast and when we check out.    The CCI is special.  It is not over-the-top-fancy, but it more than meets our needs.  I would say it is a lot like Disney.  It is the small things, the attention to details, the staff that makes it special and keeps us coming back.    As described by some many, it is the best deal there is for Disney.  The location to the parks

The rooms are comfortable and clean, but could probably do with new bed covers. We had a parking space which was a plus and the daily breakfast provided (although not lavish) was enough to get us started for our days at the park. For those on a budget visiting Disneyland I would recommend staying here. It's clean, safe and well located.

Got there person at counter manager said no but going back n forth allow it. 7:00 am trash truck came banging trash bins. Cold outside not many table to eat at maybe five so breakfast not possible. So don't take that in your decision to stay. The little things or extras not there. So sad it was one of my favorite place for Disneyland. The guess are rude. Summary: Once again the Candy Cane has met or exceeded our family needs and wants for a Disneyland visit.  Comfort, convenience, courtesy.....all at a reasonable cost.  This was our 4th stay with them, with many more to come.

Summary: The room was clean on the surface.  We made the mistake of bringing bread home and putting it into the refrigerator, which in the morning was covered with ants--I think this might be a Southern California problem. The breakfast in the morning was good--my girls liked the donuts and hot chocolate. Seating at breakfast was tight and mostly outside.  We walked home from the park each night; which was a short, safe walk. The hotel did allow the car to stay parked in the hotel lot while we enjoyed the last day.  Overall it was a good stay.
Manager Response: First and foremost I would like to sincerely apologize for the items you noted. Due to the drought in California we do have more ants than usual; however we do have a program in place to constantly spray to avoid any issues. Thank you again for your business and kind regards!

Summary Heading: ADA rooms are not truly ADA
Summary: We requested a ADA room and made a reservation for a PREMIUM room with handicapped accessibility for 8 nights. Upon arrival the hotel is indeed nice. That being said, it went down hill from there. The only thing ADA about the room is pretty much the parking spot. The bathtub had a grab bar but it was only for standing and not for entering the tub or rising from a sitting position. No hand held shower, and the toilet was extremely low. Again, it had an added grab bar but it was way too far a reach to be of any use. The door to the bathroom opens out into the room so you cannot get to the sink with out closing it first. Probably great for a non disabled person, but if you use a wheelchair and need stability assistance DO NOT STAY HERE. Also the fridge was very small and dripping
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and please know that we sincerely appreciate your feedback. We are moving forward with renovations and we will be looking into updating all our rooms in the near future. Thank you again for your visit. Kind regards.

Summary: Older hotel but location is everything.  Clean rooms, pool, nearby restaurants and of course, they are right next door to Disneyland.  They offer shuttle service to and from the Magic  Kingdom but it is well within walking distance to the park.  You can arrive, check in and park.  Never need to drive anywhere during your stay.  No having to pay for parking or having to deal with traffic.  Within driving distance of other activities should you choose to explore.   Can't wait to return.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and I thank you once again for your kind comments about our property! Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Super convenient, relatively economical location for the Disneyland Resort area
Summary: It's hard to beat staying on-site at one of the Disneyland resort properties (Grand Californian, Paradise Pier, or Disneyland Hotel), but those are pricey. Because Disneyland - unlike Disney World in Orlando - is not set off by itself in an enclosed area, there are plenty of non-Disney motels/hotels within walking distance of the parks. The Candy Cane Inn is located just southeast of California Adventure. In fact, it's basically right behind the Radiator Springs ride, as you can tell from the back facade of the attraction.  This means that it's a pretty easy walk, about 1/2 mile, from the hotel to the entry plaza of the parks. They do a great job with this -- even our toasted bagels were still warm when they arrived at our door.  There is not a large array of items to choose from but it was more than adequate.  Two possible negatives, however, they do not have an elevator but their staff helped us get our large suitcases up and down the stairs. Summary Heading: Close to Disney but otherwise just average
Summary: This is the third time we have stayed at Candy Cane. First visit was great, 2nd visit was not so good, third visit was average. Pros and cons: PRO/CON:  close to Disney, you can walk in 5-10 minutes or take the free shuttle. For whatever reason, they were using a passenger van instead of shuttle bus so there was no room for us on our way back to the hotel. This happened twice on this stay. PRO/CON: rooms are pretty clean. Carpet is dirty and bathroom needs some updating. PRO/CON: free breakfast but there's nowhere to sit and its extremely crowded. Food is mediocre. PRO/CON: free wifi but..... it didn't really work so whats the point. CON: very thin walls.  We stayed 4 nights and were woke up past 1 am each night by people in the next room talking loudly, slamming doors, etc.

We loved the shuttle drivers. They are always so friendly and funny. Thank you for all the great service you provide! My 5 year old was so sad to check out, because she fell in love with the property. We love the Candy Cane Inn and will continue to stay when we are in the area!

The noise you will hear is typically families coming home from long day at parks and shuttle running through parking lot until park closing.  Even with that, we will always prefer this property over others in same or lower price range.  Deluxe rooms on south side have firework views.

Plus, they have a very acceptable continental breakfast, a pool and jacuzzi, nice rooms and i's as quiet as you can expect in this neighborhood.  I'll be back!

The morning breakfast is sufficient enough to hold you for the morning until your next snack or lunch even.  Well worth it.  We have stayed here 3 different times!

Summary: This hotel is right next door to Disney's California Adventure. A true gem. Rooms are small, but when you are out all day that isn't an issue. Had all the amenities our family needed, comfortable beds, laundry facilities, free car parking, wifi, a good shower and interconnecting rooms available which was perfect for our family of 5. Hotel staff were all very friendly and accommodating, whether it was the staff at the front desk, to housekeeping, to the bus driver. Whilst it is a little outdated in furnishings, we wouldn't stay anywhere else. One tip, if you have a lot of luggage, ask for a ground floor room. Our suitcases were heavy and there is no lift! Loved watching the fireworks from our room! Definitely will be staying at the Candy Cane again.

It's  great after  a  long  day  at  the  parks. They have  their  own  bus to the parks or  you can walk. It's about a 10 minute walk. Rooms  are clean  and quiet. I highly  recommend  this  hotel.

Summary Heading: The closeness to Disney makes it worth it.
Summary: Overall, the hotel is average. The dated décor of the rooms was not important to my family. The bathroom/shower is average, the counter space is average, and the beds were comfortable.   The breakfast is carb heavy (donuts, croissants, cereal, toast, bagels) but they also have hard boiled eggs and cheese to mix in some protein. Plenty of fruit, yogurt, coffee juice and hot chocolate are available.   The grounds are nice to look at and the upkeep is good. Free hotel parking for guests. No elevator for the second floor.   The best aspect of the hotel is the closeness to Disneyland and California Adventure. There is a hotel shuttle, but walking to the park pushing a stroller took us 7-9 minutes at opening and closing hours. You can leave your rental car at the hotel  CVS pharmacy

The grounds of the inn are well-maintained and very nice, lots of flowering shrubs, bushes, etc. I am shocked that several people on TripAdvisor have called this inn "affordable" and a "good value".  Perhaps my budget is more limited than many of the other reviewers but I find the price of $186 (and that was with a military discount!) for a simple, small hotel room and a mediocre breakfast to be way overpriced! Turn down service, continental breakfast delivery (always ontime I might add) and someone always around to help. Third, intimate and beautiful grounds. Today it seems there are so many mega-resorts and over the top everything it was nice to only have a little walk to the pool and look over the gardens. Overall the employees were very friendly and Danilo at the front desk was exceptionally great for helping me book a shuttle to the airport. I look forward to staying here again on my next Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting with us and for sharing your kind comments regarding our property, complimentary amenities and exceptional guest service. We have a wonderful team, including Danilo, who take pride in their jobs and taking care of our guests and they too appreciate when folks take the time to write positive comments such as yours. We thank you again for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Neat family-owned hotel.  A well rounded package.
Summary: CCI is a moderate sized family owned hotel located about a 10 minute walk from Disneyland.    Pleasant landscaping and ubiquitous greenery take the hard edge off and make the CCI more relaxing than competitors.   Average sized rooms, with slightly dated but functional furnishings.  Beds are comfortable, but may be too soft for some people.  In room storage is somewhat limited- a bedside table, a portion of an entertainment armoire, and a small closet.  Pool and hot tub are easily accessible in an attractive central garden area but small… typical of other Good Neighbor Hotels where real estate is easily $millions/acre.  Pool area gets crowded with more than 12-15 people.  Adjacent but small toddler pool is a nice addition separately fenced from hot tub and main pool.   Several
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting with us for the first time and for sharing your many kind comments regarding our property, complimentary amenities and exceptional guest service. We have a wonderful team, who take pride in their jobs and taking care of our guests and they too appreciate when folks take the time to write positive comments such as yours. We thank you again for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary: The Candy Cane Inn was recommended by my travel agent. It was just the perfect place to relax and feel at home.  The staff were extremely helpful the rooms very clean and our room was in the front was quiet.  The pool and spa made for a perfect end of the day.  The location to Disneyland was perfect, approximately 8-10 minute walk although we could have taken a shuttle.  It is located close to a variety of food shops,   When returning to Disneyland I would ABSOLUTELY stay there again
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and I thank you once again for your kind comments about our helpful staff and property! Kind regards!

Summary: Room was on the second level close to the front of the hotel near the main thoroughfare.  ALERT: no elevators (none that we saw or were told about)   ALERT:  could hear sounds from the street   Continental Breakfast was available - staff did an excellent job keeping things stocked  Front Desk - While helpful, sometime there was only one person at the front desk and if the phone rang, you had to wait for them to finish the call before helping you.  However, very friendly and courteous.  Check in/Check out - check in is at 3pm so if you arrive early, you can store your luggage.  They do not do txt msg for when your room is ready, you just have to call or go back to the hotel.  Check out is at 11am but was offered a 12 noon complimentary extension when I asked for a 2pm check out
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am delighted you enjoyed the location and friendliness of our staff. Thank you again for your stay and please feel free to contact me personally if your family is returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: Great place to stay, clean with well kept grounds. Decent continental style breakfast, convenient Disney shuttle bus although walk to Disney gate is a little over ten minutes away so you can choose. Swimming pool and hot tub open to 11:00. Staff very friendly and helpful, printed off some etickets  we ordered online to Knott's Berry farm which were about half price of what it would cost at the gate. While there are fancier places when you consider the service, convenience and early breakfast at the Candy Cane, I wouldn't consider staying elsewhere while visiting Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our team and property! We look forward to seeing you again and please feel free to contact me personally, as I would be delighted to assist with any requests or needs you may have. Kind regards!

Summary: This hotel is located really close to the Disney parks, it is closer than the parking lots!   The rooms are very comfortables with everything a family going to Disney needs.   I believe it is the best value for Anaheim, it's not a fancy hotel as the Disney ones try to be but it delivers a great experience.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the theme parks. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and the many complimentary amenities we offer here at the Candy Cane. We hope to see you again real soon! Kind regards.

Summary: Nice hotel close to gate at Disneyland. Has pool with jacuzzi and very good breakfast is free. Also has small bus to take you to Disneyland. Room is large and clean with comfortable bed. Hotel employees are very nice and help a lot. I will go again next year.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our team and property! We look forward to seeing you again and please feel free to contact me personally, as I would be delighted to assist with any requests or needs you may have. Kind regards!

Summary: This was a beautiful hotel!  Great continental breakfast. Pool was awesome. Originally they gave us a room on the second floor but there isn't an elevator. A real bummer if you're hauling a kid and stroller to Disneyland several times a day. They happily moved us to a room on the ground level.  The shuttle ran every 30 minutes reliably but it was soooo close that sometimes it was quicker to walk.  I'd definitely go back.  My only suggestion is that if you are taking a stroller, request a room on the ground floor.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and I thank you once again for your kind comments about our helpful staff and property! Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Sweet Stay at the Candy Cane Inn
Summary: This hotel was very easy to find off the freeway - just took the Harbor exit. Conveniently located just a 10 minute walk from door-to-maingate of Disneyland. However, there is a shuttle available that runs every 30 minutes, but it's faster to walk if you are able to. The grounds are immaculate. There were three of us who stayed in a standard two queen room. It was adequate for us, but not much room to get around. Only one sink to share between the three of us, and not much room to put our suitcases and live out of for four days. One bed was right up against the air/heating unit, so there wasn't even room on that side of the bed. The bathroom, however, was spacious, and included a tub/shower. The plantation shutters are visually appealing, but unlike curtains, don't block out
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am delighted you enjoyed the location and the friendliness of our staff. I am truly apologetic that you found our plantation shutters and window difficult to use, as we do strive to meet all of our guest’s needs and requests. Thank you again for your email correspondence and please feel free to contact me personally should you return to the Anaheim area as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations requests, as well as discussing what our team can do to bring your next review up to a five. Summary: Having stayed on Harbor Blvd. many many times, I always wanted to try Candy Cane Inn when I had seen it. Glad we did. The hotel lives up to all the good reviews it gets. Grounds are very pretty; rooms not overly big, but comfortable. Breakfast maybe a little disappointing in choices; too any sweets and breads; only protein was hard boiled eggs and cheese. Would have preferred a better assortment of cereals; or even make your own waffles. But it was ok.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am delighted you enjoyed the location and cleanliness of our property. Summary: I was pleasantly surprised by the beautifully maintained grounds, lobby was also very nice. It's very old fashioned and in need of an update. We stayed in a "deluxe" room on the second floor, and the bed was completely awful, it was so worn and overly soft it was like sleeping in a hammock. It moved and swayed with every movement. The room was advertised as "two wueen" sized beds but they were only full size beds. Not worth the high rates! Swimming pool was lovely but the chlorine was so strong it burned
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to the theme parks. We appreciate your business and feedback regarding our Inn and your stay. I have spoken with our Serta Manufacturer who have confirmed that our mattresses are truly Queen sized. Now, they are a Double Pillow Top mattress and there may be a slight variance as the “pillow top” may move and I apologize if they were too soft for your personal liking. Again, thank you so much for your kind comments and know that we do listen to guest feedback as strive to provide exceptional guest service and satisfaction. Kind Regards!

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel the last two times when visiting Disneyland, and previously we've stayed at Paradise Pier (3 times), Disneyland Hotel (twice) & Fairfield Inn.  This is our favourite by far. It was built the same time as the original Disneyland & retains the ambience with cobblestones, beautiful landscaping, lovely wrought iron railings & lamp posts.  The place is impeccably clean, the staff hard working, friendly & very professional.  It is an oasis amongst the busy streets of Anaheim.  It is a short walk to the main gates of Disneyland along well-lit, landscaped pathways - you feel like you are in Disneyland as you are on the same side of the street and away from the businesses on the other side.  The free shuttle just shines - it is so clean - & it is very welcome
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for being a repeat member of the Candy Cane family and for sharing your many wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you and your husband enjoyed your 3rd stay with us and I thank you for your kind comments about our many complimentary amenities and hardworking staff. We appreciate all guest comments, and I know our whole team is delighted to provide exceptional service to each and every guest. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Nice place for the price, great location to parks
Summary: This is a nice hotel for the price in a great location. It is an easy walk to the parks, or they have a complimentary shuttle that is easy ti use. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are clean, dated but clean. The rooms are spacious, we had two connecting rooms. The complimentary breakfast was good, everything you need for a quick start in the mornings. Its a cute little place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our team and property! Summary: The room was generally quite clean except for an ant problem. We have been staying at this motel off and on for over 25 years now so we know it is quite old.  The bathtub and fixtures need to be replaced and old grey towels need to be removed from circulation.  I hate drying with a towel that looks like it has been used to wash the floor.      In general, I like this motel because it is very close to Disneyland and is very quiet.  The shuttle is convenient and on time with friendly drivers.
Manager Response: First and foremost I would like to sincerely apologize for the items you noted. I have personally spoken to the parties involved as well as their corresponding managers to ensure we are continuing to maintain a clean and professional environment for all of our guests. Thank you again for your business and kind regards!

Summary: The room had everything we needed: comfortable beds, hair dryer, free wifi, small refrigerator, continental breakfast, etc. The lighting in the bathroom/dressing area was poor, also needed more and more conveniently placed outlets for charging devices.

Summary Heading: Location to Disneyland Parks is great for a good neighbor hotel.
Summary: My party of four were all adults.  We shared a 2 queen bed premium room.  The lack of an elevator for 3 nights was not a problem for us but could be for others with a lot of luggage to haul.  The hotel location and the late check out terms with the premium rooms are what caught my eye. The in room breakfast was not as special as one would think.  Yes it was convenient to have breakfast delivered but the consistency of the order accuracy was spotty at best.  On the third morning we just skipped that service all together.  A good feature of this hotel was the very comfortable beds.  Fell asleep easily.  Room was cleaned with fresh towels daily.  Air conditioning unit worked great and noise was not an issue for us.  We were located upstairs in room 243.  We did use the pool for an

Summary: Spent 2 nights at the Candy Cane Inn while we were visiting Disneyland.  The location is very convenient to Disneyland- a 10-15 minute walk.  There is also a shuttle bus run by the hotel which was super.  We used it several times, including loading a baby stroller on the bus and the driver was very helpful and patient.  The room was very comfortable with 2 double beds, although there wasn't a lot of space to move around.  With 2 adults, 2 kids under 6 and an infant things were a bit tight, but we were mostly just there to sleep, so it worked out fine.  The free continental breakfast was quite generous and everything was fresh.  The pool and pool area were very nice.  Parking was free and it was easy to find a spot.  A great hotel if you are visiting Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting with us for the first time and for sharing your many kind comments regarding our property, complimentary amenities and exceptional guest service. We thank you again for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary: This great little spot is just a shirt 10 minute walk to the front gate of Disneyland.  The staff is excellent, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and there are many restaurants in the area. The 7-eleven just around the corner has the greatest and most friendly people working there.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and I thank you once again for your kind comments about our helpful staff and property! Kind regards!

Summary: THis average rating is a result of averaging 1'2 and 5's!  Let's start with the positives...5 stars...location, housekeeping, breakfast, pool, shuttle, welcome basket, comfy beds.  The ok's- I can live with it....very musty cupboards under the sink counter, you could not store food or clothes in there.  Noisy during afternoon naptimes with new arrivals and car beeps when locking and unlocking, doors and trunks slamming etc. On checkout I questioned charges, only to find that was presented with the wrong bill and still after the correction, my 'return ' certificate has the wrong name on it. Would I return...  yes, but not with toddlers.   The huge negative was a safety issue.  As another guest pointed out, the doors are heavy and self close quickly when opened a little way.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am sincerely sorry that you were disappointed that we did not have safety locks, as it is not our intention to make any guest upset or feel unsafe. All of our hotel rooms are equipped with a lock and deadbolt. I again thank you for your valuable feedback and again while we never want to disappoint our guests, I will use this as a training tool for my staff and managers to ensure we are giving the best service possible. I am however, happy that you enjoyed our location and cleanliness of our property. Thank you again for your valuable input. Kind regards!

Summary: This is our second time staying here.  We love it.  The employees are fantastic, the room was super clean, the breakfast was wonderful and the free shuttle to the park was awesome.  We slept really well and even though we were on the first floor, didn't hear much from our upstairs neighbors.  My mother joined us this time and she is disabled, the hotel helped us rent a scooter during our stay and they charged it each night for us so it was ready to go in the morning.  Can't say enough good things about this place.  OH and the pool was fantastic since it was like 95 degrees each day!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for being a repeat member of the Candy Cane family and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your second stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our many complimentary amenities and wonderful staff. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, great location and friendly staff
Summary: Just had 11 nights at the Candy Cane (23rd august – 3 sept), first time we’ve stayed but wont be the last.  It was great, rooms are plenty big enough, fridge was handy.  Huge safe to use, which fitted everything in. We had a Disney View so could watch the fireworks from our room if we wanted which was amazing ! The breakfast was brilliant, and a lovely setting to eat it when sat by the pool too.  Grounds were gorgeous and there was always someone tidying or cleaning something. Staff were very friendly and would do anything for you.  Bus was good when you needed a lift, and the bus drivers were great. Or a quick 10 min walk to the parks. On the whole it was a fantastic place and we will definitely be booking again for next year.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Summary Heading: Family friendly, clean and comfortable place to stay
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights. 3 adults, one child in double room. Hotel has a steady shuttle service to Disney, but we mostly walked there as it is only 5 mins. away. Great continental breakfast. Nice pool and hot tub. Suited our needs perfectly. Refrigerator in room was useful too.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the theme parks. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and the many complimentary amenities we offer here at the Candy Cane. We hope to see you again real soon! Kind regards.

Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights in the first week of September. We stayed in a premium room and it was worth the money. The breakfast delivery was always on time and the food was really good. My wife raved about the hot chocolate. The late check out gave us time to hit the gift shops without leaving our luggage in the car. My wife and I love to stay in really nice places and I can tell you without hesitation that the Candy Cane Inn exceeded our expectations! The staff was amazing and went out of their way to make sure that we were taken care of. The daily shuttle was a God send and one busy morning the driver made an extra trip since the bus was full at the scheduled time. Everyone we encountered really tried to make our stay wonderful and I can honestly say that we loved it and
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting with us and for sharing your kind comments regarding our property, complimentary amenities and exceptional guest service. We have a wonderful team, who take pride in their jobs and taking care of our guests and they too appreciate when folks take the time to write positive comments such as yours. We thank you again for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for several nights.  The hotel is your standard motel with exterior entry doors.  It is clean and the upkeep is GREAT!!  With it being right next to Disneyland you can walk there in under 15 minutes BUT they also have their own bus shuttle service which left every 1/2 hour .  The bus drivers were all amazing, friendly and helpful.    The hotel staff was nice but uninformed.  Whenever I went to the front desk to ask a question they couldn't give me an answer.  Also the continental breakfast was stale.  We went once - all the food appeared old.  The bagels were stale.  We didn't go back ...  Another plus is that parking is free - that is HUGE in California!!  Yes I would recommend and would stay there again just know that you get what you pay for.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am delighted you enjoyed the friendliness of our bus drivers and the beautiful grounds. I am truly apologetic that you did not fully enjoy your stay, as we do strive to make all of our guests satisfied and provide the exceptional service folks have come to expect from the Candy Cane. Thank you again for your stay and please feel free to contact me personally should you return to the Anaheim area as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations requests, as well as discussing what our team can do to bring your next review up to a five. Summary: This is a lovely family owned property located next to Disneyland/CA Adventure.  Pride of ownership is evident.  Rooms were clean, quiet and well maintained.  Pool area was clean.  Free parking, free shuttle to Disneyland, and free breakfast.  Staff was welcoming, helpful, and appeared happy.  This is a delightful place to refresh and recharge for your Disneyland visit!

Summary: We stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed ourselves.  The rooms are smaller than most other hotels but that was fine for us as we were using it as a base for the parks.  The hotel staff were lovely and very friendly.  Breakfast was great - cereals, pastries, donuts, cheese, yoghurts, fruit - lots of variety.  10 mins easy walk to the parks, or a quick bus ride from the hotel.  We travelled with two small children and the location was perfect as we were close enough to go back to the room to nap during the day.  Such a great price too.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Summary: 3 1/2 stars  this was a fine stay for the price.  The rooms were clean and no problems. Convenient to the park. Nearby shopping easily accessible. Didn't use the pool or other amenities as I only stayed one night.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the Anaheim area. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and the many complimentary amenities we offer here at the Candy Cane. We hope to see you again real soon! Kind regards.

Summary: My husband and I stayed in the deluxe room the second weekend of September 2015.  This hotel is a good option if you are on a budget.  They offer free parking, shuttle, wi-fi, and continental breakfast which is great.  We had no problems in our room.  We were hardly in the room and spent most of our time at the Disneyland parks.  You can walk to/from the hotel to the entrance of the Disney parks.  It will take approximately 10 - 15 minutes.  One con is that the shower temperature would go between cold and hot while using.  Other than that, everything else was not bad.  I would recommend this hotel for families or people on a budget.  This hotel is a third of the price of any on-site hotels.

Summary: We have stayed near Disneyland in many different hotels over the past 40 years! Until last week we'd never stayed at the Candy Cane Inn. WOW! What a loss. This hotel is a hidden treasure. From the quick check-in, to the beautifully appointed room, to all the free amenities including breakfast, bus to the park, wi-fi, and parking, this place was near perfect!!! The cost was lower than the nearby hotels too! Cannot say enough about this place. It is highly recommended!

Summary Heading: WARNING: Your rate may increase at check-in without notice!
Summary: About two weeks prior to my stay added a second room to my reservation. I made it clear that I only wanted to book if I could have the same rate (AAA discount plus past guest discount). The person on the phone said yes without hesitation. It does say on the past-guest coupon that it is for one room but as they gave me the second room at the same rate knowing what discounts I had booked with. I called again 3 days before arrival to confirm the reservations and rates. Everything was confirmed verbally and in writing. When I arrived at the hotel for check-in, literally the first thing the desk staff tells me its that they will not be honouring that rate and it will be more expensive than they quoted- despite having a PRINTED CONFIRMATION with the rate on it! The manner of the desk
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the hotel to save money over some of the nearby chain hotels while going to a convention.  The hotel primarily caters to families going to Disney Land.  While being an older property, the hotel is well taken care of and the rooms clean.  It is a quick 10 minute walk to either the convention center or Disney.  The service was good, my only complaint was a slow wi-fi.  For the money I saved, I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the Anaheim area. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and the helpful staff we have here at the Candy Cane. We hope to see you again real soon! Kind regards.

Summary: I think the candy cane is the best good neighbor hotel there is!  It has a pool, breakfast included and a shuttle to Disneyland of its own. The staff is super friendly and helpful and it is very clean. My it complaint is the beds. They need to replace them. Ours was worn out and had a soup bowl in the middle!

Summary Heading: A fun week with my grandsons
Summary: A great place within a quick walk to Disneyland.  Had their own dedicated shuttle to and from the park which was nice if you didn't want to walk. Nice pool and hot tub. Nice clean room with the great premium service.

Summary: I had heard of this hotel many times, and we decided to give it a try.  We were not disappointed.  Attention to detail throughout, and owners who really care about guests (and many guests we spoke to had stayed there MANY times.) We arrived very early in the morning, not wanting to check in, but hoping to leave our car while we went to the park.  Staff was very accommodating, saying as long as there were spots available, we were welcome to leave our car.  That service started things off just right.  Although the price for this "motel" is not super low, remember that it includes parking and breakfast, which is not always the case close to the park.  They allowed 5 people in the room, which is also not the case at many Disney-area hotels.  The breakfast, although not a hot
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the theme parks. I am delighted we were able to accommodate leaving your car here and that you enjoyed the many complimentary amenities we offer here at our hotel, including our expanded continental breakfast, parking and complimentary exclusive shuttle to and from the parks. Thank you again for your stay and we hope to see you again real soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for a Disneyland trip!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights for our Disneyland trip. I am so glad that we picked Candy Cane Inn!   Great location: it's only 9 min walk to the entrance of Disneyland resort. The best part is that it's on the same side of the Disneyland--no need to cross the Harbor blvd. It has shuttle every 30 min too.   Clean room & comfortable bed: my husband even wants to find out the brand of their pillows! We also enjoyed wifi in room a lot. The water pressure in shower is just right too.   Nice & free breakfast: besides muffins, croissants, breads, and pastries, it also provides fruits, boiled eggs, cheese cubes, and yogurt! You can also get coffee, milk (both non-fat and 2%), and hot chocolate!  We will definitely come back again!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our friendly team and property! We look forward to seeing you again and please feel free to contact me personally if you would like to know the brand of pillows, as I would be delighted to assist you with that and any other requests or needs you may have. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great hotel option Close to Disneyland
Summary: We have stayed at the Candy Cane multiple times and we keep coming back. You can't beat the location, just a short walk to Disneyland, plus you have the option of taking the hotel shuttle. Candy Cane also has one the best free continental breakfasts around. Many assorted pastries, fruit, cereals and juices. You can buy park tickets from the front desk if you need them. Staff is excellent and helpful. the park is so close it abuts then back of the park. Candy Cane has the best manicured grounds of any hotel in the area. It makes entering the hotel property very relaxing. Great courtyard to have your breakfast in the morning or swim in the pool later in the day.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for being a repeat member of the Candy Cane family and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our many complimentary amenities and wonderful staff. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary: We visited this hotel as our first stop on our west coast tour for our honeymoon, and we weren't disappointed. Bearing in mind the price we didn't expect much but were pleasantly surprised! The location is ideal for DisneyLand only being a few minutes walk from the park entrance (you can even see the back of the park from some of the rooms). The hotel has a distinct motel-ish feel to it but the parking right outside your door has it's benefits and we found that although very busy it was reasonably quiet at night so good for those with kids. The breakfast provided as part of the price is a bonus with tea, coffee, juice, cereal, toast, pastries, bagels and hard boiled eggs being provided. The room was spacious, clean & tidy and had everything you needed including a fridge, ice
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us on your honeymoon and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your many kind comments about our helpful staff and property! Kind regards!

Summary: We spent 4 days in Anaheim this year and the Candy Cane was exceptional. Staff was great, rooms were clean and we had a great time. Outside of the a Disneyland resort hotel, it's the only other place we will stay!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the theme parks. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and the many complimentary amenities we offer here at the Candy Cane. We hope to see you again real soon! Kind regards.

Summary Heading: Does what it says on the tin
Summary: This place really worked for us.  It's a lovely short walk to the resort but the bus is so convenient for tired kids later on.  The swimming pool area is small but there were enough loungers for everyone.  The breakfast is free and delicious.  The room décor is "interesting" but you need to look though this and least it has character unlike the Disney hotel we visited which seemed soulless. Pros: close to resort, great staff, great breakfast, great value Cons: my grandmother chose the décor (but it's got character!), there's nowhere to sit outside once the kids go to sleep (minor inconvenience)
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your many wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your visit with us and I thank you for your kind comments about our team and property! Thank you again for your stay and we hope to see you again real soon. Kind regards!

Summary: Highly recommend!  Clean, bright room. Great, helpful staff.  Price is great.  As close to disneyland as you can get without being at a disney hotel.  Free breakfast and shuttle a huge plus!  Easily walkable to disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Summary Heading: Its close, its clean and it offers free breakfast
Summary: We had decided that we wanted to stay in a room with the new hardwood floors, so upon arrival they tried to put us in a room that faced the street. The manager came over and fixed the problem and put us in a different room on the second floor. They were excellent.  It is a motel with a very small pool. Remember you are not at Disney to spend time in your room, so as long as its clean which it was, it comes with a free breakfast, which was decent and it is in walking distance of the entrance then I would highly recommend this hotel. I will tell you that the walls are a little thin so if you are a light sleeper bring ear plugs for sure. If you are a gym geek like me you will be disappointed as to what they call a gym. All in all we were happy with our choice of hotel. Enjoy, I
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am delighted you enjoyed the location and cleanliness of our property. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Good motel to stay at that is close to Disneyland!
Summary: My family and I stayed here in late August 2015 and it was all that I expected.  I had stayed here many years ago and I would say that I was pleasantly surprised.  I have to young kids (2 1/2 and 4 months) and the room was able to house all of us really well!  The staff was SUPER friendly and very accommodating!  The complementary breakfast was quite large from most, especially for a motel!  Loved the greenery and small quaint feel.  Stayed on the bottom floor towards the back of the motel.  Quiet for the most part but did hear the occasional children running around in the room above (but that is to be expected).  The only difficulty that I had was the shower/bath water was hard to predict/ maintain hot cold.  We were able to get by without any cold showers or super hot showers
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our friendly team and property! I do want to apologize for the inconsistency with our water and I have brought this up to my Chief Engineer, so we may fix this issue. We look forward to seeing you again and please feel free to contact me personally, as I would be delighted to assist with any requests or needs you may have. Kind regards!

Summary: I really wanted to love this place, after all the positive reviews. And it wasn't bad...as others have said, beautiful grounds for a "motel" type property, decent breakfast, reasonably clean. Staff was very nice. The room (deluxe) however was pretty small for our family of four. Bathroom was tiny. Shower had poor water pressure. Just remember, this is a motel, and as such, probably a bit better than average. My biggest complaint is the price we paid...the hotel was no where near capacity (as judged by the half empty parking lot and very few guests on shuttle), however, I felt the price quite high. A bit nicer than some of the other motels on Harbor, but not enough nicer, in my opinion, to justify the price and the less convenient location.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am delighted you enjoyed the friendliness of our staff and the beautiful grounds. I am truly apologetic that you did not fully enjoy your stay, as we do strive to make all of our guests satisfied during their stay with us. Thank you again for your stay and please feel free to contact me personally should you return to the Anaheim area as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations requests, as well as discussing what our team can do to bring your next review up to a five. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Hotel staff and grounds are wonderful
Summary: I stayed here 2 weeks ago with my 2 kids.  We arrived a bit early and only expected to ask to park and not actually check in.  We were received graciously by James even though we were early.  Since we were arriving on a Monday they were able to accommodate us right away and allow us to check in.  We stayed in the front area of the hotel and we heard no road noise.  The room was very clean and the shuttle was great for just that extra something. We only had noise issues from other guest upstairs, but that has nothing to do with the accommodations. It would be super if the hotel could just do a small update to have more accessible plugs for phones, etc, but it does not deter me from staying here again.  The pool was great for a quick refresher and the breakfast was very pleasant.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the theme parks. I am delighted we were able to accommodate you for an early check in and that you enjoyed the many complimentary amenities we offer here at our hotel, including our expanded continental breakfast. Thank you again for your stay and we hope to see you again real soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great Place for a Large Family
Summary: We have been coming to the Candy Cane Inn for several years, and now it is necessary to book two rooms to hold us all. The Candy Cane Inn consistently delivers clean quiet rooms and an excellent breakfast, minutes away from Disneyland's front gate. The staff at Candy Cane make everything so convenient, from the shuttle to the park to the on-site laundry to breakfast by the pool. This is a great value!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for being a repeat member of the Candy Cane family and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our many complimentary amenities and wonderful staff. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Inn is a sweet deal!!
Summary: I took my daughter on a mom/daughter trip to California and Disneyland in August.  We stayed here again as it is her favourite and third stay now. I started staying here in 1985 (5 times). Mostly for the convenience, location, staff and hotel with lush green welcoming grounds. We had room 279 across from the pool area. The room was comfy, clean and has everything we need as well as reasonably priced, free parking, free shuttle that runs every 30 mins.  Staff is friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!  We have never had any disappointments here and will be back, hopefully for another visit during the 60th Anniversary of Disneyland!  Yes they still have little candy canes in the lobby, hot coffee and chilled ice water with lemon and cucumbers!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for being a repeat member of the Candy Cane family and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Sweet stay at the Candy Cane Inn!
Summary: My son and I only stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for 1 night, but wished it would have been more!    The Good:  Location-was just as close to the main entrance of Disney as Paradise Pier and Disneyland Hotel.  We stayed at both of these hotels on our trip and the walking was the same.  They offered a shuttle every half hour which the Disney hotels do not.  We would have used the service but we missed it by 5 minutes and just decided to walk...which was 10 minutes.     The free breakfast was really good!  Plenty to eat and good variety of pastries, cereals, fresh fruit, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, bagels.  Good coffee and assortment of juices as well.     The pool area: Inviting and the temp of the pool was just right.  We were sad that we didn't get to spend more time here staying
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and for sharing your many kind comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We look forward to seeing you again soon and hopefully it is more than one night, so you can enjoy us a little bit longer! Kind regards!

Summary Heading: A charming hotel close to Disney theme parks.
Summary: My sister and I stayed here while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. It has everything we look for in a hotel -- cleanliness, charm, comfort, a spacious room, a reasonable price and a friendly, helpful staff. I would recommend it to anyone! There is a free shuttle to the parks (but you could also walk; the hotel is reasonably close), and a beautiful pool and Jacuzzi to relax your tired bones when you return. The continental breakfast includes fresh fruit, pastries, coffee, juices, yogurt, toast, bagels, muffins, and hard-cooked eggs, which you can eat at tables by the pool or inside a pleasant room. Our room was sparkling clean and quite large, with good air-conditioning and very comfy beds.  I wouldn't change a thing!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your many wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Summary: Picked this hotel with a big gulp and a hope that the TripAdvisor reviews didn't steer me wrong! This hotel was perfect and here is why - free parking, easy walking distance to the entrance pavilion, free breakfast, pool, laundry room, and the friendliest, most helpful staff I have encountered in a long time. The hotel is beautifully maintained with gorgeous landscaping that at night, with the right jasmine smell, reminds you of being at Disneyland as a kid 30 years ago. The hotel is two stories with exterior walkways and stone driveways. Breakfast is inside or pool side and is kept well stocked by a very attentive staff. From the front desk to the maintenance staff every one was friendly, polite and extremely attentive. We walked with our elementary age kids back and forth to
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your many wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Summary: This was my 2nd visit. I really have to recommend the Candy Cane Inn. The shuttle was so helpful. Many thanks to Lee, the shuttle driver. He was friendly, courteous and on time! The breakfast was perfect. The beds were comfortable. We (my mom, 10 year old son and I) stayed in room 156, it was clean and quiet. The Candy Cane Inn is the perfect reason not to drive home after a tiring day at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Inn the HIDDEN GEM RIGHT NEXT TO DISNEYLAND IN ANAHEIM, CALIFORNIA
Summary: From the beginning to the end this was the perfect hotel to stay in while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure, in Southern California. Easy walking distance to both. If you prefer reliable shuttle service is provided to and from the amusement parks. Great when you are exhausted at the end of each day. The closest hotel right next to Disneyland/California Adventure. The hotel puts out a phenomenal breakfast everyday. Continental breakfast includes coffee, tea, apple/orange juice, bagels with a variety of cream cheeses, pastries, croissants, sliced bread/toast, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, cubed cheese, a variety of dry cereal, including instant oatmeal with choice of non-fat/2% milk. We used a roll out bed, which was super comfortable. The mattress does not fold in half, it
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. The hotel room was very nice as they sent popcorn, cookies and coffee bags to the room before you get there. The location is great cause you can see the fireworks from Disneyland. And you can also hear the cars ride. It is a 5 minute walking distance. I loved how the service was so nice.

Summary Heading: Another great stay, perfect for Disneyland
Summary: This was our 4th stay at this property.  It truly is perfect for a trip to Disneyland.  About a 10 minute walk to the parks, and a free shuttle for the end of a long day of walking.  Every employee we encountered on this trip were so nice and kind.  My son was ill one afternoon we were there so we skipped having the room cleaned so he could rest.  Once the housekeeper saw he was in bed and not feeling well, she offered cold water bottles and brought fresh towels.  We stayed in a Premium room and the breakfast delivery was prompt each morning of our stay.  The breakfast items are fresh.  The hotel grounds are kept so nice with beautiful flowers everywhere.  There was ample parking.  What else can I say, we love the Candy Cane Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for being a repeat member of the Candy Cane family and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Summary Heading: Good stay for going to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel was sufficient. The staff was helpful. It was pretty clean. My only issue was that I asked for a quiet room, and I was placed in a room near the front office which was too close to the street traffic, so I couldn't fall asleep because of the street noise. The free WiFi would never connect for me. The free breakfast was decent. they served hard boiled eggs, cheese cubes, dry cereal and oatmeal packets, bread and bagels for toasting, danishes, coffee, juice, and milk.

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for one night before a day at California Adventure. The hotel is in the perfect location.  It was an easy walk to dinner at the Gardenwalk and to Disney in the morning.  The beds were comfortable and breakfast was great.  The only problem we had was with parking.  The spots were very narrow and because people who checked out kept their cars there for the day while they were at the parks, the people checking in had no place to park. We would definite stay here again when we return to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: could be the best in the area but there are a few things to consider
Summary: this gets reviewed very well for a reason.  It is very consistent in its service and offerings. set up as a motel type place with beautiful grounds and parking for everyone.  the way it is set back from the road and tucked into the corner of calif. adventure makes it quieter than most along harbor.  the rooms are fairly updated and clean, they have a much better than average free breakfast.  since it is one of the only hotels on the west side of harbor you have a direct walk to the disney gate so even though it is farther than many hotels it doesn't take any longer to walk due to lack of crosswalks(there is one but it doesnt carry public traffic.) the downs(if you want to nitpick) small pool, small rooms,and little higher price.  overall we usually check here first and if we
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am delighted you enjoyed our expanded complimentary continental breakfast, hotel setting and the cleanliness of our property. Thank you again for your wonderful comments and we hope to see you again real soon. Kind regards!

Summary: This was our 4th visit to the Candy Cane Inn and as always it was outstanding.  The room was super clean & quiet.  The beds very comfortable, AC is quiet & the staff super friendly.  Everything is so well maintained.  While there is a shuttle it is an easy walk to Disney. We highly recommend this wonderful hotel and plan to stay here again should we be back in Anaheim.

Summary: I researched many hotels close to disney and this property seemed promising.. It did not disappoint! The grounds are beautiful! The staff is friendly. The rooms are large, comfortable and clean. Very tasteful decor. It is close enough to walk (5 mins) but after long days at the park the bus is nice to have.. The drivers are very friendly and kind. It was nice to have free parking and breakfast. Also close to 7-11 and CVS. Our family will definitely stay at this property again.  They help make our daughters birthday special! Thank you candy cane inn!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for agreeing with our many TripAdvisor reviews. Summary: This was our second stay here. The first was 10 years ago.  The rooms are clean and neat and the property is beautifully maintained...pool, plantings, flowers, walks, etc.  The staff is extremely helpful and very friendly.  They run a complimentary bus to Disneyland every half hour. The continental breakfast is very good and can be eaten inside or on the patio poolside.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the theme parks. Summary Heading: What a great place - should have stayed here in the past
Summary: The only downfall was the soft beds. Otherwise, EXCELLENT hotel. Nice, friendly staff, no one ever passed me without saying hello. Shuttle bus is fab, always on time, life saver on the feet at the end of long day/night at Disney. CVS/ 7-11 and another small store right next door. Just down the road from the amazing Roscoe's chicken and waffles. Hotel pool excellent, wifi sufficient as was the breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am sincerely sorry that you found our mattresses to be soft, as I know everyone has their own taste in mattresses, and we do have double pillow top’s on all of our beds. I am however, extremely happy that you enjoyed the breakfast and our other complimentary amenities. We thank you again for your visit with us and hope you have a delightful day!

Summary: Our family spent three nights at the Candy Cane Inn at the end of July. Our experience was everything we hoped for!  The location is perfect for visiting Disneyland. Our kids are teens so the walk only took us about 10 minutes. We did use the shuttle once, but it was so crowded that we had to stand, which kind of defeated the purpose of using the shuttle. However, we could have avoided that by getting on the bus a few minutes earlier!  We booked two adjoining rooms, both "deluxe", and while one was slightly bigger than the other, both were just right for our family of 6. The rooms were clean and cool, thanks to the air conditioning. There are shutters instead of black-out drapes on the window, so a little light snuck through, but it was probably a good thing, or else we would
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your many wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your visit with us and I thank you for your kind comments about our team and property! Thank you again for your stay and we hope to see you again real soon. Kind regards!

Summary: I last stayed at this property around ten years ago, and enjoyed it so much that I had no hesitation in booking a last minute stay.  My last few stays have been at the Disneyland Resort hotels but the rates were obscene for this past week.  I had checked the rates on-line but needed to book two rooms and wanted them to have a connecting door.  The gentleman who took my reservation was so helpful and assured me they had two rooms with a connecting door - asked me if I wanted the ground floor for first floor (first or second floor in American speak).  He quoted me the rates, then asked if I was a AAA member and gave me a discount off the quoted price.  I often forget to ask for AAA discounts so this was a great touch.  We drove up to LA and spent the day at Universal, then drove
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us once again and I am delighted that you had another enjoyable trip to the Candy Cane Inn. Summary Heading: A Great Value Right Next to Disneyland!
Summary: I stayed at the Candy Cane Inn recently for two nights. I arrived around 5 pm the first night and decided I'd hit Downtown Disney first thing. Check-in was extremely quick, and the front desk staff was very friendly. I had a room right at the front of the property, which unfortunately meant that the only parking was far from my room, so I ended up having to schlep my bags quite a ways, though I think I could have left my car in the entry way to unload.  The room was clean and well lit and had all the amenities as advertised. The Candy Cane Inn does not skimp on the details, even leaving things like Q-tips and combs as standard that other larger chains won't do. I appreciate that the floor is wood rather than carpet, as touching carpet with your feet in a hotel is usually a gross
Manager Response: Thank you for visiting with us for the first time and for sharing your kind comments regarding our property, complimentary amenities and exceptional guest service. We thank you again for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great Location, Staff and Love the Shuttle Bus
Summary: We come to Anaheim every year but this was our first stay at the Candy Cane Inn and we were not disappointed with our decision to stay here on this trip. Overall we loved it although there was a few things that we didn't like! First the positives: -The staff:  every interaction I had with the front desk, housekeeping, the shuttle drivers and the people maintaining the grounds was so pleasant.  They were always friendly and helpful!   I was even "pixie-dusted" with quarters for a dryer load by their resident  disney enthusiast! -The location:  loved it!  A very short walk to Disneyland.  Right next door to an ABC  Mart and 7-Eleven with a 24 hour CVS on the other side of the street.  Also across from a little plaza with several eating places which included a 24 hour Subway.  IHOP

I thank you once again for your stay and please feel free to contact me personally when booking your next stay with us, as I would be delighted to assist with any requests or needs you may have. Kind regards!

Summary: We were a little wary at first to stay here at first due to its location, but decided to give it a go due to the reviews.   We got a great rate and where able to choose an upgraded room by request. Upgraded rooms as I was told are the standard rooms, so they are smaller, so ideal for a family of 4, maybe 5 if the kids are small. No room for a cot or roll-away.  When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly staff. Check in was fast and easy.  Room was clean and comfortable which is very hard to find unless you’re staying at the Disneyland hotel.  Most places have that sticky feeling, this place didn’t.  My favorite part of the room was the floors, no carpet! I had bad experience at another hotel. (See my Ramada review.) So the no carpet room was a blessing.  They have free wifi
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and for agreeing with our many TripAdvisor reviews. Summary: There's a lot I liked about this hotel. The room was cute and clean. Great location if you're going to Disneyland. It's easily walkable and takes less than ten minutes. We drove in and arrived around 8 AM. I fully realized this was early and didn't expect my room to be ready. We just planned on checking in and going to Disney until our room was ready. At first the woman working at the check in desk said we couldn't even check in until 11. I've never had a hotel not let us check in early. We weren't expecting to get our room until 3 but at most hotels we can check in early, leave our luggage and come back when it's ready. She finally took our information but said we weren't allowed to park there until 11. She refused to give us a parking pass and told us we had to find somewhere
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am sincerely sorry that you were unhappy with our parking policy, as it is not our intention to make any guest upset or disappointed. We had implemented this policy in order to accommodate parking for all of our guests during the busy summer months, including our in house guests who have till 11 am to checkout and move their vehicle. I again thank you for your valuable feedback and again while we never want to disappoint our guests, I will use this as a training tool for my staff to ensure we are being flexible as parking is available. I am however, happy that you enjoyed our location and cleanliness of our property. Thank you again for your valuable input. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Amazing location for your Disney visit
Summary: We decided on the Candy Cane Inn purely due to its cost and proximity to the Disney entrance and we couldn't be be more pleased. This hotel delivers so much value for money - continental breakfast, free parking, free wifi, mini-fridge, and free shuttle to Disney. Whilst the hotel may not have all the bells and whistles of a Disney hotel, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the pool is perfect for a quick dip after a long day at Disneyland. The staff were very friendly and were able to quickly provide answers to all of our questions - local shops (7-11 next door), pizza delivery (Marri's - yum!) and Disney transport advice (shuttle or walk). We intended to use the shuttle, but after learning the Disney gates are a 5-10 min walk, we walked both ways instead. We would
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the theme parks. I am delighted you and your family enjoyed your stay and the many complimentary amenities we offer with our hotel. We try to deliver excellent service and product, while being mindful of our families traveling on a budget. We hope to see you again real soon! Kind regards.

Summary: We booked this hotel about 2 weeks before our visit. I just went on Tripadvisor, found a hotel in the top rankings that was within walking distance to Disneyland, and went for it. Our room was a deluxe (medium quality, not the premium) room #228 and my in-laws took a connecting room beside us. We were on the second floor at the top of the stairs.  The good:  - It was close to Disneyland, but we never walked. My father-in-law uses a cane so we took the shuttle. The shuttle is exclusive to this hotel and doesn't make any other stops. That was good. It leaves every half-hour. - The other reviews raved about how clean this place is, and it was. It has a motel feel, small and old-ish, but clean. - There's a mini-fridge but it is a SMALL mini-fridge.  - Breakfast was included and
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Summary: This was the second time I've stayed at the Candy Cane Inn and I was just as impressed as the last time. The Staff are SO helpful - from the moment we checked in, to helping us with public transport questions, to storing our bags on our last day (even though we didn't leave until the evening!). The location is almost impossible to beat as well - a 5 minute walk from our room to the Disneyland gate? perfect! The breakfast is a huge plus - by stocking up for breakfast we didn't need to eat much/anything for lunch at the park.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your recent trip to the theme parks. I am delighted we were able to accommodate you for your second visit with us and that you enjoyed the many complimentary amenities we offer here at our hotel, including our expanded continental breakfast. Thank you again for your stay and we hope to see you again real soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: We love the Candy Cane Inn!
Summary: We stayed here 12 years ago, and it was our first choice of where to stay when we came back to Disneyland this year. It is just like we remembered, in all the best ways. I don't think I would want to stay anywhere else.  The motel is literally next door to the Disney Parks. You are really only a few way from the Radiator Springs ride's back wall, although you can't hear it at all.  It is any easy (10 min. or less) walk to the Disney entrance gate, but the Candy Cane also provides a free shuttle to the parks from before opening until after closing, twice an hour and also back from the parks twice an hour. We loved being able to get out of the mid-afternoon heat and crowds and relax with our feet up in our air conditioned room or by the lovely pool area (small, but very pretty).
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay once again with us and I thank you for your kind comments about our team and property! We look forward to seeing you again and please feel free to contact me personally, as I would be delighted to assist with any requests or needs you may have. Kind regards!

Summary: I just spent 5 days at Candy Cane Inn with my nieces.   This is our second visit to the hotel and love it!  Our room was clean and spacious.  The grounds around the hotel are beautifully maintained.  It was nice to start out our day having breakfast by the pool.  I also like the close proximity to Disneyland.  I mentioned at the front desk that we were celebrating my niece's graduation from college.  They surprised her with a beautiful card and cookies!  Finally, the entire staff at the hotel are knowledgeable and friendly.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for being a repeat member of the Candy Cane family and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and I thank you for your kind comments about our many complimentary amenities and wonderful staff. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: This is the place to stay!
Summary: We just left today. Very clean!!! Our room was cleaned daily and spotless. Staff was wonderful too. The breakfast is good as well. Pool is small but is clean as well. Beds and pillows are the softest around and super comfortable. The walk to D-land is about 10 minutes.  The owners are doing something right!! Edd (the hotel historian) is a wonderful fellow to meet. He usually greets all guests at breakfast :) We will definitely be back and recommend this place to all who visit D-land :)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. I am delighted you enjoyed our staff, setting and the cleanliness of our property. I am also happy that you had a chance to visit with Edd, who has been with us for over 30 years, and is just one of the many wonderful team members we have at our hotel. Thank you again for your wonderful comments. Kind regards!

Summary: My only hesitation in reviewing this hotel is that it will make it even harder to book!  Our recent second stay was as great as our last stay a few years ago.  The facility is modest but it is maintained very well and updated regularly.  It is extremely clean.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The breakfast is great.  It is a shorter walk from here to the Disneyland entrance than the walk from most of hotels operated by Disney.  It is ideal if, like us, you want to spend as much time as possible in the parks and only want to come back to your room for a good night's sleep, a mid-day nap, or a dip in the small but very nicely landscaped pool.  It's possible that you will not like this place if you fall into one of these categories:  1. People who prefer their hotels big,
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us once again and I am delighted that you had another enjoyable trip to the Candy Cane Inn. We appreciate your many kind comments and it is our pleasure to provide our guests with friendly and excellent customer service. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with future reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Outstanding Stay!!  STAY HERE if you're in Anaheim!!!
Summary: What a find.  First time staying at the Candy Cane Inn.  It's been about 10 years since being in Anaheim.  We used MouseSavers for the recommendation (never led us wrong).  This place is similar to a moderate Disney resort - big rooms, very clean, great staff.  It's smaller than what you might expect, but never an issue.  The included breakfast was great.  The pool and hot tub was great.  The staff was excellent.  I think any time a leaf fell from a tree a worker was there to sweep it up!   A huge shout out to the Manager, Jose Aguilar.  I saw him in the lobby on our 2nd or 3rd day and told him how nice his hotel was.  That night, we sent a gift basket to our room!  Really??!!  Who does that today?  A hotel manager who wants to exceed and delight people!   And the best part:
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us for the first time and I am delighted that you enjoyed the Candy Cane Inn. We appreciate your kind comments about our team, including my Front Office Manager Jose. He is a great asset to our hotel and continues to value and offer exceptional service to all guests. I again thank you for staying with us and we can’t wait to see you and your family back real soon. Kind regards!

Summary: We had stayed in the Candy Cane inn for three days and we all loved the service. It was great being able to get up and eat breakfast at the hotel and go to Disneyland in the shuttle without having to wait long. The shuttle drivers were so nice and thoughtful as well as the staff in the hotel. The only complain I might have is that the water pressure in the faucets was real low and the water seemed foggy. Maybe try a filter? Other then that great experience! Will come again! Thanks!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and for sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers.
