Summary: We stayed one night at the Candy Cane Inn. It was the last week in March, during Spring Break, but I am only getting around to writing a review now. I have used Tripadvisor several times for my other vacations, and I study customer reviews carefully. I was intrigued and impressed by CCI because of all the wonderful reviews, repeat customers, and raves about the service, not to mention the very affordable rates. I decided to give it a try. Our family of three drove down from Northern California and planned to stay one night, and and go to California Adventure the next day. I had to change our original reservation from two nights to one because I had developed plantar faciitis in my heel, and would not be able to do both parks, so we decided to do just the one. We arrived in the
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your visit in March and we appreciate your feedback and recommendations. I have shared your comments with our management team and I am so very sorry that your alarm clock awoke you in the middle of the night. Please contact me when planning your next visit as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: This is a very cute little hidden gem next to Disneyland.  We stayed here for my birthday in February.  The rooms were comfortable and very clean.  The service was great.  Everyone was very friendly.  I love the landscape, it is very well taken care of.  We didn't have any problems with noise from the outside as others had stated they did.  We walked and took the candy cane inn bus over to Disneyland.  The breakfast was plentiful.  They had all sorts of breads and bagels, cream cheese, yogurts, fruit, cereal, coffee, and juices.  The price is very budget friendly.  Would highly recommend this place.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We appreciate your business and our team certainly cares about our guests and property. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Love it here but check in was a downer
Summary: We have stayed at Candy Cane 8 times in the last 10 years and have loved it every time. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. It is very close to the entrance to Disneyland with their own shuttle, which is a huge advantage. I have never heard anyone next door which is my pet peeve, very quiet. The only negative I have to say was the check in. Angel did not look us in the eye when we came in and barely looked at us through the whole process, we did not feel welcome and there definetly was not the disney vibe present.We all walked away feeling a little disappointed. Other than that it was a great stay. Maybe a little reminder this is a hospitality business is in order.  The price is getting a little steep also, if it keeps going up we may have to look elsewhere
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for being a loyal repeat guest and we do appreciate and listen to your feedback. Being a return guest please make sure that you bring your Rewards Certificate that is given at checkout so you capture the discount if returning within the next year. Please feel free to contact me when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: not an inn but a motel but location, location, location.
Summary: A very odd name for this motel.  I consider it a motel because you park in front of your room.  The staff was very friendly and you can purchase anything from their gift shop at normal prices.  We bought water, suntan lotion and food at a very reasonable price compared to if you were to purchase them in the Disneyland park.  For example, water was $2.00 compared to $6 in the park.  When we walk into the room it was clean but has a little musty smell from the air conditioner.  There was a fridge to put any food we packed or bought from the array of restaurants or convenience store right next door.  They serve a continental breakfast of fruits, cereal, breads and drinks in the morning.  Tip to you.......bring the tray from the room to allow you to bring the food back with you if
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit and I am sincerely apologetic that our front desk agent appeared uninterested in your comments as this is certainly NOT the issue and we appreciate and welcome guests feedback. In regards to our closing the door when in the room, this is done to protect the personal items of the guest (as well as themselves) as the attendant may be in the restroom cleaning and not hear someone entering the room. I am not sure if you noticed that a card in hung on the door handle stating that someone in the room.  And yes, the trays in the room are intended for use at our Expanded Continental Breakfast. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Beware - they tried to rip me off on the rates - other recommendations are wrong
Summary: I planned to follow the recommendations and go to this inn. I found it hard to find (with my GPS) for some reason. The lady quoted me room-rates, which were much higher "because of a convention". So what!!! We had nothing to do with the convention, so why should I get charged a way higher rate? There was no convention anywhere else. I also asked about "the standard rates" and she quoted prices considerably higher than the rates other people posted in their reviews on this site.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments; I have attempted to contact you through TripAdvisor with no response however wanted to respond. We cannot locate a reservation of your visit based on information you have provided here. In regards to rates, our rates are published as other properties noting the lowest and highest rates based on room type, occupancy levels, availability and season of the year. Kind regards.

Summary Heading: Another great stay at the Candy Cane!
Summary: Family just got back for 3 great nights at the Candy Cane. This is a repeat visit and reminded me why we come back here every time we visit Disneyland. James at the front desk was so great at welcoming us and was even able to get us checked in a bit early so we could get our stuff in the fridge and head to the park. Thank you James! Everyone there was so friendly and helpful. Location is perfect as it is very short walk to the park. Plus they have a shuttle that runs every 1/2 hour so it really was nice. Not to mention there is a store next door that was very convenient. We also made a couple trips to the Cheesecake Factory for some great food and it was a very short walk. It was packed but we still had no problem finding a parking spot.  Hotel room was perfect. Plenty of room
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we appreciate your kind comment and that you are a loyal and repeat guest of our Inn. Our entire team does a wonderful job in taking care of our property and they are sincere in the genuine care and concern they demonstrate with guests. I am delighted that your son enjoyed the cookies on his special day and it’s a small token of our appreciation. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Nice,not stunning but decent for price. No elevator, good breakfast, tight parking
Summary: Overall I would probably stay here again, but planning on trying somewhere a bit closer next time.  I thought this was the closest hotel, but there are some RIGHT outside the gates that would be more convenient for naps for the younger kids.. and that has an elevator.  My only complaint about the hotel overall was that there is no elevator. It wasn't carrying the luggage that was a problem, that's just once up and once down.. but hauling the stroller up and down several times a day got really old, really fast.. then stick a sleeping child in there.  That was not fun.  Check in was easy and quick.  We didn't realize we needed to present our AAA card for the discount and didn't bring it, so had to pay the $10 extra per night for our room.  Staff is super friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback and I personally appreciate your responding to my email and your information. First I would like to apologize that our front desk agent did not attempt to contact AAA to validate your membership being that you did not have your card. We have met with some resistance from the AAA staff when we attempt to verify membership however most time the staff is accommodating. We do certainly attempt to honor all requests as it pertains to being on the first or second floor and in the future please inform the reservationist and by all means please know that if you simply contact the front desk one of our staff would be delighted to assist with your luggage. Kind regards!

Summary: This was my first time to Disneyland and I chose this place based on the many positive reviews here. Now I have to add mine! First off, this is a motel (room doors open up to the parking area), so don't want anyone to be surprised there. But this is the best landscaped motel I've ever encountered and was a pleasant environment. The rooms were fine, though a little cramped when we added the rollaway, but what do you expect. There is a TV, but I don't think we even turned it on, we spent all our time at the parks. There is a fridge to keep things in. Toilet and shower are in one room, the sinks are outside, so someone can have some privacy taking a shower while the rest can primp outside. There is a pool area that looked inviting but we simply had no time to make use of it.
Manager Response: Thank you staying with us and we appreciate your kind comments regarding the condition of our property and being reasonably priced. Our on staff gardeners do a wonderful job and we receive many positive comments regarding the pleasant and peaceful environment. Yes, there are many dining and shopping options within walking distance. Kind regards!

Summary: We just recently stayed six nights here and once again we were very pleased. This was our third time staying here but our first time getting the deluxe room. For only $10 more per night we upgraded, and I sure am glad we did! With two daughters and a wife, we sure needed the extra space and shelves! We spent a lot of time in the swimming pool area. They have a nice pool area including a seprate jaccuuzi and a kiddie pool. The breakfast in the morning is very nice! Better than most standard continental breakfasts I've seen. This one has oatmeal, yogurts, cereals, bagels, fresh fruit, pastries, donuts, coffee, juice, milk, and much more...... The gift shop has great souveniers at great prices! The parking is free! My sister lives 20 minutes away and wanted to come visit since we
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat Candy Cane Inn guest and I am delighted that your family had a wonderful visit. We look forward in seeing you again and please feel free to contact me when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: We just spent three nights at the Candy Cane Inn - our first stay at this property.  We have two kids (7, 11) and found the room to be clean, spacious and very comfortable.  The property itself is immaculate and full of amenities.  We bought annual passes to Disneyland and this was our first visit - we were so tired by the afternoon, and it was great to be able to come back to the hotel and let the kids swim for a couple of hours while we rested!  The pool was clean and heated and the jacuzzi was perfect for soaking away the pain of Disneyland.  While you can walk a short distance to the Disneyland, the shuttle is great...especially when you are coming home.  The free breakfast in the morning was yummy - cereals, fruit, yogurt, bagels, pastries, coffee, juice, etc.  My kids
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your first stay and I am delighted to read that you look forward to many times ahead. Please feel free to contact me personally as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and future reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: Candy Cane Inn is very close to Disneyland.  Its about a 10 minute walk.  We have a disabled daughter so we chose the FREE shuttle provided by the hotel.  The shuttle left and arrived on time.  The shuttle and hotel staff was great.  The breakfast was fine and it was nice by the pool. The hotel was decent size and clean bathroom/bedding and vanity.  My only complaint was the carpet.  I know kids stay at this hotel...so that means they eat and drop things on the carpet and they dont wipe there feet as well...but the carpets should be steam cleaned alot more.  It had stains and looked a little dingy.  I would absolutly stay here again.  We plan on coming back in November and we will stay at the Candy cane inn.  Great for family.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your comments and have shared with our housekeeping management team. We are currently working on a project where we are re-tiling our bathrooms and continuing the tile across in front of the vanities and have received many positive comments.  Please contact when planning your November trip so I may place you in one of the completed rooms as I would enjoy your feedback. Kind regards.

Summary: Perfect for walking to Disney with kids or take the free hotel shuttle every 30 mins.  Very clean, full bath in bathroom, and great continental breakfast with fresh fruit and hot chocolate to get the kids started.  Beds are too soft would be my only complaint.  Lots of restaurants on the other side of the street or order Chinese, Mexican or Italian to your room with free delivery.  Pool and spa are in a very pretty garden setting.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we DO appreciate your business and kind comments. Yes, there are many dining option within a short walk of our Inn. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Inn is a gem!
Summary: I was intrigued, but wary, of this property for many years.  The name brought pictures of plastic lollipops and huge canes you walk through to your room.  My family and I went last week, and we were sold on everything!  The room was very clean, somewhat spacious (more than I expected, since we had five sharing it).  Every employee was courteous, helpful and genuinely interested in our stay.  The front desk was gracious, the gentleman who came around and talked about Disney history with me (I love that subject), the people cleaning up outside, could not have been more pleasant.  It was a bit noisy in the morning since we were in a motel, and the cars were parked right outside our room, but that was to be expected.  The poolside and room service for breakfast made it more
Manager Response: Thank you for finally allowing us the opportunity and I am delighted that your family enjoyed the experience. Yes, Edd, our Hotel Historian has been with the Candy Cane Inn almost 28 years and he certainly has many stories to share. In a family property with many children the upstairs rooms tend to be quieter and simply ask the reservationist or front desk agent as we certainly attempt to honor all requests. Kind regards.

Summary: The Candy Cane Inn is great. It's best feature is its proximity to Disneyland. It's about a 10 to 15 min easy walk but they also provide a free, hotel only shuttle. This is wonderful after a full day of walking and standing in line! Previously, we have stayed about 1 mile from Disneyland with a  many hotel, pay by the ride, shuttle. Candy Cane is far better. It has very clean, neat and has relatively large rooms. My mother's room had a slow sink and they arrived within the hour to fix it. The breakfast is typical hotel continental fare with bagels, donuts, muffins and bananas, apples and oranges. It suffices to get you started on your day and they open early enough you can get breakfast and still get to Disneyland by 7:00. My only complaint is the last day we slept in and went
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am sincerely sorry for the shortage of bagels and while we do order based upon guest counts we attempt to be as close as possible as our shipments arrive daily to ensure freshness without heavy waste. Yes, many folks prefer the larger vanity and sink outside of the shower area. Kind regards!

Summary: We stayed at CCI for two nights. I haven't stayed here since I was a child but I am regularly in this area for Disneyland trips. Always excited to try new hotels after hours of research because I am picky. Rooms are very clean and I would say standard size. Not huge but enough to fit two travel cribs for my twins. We just had a standard room with two queen beds. Bathroom sink area had alot of room but the bathroom could had been bigger but average. Breakfast was okay we just did yogurts and fruit for the kids. Not into all the pastries etc. Staff was nice and we didn't use the shuttle, it's walking distance and that is the best part. Same side of Disneyland and after eating all that bad food we jogged or raced as a family back to our room. I would def. stay here again because it
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and remember to use your Rewards Certificate with your annual pass holder for the double discount. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: A little weird to be there for business
Summary: This place clearly caters primarily to families, since it is almost next door to Disneyland.  It is also only a short walk from the Anaheim Convention Center, which is why I was there.  Room was OK -- perhaps slightly smaller than you would get at a Fairfield Inn or Hilton Garden Inn, and definitely older (especially the bathrooms).  That said, however, the room was clean, and was quiet inside despite lots of kids running around outdoors.  The pool was very small and was jammed with little kids all day, so you can pretty much forget about using it.  Service personnel were very nice and very efficient -- clearly a strong plus.  Given its location and modest price, I would stay here again -- just don't go in expecting anything above average.   .
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and while some may not call us a “business” traveler hotel we do have a fair amount of guests that attend the Convention Center and appreciate all that we have to offer and prefer our smaller and quaint atmosphere. We certainly appreciate your business and appreciate your feedback. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: The love affair is over... I won't ever be back
Summary: I live in Texas and I take my daughter to Disneyland every year for her birthday. We always book a premium room because that's why we stay there -- the cookies, popcorn, video, candy cane, breakfast in a basket... it makes the birthday girl's time there so very special. This year they did not have the double queen so we accepted the king. They never told us we were being downgraded. To a dirty, closet of a room under the stairs. Dingy, smelly.... my daughter started crying. I went to the front desk and explained that there was some kind of mistake. They turned it back on me, stating that they told me that my room was not available. I asked it I could 'upgrade' and at least buy some cookies and try to make that room something special. I was told the cookies are only available for
Manager Response: First and foremost and with all due respect I want to make it perfectly clear that we appreciate ALL guests (past, present and future) and the feedback they provide and I have always chosen not to use this platform to challenge. This being said the reservation was correct and we clearly had it in our notes that this guest would like a Premium Room should one become available, however they were already reserved and none became available. The room that was reserved was a King Bedded accessible room and while the location is behind the stairwell (so they are close to the sidewalk ramp and vending area) the location is for guest convenience. They are as clean, fresh, nicely decorated and the same size as all other Deluxe Rooms. I am sincerely apologetic that our hotel was completely sold out and we could not move this guest without effecting another guest reservation as this would be disrespectful to that guest. Kind regards!

Summary: We had 4 adults in one room, which required an extra trundle bed, which made the room a little squishy, but overall, the room was excellent, clean, beds soft, and for the price and location, a short 10 min walk to Disneyland, it was excellent. The breakfast rush can be a bit crowded, and the breakfast is basic fare, cereal, toast, buns and muffins, and some really bad orange juice and coffee. But, it's all included in the cost, so we thought it was great. Lovely pool and spas if you get a chance, the grounds are picturesque. And the desk clerks were really friendly and helpful. Thanks dudes!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing us with your kind comments. I am delighted that your stay was excellent and look forward in seeing you again. Kind regards!

Summary: I found Candy Cane Inn on Trip Advisor and recently spent 5 nights here (during 'Spring Break'). Initial check in late one evening after driving from San Francisco was not very friendly but can't fault any other aspect of our stay. Rooms are large and beds excessively comfortable; bathroom adequate; fridge provided and coffee making machine, iron and ironing board (who irons on holiday?!)...buffet breakfast adequate and casual - can take stuff back to your room. Small dipping pool and laundry room. Efficient cleaning staff. Although only a 10 minute walk from Disneyland there is a complimentary shuttle every 30 mins through til after the fireworks at midnight. Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we appreciate your feedback about our rooms and services. We receive many positive comments about our Serta Presidential Mattresses and I am delighted that you found comfortable. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Lovely family facility right near Disneyland
Summary: Friendly staff, nice rooms with free parking, wifi and breakfast.  Free shuttle if you want to skip the 10 minutes walk to Disneyland, last service back to the hotel 45 minutes after the park closes.  I definitely recommend the service, value and convenience of this lovely property.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers, we sincerely appreciate your business. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: they messed up, and then they made it right!
Summary: Candy Cane grounds are beautiful. 10 minute walk to Disney, and you don't even have to cross the street. Loads of restaurants straight across the road. We made a reservation in advance and dropped our bags off on our way to Disney for the day. When we got back that evening, one backpack was lost, they didn't have a room for us, the desk clerk couldn't think on his feet and address the situation, and there was a lot of flailing. A LOT OF FLAILING. It was not a pretty sight.  We finally got our room, but the key didn't work. We asked to speak to a manager, but s/he wasn't available. The flailing continued. The good news, after this cascade of ridiculous screw-ups, is that they made it right. They found our backpack buried under a random desk somewhere, and yes, the claim ticket
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your understanding and you are completely correct with your comments. I was the gentleman who spoke with you in the morning and the discount was a token of our gratitude with your seeing that our team is like anyone else and is NOT above making mistakes. The thing we must take from any situation is how to discover what occurred and prevent from future mishaps. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist you and your guests with reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: We absolutely loved it here.  Great location, great pool - perfect for a visit to Disneyland.  It was very easy to walk to restaurants and Disneyland.  You don't need a car if you stay here.  Breakfast was great.  Both of our kids, ages 8 and 10, loved this hotel as much as we did.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Kind regards!

Summary: Wonderful accommodation very close to Disneyland- we walked there each day in less than 5 minutes!  The service was very good and the people in reception very professional.   The only slightly negative comments I had were that we had a room with a connecting door and the people next door very loud and we didn't get to sleep until 12am (there was a fair bit of noise outside, too, and we were at the back of the complex). I am a very light sleeper thought, so others would probably be able to sleep through that!  The grounds were gorgeous and the complimentary breakfast was a nice addition! We're very glad we stayed at the candy cane inn and would happily stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sincerely apologetic about your next door neighbors. We only hope and wish that others in our (or another) hotel will take into consideration the respect for others who are in the rooms next to and above or below. Kind regards!

Summary: We have been coming to Candy Cane for over 10 years and love it each and every visit. We have tried other hotels occasionally (when CCI was full) and they just don't compare. The location can't be beat its a lovely 10 minute walk to the parks. Staff always go out of their way to help in any way (even helped wash our car one visit). Rooms are tastefully decorated and beds are super comfortable. It's very quiet throughout the property and its gorgeous any time of year with hundreds of flowers. The breakfast hours have been extended which was a great help to us for getting an early start. Candy Cane is our disney home and will continue to be our hotel of choice in the Anaheim area for many years to come.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat guest, we sincerely appreciate your business. I am delighted that you refer to the Candy Cane Inn as “your Disney home” that is what continues to make us proud. Please feel free to contact me personally when planning your next visit as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: You can't even find this place on Expedia, Hotwire, or Priceline-- which I love. We stayed there for my birthday trip to Disneyland last November and I can hardly wait to go back. This place literally backs up Disney Adventure. The room was clean, reasonably priced, and came with a lovely breakfast. There was a shuttle service offered to the front gate, but you are literally 2 blocks away.  Next door was a 2 different convenience stores, so if you forgot something or needs some late night snacks, you're covered! We even had a little fridge in our room, which is always nice.  I can't wait for our next trip!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted to read that your birthday celebration was enjoyable.  No, you will not find us the noted websites as we process all of our own bookings on our website, through our business listing on TripAdvisor or by calling the hotel directly. Kind regards!

Summary: Candy Cane Lane was a perfect hotel for us. Travelling with our little ones (age 1 and 4) we got rooms side by side with grandparents (we had reserved adjoining but they were unable to accomodate at check-in time). The rooms were lovely and had very comfy beds. We spent 6 nights in a deluxe room and our final night in a premium room (in-room biscotti, bottled water, robes, breakfast). The farther back you go on the property the better the rooms (regular at the front, deluxe halfway down, and premium at the back). We were also able to get a play and pack crib for our son which was great.  Continental breakfast was great - cereal, yogurt, bagels, toast, doughnuts, danishes, bananas, apples, juices, hot chocolate, tea, coffee, and milk. They also have coffee in the lobby all day
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us that opportunity on your family visit with the grandparents. We certainly do our utmost to honor all requests and thank you for understanding that sometime this is unable to occur with levels of occupancy and they were able to place you in rooms next to each other. Kind regards!

Summary: We stayed 3 nights at the Candy Cane over spring break 2013. The hotel is clean, room we had was cozy, but nice. Pool was clean, but not heated. Hot tub was HOT.  Pro: Shuttle departs from hotel every 30 minutes. This was wonderful in that my son (7) and my pregnant wife didn't get exhausted just walking to the park.   Room was very clean. None of the standard icky items sometimes find at hotels (hair in bed, grim around shower).   Breakfast was tasty. Kids loved having donuts all 4 breakfasts. Options were pastries (donuts, muffins, bagels), yogurt and cereal. Coffee, juice and milk on tap.   Free parking! I've paid $15-20/night for parking.   Con: Cleaning crew used a strong, orange scented spray in room. First night, it was like we slept in an orange orchard. Had to let the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with this valuable feedback, we DO appreciate you taking your time. One thing that you noted and I saw in another review is our pool temperature, our pool and kiddie pool is heated to 79-80 degrees and the spa to 103-105 degrees year round. Kind regards.

Summary Heading: Quaint Inn Right Next to Disney
Summary: We just got back from our California vacation, and I was very pleased with our experience at The Candy Cane Inn.  As a Disney fanatic, I've been hearing about this place for years, so I was excited to be staying there for our most recent vacation.   The Inn isn't the most up to date, but the rooms are super clean and well taken care of.  The grounds are pristine and very lush--there are plants and flowers everywhere.  It's very cute and reminds me a bit of Port Orleans-French Quarter at the Walt Disney World Resort.  Having the bus service available to us was great on days that we were tired from walking the parks, but honestly, Disneyland is two blocks away, so it was a nice, quick walk if we happened to miss the bus (they only run every 30 minutes).  The contintental breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your kind comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Our team in housekeeping and our gardeners certainly do a wonderful job in keeping our Inn clean and grounds pristine. Kind regards!

Summary: I keep finding myself giving this Motel high regards.  We stayed again in March during the Cheer week/spring break and they were extremely busy.  You would not know it though.  The staff were great to work with.  We got there early and our room was not ready, so they checked our luggage in and we were able to go to the park to spend the afternoon and not have to wait.  We stayed in the premium room for a week which was definitely worth the extra price.  The candy cane inn also has a returning guest coupon which we used as well as our AP discount.  The grounds were spotless the whole time we were there and housekeeping staff very respectful of us when we had to spend a day in as both my daughter and I had fell ill. The candy cane inn is our home away from home while in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat guest, we DO appreciate your business and our team works very hard to maintain your trust and loyalty in our Inn. Please feel free to contact personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here.  Room was comfortable and functional.  The breakfast every morning was a lifesaver wtih two kids and a nice way to get our early days started.  They had quite a few choices (cereal, bagels, donuts, oatmeal, yogurt, etc) and never ran out of items.  The shuttle to and from the park was good but we also had the option to walk when we wanted to as it is very close.  The shuttle drivers were very friendly and helpful.  It has a lot of food choices around it when we did not want to spend a fortune in the park.  One bummer we had was the first day we went to buy our Disneyland passes and the front desk had run out!!!  It caused a bit of stress but we ended up buying them on line instead. We did not have the chance to use the pool this time due to how
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sincerely sorry about our being out of Disney Tickets. While there was some confusion with Disney folks processing the order, I take full responsibility that we should have taken into consideration spring break and apologize for any inconvenience. Kind regards!

Summary: We have stayed in many different hotels in the Disneyland area.  We have tried more expensive hotels and less expensive hotels.  Once we stayed here, I found no need to look any further.  This place really is the best deal.  Its is an easy walk into Disneyland.  No charge for parking.  It is very clean and the grounds are well kept.  Its includes breakfast.  It has a pool and hot tub.  The hot tub is especially great after walking around disneyland.  I am truly a fan and have been a repeat customer every time I go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat guest and certainly know that we appreciate this so very much! Kind regards.

Summary Heading: Another lovely stay at this nice Motel
Summary: This was our second stay at the Candy Cane Inn.  This large and conveniently located motel goes the extra "mile" to accommodate its guests.  For example, my granddaughters and I arrived quite early (9:00 a.m.) and our premium room was ready.   It was a pleasant surprise to be handed the keys several hours before check-in time.  And, if space is available, which it was both times I stayed there, you are allowed to park in their lot and use their shuttle before you check in.  (You must go to the front desk to get a parking permit.)   It is walking distance to Disneyland, but I almost always used their shuttle.  The front desk staff, housekeeping staff, and shuttle drivers are friendly and efficient. (except for Amy at the reception desk who was just as grumpy this time as she was
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your wonderful remarks about our Inn. Please contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure in allowing Amy to assist with your next reservation and let you find out that she IS a certainly a warm and caring individual and an asset to our team. Kind regards!

Summary: My family stayed at the Candy Cane while on our vacation to Disneyland. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland and also offers a free shuttle if you don't feel like walking. Upon our arrival we discovered the bathroom door did not latch shut and the toilet seat was very loose. I called the front desk and they had someone up to repair everything within 30 minutes, very pleased. Our room was very clean, the beds were comfortable. Hotel offers a free continental breakfast, nothing fancy but better than others I've had. They offered cereal, pastries, oatmeal, fruit, bread... You could eat your breakfast by the pool which was nice. The parking lot is a bit tight, we had trouble parking our minivan but it is free which is a huge plus so can't complain too much. Enjoyed our
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted that our maintenance team expediently took care of the noted items. I am sorry for any inconvenience as will certainly bring to the attention of our housekeeping team to report prior to guests occupying a room. Kind regards.

Summary: Just got off the phone with the Motel Manager named Jeff who claims I've made a great decision by canceling my reservation with a larger and cheaper chain to stay with them. He was extremely friendly so we are off to a good start.  I have 8 months to sweat this one out however and go over all the great reviews, both good, bad, and indifferent.  I am quite honestly one to stay in my comfort zone but I find it extremely difficult to overlook so many positive reviews. I am taking note of the many tips and may consider upgrading to a deluxe room as I don't want to disappoint my wife on her 40th Birthday Surprise.......check back in December and as I will certainly update all of you who are thinking the same thing I am regarding the old adage that some things aren't as good as they
Manager Response: Thank you speaking with me and for making this reservation, we certainly look forward to your wife and her celebrating her 40th here at the Candy Cane Inn. Kind regards!

Summary: This hotel, located right next to Disneyland and an easy walk to the park, is nicely located for families.  We had party of 5, three adults and 2 children, 9 & 11,so we reserved early (Feb. for a April stay) for a premium 2 queend bed/plus rollaway, HC  (confirmation in hand). A day before check-in, I received a call asking if we could forgo the large room for one night (because of a guests illnss prevening them from leaving, so I was told), and we agreed to do so.  However, when we checked in, we were told that the large room was  available only for one night, then  we wold have to move a standard room with 2 queen beds and a rollaway.  We had not choice but to take the smaller room as all the hotels in the area were booked (spring vacation).We took the smaller room for all
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Too good not to come back to
Summary: We first stayed at the Candy Cane Inn back in Sept of 2012.  We were going to be in LA for a wedding in Jan of 2013 so we thought we would extend our stay an extra day and do Disneyland with our daughter.  It was an easy choice to stay here again.  Close to Disney (you can walk or take the super easy shuttle right to the entrance), clean, comfy and a good price = lifelong customer.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted that decided to extend a day to visit the Theme Parks with your daughter. Kind regards!

Summary: Stayed at this hotel 3 times within the past couple of years, Its right next to Disney Lane so can either walk or get the shuttle bus which run very often. Also next to shops to grab snacks etc as well. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are pleasant and clean!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat guest at the Candy Cane Inn, we appreciate your business and kind comments. Kind regards!

Summary: We stayed for two nights on March 17th and 18th for our Disneyland visit.  Normally we stay at the Disney resort, but since the entire family couldn't make it on this trip we decided to try the CCI because friends and co-workers recommended it to us.  There was a small problem with the reservations where we were booked for three rooms instead of two. This was quickly and efficiently resolved at the front desk office.  BTW the kids loved the basket of candy canes in the lobby.  We were on the second floor with adjoining rooms. The rooms were very clean and bright, the only small draw back was that the beds were a little too soft for our taste. The continental breakfast had a good selection of pastries, cereal, coffee and juices.  It could get a little crowded in the seating area,
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit and listening to your friends and co-workers. We appreciate your business and thank you for your feedback. I am delighted that your reservations were quickly and efficiently resolved with our front desk. While we receive many positive comments regarding our double pillow top Serta Presidential Suite mattresses this is item of preference and I am sorry if they were too soft for your liking. Yes, our guests enjoy our Rewards Certificates and feel free to contact me if you would like assistance with future reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here 3/19/13-3/22/13 for our 10th wedding anniversary all the way from Long Island.  This is a perfect little slice of Anaheim, making a Disneyland experience even better.  The beds and pillows were wonderful, the room was clean and just what we requested.  The pool and surrounding area was really pretty but we didn't use it.  The continental breakfast was really nicely done.  They had food and coffee inside and near the pool so everyone could sit outside if they wanted to.  Every day we would get up early, get our coffee and listen to the birds chirping.  So peaceful.  Parking was a little tough at times but no big deal really.  Everyone from the gardeners to the front desk were very friendly.  The grounds were beautiful.  Flowers galore.  We loved this
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers.  It was our pleasure to have you celebrate this special occasion at our Inn and should you be returning please contact me personally as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations.  Yes, the serenity around the pool is certainly peaceful and enjoyable in the morning and as well in the evenings. Warm regards!

Summary: Stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for two nights during a visit to the Disney Parks. The hotel staff were friendly and the hotel is located waking distance from the parks and other amenities (including a grocery store and places to eat). Breakfast is included in the room rate (bagels, toast, cereal, pastries, coffee and tea) and hotel guests can access a free shuttle (that goes every half hour) to and from Disney (even though its close by, after spending all day walking around the parks it's great to just be able to just hop on a shuttle back to your room).  The pool area looked nice (too cold for swimming for me) and the gardens are very well maintained and pretty.  I would definitely stay here again when visiting Disney Parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to the Theme Parks. We appreciate your kind comments and while it may have been a bit cold for you please know that our Pool and Children’s Wading Pool is heated year round to 79 Degrees for guest comfort. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: As first time visitors to the Disneyland Resort, we wanted everything about our stay to be easy and convenient. Our stay at the Candy Cane Inn was all I could have hoped for!  The property is charming - lots of flowering bougainvillea, cobblestone parking area, all very beautifully maintained. It felt like a little oasis in the busy, tourist area around Disneyland.  Our room (#136) was super clean, the beds comfortable, and on the first night we watched the fireworks display out our window while lounging in bed!  The staff was accommodating, friendly, and always helpful - I'd like to give a special thanks to Danilo Gonzalez (Executive Housekeeper) and anyone else on the staff who took the effort to find my son's lost teddy bear and have it back in our room before bedtime!  The
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity on your first visit to the Theme Parks. I am sincerely delighted that the Candy Cane Inn delivered “all that you could have hoped for!” I am very happy that Danilo and team were able to reunite your son’s teddy bear and him for a peaceful and restful night. Kind regards!

Summary: Stayed at Candy Cane Inn in March 2013 with a family of 4. This hotel is plane, clean. There is a really nice continental breakfast. No hot food, but good selection of pastries, fruit, yougurt. Nice pool and jaccuzzi, also used as an overflow area during breakfast. Staff was nice and accommodating, although when we arrived at noon, our room was not ready and they had nothing to offer.  Best of all, this motel is within a really short walk to the park gates. There is a convenient shuttle from the hotel to the park too. We did both. This hotel is a very economical ,convenient and great option when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. We do believe in providing quality accommodation and exceptional service while being mindful of travelers on family budgets. Kind regards!

Summary: Just got back from a 2 week trip through Nor/Socal, we stayed at the Candy Cane on trip adviser reviews. We we not disapointed , good breafast clean rooms helpful staff . all for $130 A NIGHT !!! We will be back ,  Thanks Mike & Cindy !
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers, we appreciate your business. Kind regards!

Summary: We spent four nights at the Candy Cane Inn, and as per the other reviews lived up to its reputation. Good possition and generally well run establishment. We had an issue with non performance of hot water, this was resolved with first a call from the Manager Jeff and followed by a gift basket and of course HOT water, a rare experince these days. If you are a family brave enough to spend 4 days in Disney Land then this is the spot for you.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and it was my pleasure to speak with you while you were on property. I am delighted that you understood of the situation that occurs at times with the calcium level here in Anaheim and how it plays havoc on water valves and cartridges. Warm regards!

Summary: Our family recently stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for three nights. We chose this hotel based on the reviews we read on Tripadvisor. We have been to Anaheim numerous times and have stayed at nearly all the hotels close to Disneyland. While the grounds are beautiful and the pool/breakfast area is great that is where it ends. When we went to check in the cost of our room had been changed to reflect a $10 a night increase. When I protested and insisted that the confirmation email did not say $139 a night, they did not believe me. They were not rude just irritated that they had to wait for me to pull the confirmation letter up on my phone. Once I showed the letter they changed the price back and could not begin to explain why the price had changed. While parking is free, get there
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with this valuable feedback regarding your experiences. We do listen to our guest and certainly discuss and implemented operational changes based on the overall operation and thank our guests for bringing items that will enhance the overall guest experience. Kind regards!

Summary: We picked the Inn based on other positive reviews.  We like the very easy location.  We could easily walk back and forth to DLR, but we liked having the option to use their shuttle, and it was nice for a midday break and at the end of the day after our feet were tired.  The food was good, but it does get crowded in the breakfast room, and seating is limited, so I recommend going early or grabbing a tray to take it back to your room.  The rooms were very comfortable and nicely decorated.  I have to agree with other viewers, though--the floor was gross.  The carpet was dirty and bumpy, so I kept my flip flops handy.  We've stayed at BWI and PPI across the street from the DLR, and this was slightly less than both of those.  Even if it was the same price and even though they have
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and bringing your comments to our attention. I would like to bring up that we have reviewed guest feedback and started renovation in our guestrooms and are continuing the ceramic tile directly across in front of the sink area as this is very high traffic. Kind regards!

Summary: Have just completed a 4 night stay at this hotel and were very impressed. The rooms, although small, have had some upgrading and are quite comfortable. There is a continental breakfast bar which  doesnt offer any hot items, but is well stocked with buns, muffins, yogurt, cereal and fruit. The seating area in the breakfast room is small but there is an overflow area outside on the patio surrounding the pool.This can be quite pleasant on a morning when the weather is nice.The staff are exceptional at this hotel. They go out of their way to be helpful and are always smiling and friendly.The hotel has their own shuttle bus to Disneyland which runs back and forth every half hour. While this is an excellent bonus, the hotel is only a 2 block walk from the entrance to the parks,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Yes, our deluxe rooms are approximately 45 square feet larder than our standard rooms allowing additional free floor space. Our premium rooms are another 40 plus square feet larger than the deluxe and provide additional amenities and services. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Heading to Disneyland and Candy Cane Inn next Sat March 30th 2013
Summary: Excellent so far but need to update next Sunday pending review.... I am pleased to read most of the reviews on this site. My family loves to travel to Disneyland at least twice a year and I am shopping around for good hotels. This morning I spoke with James, who was extremely helpful and very thoughtful. I was kind of stressing out because I would like everything to be perfect for my daughters 5th birthday next weekend. I informed him I would be headed down to Anaheim by 7am and needed to check in earlier then 3pm (the hotels check-in time). He informed to do the following:  park and come into the front desk, get a parking permit, check in my belongings, take the shuttle to Disneyland and not to worry about a thing. The shuttle runs 45 min after the park closes so I have more
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing the Candy Cane Inn to celebrate this special day for Victoria-Rose. We will certainly do our very best to accommodate your early arrival request and wish you an awesome family weekend. Kind regards!

Summary: Just returned from a stay on March 15th, our 4th stay at this wonderful hotel.  We booked a Premium room and when we arrived at 10 a.m. on a very busy week we were thrilled that our room was ready and we were able to check in immediately!  We used to stay at another hotel down the street, but ever since staying here we refuse to stay anywhere else.  Their shuttle service is amazing, always on time and all the drivers are so nice.  Love the premiums rooms, nice to be at the back of the hotel with a slightly bigger room including a microwave, welcome basket and breakfast delivered to your room.  Just made another reservation today for September.  We've been there so much I now call Candy Cane our "home away from home".
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing the opportunity on your recent visit. I am delighted that you now call the Candy Cane Inn your “home away from home”.  This speaks highly of our property, services and team and for that I am grateful and what more can a General Manager ask for. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would certainly be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay for Disneyland.
Summary: This is where we stay almost every time we go to Disneyland. The staff is very friendly and the location is ideal. They have a shuttle that goes to Disneyland every half hour which is great. The rooms are really nice and the cleaning staff is amazing!!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal repeat guest of the Candy Cane Inn, we appreciate your business and kind comments regarding our property and staff. Warm regards!

Summary: We reserved a Deluxe room for four nights in February 2013, had a little bit of a rough start with Angel at the front desk, I have to say I am not a big fan of his, never have been. The next morning I woke up tried to take a shower , no hot water, called the front desk, they sent maintenance immediately. No hot water.  They decided to move us , they upgraded us to a premium room for the remainder of our stay. The maintenance guy moved all of our stuff as we packed it up, awesome service! We had a wonderful stay. Can not wait to come back for our next trip to Disneyland! Thank you Candy Cane
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat guest and we do appreciate your business and feedback. I am delighted to read that our staff took what could have been an uncomfortable situation and immediately made the remainder of your stay enjoyable. Here in Anaheim the water is extremely hard and mineral deposits at times can become lodged in the valve preventing hot water flow. We appreciate your understanding and feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Little pricey, but you are very close to Disneyland
Summary: My husband, daughter and I stayed here in October (better late than never).  Check in was very easy and they accommodated my request to be on the upper floor away from the ice machine. The room was better than most basic rooms.  I wish it had black out shades as the plantation shutters let a lot of light in, but it was still nice.  Comfy beds and just enough room for the 3 of us.  It was not noisy at all.  Major plus for me!  The free breakfast was ok.  Basic cereal, fruit, muffins, yogurt, bagels, and toast.  Juice, coffee, and hot chocolate to drink.  Seating was limited so you may have to take it back to your room. Parking was a challenge at times and they have these trees there that drop hard pine cones like things.  One hit the roof of my car, but it didn't damage anything.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the pleasure on your visit to the theme parks. We appreciate your feedback and will certainly review your comments. In regards to our rates, please take into consideration that we have many complimentary items such as, Parking, Exclusive Shuttle, Expanded Continental Breakfast, Wifi and have NO additional resort or convenience fees that are found at many local hotels. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Pretty good stay at this plush motel a stones throw away from Disneyland.
Summary: Our family stayed at the Candy Cane this Mach for two nights and can say it is a nice, super close motel to stay inn for a visit to Disneyland. Breakfast was plentiful and the walk to the entrance to both Disney parks could not be easier. 8-10 minutes tops, and that was at a leasurly pace with our daughter in her stroller. It is a motel but the grounds are nicely landscaped and the place looks really much much nicer than you average motel. It is not cheap but it is not expensive either. A pretty good value over all. Rooms could have been a bit larger and the staff was nice but not amazing. Other than that a nice stay overall.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate and enjoyed our conversation this morning regarding your comments. Your feedback will certainly assist us to remain focused on our training programs and instituting the “WOW” effect. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Nice motel, very convenient to Disneyland.
Summary: Candy Cane Inn is a nice, reasonably priced motel that's really convenient to Disneyland. There's a shuttle every 30 minutes or you can walk just down the street. The room wasn't fancy but perfectly functional, with fairly comfortable beds. Our only minor complaint was a noisy heater/AC unit. The complementary breakfast was better than average - bagels, cereal, fresh fruit and decent coffee. The staff was very friendly. We'd definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback, it is most appreciated and allows us the opportunity to improve our property. Kind regards!

Summary: Very convienent to Disneyland.  Reasonably priced.  Well kept and Clean.  Why would you want more for just a place to sleep?  We left at 8:00 AM and did not return untl late in the evening.  Pool was very nice and breakfast was very adequate.  I cannot imagine staying anywhere else if I were to return to Disneyland.  The shuttle was always prompt, and even though the hotel is close. the shuttle looks pretty good afte a long day on your feet.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and writing your comments. Yes, our complimentary exclusive shuttle does look pretty inviting after a long day at the theme parks on your feet. Kind regards!

Summary: My daughter and I stayed here for the 3rd time.As usual,it was clean,comfortable and the staff is very helpful and curteous.The location is so convenient as well.We always stay in the Premium Room since getting breakfast delivered is so nice!The extra space in the room is helpful too.The shuttle is a nice option to have after a looooong day of walking around the parks.The grounds are beautifully kept and my little girl loves the hot tub!We will be staying there next year for sure!!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat guest and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Please feel free to contact me when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: Great place really near Disneyland. Worth it stay to enjoy the parks. Shuttle to teh parks helps after a day walking at the parks. Breakfast simple, but enough to get prepared for the lines at Cars Land.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor guests. Cars Land has become a very big hit with visitors of all ages and great fun! Kind regards.

Summary: When we travel to Southern California to visit Disneyland we always stay at the Candy Cane Inn.  We love their location, facilities, friendliness, and cleanliness.  The over all atmosphere is beautiful,  tropical, well lit, and very safe.  A courtesy morning breakfast is offered to all of their guest.  They offer a shuttle every one-half hour, or you can enjoy a short walk to Disneyland.  Parking is available just outside the inn door.   I would recommend the Candy Cane Inn to all of my family and friends.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and sharing your kind comments here on TripAdvisor. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations on your next visit. Kind regards!

Summary: This review is a few months overdue.  We stayed in a double queen room in early October 2012 for three nights. We were visiting Disneyland with our two sons.  The location to Disneyland is excellent, car parking was great and the room was well priced.  On the first night my husband and I climbed into bed about 11pm, our two boys were already asleep in the other bed.  I noticed straight away that my side of the bed was wet, on inspection it smelled of urine.  This was very frustrating as it meant having to get up and shower (wash off where i had come into contact with the urine) and get dressed and go and inform the office.  A young lad came over and advised that the Inn was full and the best they could do was turn the mattress over and remake the bed which he proceeded to do.
Manager Response: First and foremost I would like to say that I am personally and sincerely apologetic of the situation that you have encountered and posted here. I have written you an email on TripAdvisor to ask to speak with you personally and to be honest would understand that you most likely didn’t think we even cared enough to respond to your comments. However I want to respond here as it is most evident that our team clearly mishandled your situation and for this I understand your frustration. We have discussed this review in-depth and while it is not an excuse time prevents us from investigating as there are changes in staff and I want to let you know that we DO listen and DO care about our guests and your comments have been received LOUD and CLEAR! Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Convenient location, free parking, wi-fi and Disneyland shuttle, continental breakfast
Summary: We needed a place for just one night and got our room the day before we checked in at a reasonable price. We stayed in an accessible room downstairs that just had new tile installed; very nice. The beds were somewhat soft but clean and comfy. It was hard to tell if the carpets were clean but they seemed to be. The tub did not drain when taking a shower, which is yucky (I meant to tell the staff this but forgot; I have no doubt they would have addressed it.) All staff were attentive and kind. You can hear everything everyone says when they walk by. We paid $16 per day parking at the Sheraton and $5 per day for the city shuttle and had no free or continental breakfast so for the Candycane to offer these things and be closer to the park is awesome. I don't like these type of motels
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing to our attention your drain issue and we are sincerely apologetic this occurred. We were able to drill down based on your comments to locate your reservation and have addressed immediately. Yes, we do believe in providing our many amenities complimentary with budget minded family travelers. Kind regards!

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn to attend an event at the Anaheim Convention Center.  The location was excellent because we were able to leave our car at the inn and walk to the event.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The staff were nice.  The continental breakfast had plenty of fresh pastries and breads plus yogurt, fruit and cereal options.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to attend an event at the Convention Center. Yes, our location and amenities are very convenient to the theme parks and Convention Center. We appreciate your business and please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Well kept, cute hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: It’s been a couple years since we stayed at Candy Cane Inn, so this review is long overdue.  We absolutely loved our stay here, and would absolutely not hesitate to stay her again.    Rates were very reasonable, and staff very friendly.  Rooms were basic but very clean.  Nice that it includes a free breakfast, and it’s nice to eat your breakfast around the pool.  Nice small pool area and fantastic hot tub which is open fairly late.  The greenery/flower baskets they have hanging around makes this hotel feel very quaint.    It’s not a bad walk at all from the Candy Cane Inn to the park gates, but from time to time we did take the free shuttle bus back and forth available to hotel guests.  Overall we loved this cute little hotel and would recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and you must return to see the many wonderful upgrades at the theme parks, they are awesome! Please feel free to contact me when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Would not stay any where else
Summary: We stayed in a King room. Our other family members stayed in queen rooms.  The bed was comfortable.  The front desk people went out of their way to be helpful and nice.  The shuttle drivers were friendly and also helpful.  Breakfast was basic but a good start for the day.  I liked the fact they had fresh fruit daily.  One of our daughters who was in another room brought her own bagel and cereal because she is gluten free. If the room is ready they even let you check in early.  We needed milk for my toddler grandaugter at night and they went upstairs and brought us 2 small milk containers, so very nice of them.  You cannot beat the free parking and free hotel shuttle.  The shuttle is every 1/2 hour and they are on time.  Would we stay here again?  My answer would be YES!.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your kind comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Yes, our team certainly attempts to do all they can to assure that our guest’s needs are attended to and I appreciate your noticing this. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would certainly be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: We go to disneyland every year and this was our first stay at candy cane inn. we have stayed in a hotel close by but were never really happy with it so we decided to try something new. We stayed in a premium room from 2/27-3/3. We really enjoyed everything the premium room had to offer. The room was a nice size. Beds were comfy as far as hotel beds go. All the staff we came in contact with were very friendly. Front desk staff, shuttle drivers, people delivering breakfast, were all very nice. We called the front desk for more towels and someone brought them within 5 min. The shuttle was always on time perfectly. We walked a couple times but really appreciated the free shuttle. Breakfast was always on time although one day we were given the wrong kind of cereal, it's free so we
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your yearly trip to the theme parks. We appreciate your trying “something new” and are delighted that you had a wonderful stay. Yes, our new WiFi system is working great and we DO believe in providing many free services in appreciation of our guests and with respect to their budgets. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our 5 night stay at Candy Cane Inn. There did seem to be a bit of a snag at check-in, but it was solved & our room was ready. Nice double queen room with a good size bathroom. Although a shuttle was available, it was easy walking distance to Disneyland & California Adventure. The breakfast was very adequate. There were also restaurants nearby where we could get a meal for less than Disney prices. ;-) The noise level was hit & miss. Mostly it was pretty quite. The bed & pillows were comfortable. I would certainly stay here again should we take another trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your email response to my message regarding your snag at check-in. Yes, Nice is a wonder young man and an awesome addition to our front office team of service professionals. Kind regards!

Summary: We had a regular 2 queen bed room for 3 nights originally, but decided to extend our trip by one day (which was easily accommodated by the staff at the candy cane inn.) Check in was easy and the front desk was very nice. We did have one little hiccup. The room number they provided us was still dirty. I went to the front desk and they realized the room number had been written down incorrectly on our keys.  It was an easy fix and we entered our correct  room. It had two queen beds and it was a nice size.  We did realized there wasn't a closet. It wasn't a HUGE issue, but it did make unpacking a bit difficult for 3 people.  We managed to use some of the drawers provided and made it work.  The mini-fridge was nice and so was the coffee maker.  The TV was small but appropriate since
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I am certainly appreciative that our team was able to comfortably and expediently fix the “little hiccup” and thank you for your understanding. Yes, our upstairs rooms do have a drain to prevent flooding into the bedroom should there be an overflow. Thank you for your observation and I will work with the housekeeping team to increase their frequency of adding water and deodorant in these drains to prevent odors. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: I have to start by saying that I have never experienced a hotel that is so actively clean! When we arrived, the front lobby awning was being cleaned as well as the huge beautiful windows.  Later, I noticed that there was always someone sweeping or wiping something down.  To top it all off, on the day we left they were steam cleaning the chairs in the empty rooms.  I was so impressed!  The pride this establishment takes in it's reputation is apparent when I entered the room.  The beds were comfy too.  We loved the shuttle to Disneyland.  The drivers were very friendly and kept us informed of the plans for the day (times and drop off/pick up points).  The choices for breakfast were plentiful.  The breakfast room was crowded, but that's to be expected as everyone was getting ready
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I appreciate your comments about the team and yes, they are all very proud of the property and do such a wonderful job in maintaining the Inn and providing genuine care to our guests! Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted in assisting with reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Beautifully Maintained - Nice Pool - Excellent Location
Summary: For the price, Candy Cane Inn deserves an excellent rating. We were happy with our room and with the AAA discounted rate.    We liked the second floor, but honestly with people returning very late from DL, it's near impossible for any room to be actually quiet.  But, what would you expect?  The thing we thought was fun was that you can see the backside of CARS in California Adventure from the property.  That's how close you are.  Even though it's like an 5-10 minute walk to the front entrance (super close compared to other hotels), the shuttle is really consistent and leaves the hotel on the hour and half hour.  And it picks up at the main entrance on :15 and :45.  The pool area is very pleasant. Breakfast is just fine.  We were in such a hurry to get to DL, we didn't want to
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to the Theme Parks. Yes, the addition of Cars Land right in our “back yard” is exciting and certainly a hit with park attendees. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Jan 23-29 for 6 nights as a family of 4 with two teenagers in a preferred room.  No issues checking in or checking out.  Room was very clean and beds were very comfortable.  Rooms had a 70's feel to them - you can tell this is an old hotel but everything is very well maintained and the furnishings and carpet are all in very nice shapem and everything works - lamps, fridge, shower, toilet, tv, hair dryer, etc. The microwave was quite old and didn't allow you to punch in an exact cooking time (dial type) but it worked.  The preferred rooms have a lot of floor space but they are lacking in furniture.  There was only three chairs in the room and one small table.  There is room for more chairs and a bigger table and/or a desk but the extra square footage
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity on your recent six night visit and we certainly appreciate your feedback regarding our Inn. We do listen to our guests and make necessary improvements to our property and WiFi was one of them. Yes, the overall internet connectivity with our new provider has been absolutely wonderful; however there have been a couple “kinks” and while they may be expected we certainly apologize for any inconvenience as we work through them. Kind regards!

Summary: We've stayed at the Candy Cane Inn twice this past year and were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are comfortable, the simple no-frills breakfast is nice but the location and price were the best part. I highly recommend this hotel for a convenient hotel for Disneyland. They do have a free shuttle but the walk is no big deal, even for little ones. Saved us from having to rent a car!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and being a repeat guest at our Inn, we DO appreciate your business! Yes, our location is very accommodating to the theme parks, dining, shopping and the convention center too. We do aspire to provide a clean, comfortable property with an emphasis on customer service and price value. Kind regards!

Summary: We just spent 10 nights at the Candy Cane Inn and had a great trip! This was our third time staying at the Candy Cane and will definitely return!  We had an extended family trip to California and the Candy Cane was great to work with. My wife and I were even celebrating our anniversary (February 11) and they accommodated my request to be in room 211.  Every staff interaction was great and the room was very clean as always. The Candy Cane Inn even has nice Kleenex and toilet paper and soft towels which is much appreciated over the normal cheap and rough ones you tend to find in hotels these days. The one improvement I would suggest is they move to a higher quality sheets with a higher thread count. The sheets are okay, just not what I'm used to and not up to par with the rest of
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being a loyal and repeat guest of the Candy Cane Inn. We DO appreciate your business and taking time to provide us with your feedback. I will be meeting with our management team and linen sales person to discuss your linen comments. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: I booked a room here based on other Trip Advisor reviews. It was an older property, but very well-kept. We got the Deluxe room, and it was pretty tight in terms of space, so would definitely recommend that if you have more than two people. It was very close to the main gate, so less that ten minutes by foot, and the free shuttle was nice at the end of the day for tired kids!   Even though it was on the main strip, it was fairly quiet and peaceful. It's a two-story motel with stairs to the upper level, so it was nice not having foot traffic and elevator traffic at all hours of the night. Pool and hot tub area was also very nice. Complimentary breakfast was a bonus! Would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We do take pride in our property and do our utmost in maintaining its pristine condition. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Good price and location but wifi was major issue along with lack of service
Summary: At the end of the day it is a travelers choice award winner but I gotta say it's not the best. I thought Jerry's in la was deserving of a better review given it was half the cost...candy cane was a good value and highly rated. The rooms are a bit dated and I had major issues with wifi which I needed for work. The folks at the front desk were not that helpful and thought it was my computer. I am a computer tech and I knew this wasn't the case. Spent a couple hours at Starbucks each night instead the hotel room I was paying for. Can't deny that it is very close to Disneyland and that my wifi issue may have been a onetime incidident.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us, and we thank you for this valuable feedback. Yes, our WiFi system was completely updated in December and has gone live in January. We have had a few incidents with this change however the connectivity is absolutely wonderful and we have addressed these minor opportunities as they have arisen. I ask you to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: Only good things to say about this hotel. Beautiful grounds: plenty of lush vegetation, great pool, even the parking lot has attractive pavers. The rooms are spacious and neat. They have a bit of a '70s flavor, but done very well. We have stayed here roughly eight times during our travels to Disneyland and have not been unhappy. About half of those visits we have stayed in the largest room, which includes a continental breakfast delivered to your door. A nice treat, but recently we've chosen the regular room, which is adequate, then ate at the park which we prefer. Also, the bus service is second to none. Frequency is just right (on the half hour) and the drivers are very courteous.
Manager Response: We appreciate your staying with us and sharing your kind comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Thank you for this valuable feedback and please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: We booked at the Candy Cane Inn this past weekend after reading all these glowing reviews everywhere. Our stay wasn't anywhere near terrific. I mean it's not the worst place to stay, the green leafy ambiance is nice and the breakfast is ok, but that's pretty much it. Our biggest peeve was that the staff was unfriendly and stoic. First the internet went out, and they unapologetically told us to call their provider if we wanted internet. Then, the heater in our room stopped working, with a winter storm blowing in. After the internet thing, I didn't even want to bother asking for assistance. From check in to check out, never got any type of decent or warm reception from the staff. And, the rooms are a lot smaller than comparable hotels, and they hide this fact on their website with
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sincerely apologetic that your experience with our staff was “unfriendly and stoic”. I have attempted to reach out via email with no response and from the limited information here think I know who the desk agents were that you dealt with. We DO pride ourselves on our guest service and rest assured that we take this type of comments seriously and have had general conversations with the team. Please feel free to contact me personally as I would certainly like to have the opportunity to bring you back and demonstrate the service that the Candy Cane Inn has built its reputation on. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: 2 small issues but room was great
Summary: clean, surprisingly quiet (our window faced harbor blvd), safe, comfortable, reasonably priced (don't forget to get your AAA discount), close to disney place to stay .... we had 2 issues .... internet wasn't working and the front desk told me to call and straighten it out with the provider (waste of my 20 minutes - that should be hotel's job - they even told me they have issues with the provider) and the TV is definitely on its last legs (many stations static-y and unclear - room 188 if you guys are reading this - we forgot to mention it at check-out)  .... BUT the important things were provided in a tip-top fashion,which is why i give it an excellent --- hotels near big tourist attractions take alot of abuse and wear and tear and they are running a tight ship to keep things top
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we certainly appreciate your feedback and I personally thank you for speaking with our Front Office Manager regarding your comments. We respect and thank guests for bringing items to our attention and rest assured these items have been addressed.
