The TV was immediately changed out with a new one and we have spoken with our Internet provider and our Front Office team as customer service is paramount to our continued success. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay when not on the Disneyland Property
Summary: The Candy Cane Inn does all it can to make your trip to Disneyland enjoyable. The outside gardens are very well kept and the rooms were spotless.  Rooms: Clean, roomy, comfortable beds, table and chairs, flat screen tv. Lots of counter and storage space for the bathroom sink, drawers for clothes in tv console. Two suitcase racks, (nice), ceiling heater in bathroom (nice again), maid service was timely and thorough. Breakfast: Continental, but very good. Not the typical muffins you would get in other free breakfasts. They were tasty and fresh. Coffee was good. Bagels, toast, fruit, cereal, and yogurt are also available.  Shuttle service: leaves right on time, every half hour. Friendly drivers. van/bus, was never full. Only serves Candy Cane Inn guests, and it's free. Fantastic.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I certainly appreciate your response to my email communication regarding the WiFi misunderstanding, as we DO NOT charge for WiFi at the Candy Cane Inn.  Please feel free to contact me when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm Regards!

Summary Heading: Quick Walk or Shuttle to Disney
Summary: You can either walk or they provide a shuttle to and from Disney. When we arrived, our room was available so they checked-us in early, which was very convenient. The staff was nice and friendly and there was breakfast included the next day. An assortment of muffins, bagels and cream cheese, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, coffee, hot chocolate, tea. Free parking and free wi-fi. They also gave us a small discount for being Disney Annual Passholders. We will stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit the theme parks, we DO appreciate your business. Yes, we have included the Annual Passholder to our list of discounts and certainly welcome and cherish these folks. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be belighted to assist with rates and reservations. Warm Regards!

Summary: Well run, clean, very quiet, comfortable motel within walking distance of Disneyland.  I was amazed at the overall quality and comfort of this motel, given that it attracts many families with small, excited, and sometimes very tired children who are to or have visited Disneyland.  Very little outside originating or room noise was evident on our room - and the motel was filled with children and students from a nearby high school.  Comfortable beds, a clean room, a helpful front desk, and a somewhat spartan but quite adequate breakfast worked very well for my wife and me.  And for those who don't want to walk, a convenient shuttle bus every 30 minutes to take guests to and from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers, we do appreciate the positive feedback. Kind regards!

Summary: Location, location, location!!!  Expcellent if you have an upcoming event at the Anaheim convention center, also if you plan on going to Disneyland. Rooms are OK, service is great, breakfast simple but good. Free parking and internet a plus. Would come again for sure.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and yes, our location is exceptional with about equal distances to the Theme Parks, Convention Center and the Anaheim GalrdenWalk. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: We love the Candy Cane Inn!!
Summary: Our family loves this place! The people are the best! Everyone from the front desk to the  shuttle drivers are friendly and helpful. You can't beat the location or the price. Also, they DO NOT charge for parking, as all the others do.We try to stay a few times a year, but especially in Feb. for our Grandsons Birthday. He turned 14 this year, and can't wait for next year. The rooms are always clean, and have plenty of room. I especially like that the sink is seperate from the tub and toilet. the kids love the pool and spa, and everyone loves the breakfast. Thanks again for a great time. Oh, I forgot a family picture we had taken at a nearby resturant, called the hotel, and got it in two days! Friendiest hotel staff in town!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat member of the Candy Cane Inn family and please extend my birthday wishes to your grandson! Yes, we do believe in providing an exceptional product with friendly caring staff. In addition to free parking we provide our Expanded Continental Breakfast, Wireless WiFi and our Exclusive Shuttle to the theme parks all complimentary. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Another Great Stay at the Candy Cane Inn!
Summary: My wife and I just returned last week from an 8 night stay at Candy Cane with our grandaughter.  As usual, we loved the staff, the facilities and kindness of everyone there.  From the shuttle drivers to the front desk staff and everyone else- it was another great Disneyland experience, in part because we knew we were coming back to our favorite place to stay after a long day in the Parks.  This is and will continue to be our hotel of choice in Anaheim.  It is older but very well maintained and clean.  If you haven't stayed her before- give it a try.  You won't be disappointed.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us again and please know that we DO appreciate your repeat business and thank you for your kind comments. The Candy Cane Inn is built on relationships such as yours and please feel free to contact me when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: My husband and I previously stayed in a standard room. Since we brought our 3 kids on this trip, we had to get the large, premium room. The room is located in the back away from the street. It's about 350 square feet. It's small room for a family of five, but the amenities make up for it. The room includes breakfast delivery, mini fridge, microwave, snacks (the cookies were good), movie rental and a late 2pm check-out.  Though the walk to Dland isn't far, the shuttle service is convenient especially after a day at the Parks. There are many places to eat in the area. Subway is across the street. iHOP, Dennys, Tony Roma and the Garden Walk mall are within walking distance.   The staff is nice. However, the woman who checked us out needs to put on a friendly face even if she
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I also appreciate your responding to my private email as we DO listen to our guest and value the feedback that is provided to enhance our product and service. I am pleased to know that you enjoyed your Premium Room and yes, the added amenities are certainly worth the additional cost.  Warm regards!

Summary: Our last Candy Cane Inn review was for our October stay. Since then we speak Thanksgiving there and Feb 1st - Feb 4th.  We have also booked our spring break trip, March 30-April 6.  We love the CCI.  Why? The staff. When my son walked in James at the front desk welcomed him by name. When our room is not available, they allow us to park there and walk to the park. The hotel is always clean, the pool is always pleasant and everything we need is nearby. The walk to the park is easy, the I-5 is right there and a Target is just down the road. But it really is the staff.   We are counting the days until we return.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat member of the Candy Cane Inn family, we certainly appreciate your business. Yes, our team of service professionals goes that extra mile in providing exceptional guest service and friendliness. Please feel free to contact me directly when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Took a chance and it paid off
Summary: We stayed here for two nights on a trip to Disneyland.  The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and it was very quiet.  The only minor issue we had was a strange smell in the bathroom.  There was a drain in the floor and we suspected the smell was coming from there, so my husband covered it up and it seemed to take care of the problem.    This place is on the same side as Disneyland, about a block or two away.  You can easily walk there, but they have a shuttle that drops you off and picks you up.  It leaves the hotel every 30 minutes on the hour, and picks you up at Disneyland at the 15 min. and 45 min. mark every hour.  After a full day in Disneyland, it was nice not to have to walk back to the motel.    Their continental breakfast is minimal but a nice start to the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for responding to my email and providing me with additional information regarding your recent visit. We DO listen to our guest and appreciate valuable feedback that will enable us to improve product, service and enhance training where necessary. Please feel free to contact when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Perfect location for a family trip to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here in January and found it to be a great place to stay for our Disney visit. We have two young girls, the room we stayed in was spacious for a portacot as well as 2 queen beds. It was clean and comfortable ( although bed a little too soft for me) and the staff were great. My husband was extremely grateful to the staff for their understanding & hospitality during the early hours of the morning when a little person couldn't sleep from jet lag. We used the pool which was clean, plenty of towels available, and this was in winter! Breakfast had a good selection - the only thing being if its cold outside there is not much indoor seating and we had to wait for a table to become available (I guess it's not normally cold in CA!) otherwise plenty of seating around the pool. We
Manager Response: I am delighted to read that you and your family enjoyed your family trip and thank you for your kind comments regarding our property and staff.  We understand that different time zones and sleep patterns and I am happy the little person was comfortable during the early hours. I thank you for recommending us to your friends and let them know they may contact me personally as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Really close to Disneyland and perfectly nice!
Summary: The best thing about the hotel is the proximity to the Disneyland parks.  The room was clean, the parking was plentiful, and the price was right.  My only complaint is that the pool wasn't super warm.  I'm local and checked in to have access to a really warm pool.  The hot tub was awesome!  It was hot!  The pool was lukewarm.  It was definitely heated, just not warm enough for me.  Kids had no problem swimming in it, of course.  The front desk was nice, the soda in the vending machines was cold, and we ordered pizza up to our room from a local delivery place.  If you don't want to pay for parking at Disneyland, this place is close enough to walk (although they do offer a shuttle, which is totally unnecessary).
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to the theme parks, we DO appreciate your business. I am sorry that the temperature of our pool was not warm enough for you as this and our children’s wading pool is set at 80 degrees and our spa is set at 103 degrees year round for guest comfort. Kind regards!

Summary: Stayed for just one night at Candy Cane Inn on the first leg of our vacation since we were going to Disneyland the next day.  Since it was just my husband & I, we wanted a room with one king bed - not two queens.  Due to it being a handicapped accessible room, there were some drawbacks.  There aren't many king rooms (due to families needing two beds) & this one was not in the "premium" category I would have preferred, but since we were not traveling with the kids, we chose this option.  Here are the pros & cons of our stay:  Pros: Price was great           shuttle service to Disneyland -every 1/2 hour.  We used it & were pleased           location - backs California Adventure - ten minute walk to the parks or Downtown Disney           free parking - plenty of spots at this time
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. Yes, we are a family property and only have three King Bedded rooms and they are accessible. The location is close to the ice and vending machine with respect for folks and their possible limited movement. All of our bed are Serta Presidential Double Pillow Top and while they may be softer than a conventional mattress. We receive so many positive reviews regarding sleep quality and I am very sorry they are not to your liking and we will retain you’re comments for when we shop replacement mattresses. Kind regards!

Summary: We are a family of 4 travelling to America.  We can completely recommend the Candy Cane Inn to anyone, for value for money, for excellent service from friendly and very helpful staff, for immaculately clean rooms, free parking, walking distance to Disneyland and great to be able to walk also to nice places to eat after spending all day and half the night at Disney and California adventures.  A regular shuttle service is provided to and from Disney when you are just to tired to walk anymore!!  Its got a lovely pool and 2 spa pools to use which are very nice and clean. The breakfast is more than sufficient and very nice, we had bagels, yogurt, cereal, toast, fruit, and sweet pastries, hot choc's and coffee and juice it was really great to be fill up before we left for disneyland
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and sharing your wonderful comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted that you enjoyed your visit and thank you for your kind word about our staff, yes, they are honest and reliable and we are blessed to have a great team! Warm Regards!

Summary: My family of 4 arrived from Australia for our first visit to Disneyland. What a great inn. Fantastic location, the most comfortable beds and pillows, and very friendly staff. The breakfast was a great way to start the day without further expense. The desk staff also arranged a town car for our transfer to LA. told them the time, day and voila, no more worry. Would definitely stay again and recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We do appreciate your business and please feel free to contact me personally when staying again as I would be delighted to assist you with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great location for Disneyland, tired room
Summary: Our first stop on landing in LA from England. We spent two nights here with our two children. Loved the pool and the breakfasts, we were up early so getting a table by the pool was no problem. We had a room on the upper floor and to the right, which was not good. It was dark, stuffy, small and tired. We had requested a roll out bed but it had a dreadful mattress and was not very clean, plus there there was really no room for it, so we could not use it. We were next to some air con unit outside which was extremely noisy. My sister and her family had a room on the ground floor and in the middle, which may have been a more expensive room. SO much nicer, very roomy, fresh decoration and bedlinen. This is a fab location as you can walk to Disneyland (don't bother with the shuttle, it
Manager Response: I have attempted to contact you through the email here on TripAdvisor without success however wanted to respond. First and foremost I am very apologetic if you feel that your accommodations were not up to the level of your sisters. I would like to note that all of our guest rooms have been updated at the same time and the “fresh” decorations and linens are the same throughout the property. In addition we have no exterior air conditioner units as we have outside corridors and each guestroom has its own unit. Thank you again for your feedback and know that we do read all comments and listen to you, our guests. Kind regards!

Summary: I chose this hotel becuase of the other good reviews on trip advisor!  The hotel was ideal for my mother daughter trip with my daughter.  We used the hotel as a base for our Disney visits, and the shuttle was perfect.  We also walked to the park a few times, and that is doable as well.   The complimentary breakfast was a perfect start to our day!  The pool area was very nice, and we enjoyed some down time poolside.  The only issue was the complimentary wi fi....it was not always easy to access.  We were happy with the stay overall and would chose this hotel for another stay.  By the way they also offer a military discount, and we took advantage of that as well!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us on your “mother daughter trip” and I am delighted that you enjoyed this special visit. I am pleased to inform you that our WiFi upgrade has been completed and the service is absolutely wonderful and we thank you, our guests for your patience. Kind regards!

Summary: I stayed at Candy Cane Inn for my Dec 13-23rd trip to Disneyland because of the great reviews here on tripadvisor.  I'm happy to report that I had a great stay and would recommend this hotel.  After a snafu with Prime Time Shuttle getting me from Long Beach Airport to the hotel, things went very smoothly.  Check in was fast, friendly and efficient.  I had a standard room with 2 queen size beds.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The Fridge was almost too small for a 2 ltr bottle of soda and much else, but it got the job done.  My only complaint about the room was that I could have used more drawers to store clothes in.    The hotel itself is quite cozy.  It is smaller than I expected - a U shaped property with the pool and check in building in the middle, but it was very well
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to the theme parks. Yes, our location is certainly convenient to the parks and local attractions and many dining choices.  Please feel free to contact me personally when returning to Anaheim as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind Regards!

Summary: Small, but clean rooms. Hapless, but genuine service, Generous, but awful breakfast unless you are loading up on carbs and calories.   When I forgot my iPad charger, I asked for a loaner at the desk....no can do...but try the store down the street they suggested....a 7-11. Hahahahahaha. C'mon.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments regarding the iPad charger. While I am extremely apologetic that we do not stock these items due to the vast number of devices. I am happy to report that we have engaged in training with our front office team and now keep the chargers from lost and found that have not be retrieved at our front desk to see if we may accommodate guests in the future. We do appreciate your business and thank you again for bringing this to our attention.

Summary Heading: Best combination of location and value
Summary: The Candy Cane Inn is the best overall combination of location and value. It is an easy 5-10 minute walk to the park entrance, as close as any of the non-Disney hotels and the price can't be beat. It is a clean hotel with an adequate continental breakfast. The rooms are fairly small and basic but I don't imagine many people staying in this area are going to be spending much time there. It was perfect for our family to enjoy the day in the park and then basically walk back to the hotel and crash. There is a shuttle that goes back and forth every half hour or so if you can time it right.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your staying with us and your kind comments and review. We too feel that we honestly try our very best to provide exceptional product and service while being mindful on family travelers on a modest budget.  Again, thank you for staying with us. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Mediocre rooms in a good location
Summary: If cheap and close to Disneyland is what you are looking for, this is the place for you. But if you want any amount of quality with your stay, you'll be absolutely disappointed.  Though the room appeared clean, the towels were old and very discolored with a yellow tint to them. The bed was extremely lumpy and uncomfortable. The sheets were as thin as tissue paper and the bed spread, ick ick ick: it was old, ratty and seemed dirty.  To top it off, we *might* have had fleas in the bed. I had a slew of bug bites on my body the next morning (though my husband was fine).
Manager Response: Thank you for responding to my email and giving us the room number as we do not have a room numbered 126.  We do thank you for your feedback and I appreciate your follow up so we could investigate and make necessary improvements. Kind regards!

Summary: This is our go to hotel when visiting Disneyland.  The rate can be a bit higher than neighboring properties but we have always found the value to be better.  What I mean is Candy Cane includes free parking, wifi, a free shuttle (even though they are walking distance) and a free breakfast.  Those items to me are worth paying a bit more for.  Plus the service is always wonderful, the grounds are always well kept and the rooms are always clean.  A note on the service, our battery went dead while we were there and they had someone there to jump us within 5 minutes.  We have stayed here 20+ times and look forward to our next return!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being a loyal and repeat member of the Candy Cane Inn family, we DO appreciate your business. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: After previously staying at several different establishments in Anaheim, we finally found our favorite place to stay when visiting Disneyland.  My husband called the night before and spoke to Nick to request an early check in with a room located away from the street. Luckily, he was able to accommodate us. James at the front desk was friendly and informative when we checked in the next morning before we went to Disneyland. The customer service is excellent. The location is convenient with only a 10 minute walk to the park. Though we did not use it, a free shuttle is available. The continental breakfast is standard fare but it was nice eating by the pool. We're glad we found this place and we will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I am delighted to read that you have finally found your “favorite place” to stay when visiting the theme parks. Yes, Nick and James are wonderful gentlemen and I am proud to have them as part of the Candy Cane Inn team of service professionals. Warm regards!

Summary: This was my second stay at the Candy Cane Inn and I remain impressed.  The rooms are clean and well appointed, though basic.  Check-in, the front desk staff, housekeeping...all were very nice, service oriented, and efficient.  Our family had 4 adjoining rooms, with two queen beds in each.  We appreciated the bathtub/shower combination, refrigerators, hair dryers, flat screen tv, free wifi, breakfast, pools, safe etc.  The breakfast was usually available from 6:30 AM, but they made a point of opening it up early for race day at Disneyland.  The shuttle was always on time, clean, and the driver was always cheerful.  The beds are very comfortable and the 4 pillows/bed were great.  We definitely will be checking in here for our next trip to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a return guest and we appreciate your sharing your kind comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Please feel free to contact me when you are returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Warm Regards!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland.
Summary: Our family met in Annaheim ... and all stayed for six nights.  Two connecting rooms were sufficient for 5 adults and 2 young children.  Two queen beds in each room.  The shuttle to the park gates was wonderful ... especially for me as I am unable to walk longer distances.  The complimentary breakfast was nothing special but quite sufficient to get us all going in the mornings. Much better than having to take everyone to a restaurant in the early hours.  Peaceful garden type setting with a lovely pool area ... Clean basic rooms with everything you really need ... each of our rooms had a small fridge which was great for wine/ beer/ juices and snacks for the children.  We would definitely recommend this hotel.  Be sure to ask for the AAA rate if you qualify.  The free parking was a
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow travelers. In the future please feel free to contact the front desk as a member of our team would be delighted to assist with luggage at any time. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Do Yourself A Favor And Stay Here!
Summary: I stayed here by myself, as the rest of my family shelled out the big bucks at the Disney Grand Californian. I got a AAA discount and a great second story room with all the comforts I could want. Free parking, a decent continental breakfast and a 10 minute walk right into Disneyland, made this a great choice. I stay loads of places and I have never had housekeeping write me a personal thank you for the tip I left. Save your money for the expensive EVERYTHING at Disneyland and stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your kind comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Kind regards!

Summary: We are a family of 4 (2adults + 2 children). The Candy Cane Inn is very close to Disney's Parks. It only takes up to 10 minutes walking. We also took the Bus. We found this service very helpful and the driver is a nice person. Breakfast is fine, not so many items to choose from, but it is very nice to have breakfast on the pool side. Parking lot a little crowded. Room is clean but a little tiny. Not so much room for for people and luggage. Maybe deluxe room are larger. I'll try one of these in the future.We shared great memories and I hope to come back one day.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your trip to the theme parks. The Deluxe room is approximately 45 square feet larger than our Standard room and both rooms have two queen size beds. Thank you again for your business, it IS most appreciated!

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for 5 nights starting December 25th, 2012. The staff are exceptional and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. My Daughter and Grand daughter were celebrating their birthdays for the trip and the Candy Cane Inn made it very special.  We stayed at the Disneyland Hotel our last two days and wished we would have kept our stay at the Inn instead!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am most delighted that you thoroughly enjoyed your visit. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Yep, it was Good, OK Very good based on all the other places in this area.
Summary: Hello; We stayed at Candy Cane Inn in the summer of 2012 and based on the reviews we read we were expecting WOW, but it was very good. The check in was simple and we don't need any grand introductions to feel welcome.  The long and short of it, this place is a older motel which is really well kept in my opinion and clean. There always someone keeping up with cleaning or touching up paint on the railings. They seem to be keeping up with maintenance throughout, unlike other places we stayed in this area. The location is good, we took the shuttle once and walked the other 3 days with 3 young kids. We would stay here again. Have Fun, Chow
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity and I am delighted that your stay was very good. Yes, our team is continually working to keep our property clean and comfortable for our guests. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Another wonderful stay at the Candy Cane Inn
Summary: My daughter and I have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for 20 years, since she was small.  I would not stay at another hotel in the Anaheim Area!  The Candy Cane staff is awesome, Kim, James, Amy, Fred, Robert, Edd, Jeff... well, they make us feel like family!  In addition to this, the Candy Cane is clean, has a delicious breakfast for guests, comfortable, the  property is lovely and it is cozy.  My home away from home.  Thank you all so very much. Silvia Boosten
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat guest for the past 20 years, we DO appreciate your business. It makes me, as General Manager feel great when a guest refers to the Candy Cane Inn as their ”home away from home” and I am delighted that our staff treat you as family! Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay off site!
Summary: Rooms were clean.  Perfect walking distance to Disneyland- about 8 minutes.  There is a shuttle that runs to and from the hotel to Disney every half hour.  My only suggestion would be to start the complimentary breakfast earlier.  It runs 7-9 and if you want to beat the crowds at Disneyland you need to be leaving the hotel by 7.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I am very pleased to inform you that we listen to our guests and have made operational changes for 2013.  Our Expanded Continental breakfast is NOW being served from 630am until 930am daily and Our Exclusive Complimentary Shuttle to and from the Theme Parks is NOW making the 800pm to the park and 815pm return from the park nightly. Kind regards!

Summary: We just got back from a family vacation at Disneyland. We have stayed at other hotels in and near the park and we were thrilled with the Candy Cane Inn.   The room was small but clean and comfortable. The beds were great and the location can't be beat. The complimentary shuttle was punctual and comfortable. The shuttle drivers were even very nice and helpful, as was the rest of the staff. The complimentary continental breakfast was very filling and fresh every day.   Based on our experience, we will definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Thank your staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We do appreciate your feedback and please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind Regards!

Summary: I was a bit disappointed after reading all the postive reviews.  Had a few issues with the Inn.  Our room was very close to the main street and where the shuttle comes and goes so the room was quite noisy.  The front desk staff were not very helpful and I certainly didn't feel like customer service was a priority for them.  One question I had the staff committed to looking into....i checked two days folloiwng and there was no follow through....I was told it was because the staff on the day before were "lazy" and didn't do it.  Our room's bathroom had a sewer smell.  The breakfast was horrible....stale muffins that were hard as a rock.  The pool was very cold.  One member of our family was sick and slept in til 11, leaving the room at noon and indicating maid service was
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at Candy Cane Inn for the past 17 years. Each year we have made 2 -3 visits a year. This year I had given my children a trip to Disney for Christmas. We were planning on staying at the Candy Cane. Right before Christmas my son broke his Wrist I called the hotel to ask what the last day of cancellation would be. It happened to be the day before I would know if my son was able to travel because he had surgery. I spoke with Angel who was the rudest employee. He said I would be charged. I asked to speak to the Manager and he said he would start a waiting list and not charge me if he could sell the room. I called on wednesday before the trip to check on the reservation to find that the Manager on Duty had cancelled the reservation because of my credit card. Well Being
Manager Response: First and foremost the Candy Cane Inn stands on our over 55 years of exceptional service to so many guests and families who see us as their “home away from home”.  I have always chosen to NOT use this platform to combat a past guest as we certainly appreciate, care and listen or we would not have survived the guest service industry and touched so many hearts for so many decades. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: What a wonderful place near Disneyland!
Summary: Our family of five stayed here just before Christmas to take our granddaughter to Disneyland.  The grounds are beautiful and extremely well maintained.  The buildings are clean, clean, clean, and freshly and brightly painted.  The registration staff was friendly, warm, and helpful.  We wanted to check in early and leave our car so that we could use the shuttle (fabulous!).  The rooms weren't ready, but we were allowed to use the shuttle, and what a nice experience that was.  We have used the "group" shuttles before when we've stayed at other hotels, and it's a nightmare.  This is a dedicated shuttle for Candy Cane Inn only -- great!  Our rooms were clean and well maintained.  The complimentary breakfast, which many hotels don't have, was fresh and yummy.  We all got a good
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted that your experience was great spending special time with your granddaughter! Our landscaping gentlemen do an awesome job and we receive many positive comments on the beautiful grounds. Thank you for the kind comments regarding our expanded continental breakfast and rest assured all pastry items are delivered daily for freshness. Please feel free to contact me when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm Regards!

Summary: Having looked at the hotels in Disneyland and finding them rather pricey we started looking at places in Anaheim and found the candy cane inn. We were more than pleasantly surprised when we got there and realised how close it actually was to Disneyland (about 3-5min walk!)  The room was OK, 2 big queen beds that were comfy and a nice clean ensuite bathroom. A little dark and dingy but hey who's planning on spending that much time in the room when Disneyland is near? There is a shuttle bus that runs regularly to and from the parks, although no need for it really as it is that close. The staff at the front desk were very accommodating and welcoming. Breakfast was nicely done with an area inside and out for eating and quite a lot of choice (well as long as you like carbs for
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing the opportunity on your visit to the theme parks in September. Yes, our location is wonderful and our Exclusive Complimentary Shuttle is certainly nice after a long day on your feet. Thank you for the kind comments about our team, they are a great group who really DO care about our guests! Kind regards.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay and Convenient location near Disneyland
Summary: My family (2 adults and 3 children) stayed here. We went to California Adventure on a Friday and we slept at the hotel that night. The hotel was very accommodating for us. We were able to park near our hotel room on the property for free, also saving us money from having to pay parking at Disneyland. They have a shuttle to take you to Disneyland. How more convenient can it get? We didn't have to walk to Disneyland even though it was only a few blocks away from Disneyland. The shuttle came every 30 minutes on the dot all day until the closing of the park.  The room was decent. We had two queen beds and mini fridge. We had to get an extra roll away bed. They charged us $10 for that which I didn't expect, but we needed it. I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to the theme parks. Yes, our complimentary parking and exclusive complimentary shuttle to the parks are cost and energy savers that guests appreciate.  Please feel free to contact me when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm Regards!

Summary: We booked the premium room and had 5 in our party and requested a roll-away bed for the 5th person weeks in advance. Upon arrival the room wasn't ready which was fine as we were early, I confirmed that we needed a extra bed. We bought 5 two day passes at the hotel ($1000). The staff member had me sigh each ticket. Upon arrival at Dland we were denied entry because the tickets were pre signed. After TWO HOURS and several supervisors we were issued new tickets. After we returned to the Candy Cain we discovered NO roll away bed. The staff said sorry they are all taken nothing we can do. I asked for an extra pillow and blanket  and they said no it was a fire hazzard to have someone sleeping on the floor.  The next night we got the extra bed... the only place it fits in the room is
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sincerely sorry that there were issues with your stay.  We do have a limited supply of rollaway beds and are issued based on order of request and if were requested at time of reservation.  In reviewing your reservation I noticed that you made an online on the evening of the 17th of December and your arrival was on the 20th.  I am very surprised about your comments regarding tickets being signed as our team is trained by Disney cast members and I have personally been in attendance where it is clearly stressed that guests sign tickets as they are treated like cash and if lost will not be refunded. I will contact our Disney contact and inform them of this incident and again apologize for any inconvenience.  Kind regards.

Summary Heading: A great stay at the Candy Cane Inn!
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Inn during a December trip to Disneyland. We decided on the hotel due to outstanding reviews posted and the recommendations of friends. We booked a premium room and were very pleased with it and the overall quality of the inn and it's staff.  After returning home to the Ca. Central Valley, my wife, a cancer survivior realized that she left behind in our room a blanket that was adorned with the pink cancer survivor symbols. This is a prized  possession of hers. I called the inn and spoke to the office staff. They checked with housekeeping and to our relief told us that the blanket was there and that they would hold it for us. When the staff was told that we lived quite a distance away, they took the time to mail the item to us.   My wife was reunited
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am delighted that your wife reunited with her very special blanket. Our housekeeping team does a wonderful job on retaining items left behind and it is always a pleasure to see items returned to their owners. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: This was a sweet, cozy stay!
Summary: I had read reviews and was even more pleased than I could imagine. We loved the quaintness of this place-beautiful vines with flowers everywhere. It's proximity to Disneyland was wonderful, so we walked back and forth. The breakfast was a great money saver.  The pool looked fun, but it was cold and rainy. We had rented a scooter and the staff took care of charging it each night. Wifi didn't work at first and we asked and they fixed it. We needed handicap accommodations and the stool could not be adjusted. One call and it was taken care of immediately. And then the sweetest surprise was on Christmas eve we arrived to find a teddy bear, an ornament and fresh cookies in our room. I would highly recommend this place for anyone visiting Disneyland. The price comparison for staying on
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your feedback for both us and fellow guests. It was our pleasure to send the Christmas goodies on the eve of Christmas and again for the arriving guests on Christmas day. Please feel free to contact me personally should you be returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Falls short in important stay needs, excels in a few others.
Summary: Stayed here for two nights the week before Christmas on recommendations by friends in concert with Trip Advisor reviews. It's rated No. 2 on TA, and other hotels so highly ranked have not disappointed.  But this one did slightly for reasons that might not affect some families. Thought travelers should have more info hence this review. This tidy, but dated hotel is literally within throwing (even if you stink at throwing) distance of Disneyland. On same side of street as park entrance, it eliminates need for municipal shuttle, which is $5 per person per way and invilves a wait at closing time. Hotel has its own free shuttle, but at night it was never on time so we always walked. Would have been nice to ride after 15-hour day at Mickey's place.  WiFi is free compared to Marriott's
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I do appreciate your comments regarding our Inn. I am sincerely sorry that your WiFi experience was not to your expectation. Our upgrade has been hampered with the holidays and companies reduced hours for technical staff and should be completed within days. I am very much excited about our upgrade as we will now have 63 access points throughout our property up from the current 18 and will be secured with guest signing in. Your comments regarding our exclusive complimentary shuttle concerns me and I have spoken with our drivers. The shuttle simply leaves the hotel on the hour and half and leaves the park on the 15 and 45 of each hour. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for your visit to Disneyland!
Summary: After fine-tuning our hotel options from reviews on Tripadvisor, we chose Candy Cane Inn and we were absolutely thrilled with the choice.  The hotel is walking distance to the entrance of Disneyland, which we did going and returning on Day One, but on Day Two were were starting to get a little tired after our first day's outing that we caught the complimentary Shuttle Bus (which leaves every half hour from both Candy Cane and DIsneyland to return.  The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  Shower pressure could have been more and a lot warmer in our room, but that would be our only complaint.  Beds were very comfortable and the rooms were very quiet.  The staff were all helpful and pleasant.  The complimentary continental breakfast went down well.  Free coffee available in
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: I've stayed at the Candy Cane Inn 4 times now and I find it well worth the money.  The property is close to the resorts and other Anaheim destinations.  The property is well maintained.  The rooms are older and not a lot of updates,  but they are clean and well stocked.  The staff is nice and helpful.  Free continental type breakfast in the morning is good,  just make sure to get there way before the cutoff time or there's no food left.  The staff stops restocking about a hour before breakfast hours end.    *** the free Disneyland shuttle is the best part of this hotel****   The only 2 criticisms I have are   (1)  noise is a factor. Not surprisingly,  there are a lot of kids staying here.  Families here tend to stay up late and wake up early and let their kids run rampant in
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat guest and we DO appreciate your business and valuable feedback. We listen to our guests and will be making changes in our breakfast hours soon to enhance our guest satisfaction. I do apologize for guests that may not be as respectful to others and yes, we are a family hotel and children do get caught up in the excitement of the theme parks.  Kind Regards!

Summary: This was our second time staying here, and we will definitely be staying there again. Overall it is a wonderful experience!  PROS: Check-in is a breeze. Both times we stayed there it was super easy and quick. The staff was very helpful and polite. I appreciate the coffee and candy canes in the lobby :)  Super close to Disneyland. We mostly walked but took the shuttle a couple of times. The shuttle was always on time and the driver was courteous.  You can buy Disneyland tickets at the front desk. We were able to buy 3-day Park Hoppers and charge to the room, which made the hotel and tickets on one charge.  VERY comfy beds and clean rooms!  The first time we stayed, we used the pool. I understand it is heated in the winter, so I saw people swimming this trip. The pool is
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us again and we look forward in seeing you again. We appreciate your feedback and I have spoken with our housekeeping team as it is policy to NOT change settings that guests have selected and I apologize for any inconvenience. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Perfect for a family visit to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in December of 2012, for a family trip to Disneyland.  We travelled with our three kids, and my mom and dad stayed at the Candy Cane as well.  I was extremely pleased with the entire experience, and I will absolutely stay there again the next time we travel to Anaheim.  The grounds were beautiful and well kept, including the pool and hot tub...the rooms were spotless and well appointed, the fitness facility was great, the continental breakfast was just right, and the staff was awesome.    Some other perks we loved: -We walked to and from Disneyland in 10 minutes (for real).  It's on the same side of the street as Disneyland, and it's an easy walk even with a stroller. -The free shuttle was convenient, even though it wasn't necessary, but it
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I appreciate your kind comments and recognizing our team, that truly DO care about our guests and their happiness and pleasant stay. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Happy Holidays!

Summary: A 2 night stay in a comfortable standard room with an Auto Club discount (make sure you bring your card!) - this hotel is a good value and great location. #214, a second floor room was at the stairs and configured a little differently than other standard rooms but essentially the same size - 2 very comfortable queen beds, just enough room for a little table for the laptops and 2 chairs. A tube TV in a big armoire. Free and FAST internet, free parking, walked to Disney and also took the convenient shuttle. Quiet! The breakfast selection of bagels, cereal, bananas, yogurt, and pastries made a great start for a Disney Day. Will definitely return next year!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and please feel free to contact me personally when returning next year as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Don't expect breakfast or anyone to care about it.
Summary: We stayed 12/18/12.  The rooms aren't the problem but the service.  They got my reservation wrong to start with.  We were told breakfast was from 7:30-10:00 am.  We arrived in the food area at 9:00 am.  4 tables and all were dirty.  Two hispanic women frantically cleaning and not paying attention to guests at all.  Taking food away right in front of me.  When my wife asked one to clean a table, she rolled her eyes, wiped it, then left.  She was speaking very loudly in Spanish to her counter part.  Several other guests came in then quickly left as no food was around and no greeting.  My wife asked the counter to have someone talk to the women working and to stop yelling Spanish back and forth.  (we don't speak Spanish).  A man came and talked to them and it was quiet immediately.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we appreciate your feedback. Your comments have been taken VERY seriously by our ownership and management team. The gentleman at the desk was sincere with his comments about the situation being addressed by the ladies manager and I am sorry if you expected him to elaborate on internal disciplinary actions. I support this as it is certainly not professional and I apologize if your expectations were otherwise. Kind regards.

Summary: As promised, the location is great.  We walked to Disneyland and California Adventure most days, or took the shuttle when our feet were sore. Shuttle drivers were great.  Other service was not so good. When we first arrived, we asked the time of the next shuttle, and they said 8pm (we arrived in the evening).  So we rushed to unload the car so we could make the next shuttle, but there was no 8pm shuttle!  So we walked, which we discovered was not a big deal, but still.  The staff (other than the shuttle drivers) seemed a bit grumpy.  The breakfast was just average.  We had a regular room, which was small (couldn't even open the door all the way because it bumped into furniture.  If I ever stay here again, would probably want to pay extra for a deluxe room.  Never did get any
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we appreciate your comments, we DO listen and sincerely care about our guests and their wellbeing. Your feedback has been reviewed with our team and I am apologetic as we all know that the holidays bring out the best and worst in many folks…however we must NEVER be grumpy to our guests. Thank you again for bringing these very important items to our attention. Warm regards!

Summary: Stayed at this hotel Dec 2012. What a fantastic place Tripadvisor did not let me down. Great location to Disney parks, very short walk with toddler. The deluxe room was one of the largest i have stayed at in the U.S, it was spotless every day. Great continental breakfast with a wide range of food. Staff were very helpful anf extremely pleasant to deal with, including holding our bags for the day whilst we shopped before a late night flight to Australia. The free shuttle bus is not a bus it is a coach, very nice. The town car service arranged to & from the airport was great too, very comprable to a shuttle but way more comfortable. Overall a fantastic hotel in a great location,will be back for sure.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your in-depth comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We do appreciate your business and please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: My family plans a Disneyland vacation 1-2 times a year and every year we stay at the candy cane inn!!! The rooms work out great for 4 adults nicely, the complimentary shuttle and drivers are superb, we always get excited for the breakfast buffet (great muffins and treats!!!) My husband and I also visited the candy cane inn for our honeymoon and our one year anniversary Disney trip!!! The hotel grounds are beautiful it definitely has a little Disney touch, reminds me of the tikki room!!! A great place for families and couples!!! Thanks for the great memories candy cane!!! Can't wait to visit you guys this Feb 2013 to see the new cars land!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat Candy Cane Inn guest, we DO appreciate your business! I am delighted to read that you have celebrated many wonderful occasions and you will certainly enjoy Cars Land and the many new additions at the theme park. Warm regards!

Summary: Stayed here on the 4th of December for 1 night as we were going to Disneyland and seeing Bruce Springsteen at night, we arrived around 9am and it was good we are able to check in, to my disappointment we were the upper floor and as there were no ramps we found it very hard trying to get our heavy luggage up the stairs, the rooms were quite large which was good. The following morning when I went to have a shower I was unable to turn the shower on, most showers you should only have to simply turn the tap to the right and the water turns on but not here I had to try to push in the tap, twist and turn and still nothing so I called reception and someone came up and turned it on for me as though it was a simple thing to which it wasnt. Once I finished with the shower the water wouldnt
Manager Response: I am sincerely sorry that your shower knob worked hard. The water in Anaheim with the high calcium levels can affect these and it was changed out immediately upon your bringing to our attention. Again, I am very apologetic for this inconvenience and do thank you for bringing to our attention.  In regards to luggage assistance, we ask that if you simply contact the front desk and one of our team would be delighted to provide immediate assistance with luggage. Kind regards.

Summary: The Candy Cane Inn is a very nice hotel close to Disneyland/California Adventures park.  It is clean and very well priced.  Breakfast is free and very good, however it is all carbs..no meats.  There is a free shuttle to the park although the walk is very close and easy.  Only complaint is we were in room 240 which is right next to house keeping.  We were woken every day at about 5:30am by them talking and going in and out of their room.  DON'T take this room is you need to be able to sleep late.  We were at the parks until 1:00am each night so the 5:30am noise was not fun.  But I do recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with the valuable feedback and we have already discussed with our team. We do appreciate your business and look forward in seeing you again. Kind regards.

Summary: I have used Trip Advisor many times for travels throughout the world and welcome honest reviews that help me make informed choices. I stayed at this hotel during my recent trip to Anaheim based on the positive experiences of others and now have my own to add. I describe this hotel as "clean and colorful," and it really is. It has all the basics of a good hotel: clean, spacious bathroom and adjacent sink/closet area, plus comfortable beds, cheerful decorations, table and television cabinet. For my own personal taste, I very much appreciate the refrigerator, coffee maker and real glasses (for the sip of wine I enjoy in the evening, real glasses beat plastic cups every time). On top of the above average rooms, the hotel lobby itself is welcoming, filled with Disney items spilling
Manager Response: Thank you for following your intuition and the many positive reviews on TripAdvisor. It certainly is a trust worthy site and we ask guests to view the site when we are sold out as the feedback is non-bias and actual comments by the guests based on their experience. I am delighted to read that your family gave us the thumbs up for future visits. Please feel free to contact me personally as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. The best of the holiday season to you and yours. Warm regards!

Summary: We stayed at the CCI from 11-22-12 to 11-29-12 and as usual everything was perfect.  Great staff, amenities and breakfast.  This is our 5th stay in the last 8 years at the CCI.  This trip, we opted for the premium room, which includes extra in room amenities and continental breakfast delivered to our room.  The night before we put our breakfast request and time on the door.  Our breakfast was always delivered at the time and the with the items we requested.  The offerings were plentiful, (i.e. coffee, juice, milk, hot & cold cereal, muffins, donuts, yogurt, fresh fruit).  We will not stay anywhere else when we are in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal Candy Cane Inn repeat guest, we sincerely appreciate your business. Happy Holidays!

Summary: OMG... trip adivsor and friends said this would be great. Got there.  Sink broken, toilet ran, water bubble on the ceiling, earwigs in tub...worst of all:  luke warm shower that ran warm and cold....miserable...LOUD!!!  Told us we could go next door and buy earplugs for $3.99/ea.  Tried to talk us out of $40 cab for their "town car"  for $60.  Nice job Trip Advisor.  You are so bought and sold.  Never trust you again.  Hope you don't ever go public...
Manager Response: After reviewing your comments regarding our Inn and California Adventure I am sorry that neither of us delivered to your expectations.  I professionally feel that TripAdvisor is fair and allows guests to make accusations and claims based on their perception and/or opinion and only ask that we be given the opportunity to rectify issues in advance.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: The Best Value Near Disneyland Resort
Summary: My wife, parents and I just completed a very nice, one-week stay at Candy Cane inn. My wife and I had stayed there about ten years ago and really enjoyed it. Therefore, we highly recommended it to my parents for this Disney trip. They balked somewhat at the price, but I assured them it was a better value than the other motels in the area which only seem to be less expensive. Once they checked into their standard room, they agreed.   It's the many very nice, little things that make the Candy Cane Inn a great place to stay. The grounds are attractive and well maintained. The rooms are always kept up to date and squeaky clean. The mattresses and bedding are of very high quality. The staff are friendly and always helpful. The free breakfast is very good by Disneyland resort area
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and bringing up these VERY important costs and amenities to consider when comparing our Inn to other properties in the area. We certainly appreciate your business and please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Great family place while visiting Disneyland!
Summary: What a nice place! I chose this place based on reviews and I didn't make a mistake. It's close enough to Disneyland to walk but they provide a great shuttle service twice an hour. The deluxe room was very clean and very nice, 2 queens, LCD TV which I was able to hook my Apple TV to and utilize the free wifi for movie watching and plenty of room for 2adults and 2 teenagers. The hot tub was very nice to relax in after a long day at the park and the pool area was very nice, clean with towels available. The am continental breakfast was very nice with fresh fruit, cereals, oatmeal and a nice supply of bagels and cream cheese. Of course there was coffee, hot choc and juices. My only suggestion would be to add a protein source, like hard boiled eggs. The staff was very accommodating
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit and we thank you for your in-depth review of our property and services.  We do appreciate your comments and will take your suggestion into consideration for future enhancements. Kind regards!

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for quite a long stay over Thanksgiving, and we were overall very pleased.  Staff was always friendly and helpful.  The rooms are warmly decorated and are kept very clean.  Things are fairly quiet at night (once the fireworks are over).  The beds are quite comfortable.  We liked the decor of the hotel with the vines and flowers, and the relaxing pool area.  The parking and continental breakfast are free.  The breakfast had good variety so we could have a little something different each day, and it was good quality food.  The hotel is right next to Disneyland (in fact, Radiator Springs / CARS Land backs up to the parking lot), so it's an easy walk or you can take the free shuttle.   We stayed long enough that we had to do laundry, and there are
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Please feel free to contact me when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great location, people, breakfasts and shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: The property was clean and well kept up. The staff were all friendly, especially at the front desk. The shuttle drivers to Disneyland and Downtown Disney gave us several excellent tips.  I primarily attended a convention, and from my room to the convention center is easy walking at six typical city blocks.  We will definitely stay again!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments and feedback to fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Yes, we are about even distance to the Anaheim Convention Center and the Theme Parks. I am delighted that you enjoyed our shuttle drivers as they are a fine group and I certainly appreciate all that they do for our Inn and guests. Kind regards!

Summary: We just returned from a one night stay in a Premium room. Overall, the value can't be beat and all of the extra amenities make this a top pick for us.   Here are my impressions:  Location - they are not the closest motel in the area, but it is just about a half block farther than the ones right at the main gate. We traveled with our 6 year old and our 2 year old and we were just fine with the 7 minute walk to the entrance. The location is still fantastic.   Room: we got the upgraded Premium room and honestly, what a great value. The over sized room was really spacious for our family of four. We got a "welcome" movie popcorn bucket stuffed with granola bars, home made cookies that were so delicious, candy canes, and of course, microwaveable popcorn. What a nice touch.   With the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we certainly appreciate your in-depth review and kind comments. Yes, many folks who stay in one of our Premium Rooms return and ask for them again as the amenities and services provided are of value to most. Please feel free to contact me when returning in the future as it would by my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm Regards!

Summary: There were two adults and three kids (aged 13, 10 and 8) in our room and the two queen sized beds made it comfortable enough. The laundry room was also a great convenience for us. It's also very close to nice shops on Katella ave and you can use the free shuttle to downtown disney as well.  Only con was that the WiFi didn't work in our room right at the end of the property so I usually had to walk up to the middle or up to the front to use it.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sincerely sorry that the WiFi signal in your room was weak. I am delighted and very excited to inform you that our entire system is being replaced and upgraded starting the 10th of December. We are more than tripling our access points and will have 24/7 technical support provided for our guests. Kind regards!

Summary: We (2 adults / 2 children) stayed here for one night in November.  Nice, clean property.  VERY close to D-land (about a 7 minute walk or you can take their shuttle which leaves every 1/2 hour). Although we didn't use it, there were plenty of kids in the pool in the evening.  The free continental breakfast was nice and I liked that they didn't charge for parking.  I'd definitely stay here again when we are in the area.    The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that the parking is VERY tight and the lot was near capacity the whole time we were there.  Sometime after we checked in, someone hit my car.  Not the hotel's fault but the next time we stay here I'm not parking in the marked stalls (if I can help it) but along the curb next to the office.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback, it is most appreciated. We do pride ourselves for our many Complimentary Items, such as; Expanded Continental Breakfast, Exclusive Shuttle to the theme parks, Parking, WiFi and NO hidden “Resort” or “Convenience” fees! Kind Regards!

Summary: We just got back from a great long weekend at Disneyland & The Candy Cane Inn. We stayed at this hotel in May and loved it. So we wanted to stay here again. The people were nice and helpful. The hotel is just a short walk to the park and they have a free shuttle that you can use as well. We were able to come back from the park in the afternoon and let the kids play in the pool and walk back over at night. Breakfast is not huge, but it is just want you need to get the day started.   The rooms are clean, the beds are very comfy and the grounds are well maintained. You can tell the employees take pride in this hotel. We especially loved listening to the Christmas Music in the hot tub!  We will definitely be back!! Happy Holidays!!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat guest and I am delighted that you and your family enjoyed our hotel. Yes, we receive many positive comments regarding our Serta Presidential Suite Double Pillow Top Mattresses and I am happy you found comfy! Warm Regards!

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Inn - Very Close to Disneyland and Nice Property
Summary: My wife and I booked a room on line using the Candy Cane Inn website.  We upgraded to a Premium room and it was definitely well worth it!  We had nice continental breakfast every day, turn down service and microwave oven.  For the continental breakfast, we simply filled out a form each evening with our preferences and the delivery time.  We left the form on the doorknob and each morning we received our nice breakfast during the requested timeframe.  The room spacious, was very clean and was made up nicely each day!  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  The bathroom was spotlessly clean and was cleaned very well each day.  The Candy Cane Inn is very close to Disneyland and California Adventure - no more than a 5-10 minute walk.  I'd say it's one of the closest accommodations to
Manager Response: Thank your allowing us the opportunity during your recent visit to the theme parks! We do appreciate your business and comments regarding our property. Yes, many folks enjoy the added amenities and services provided with our Premium Rooms. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm Regards!

Summary Heading: You can see Disneyland fireworks from here :)
Summary: We stayed there for 2 nights. Lovely hotel very safe, clean and closely located to Disneyland we really enjoyed our stay :) nice continental breakfast very enjoyable. Will go back one day and this hotel will be at the top of our list.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Kind Regards!

Summary: Once again Candy Cane Inn was great.  They were full this past weekend but still were able to accomadate my room requests with ease.  Great front desk members who were knowledgeable about what they were doing. Prices increased $10 over previous prices per room size over the past month, but considering the free continental breakfast prior to going to the parks, still worth nightly charge.  Beds and pillows to me were very comfortable as i like them to be on the softer side.  Rooms were very clean.  Motel is located in a great location only a couple of hundred yards away from Disney Main entry gate, and they have a shuttle as well. Continental breakfast serves pastries, breads, yogurts, cerial and fruit.  They also serve juices, coffee, milk, hot chocolate and have various teas in
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and being a loyal and repeat Candy Cane Inn guest, we DO appreciate your business and comments. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: This hotel is  a dissappointment. Foul urine smelling room. Nice but illconcerned staff. Dont stay there are better choices. Ran out of food for breakfast . The room smelled so badly of urine that the whole night of sleep was ruined. Additionally the hotel was noisy
Manager Response: The Candy Cane Inn has a wonderful and an extremely strong and longstanding reputation for our cleanliness and service provided as you can see by the positive reviews and repeat guests and families in our over 55 years of business. This being said I do thank you for staying with us and I am sincerely apologetic that the first night of your stay was not to your liking and we appreciate your feedback. Kind regards.

Summary: We arrived on 10/31 around 7am and were able to get our room right away, which we were very thankful for.  We only took the shuttle once because the walk was so short, but the shuttle was on time when we did take it & we were able to take our folded up double stroller with no problem.  There is a convenience store right next door and Subway & Chinese across the street.  IHOP is less than a 5 min walk away.  The pool was nice and had lots of towels.  Customer service was excellent both over the phone and in person.  We got the standard 2 qn room and the only downside was that the bathroom door actually hits the foot of one of the beds because it's small.  But, if you are at Disney, you probably don't spend a lot of time in the room anyway.  Towels could have been softer, but
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to the theme parks. I am delighted that you were able to check in early as this does adds to the convenience and we certainly do what we can to extend this upon availability. I will certainly cover your comments regarding breakfast service as we do ask the ladies not rush guests at 9am. Kind regards!

Summary: We've been to Disney four times. This was the first time staying at the Candy Cane. In my experience there is typically a trade off when staying in a hotel/inn near the park - you get a great location but lose out on service, comfort, cleanliness etc. After staying at the Candy Cane I wouldn't stay anywhere else. It's an absolutely lovely little inn, friendly staff, beautiful grounds, clean comfy rooms, affordable and minutes from the park - with complimentary shuttle if you prefer. The complimentary continental breakfast is substantial and adds even more value to the stay. My only critique would be the lack of multigrain options. I was a little concerned about noise as our room was located at the front of the property nearer to the street but we never heard a thing and slept
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your kind comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers, we DO appreciate you taking time to write your review. Our team does a wonderful job in providing comfort and service to our guests and we do thank you for commenting. Yes, we receive many positive comments on our Serta Double Pillow Top Presidential Suite Mattresses as they are very comfortable. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm Regards!

Summary: My family and I stayed at this property during our trip to Disney in July.   We arrived during a busy check in time and were greeted by an apethetic front desk clerk.  When I made the reservation earlier in the year, I gave my credit card and expiration date.  In the time between reservation and arrival my card expired and I was sent a new card with a new date.  I informed the clerk of the new date.  As I was trying to check in the clerk kept saying rather loudly "your card is declined".  I asked if I could use the phone to call the credit card company and I was told I could not use the phone.  After I went to get my cell out of the car and called the credit card company, I was told that the reason that my card was declined was that the clerk was not entering the new expiration
Manager Response: I am sincerely sorry that your experience in July was not a pleasant one and I have attempted to reach you through TripAdvisor email with no response. I can say that this is NOT our policy as we choose words very carefully when credit cards do not go through as it can be for many reasons. One thing that I can say is that we have severed ties with a couple gentlemen at our front desk that were not the best fit for the level of customer service that the Candy Cane Inn has built its reputation on. Thank you again and I personally apologize for this uncomfortable incident. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Whenever we visit Disneyland this is always out first choice to stay.  Unfailingly polite and friendly staff.  Rooms are clean (don't expect 5 star at this price).  Breakfast will get you going.  Frequent shuttle to Disneyland, but close enough to walk. You can't miss with this one, but book ahead! The one small downside is the cable TV is a bit spartan-- You'll get Fox, but not PBS!
Manager Response: We certainly appreciate being your “first choice” whenever visiting the theme parks. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: Son and I flew out for a week long getaway. We enjoy Disneyland decorated at Halloween. We also thought it would be a good time to visit Cars Land.  As usual we stayed at the Candy Cane inn. Based on the fact that this was our third week this year at the Candy Cane, one could guess we like it .....a lot! There is not a thing that we would change. My son enjoys his nightly soaks in the pool, going to the park - returning to the room mid day - going back to the park at night, having a store next door and the free shuttle. The other thing that we enjoy is the staff.  GM Jeff is helpful as is everyone else.  Whenever we needed anything they were more than wiling to help.    Over the past year we have watched Raditor Springs be built behind the CCI.  I was concerned about the noise
Manager Response: Thank for being a loyal and repeat guest, we DO appreciate your business and kind comments! It is very warming to read that your son is so fond of our hotel and he would state “without hesitation” that he wanted to stay with us. Now, THAT is something that puts a smile on the face of a GM! Yes, I am blessed and proud to work with such a team of helpful and caring individuals and thank you for recognizing them. Warm Regards!

Summary: This hotel is conveniently located a 7 minute walk to the Disneyland main entrance. A free shuttle will take you also from the hotel. Hotel staff was great, the rooms were clean and a great deal for the price. The kids loved the pool and hot tub and having a continental breakfast was just enough to get us started in the mornings. Just wish the free WiFi was secure as if you are on Mac you will have some troubles accessing it. Otherwise we would stay there again!. Also closely located to other quick restaurants and stores to pickup waters, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am extremely excited and pleased to inform you that we are upgrading our WiFi system mid-December and at that time will add a splash page to log on being a hotel guest. We understand the Mac issues and their firewalls pertaining to this and have asked the new folks do whatever possible as they will monitor and support our system. Kind regards!

Summary: After a 13 hour flight from Brisbane, hearing that our room was ready on arrival to the Candy Cane Inn was gratefully appreciated. The pluses are endless at the Candy Cane Inn.  Staff are warm, friendly and accommodating. Our Premium room was clean and comfortable, complete with small fridge and microwave and the daily housekeeping was fantastic.  Loved the welcome movie pack with popcorn and cookies and of course the candy canes :) The grounds, gardens and pool area all well maintained and tidy. Breakfast choices catered for all tastes.  Complimentary parking, newspaper, wi-fi and of course the shuttle make this property extremely great value. Location is perfect for Disneyland and there are various eateries within walking distance - highly recommend a visit to Bubba Gumps.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us to be your “Home away from Home”! I am very happy that our team was able to check you in upon arrival after such a long flight. We appreciate your kind comments and certainly contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Nice clean motel near Disneyland CA
Summary: Stayed here for several days while in anaheim area. The Inn is close enough to walk to Disneyland although they have a shuttle bus that runs quite often. The room was on the small side but very clean and quiet. Free parking with ample room for our midsize car. They have a free breakfast but the room was quite crowded so we did not try it. There is a small store next door for grocery and other items you might need and there are some restaurants within walking distance. We would consider staying here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to the Anaheim area. We appreciate your feedback and please feel free to contact me should you be returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: The ONLY place to stay at Disneyland
Summary: My daugher and I have stayed MANY times at the Candy Cane Inn over the past 5 years.  This is the ONE and ONLY place we will stay.  We love the cute clean rooms with comfortable beds, coffee/tea maker, fridge, nice amenities, and great TV.  Getting an expanded breakfast is an added bonus, and being able to eat it by the pool is wonderful. Fruit, bagels, muffins, donuts, yogurt and cereal with milk, is the perfect way to start our day (and coffee for Mom).  We have NEVER encountered anyone who was not helpful or made us feel at home. We both feel safe and comfortable at the Candy Cane. From the fabulous staff at reservations, helpful staff checking us in, the great shuttle drivers all hours of the day and night to the friendly staff taking excellent care of the property, we have
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being a loyal and repeat Candy Cane Inn guest, we DO appreciate your business. I will certainly share your extremely nice comments regarding our team of service professionals as we all value your feedback. Please contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: Staying here was the best decision for 2 adults and 2 young children on our 1st trip to Disney. The location is perfect!! We used the free shuttle every time and it drops you closer than you ever hope to get by car.   The gardens truly make this place special. Climbing vines and flowers are lovely.   We weren't in our room much, it was totally adequate clean and a good size. I would've preferred an updated A/C unit. The one we had was old and noisy.   We tried breakfast once but it wasn't even worth going back so we popped next door to a great grocery store and that kept us going. The value and location can't be beaten so I'd go back.
