Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am sincerely sorry that you’re A/C unit was noisy. We service our units on property and would have been delighted to exchange the unit and ask that you please call the front desk should you encounter any maintenance or housekeeping issues. Kind regards.

Summary: The hotels on the Disney property were $350 and up a night and after seeing Tripadvisors comments, we figured why not try it.... So glad we did. The place was cute and inviting. They let us check in at 10am which was awesome!! Put our stuff away and took their shuttle to the park. The room was cute and clean. Had everything we needed. Breakfast included was an added bonus! Staff was nice! Thanks and we can't wait to go back!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I thank you for your comments. Yes, we do attempt to allow guests who arrive to early check in and enjoy the theme parks. Kind regards!

Summary: After agonising over the name of this hotel it turned out to be an excellent place to stay for people of all ages.  Within walking of Disneyland, there were plenty of restaurants/fast food facilities nearby.  Next to the hotel was a convenience store.  The hotel also offered a free shuttle to and from Disneyland which was most appreciated.  The drivers were helpful and very friendly.   We stayed in a Premier room at the rear of the hotel.  The hotel surrounds were picture perfect - most beautiful gardens.  We had a breakfast basket delivered to our room daily and there was more than enough choice on the menu. The room was serviced immaculately and by, once again, friendly staff.  We had 2 queen beds, tea/coffee making facilties and a microwave.  The reception staff were more
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to be of service on your recent visit. Yes, there are many who stay here after being a bit torn by the name that cannot say enough good things about our Inn after the experience. Being here for over 55 years the name and the hotel have become somewhat of an institution for many repeat families. Give my regards to your grandchildren and feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: This motel was the perfect choice for us.   Our "premium" room was lovely, very clean, and a little above average in size.   It had a flat-screened TV, two comfortable queen beds, ample drawer space, a small refrigerator, a microwave oven, and a table with two nice chairs.   The decor of the room was pretty and inviting.     The exceptional customer service is one of the best reasons for a stay at this motel.  Almost every staff member was extremely friendly.  Most everyone that we encountered really seemed to go "out of their way" to make us feel welcomed and special.  The exceptions were the unfriendly female shuttle driver and Amy at the front desk who seemed irritated and perhaps stressed.  (I actually wished I had been checked-in by someone else.)   Our yummy continental
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Yes, our Premium Rooms have become the favorite of many of our return guests. We do appreciate your kind comments regarding our team and I will certainly cover your comments with those needing assistance. Kind regards!

Summary: I stay here every time I go to Disneyland.  It is only a couple blocks walk from Disneyland.  The rooms a nice and the free breakfast in the morning is actually good.  A lot of free breakfasts tend to be stale or a poor selection, but this one has fresh waffles, eggs, bagels, and many other items.  Unless you absolutely have to stay in downtown Disney when you visit then this is the perfect hotel.  Close, price is just right, and great free breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We are proud of our expanded continental breakfast with fresh fruits, pastries, donuts, muffins, bagels, toast, cold cereals, oatmeal, yogurt, juices, hot chocolate, coffee, tea and milk. I would like to clarify that we do not have waffles or eggs as you have mentioned and sorry for any inconvenience this may cause readers. Kind regards!

Summary: The name had always turned me off but after reading the endless positive reviews we decided to book our week in L.A. at the Candy Cane Inn and were very happy we did. The rooms and grounds are immaculate. Probably the cleanest motel I've ever stayed at. The staff are very friendly and the location was great with only an 8 minute walk to the parks. The breakfast was more than adequate. It was very quiet at night. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Thank you for the pleasant stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for deciding to allow us that opportunity after reading the positive reviews of our many satisfied guests. We have been in Anaheim for over 55 years and blessed to have owners who are very image conscious and wanting to provide an exceptional product and quality while being mindful of travelers on a family budget. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Very close to Disney, convenience store next door
Summary: This is the first time I've stayed here in over 4 years. I like other hotels for other reasons but after this stay, may be back again. It's walking distance to Disney and they their OWN free shuttle bus. There is a convenience store next door which is great since they have a fridge. Rooms: very comfortable beds. Vanity sink was in the room and quite large. Almost enough for 3 people to get ready at it. Coffee maker made single cups of strong coffee. Wish they had extra cream/sugar in the room. TV was new, WIFI was free, plenty of room for a family of 4. Missing: microwave. This would have given my stay 5 stars.  Bathroom: shower never got warmer than warm even after running the water for several minutes. I did not notify management of the issue. Very clean fluffy towels. Bath
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us again after four years and I am pleased to read that you may be back again and please feel free to contact me should you need any assistance with reservations. I would like to point out that we have microwave ovens in our Premium Rooms and we also have one in our Garden Room (where breakfast is served) that is available 24 hours per day for guest’s convenience. Again, thank you for your comments as they are appreciated and we DO listen to our guests. Kind regards!

Summary: My reasons why we will return to this wonderful hotel: 1) No charge for parking (other close by hotels charge anywhere form $10-25 per night) 2) Wonderful complimentary breakfast 3) Swimming after parks closed with kids (some hotels have restrictions as to what time kids can swim) 4) Short walk to parks 5) Free WiFi (other close hotels charge for this service) 6) Clean rooms  We arrived around 10:30 on Wednesday, Oct 17 and was not expecting our room to be ready but it was ready so we were able to unpack and get a earlier start to the parks.   We love this hotel and will return every time, if it is available. We were only able to spend Wed and Thursday as Friday was sold out. Book this place early and you will not regret it. Thanks to the staff for a wonderful first time stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and your comments about our “wonderful” hotel. I am delighted to read that you were able to check-in early and we certainly do our very best to allow whenever possible. Please feel free to contact me when planning your next visit as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: We stayed here this week and were all very happy with the Candy Cane Inn. The staff were great and the location could not be beat. Most of the time we walked to Disneyland, but sometimes took the shuttle to rest our feet.  We learned from the historian at the Inn that this is oldest motel in Anaheim. It is quite charming and breakfast was very nice with bagels, fruit, yogurt, toast, cereal, and juice/coffee,tea,hot chocolate.  Excellent location because it only takes 5 or 6 minutes to walk and you won't have to cross the big intersection to get to Disneyland. Will definately be back to stay at this clean and comfortable Inn!
Manager Response: Thank your allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit and we appreciate your feedback. Yes, not having to cross the busy Harbor Blvd or the intersection at Katella. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted in assisting with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: We stayed here for two nights in August, chosing this hotel because of its proximity to Disney and all the raves we read on tripadvisor.  It is a nice place, for sure, and the location is excellent - we were able to easily walk to and from the park a couple times a day.  There were also several restaurants within easy walking distance. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was much better than the usual fare.  On the downside, we purchased the "deluxe" room which was supposed to accomodate 5 people and it was a squeeze for sure.  My brother had a "standard" for his family of 4, and we weren't able to discern the difference in sizes between the rooms.  Perhaps the "Premium" room would have been a better option for us.  Overall, it was a good experience and we would stay there
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers, we DO appreciate your business and time you took to write this review. Yes, our location is very nice with the proximity to the theme parks, dining, shopping and things to do. Our Deluxe room is rated 5 occupants based on fire code where the Standard is rated for a maximum of 4 occupants. The room is approximately 35 square feet larger and our Premium is another 50 square foot larger than the Deluxe and is rated for a maximum of 5 occupants as well. Thank you again for staying with us. Kind regards!

Summary: Yet another great stay at the CCI...Thanks to Jeff, James, Dorothy and the rest of the friendly, helpful staff.  Might be hard to wait another year to visit....Here's a great tip:  Order a pizza from Marri's, the best you will ever have, and have them deliver it to you out by the pool!! Delicious, and not pricy at all.  See you as soon as possible..!!  Laura Napoli and family
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat member of the Candy Cane Inn family and view our Inn as your second home.  This is something that makes a General Manager proud to read and knowing that our team of service professionals is sincere in delivering exceptional service. We do look forward in being of service on on your next visit. Warm regards!

Summary: We stayed here for two nights after the Grand Californian as that hotel was booked out and we wanted to extend our stay at Disneyland. This motel offers wonderful value for money and the rooms were spacious, breakfast was great and plentiful and the walk was much shorter than I had expected. We would stay here again if we did not need the early entry at GCH. Housekeeping was great and the rooms were very very clean. The only slight niggle was the soundproofing as you could hear families coming home or leaving quite clearly, but honestly it would not deter me from returning.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers, we DO appreciate your business. We do aspire to provide exceptional price value with an emphasis on quality and guest service. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Comfortable place to start and end our day at Disney
Summary: We usually use Priceline to save money and are not as concerned about location, but I am so glad that we decided to "splurge" and stay closer to the park. We decided on the CCI because it seemed to have the best reviews out of all the places within our budget. I was nervous about the room size for our family of 4 as some reviewers mentioned (we stayed in the smallest, lowest price room); however, I didn't notice it being any smaller than any other hotel room. The beds were so comfortable. Being so close to DL, we were able to nap after lunch, go for a short swim and then head back for the rest of the evening. My children who are 2 and 4 loved the kiddie pool. It was very warm and shallow enough we could just sit on the side and they were free to play. We also loved the breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit and I am delighted that you decided to “splurge” and stay closer to the park. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: A great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here in room 206 from October 16-19. Staff were consistently friendly and helpful, check-in and check-out easy. The room was very clean and comfortable, good beds and quiet  - we had neighbours on both sides and below but didn't hear a thing from them. Everything, including air con, worked. The heated outdoor pool/spa was a wonderful treat at the end of a Disneyland day (be prepared for kids!), and the complimentary breakfast (cereals, yoghurt, fruit, toast, bagels and sweet pastries, juice or coffee) was a perfect way to start! Disneyland is an easy 6-7 minute walk for sprightly folk but the half-hourly free shuttle was a welcome option for the "early morning" starts or to avoid the hot hot walk home. The Candy Cane is spic and span and clearly takes pride in its
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to the Theme Parks. We do appreciate your feedback and kind comments regarding our Inn. Yes, we do take pride in ownership and the 55 years we have had the pleasure in serving new and repeat guests alike. Kind regards!

Summary: We always look forward to our stay at the candy cane Inn.This year was no different. When we first arrived our room had a bad order. I called and asked for a different room and someone came and helped us move.The next room was great. We were on the bottom floor so it was a little noisy above us. But we are at disneyland, we expect that stuff.Usually we stay on the 2nd floor. The shuttle was so helpful.Robert and Fred are such nice Men and safe drivers.     It was our anniversay so there was a nice card and cookies.  Can't wait to go back. CANDY CANE INN   we love you .
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat and loyal Candy Cane Inn guest. I am so sorry regarding your need to move rooms, however delighted that one of our team assisted you with the move. Yes, our drivers are all very friendly and the safety and security of our guests is extremely important. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: The Candy Cane Inn is, by far, the best budget motel around Disneyland. The location is great - it took us 10-15 minutes to walk to the park. They also offer a free shuttle. The rooms were clean, cosy and very comfortable. The continental breakfast was great and had a wide variety of foods - we really enjoyed sitting poolside while we ate. They've done a great job with this motel - it exceeded my expectations greatly. I would absolutely stay here again, it's top notch for a motel in this price range.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: This is the best budget hotel near Disneyland. The rooms are clean and the continental breakfast next to the pool is a refreshing way to start the day. It is about a 15 minute walk to the park and the complimentary shuttle leaves every 20 minutes - so why walk.
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights.  The room was very clean, and the property is spotless.  We stayed in room 217 which was on the ground floor, across from the pool, it was perfect and we never heard anything from the pool area.  We did not use the free shuttle and walked to the parks, it took us about 12 minutes with a 2 year old.  The breakfast buffet was nice (bring a tray from the room) and we had plenty to choose from.  The wi-fi was hit or miss in the room, but worked fine at the pool.  The staff was very friendly and we would stay here again.
Manager Response: We appreciate your staying with us and providing us with valuable feedback. I am very excited to announce that we have entered into an agreement with iBAHN to complete and extensive upgrade to our property and provide ongoing technical assistance for our WIFI. They are an extremely well respected leader in the industry and work exclusively with hotels. Thank you again for staying with us. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Clean, great location and friendly staff!
Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for 8 nights, the room was really clean and well set out. The location was excellent just a short walk to restaurants and shops also just down the street from a bus stop, we caught the bus one day to Target, very easy to catch! The Candy Cane Inn shuttle went to and from Disneyland half hourly, a short ride, but very welcoming after a 12hr day! Breakfast was awesome and a great way to start the day lots of fresh fruit and cereals to choose from. Staff were very helpful and were available when needed! Overall a great stay at the Candy Cane Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity to be of service on your recent visit to the theme parks. We do appreciate your kind comments and please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted in assisting with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, beautiful rooms, free shuttle to Disneyland..
Summary: From the moment we arrived after a long haul flight, the needs of our family were taken care of. The beds were beautiful to sleep on, soooo soft. quiet surrounds, nice breakfast and most importantly a free shuttle to and from disney. It is in an excellent position close to everthing.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted to read that your family was taken care of. We do believe in providing exception guest service with a personal and friendly atmosphere. Kind regards!

Summary: My husband and I had a very comfortable 2 night stay here. Our room was near the back on the second level and quite quiet considering the hotel was full. The service was very good. Room was attractive, clean, and well equipped (fridge, iron/board, coffee maker,blow dryer, wifi,tv, etc.) The breakfast area is a bit small but it was less crowded at 0700 than 0800 and nice to have it at poolside. The pool itself is small and full of children so not a place for adults to relax, but this is Disneyland, so did not expect otherwise. The hotel location is perfect with an easy 10 minute walk to Disneyland, many nearby restaurants, and a convenience store right next door.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am very happy that you and your husband had very comfortable stay. Kind regards!

Summary: We recently stayed here for 8 nights.  The short walk to Disneyland was great for those days when we needed a rest in the afternoon.  There was a shuttle bus that ran on the half hour to the parks but we only used this a few times.  The continental breakfast provided was adequate.  Beds were very comfortable.  Lovely landscaped gardens and surrounds.  We will definitely stay again (hopefully next year) but will get a 2nd level room so we don't have the 'dumbo' sound effects.  I must also make a special mention about James at Reception.  He was excellent - so helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and your kind comments are certainly appreciated. Yes, James is a long time Candy Cane Inn team member and is certainly an ambassador of guest service. Please feel free to contact me personally when making your reservations for next year as I would be delighted to assist. Also, always feel free to mention if you have special requests as our team do their very best to accommodate. Warm regards!

Summary: We were unsure of this hotel with the name Candycane Inn, but it was amazing.  The rooms are clean and well appointed. The staff super friendly. We were towards the front and it was not as noisy as some reviews stated. The pool is very clean and my lo loved the kids pool. The jacuzzi is not hot but warm.  That was the only downside i saw. The breakfast was fresh and simple. I would highly advise to stay here!
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity during your recent visit to the theme parks. Yes, the name can pose a question, however the Candy Cane Inn has been a solid and highly respected family favorite for many over the past 55 years. Kind regards!

Summary: My husband and I stayed here Sept. for an anniversary weekend getaway to Disneyland.    There were some great things about this hotel... * Our room was ready VERY early - around 11 am.  That was really nice. * Location - can't be beat if staying off property. * Shuttle - used it a lot and since it was very HOT during our time there, the air conditioning was very much appreciated! * Clean - Room was very clean. * Comfortable beds - This was great since we were only there 2 nights and sometimes it takes a night or two to get used to a hotel bed.  Not here.  Comfortable from the start. * We were give an "anniversary" gift of cookies on checkout. They said they couldn't deliver it to us since we had our "Do Not Disturb".  It was a nice touch, too bad we didn't get to enjoy it while
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your positive comments and very sorry regarding your feedback about the DND sign. This is a very delicate subject as I, as a manager and our team try very hard to respectful of the wishes of our guests. I personally have been screamed at by a guest (during my career and not at this hotel) when a room attendant called their room to ask when they would like service when a DND sign was present and the phone woke their sleeping baby. I appreciate your comments and I hope that you can understand that this subject can be tough. Kind regards!

Summary: Great place to stay. It is a short walk to DIsneyland. They also have nice air conditioned shuttle busses to DIsneyland. Very good price. Good selection of foods for continental breakfast. Rooms are older but very clean and comfortable. Good size rooms. There were 4 adults and we had plenty of room. Nicely landscaped.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My stay at this hotel was very comfortable. There are a lot of families but being so close to Disneyland the kids are excited and happy so its pleasant. Every request was met, even my tricky one about travelling from Universal Studios to the airport, and with ease. No dramas to every request and the staff are so welcoming. Initially a premier room was booked. for my first night then I had to change rooms for the remaining two nights. Both rooms were great, the deluxe rooms have more room and you get a few extras like more bath products, DVD rental, popcorn and breakfast delivered. Otherwise it's breakfast by the pool, which you can take back to the room. So do book as soon as you can, the hotel was even busy 2nd to the 5th October, and booked solid. They are very accommodating
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Its nothing fancy, but it does the trick!
Summary: First, you must get over the fact that it is ranked here as the #2 hotel in Anaheim--there's nothing fancy about this place. Second, enjoy what the place has to offer. THEN you will understand why it rates so well.  Stayed for two nights over the weekend, to attend different events at the Disney parks, with my husband, two small children (1 and 5 years old), and sister. We shared one room. The room was clean and cool, with no unusual odors or musty smell that one might associate with high-traffic hotels. The hotel provided a pack-and-play for the littlest one, which did not have a very comfortable pad. But it was clean, and we brought our own blankets for her, anyway.The beds were comfortable, and the linens clean. The towels were a bit thin and worn, but adequate. There was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Comfy stay so close to Disneyland
Summary: We booked this hotel on a recommendation from a friend and were so glad that we did. It has a shuttle to Disneyland but it is a very short walk, we found.  The rooms were comfy, the bathroom area was nice and big and the service was very friendly.    We actually stayed here in June, 2010, but that wasn't an option on the drop down below.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I think this was our 4th stay...I do not have a single complaint.  The staff here are all so nice, the grounds are very well kept, the shuttle is so nice when feet have had a weary day, and the breakfast is just great.  There are bagels, toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, cereal, coffee and juices.  The pool is very clean.  Our daughter works at Disneyland, and even with her discount at the property hotels, this is a better deal.  This is her 1st choice, she stays with us when we visit and so enjoys the breakfast.  We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Oasis in the middle of Anaheim
Summary: Just returned from 2 nights and would highly recommend. While it's a standard car motel layout, it is beautifully landscaped with large amounts of mature trees, plants and flowers. Rooms at back are very quiet. Our rooms  were very clean and had a small frig, microwave and DVD/VHS player. Wifi free and worked fine. Pool was somewhat small (compared to large resort pools) but lushly landscaped so lots of shade & it was not crowded in late afternoon (when we used it) even though inn was full and it was hot. Very close to Disneyland. Easy walking distance. Would go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our last night here tonight and I gotta say we really enjoyed our stay here.  Property is well maintained, staff friendly and room comfortable. Only minor gripe was that the bathroom fan was really noisy.  Would recomend to anyone.  Great job Candy Cane staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We travelled to Disneyland for the first time with our six year old son this summer. Had heard from friends about this place and saw good reviews on Trip Advisor. Candy Cane Inn lived up to expectations. Great location. Check-in was smooth. Room was clean, more than big enough for a family of three who were going to spend most of our time at Disneyland. The place was quiet and the staff friendly. Loved that basic breakfast was included - bagels, fruit, yogurt, cereal, muffins, toast, juice, coffee. Big enough dining room and tables looking on pool veranda. Pool, hot tub, and seperate kid pool. Plenty of towels and seating. You can walk to park - took about 15 minutes - but shuttle was prompt and very easy. Drops you off right where you want to be. Convenience store a few stores
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked 2 rooms at the Candy Cane Inn for my teenage daughter, a couple of her friends and myself.  We thought it was great.  The breakfast in the morning was a little sparse and there were a ton of people making finding a place to sit a challenge but it all worked out fine.  The shuttle was the main reason I booked at the Candy Cane Inn.  The girls just had to wait a couple of minutes then onto the shuttle and then to Disneyland for the day.  I didn't have to mess with the crowds at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I made my family's reservations based on Trip Advisor's reviews and it was everything the reviews mentioned and more....it was the perfect hotel choice and a great location for our visit to Disneyland. The two adjoining rooms we stayed in were clean, quiet and comfortable - the bed was more confortable than my bed at home!  The staff was extremely friendly and were always cleaning, or raking, or pruning trees or doing something to keep up the property's appearance. Breakfast was good and eating by the pool every morning was a bonus. The shuttle was free and REALLY appreciated after a full day of walking around Disneyland.  I can't say enough good things about the Candy Cane Inn and I would definately stay there again.  :)
Manager Response: none

Summary: After many trips to Disneyland, finally got around to staying at candy cane inn.  Not the cheapest, but well maintained and fairly close to the front entrance.  Quiet, clean, decent breakfast.  Front desk staff could be friendlier but I liked the candy canes in the lobby
Manager Response: none

Summary: We love the Candy Cane Inn and are planning a return trip next month.  It's charming, well kept, affordable, quiet, and the folks who work there are great.  Fabulous free breakfast, and closer to Disneyland than the Disneyland Hotel. Easy walking distance, even for little feet, but still has a shuttle bus for when you are dog-tired. Family owned and operated for the last 50+ years.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Ok stayed here on Thursday and Friday before Disneyland and it was a great location good breakfast good shuttle service easy to park and a good nights sleep. Used my AAA discount and it cost $301 for both nights. Nice place
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Worth the Upgrade to Premium Room
Summary: My Husband and I stayed here based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed.  The name of this Inn  does not really do it justice.  I was expecting some dated kitchy motel like some of those in the Disneyland area.  This is a clean and well maintained boutique inn.  While it is still technically a motel it is a gem.  When I booked there were no king rooms available so I opted for the premium with 2 queens.  The benefits of the premium upgrade are really nice.  The premium upgrade offers turn down service, a bucket with popcorn, cookies, and snacks, free movie rental, breakfast delivery and best of all a late 2pm check out time.  Our room also had a mini refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker.  The complimentary water in the fridge was great after a hot day at Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quality motel standard, great location for Disneyland
Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland (and Downtown Disney a bit further on), but shuttle bus is quicker for morning run.  Nice clean rooms, good continental breakfast - enjoyed outside by the pool.  Good wifi access   - but TVs probably need updating.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family of three plus my Mom were going to Disneyland for the first time.  I sweated over where to stay and if we should stay on Disney property.  Well, I guessed right - Candy Cane Inn was the correct choice.  We had two rooms next to each other.  The rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The shuttle was prompt to take you to the parks although you could walk there in less than 10 minutes.  Even the guests were fun and friendly - we would spark up conversations on the shuttle, in the lobby, at the ice machine and we all agreed that this place was a gold mine.  We will be returning one day to Disney and Candy Cane Inn will be our choice of places to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity and trying the Candy Cane Inn for your first time. I do appreciate your kind comments regarding our property, the team of service professionals and your overall observations. I too have to agree with you that we are blessed to have some of the most wonderful guests that are sincerely pleasant and very friendly. Warm regards!

Summary: It's close to Disney & has a shuttle (if your really tired at the end of your day) breakfast is bagels, donuts, cakes, fruit & yogurt (all good!), the only downside is its only served until 9am.  You can't hear next door at all which is great when you need to sleep after a long day at Disney.   It has a nice clean pool area, which we had all to ourselves! They let us leave our car for the rest of the day after booking out as they weren't busy, saving us Disney parking!  It's great value for money & we would definately return.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We have asked our breakfast ladies to be respectful if guests are there and not make them feel rushed. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: My family of 5 adults and 2 kids stayed here September 2012 and it exceeded all of our expectations.  We had connecting rooms 228 and 229 and took full advantage of the mini patio outside our rooms each morning for breakfast.    The grounds and pool area are very well maintained and the rooms were some of the cleanest that I have ever stayed in.  We appreciated the mini-fridge and coffee maker in the rooms.  The breakfast was simple: whole fruit, toast, yogurt, cereal and donuts, but was fresh and filling.  The hotel is approximately an 8 - 10 minute walk to the park's entrance, however we often took advantage of the shuttle that runs every 30 minutes.  And right next door is a 7-11 and another little market with snacks, beverages and souvenirs.  We also liked the hotels
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit and I am sincerely delighted that we exceeded all of your expectations. I appreciate your kind comments about our housekeeping team as I am very proud of the outstanding job they do in keeping our Inn in pristine condition. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: Lovely stay. Conveniently located near Disneyland parks and a shuttle buss access is provided as well (but you can walk just a easily).   My only complain about the hotel is breakfast, which ends by 9am. So if you are thinking of sleeping in, you have to find breakfast elsewhere. And by 9am I really mean sharp at 9am! Staff were at the ready to clear the area before that.   Otherwise can't fault the hotel. Pool and jacuzzi is there but didn't have time to try. Microwave is available at the pantry and laundry room is available. Parking is also abundant so no fault there.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing me with your valuable feedback. I have personally spoken with our breakfast ladies to soften their approach if guest happen to be running  a bit late in the morning. Kind regards.

Summary: My family has returned to the Candy Cane in over and over again through the years.  You just can't beat the charming lay out, the cleanliness, the kind staff and the lovely breakfast.  It really is a treat to start your vacation day off with a seat by the pool while munching on a toasted bagel.  The grounds are beautifully landscaped and it is easy to forget that a busy road is so close by.  But thank goodness for that road, because Disneyland is within walking distance!  We will continue to use this as our "go to" hotel.  Our only issues were the loud air conditioning units and the lack of tea options at breakfast.
Manager Response: We do appreciate your being a repeat and loyal guest and please let us know when returning as we have several teas that we use for our Premium Rooms and would be delighted to provide to you. Thank you again for your kind comments and we look forward in seeing you again real soon!

Summary: I recently spent two nights in a premium room at Candy Cane Inn. I have to say this boutique hotel continues to shine.  With a premium rental, we got bathrobes, snacks and breakfast delivered to your room. It was worth it to NOT have to go get breakfast, etc.     Room was very clean, WiFi works terrific, TV was fine. I would like more channels but I can't complain since the CCI is less than a 10 minute slow walk to the DLR main gates.  And there is a complementary shuttle if you prefer to ride.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat Candy Cane Inn guest, we DO appreciate your business and comments for fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Kind regards!

Summary: After some terrible service from a different area hotel we had been frequenting for 25 years, we decided to try something new and chose Candy Cane based on it's reviews here.  It's a nice enough place. The rooms are very clean. The hotel is very quiet even though it's full. Our previous hotel was set up the same, but you could hear every sound, we haven't heard anything here. The beds are comfy and there's lots of hot water. The shuttle is great and runs every 30 min.  The were only a few small negatives which are that there is no microwave and the fridge is tiny (normal size for a hotel) and has no freezer in it. It also doesn't keep things very cold at all. (I think pop left in our room with the AC on was almost the same temperature as the pop in the fridge.) The pool is also
Manager Response: I am sorry to learn that your hotel of many years did not live up to your expectations and delighted that you allowed us to opportunity on your recent visit to the theme parks. We do have microwaves in our Premium Rooms and there is one available 24 hours per day in our Garden Room directly behind the front desk for guest convenience.  In regards to your fridge, there is a control and please feel free to contact the front desk as one of our gentlemen from engineering would be happy to assist. Please feel free to contact me when planning your next visit as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: This is a great hotel and within walking distance to Disneyland.   The rooms are very clean. The staff is friendly and everyone is helpful.   They have a really nice continental breakfast with all kinds of cereals, pastries, breads, and fruits.  It is also close to many restaurants.  There are 2 spas as well as a nice pool. This is the second time I have stayed there and will again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback it is most appreciated and we DO appreciate your business!

Summary Heading: Happy to return to the Candy Cane Inn
Summary: As you will read on many other reviews, this hotel has pretty much everything.  Great location, it is literally a 5-7 min walk from Disneyland (with a 5yo in tow, so not a power walk!) but we gratefully took the shuttle both to and from the park as we knew we would be on our feet all day.  The shuttle ran often and all day long except for one run around 8.15pm so the poor drivers could grab some dinner I assume! The rooms were clean with good soundproofing. We arrived after a long day to find out  our neighbour was a crying infant but once inside our room, we could hear nothing.  The only real noise came from when people were walking past our rooms in the morning.   Abundant breakfast (mainly bagels and toast, cereal and yogurt) and a lovely pool. We also appreciated the wading
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your feedback regarding your stay and observations about our property. Yes, the one time each day we do not run the shuttle is from the hotel at 8:00pm and back from the parks at 8:15pm for the evening driver’s dinner break. Please feel free to contact me personally when planning your return visit as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: One of the better small hotels in Anaheim!
Summary: We booked a night at the Candy Cane Inn based on the reviews we had read on Tripadvisor.  We were very pleasantly surprised with the entire operation.  Our room was clean and quiet, the staff friendly and helpful, and the grounds beautifully landscaped.  The main gate to Disneyland and DCA is within easy walking distance, although the Inn does have a shuttle.  We have stayed at a number of the smaller and medium-sized motel/hotels around the park, and we found this to be the nicest we've encountered.  While it doesn't have the amenities of a Disneyland Hotel or Grand Californian, it has what most of us want - a reliable and inexpensive place to stay while visiting the parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit to the theme parks. I am delighted to read you were pleasantly surprised with our overall operation and feel that we provide price value. Your comments are valuable feedback and most appreciated. Warm regards!

Summary: Hotel is next door to the entrance to Disneyland. But even so they have a very reliable shuttle that runs on the half hour, which is great for folks with small children, or those who were there to do the half marathon :) We requested a room next to our friends and they complied, no glitches there.  Breakfast is typical hotel fare served from 7-9am.  We did not use the pool but many people did and it looked very clean.  We were allowed 2 parking spots for a family of 4 which was very nice. Some hotels have actually started charging for parking even if you are staying there which is outrageous in my book. Beds were very comfortable, room came with a mini refrigerator, flat screen TV and free WIFI.  I would definitely stay here again, the price was right for Labor Day Weekend!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers, we DO appreciate your business. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: Our family has stayed here multiple times - it's our designated hotel for Disneyland. The rooms are nice, clean, and quiet. They have a nice pool and spa. Free breakfast in the morning is various muffins, danishes, toast, fruit, and waffles. We have taken their free shuttle to Disneyland and we have also walked since it's so close. Nice to have the option - walk there in the morning and shuttle home in the evening when your feet are tired.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being a loyal and repeat guest of the Candy Cane Inn, we certainly appreciate your business. I am delighted that we are your designated hotel at Disneyland. Please feel free to contact me personally as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations for future stays. Kind regards!

Summary: I recently stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for 3 nights when I went to Disney with my husband and 2 adult daughters. The deluxe room was more than adaquate. We found the shuttle service to be dependable but the walk back and forth to the parks was easy. The breakfast was very good and more than adequate, The carpetting looked little dirty and worn but I could not find any other complaints. The price was very reasonable and the staff was very helpful. It's in a good location and close to other restaurants and a convenience store. I would definitely recommend this hotel. If you chose and upper level room be aware there are no elevators. I very nice staff member saw my daughters and I struggling with luggage and was nice enough to help. I wish I would have got his name because he
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I have shared your comments with our housekeeping manager who will certainly address. Yes, we do work diligently in providing an exceptional product and our team is extremely hospitable, helpful and friendly. Please feel free at any time call the front desk and one of our team are more than delighted to assist with luggage. Kind regards!

Summary: Thankful for free shuttle, though parks within short walk, it gets to be a lot with a tired 5 yr old. Plenty of yogurt & fruit. I would suggest the trays offered for use in the rooms be kept in the serving area because some people are too dumb or lazy to read that info. I watched more than one person both mornings we were there drop and waste food because they overloaded the plates. Grandson loved his birthday surprise, it's just cookies but that his special milestone was acknowledged made his day! My iPad worked fine with the WiFi but it just takes time to connect.  We hung up do not disturb and they left our room alone as we wished. Key card took some getting used to, they don't work as others do, had to jiggle it sometimes but always got in. Beds were very comfortable, slept
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments and allowing us the opportunity to be of service on your recent visit. I am delighted that your grandson enjoyed the surprise that made him feel as special as he certainly must be! I personally and sincerely believe that if you take time to write a comment regarding your experience, it is respectful to acknowledge, investigate and rectify if necessary. Again, thank you and give my regards to your grandson!

Summary Heading: Some Pros, some Cons, "Average" all in all.
Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for three nights, on August 2012. We're a family of 4 (dad, mom, 11yo son, and 8yo daughter). The purpose of our trip was to visit Disneyland, of course.  Here's our pros and cons of this hotel. We haven't stayed to other hotels in the area.  Pros: - So close to Disneyland! - Shuttle to Disneyland is very efficient and convenient. - Grounds and rooms are well maintained. - Great value for the price, considering the rate includes the breakfast, the parking, and wifi. - All members of the staff we intereacted with were efficent and professional.  Cons: - Beds have definitely seen better days. - Very noisy A/C, right beside one of the bed. - I'd rate the breakfast "average" at most. - Very old "motel" design; don't put your expectation too high.  All
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. Guest’s comments enable us to evaluate and make changes that will better serve future travelers and we do appreciate you taking the time to share with us. Our mattresses are a double pillow top Serta Presidential Suite and while we receive many positive comments may be a bit softer than a traditional mattress.  I sincerely apologize that our American style motel with exterior corridors was not up to your expectations however, I do appreciate your positive comments. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: A Nice Place To Stay On A Budget
Summary: I only stayed one night and didn't take advantage of all the amenities, but I was fairly impressed with the hotel and its hospitality staff.  Bryan checked me in on Saturday, August 25th. He was very professional and efficient. I was given a room on the second floor, as had been my preference. The room was nicely furnished and clean.  There were only two minor issues. The first was with the coffee maker. A tube had been dislodged on one end. When I turned it on, the water was furiously bubbling in the chamber, but wasn't coming out of the machine. I opened up the lid, saw the problem, and fixed it. To their credit, this is something the housekeeping staff would not normally put on their checklist. The second concern was the weak WiFi. When I asked Erik, he said that the signal
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your recent visit and I DO appreciate your comments. We do listen to our guest and I am meeting with an internet company this week to discuss our hardware and system enhancements and I will certainly bring up your input. Thank you again for the comments and we do aspire to budget minded with a strong emphasis on exceptional quality and guest service. Kind regards!

Summary: If you are going to Disneyland this place is a must stay.  The price can't be beat and the rooms are comfortable and clean.  They offer pack and play's for ones with little ones and free breakfast!  When we stay we do the upgraded room where they deliver breakfast to you, its nothing fancy donuts, oatmeal, tea, coffee, bagels and the like, but to have it delivered to my room and not have to get up at 7am to fight the crowd it is awesome!  The rooms are also slightly larger they say and they are towards the back of the hotel.    We never heard  anyone else and slept comfortably.  The best part of course is the short walk to Disneyland.  We love loading up our stroller and walking.  Most of the time when we leave at night one or both of the kids are sleeping and there is nothing
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat Candy Cane Inn guest, we DO appreciate your business and comments shared with fellow travelers. Yes, our Premium Rooms do off those added amenities that many enjoy and once experience do reserve for future visits. Kind regards!

Summary: Let me start with a caveat:  This has always been one of my favorite places within walkable distance to Disneyland.  It's a pretty property with lovely grounds, usually has good deals (comparatively) and has perks that a lot of the other motel-style places nearby do not.  (free breakfast with quality food, free parking, a free Disneyland shuttle bus)  We've stayed there many times and have always been satisfied.  This time was a little different.  It seems like the place is going downhill ever so slightly--not enough for me to give up on it, but enough to keep an eye on it over the next few trips. I would give it a 3.5 if I could have...  The breakfast food is not quite as good as it has been in the past, the rooms (although they had a slight re-model a few years ago) are
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to be a loyal guest and I do appreciate your comments and I am sincerely sorry for any inconvenience you encountered. We continue to enhance the WIFI and have even a direct feed dedicated fiber line to our property and are currently working with iBAHN to further improve connectivity. In regards to our Expanded Continental Breakfast we have not changed any purveyors and continue to receive fresh fruits and baked goods daily.  Again please feel free to contact when you are returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations and have the internet hardware checked.  Kind regards!

Summary: We just booked our third stay at the Candy Cane Inn for October!  We have stayed at numerous hotels near Disneyland and never stayed at the Candy Cane Inn until this March.  The hotel and grounds are always clean and well maintained. The rooms are comfortable and the AC is really quiet.  The shuttle is convenient, but not necessary because the hotel is really close to the main entrance.  The breakfast area is well stocked with great choices and plenty of seating around the pool. Great value! This is definitely our new favorite place to stay in Anaheim!
Manager Response: Thank you for booking your repeat visit and please feel free to contact me personally if I may be of further assistance for rates and reservations in the future as it would be my pleasure. Warm regards!

Summary: 3 minute walk to Disney - though if you really feel that's too far, there is a free shuttle revelry 15 minutes or so! Stayed for 4 days in August. Rooms were very clean, complete with fridge and safe. Continental breakfast was as expected and served daily by the pool. Very nice, family orientated environment. There is even a splash pool for toddlers separate from the main pool. Loved it and wish we'd booked it the second time around!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Yes, the little ones enjoy the kiddie pool and it is heated year around. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great rooms, service, location and hospitality
Summary: My family and I have been staying at the Candy Cane Inn for at least 12 years and it keeps getting better and better.  Our last stay found an overbooking situation (due to a guest illness). Even though it was not their fault, the General Manager(Jeff) and the Reservations Supervisor (Robert) went above and beyond to make sure we had a comfortable room and that the next day at Disneyland was memorable.  The rooms are always comfortable and tastefully decorated, the grounds are always tropical and spotless, and it is filled with happy families and employees who seem to really care for everyone who stays there.  What could have turned out as a delicate situation turned into yet another wonderful experience with the Candy Cane Inn, and they have earned guests for life.
Manager Response: I personally and sincerely appreciate your kind comments and understanding of the unfortunate situation that presented itself. Being in the customer service industry we certainly do not come to work every day thinking how we can inconvenience one of our most valuable assets….our guests! It was absolutely wonderful dealing with a caring person, such as yourself and when you even inquired about the other guest was heartwarming to me. THANK YOU so very much for being such a thoughtful human being! Warm regards!

Summary: We stayed at the inn for 1 week the beginning of August and all I can say is WOW!  The inn itself is kept so clean and the foilage is just beautiful.  We stayed in the Premier room and found the room large and VERY CLEAN, loved the idea of the sink outside of the bathroom as it made it easier to get ready in the am for trips to Disney and sightseeing.  I can't say enough about all the staff we met as they all greeted us with smiles and always replied on our "good mornings etc".  We thought because we were so close that we would never use the shuttle but were we wrong.....it was so nice after a long day at the park to hop on the shuttle and only walk from the front of the inn to the back.  My husband and son used the pool and loved it, I stayed on the patio watching.   Used the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your wonderful comments regarding your visit. The entire team appreciates the remarks and sincerely cares about the guests of the hotel. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: Wow, this place was an awesome find for a quick stop in Disneyland while driving up the coast. They have 24 hour check in so we came by after the park closed. Our room was right by the entrance driveway, which is where the shuttle waits in the morning, so we could hop on the shuttle quite easily and quickly.  The bed was extremely comfortable, and room was adorable with bright colors and a clean, spacious bathroom. Breakfast is complimentary, and was also super convenient and abundant - I usually had a bagel with orange juice and coffee, but they also offered large baskets  pastries, muffins, and little mini donuts, cereals and fruits, yogurt, etc.  Breakfast got crowded but it was just a quick fix.  Shuttle was extremely useful. It runs a bit off schedule once the parks closes
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity on your trip up the coast! Yes, we aspire to deliver exceptional service while providing a quality experience being mindful of family travelers on a budget. Cars Land has been a wonderful addition to the theme parks and being well received by all that attend. Again, we appreciate your business and look forward in seeing you again should your travels bring you back through Anaheim. Warm Regards!

Summary Heading: Hard to beat this moderately priced hotel
Summary: I agree with the positive reviews of this hotel. It's clean, comfortable and it's an easy walk to Disneyland. The pool area is lovely. Some reviewers have mentioned that this is more of a motel and they are right---the doors open to the outside where the cars are parked. But this is no cut rate fleabag. It's as comfortable as any other 3-star.  Was there some noise? A little, mostly the sounds of excited little feet as they got ready to go to Disneyland.   I had two minor complaints: the breakfast spread had no proteins,which some of us need to start our day (hard boiled eggs would have been a welcome sight); and the carpet in our room had stains that made it appear dirty.  All in all, it was a keeper. I would stay here again and I'd recommend it to others.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at our Inn and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We appreciate the feedback and certainly listen to our guests and make necessary changes and improvements that will benefit future guests. Kind regards!

Summary: This is our 3rd trip to candy cane and again not disappointed.  This place truly grows on you. Not the biggest but I love the fact its a family run hotel slap bang in the middle of Disney.  You can easily walk there or take free shuttle.  Love the breakfast too.  My only complaint this time was parking but I think the hotel was at its busiest for the time of year we went.  Will return for sure
Manager Response: We certainly appreciate your “coming back” and please feel free to contact me personally for rates and reservations on your next visit. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Wasn't quite as good as expected for #2 property...
Summary: We're a family of seven and that makes finding a room/suite big enough for all of us difficult for our Disney trips, and normally we stay within walking distance farther north up Harbor Blvd.(with the big drawback of only having one bathroom).  So, we wanted to try something new and chose the Candy Cane Inn due its high rating here, despite the need for two rooms and extra expense.   My one and only real complaint was with the service to our rooms.  Our first day in the park was Sunday and we came back about 3:30 pm for a nap and swim only to find that the cleaning staff had not yet made up our rooms!  Shortly they came by wanting to clean and we asked they come back in a few hours - to which the reply was "4:30?"  Don't know if there was a language barrier, but more than likely
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your taking time to share your experience as we certainly used points for training. We as many hotels around the world attempt to be ecologically friendly and not change all bed linens daily as in our own homes. This is not merely for cost savings and I apologize for the misunderstanding. In regards for having your room serviced earlier it is our pleasure to clean early (or a specified time) if you would like and please let the front desk know this. The housekeepers are a great team of wonderful people and would never want to intently not service a guestroom. It may seem like a good idea to err on one side or another, but if someone woke a sleeping baby…that was not such a good decision. Please, do not misunderstand as I DO NOT take guest’s comments lightly and your feedback has been very good and we DO appreciate it. Please contact me when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations and I WILL honor your Rewards Certificate. Kind Regards!

Summary: Just got back from our stay in Anahiem. The Candy Cane Lane was the perfect place to stay. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and beds were very comfey. So convient if your planning on a visit to Disney. Shuttle service is the best!!  We never had to get in our car or pay for parking at Disney!  One draw back is their parking, very small area. Over all we'd definately stay here again!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Third stay this year, some issues
Summary: Our first stay over New Years was great. Clean, spacious room with an incredibly easy walk to Disneyland. We returned in March and brought another family along for their first stay. While we both had the same category room, ours was smaller and in worse shape than theirs. Wifi worked great in their room also, very spotty in ours. We also had to have our tub faucit replaced, which was done very quickly.  We are now on the first night of our third stay, and the room is not even in as good of shape as our last room. The most notable is the extremely dirty carpet, the beds aren't nearly as comfortable as our previous stays, the bathroom is musty/moldy smelling and the tub doesn't drain well. I'm sure the issues that can be taken care of will be when the staff is notified in the
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat guest and I want to personally apologize that we have not lived up to your expectations on this trip. We do appreciate when guests bring items to our attention and want to do all that we can to rectify so your stay is most enjoyable. Again, it was nice emailing you and speaking with your other members of your party and have a delightful day. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Only place to stay when going to Disneyland.
Summary: We have been staying here for 12 years and stayed at a few others only to return to the candy cane inn they offer a lot for the money and if you book your trip early you get the best rates unless its peek season then its fair for what you get  Free parking yes some places charge you to park and free shuttle even though its a very short walk. Breakfast included all you can eat. It might not offer what some large hotels offer but its not a large hotel it the candy cane inn and that what we love about it.
Manager Response: We certainly thank you for staying with us and being a loyal and repeat Candy Cane Inn guest, we DO appreciate your business. Yes, we do have many complimentary features such as, Parking, WiFi, Expanded Continental Breakfast, Our Exclusive Shuttle and NO resort or convenience fees. Kind regards!

Summary: I stayed here with my 8yo and 10yo daughters for 3 nights in July and were happy with the place overall.    I had read some reviews complaining that the rooms are really small so was pleasantly surprised to find our room quite a decent size - not huge but certainly not tiny (other than the bathroom which was a bit on the small side).  The room was comfortable for 3 of us and had everything we needed.    I would note a few things though - the ventilation is not great so we kept the A/C on all night just to get some air circulating and the room we had was a bit dark.  Also, many of the rooms are on the 2nd floor with no lift so getting our luggage up the flight of stairs was ok but a bit of a struggle.  The location was great - only a 10 minute level walk to Disneyland.  The hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. Yes, this time of year with higher temperatures and humidity it is nice to sleep with the A/C on. In regards to your comment about luggage please feel free to call the front desk and one of team members would be delighted to assist. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Nice all around but a little noisy.
Summary: As the reviews have said, this hotel was definately pleasant and clean. We paid for the premium room ( quite a bit more - 200 a night) and enjoyed the few special touches but not really worth the extra money. The shuttle was very convenient as was the location. We really didn't need a car at all if we were just there for Disneyland. Lots of places to eat nearby. Breakfast was fair and plenty of it. There is some noise problems even though we were all the way in the back. We could hear people coming and going late and early. Beds are comfortable but not as nice as other comparable hotels. When you add up the cost of the free amenities like parking, wifi, breakfast, etc. This hotel compares pretty well with maybe a three star. The bedspreads and bathrooms seriously need updating.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am very sorry about your feelings of being a little noisy and even though we are a family hotel with many excited children everyone certainly appreciates the consideration of others late in the evening and early mornings. In regards to no drinks on the bus this has been done for the safety and genuine care and concern of ALL our guests. In the event of a sudden stop or turn that could end up with hot drinks being spilled and burning a guest or having to return to the hotel and change your clothes because a drink being spilled on you.  We do ask for your understanding and we apologize in advance for any inconvenience. Kind regards.

Summary: Our family has been going to Disneyland in August for my daughters birthday the past 4 years.  We normally stay at the Howard Johnson to take advantage of the kids water play area, but this year decided to change it up.  We stayed in room 104, right near the shuttle stop which was quite convenient since we could see when the shuttle had arrived.  The room itself was very clean, had nice amenities and was very easy to cool down quickly.  I particularly liked the individual cup coffee maker which used disposable coffee filter bags.  The room was on the smaller size but our family of 4 was comfortable enough in the time we spent there.  Upon our arrival, we found a birthday card for my daughter with a bag of assorted cookies.  We thought that was a nice touch!  We had no problem
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to be of service on your recent visit to celebrate your daughter’s birthday at Disneyland. I am delighted that she enjoyed the card and cookies, it’s our pleasure to help make her day more special. Please feel free to contact me personally should you be returning next year as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: I've written quite a lot of other reviews and never disagreed with other reviewers as much as with the Candy Cane Inn.  One recent reviewer expressed concern that others might find out about this special place.  Fear not my friend.  To be fair, the location is fabulous for Disney.  There's a decent shop next door for "supplies" and one road away a number of restaurants.  As for the hotel.  I'm currently staying in it.  I've just completed my first night.  Sadly I'm here for another two.  It is a motel.  The rooms are effectively on three sides of a quadrangle.  You drive in through the fourth side. - where you will find reception.   Your room door and window both face into the quadrangle.  What this means is that depending on how "deep" in to this quadrangle your room is, every
Manager Response: I sincerely apologize that we did not live up to your expectations being an American motel with exterior corridors and something you possibly are unaccustomed to. I want you to know that we DO care and listen to all our guests regarding their visit and that is why to be honest, I am a bit perplexed. I happened to walk up to the desk this morning and greet you (not knowing who you were) as you were checking out and you were quite pleasant and made no mention of your displeasure when the agent asked how your stay was. Again, we certainly know that our business (as any other) from time to time may have room for improvement and do welcome the opportunity to address the situation in a proactive manner so our guest enjoys the remainder of their stay. Kind regards.

Summary Heading: Shhhh...Candy Cane is MY secret place!
Summary: I've been staying at the Candy Cane Inn for at least 15 years, at least once a year!  My next trip is booked this coming September!  They are always so nice, accommodating, friendly and just plain WELCOMING!  The beds are comfy, and even with all the excitement of being at Disneyland, I always get a good night's sleep!  Just want to say great job, and I hope you don't get so popular that I can't get a room!  See you in September...
Manager Response: We certainly appreciate your being another loyal member of the Candy Cane Inn family. Thank you for you past business and look forward in seeing you in September! Warm regards!

Summary: Room and grounds were clean and well kept.  The beds were confortable and there was plenty of room.  Location is ideal for Disney.  They have a bus, but we walked every day.  Parking spaces are narrow but free.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Kind regards!

Summary: My family and I have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn at least 8 times over the years and are planning a return visit in a few months (without the grandkids!). The only problem we have ever experienced was during last month's stay (July 2012). We had booked two deluxe rooms and in our son's room there were dozens of little mosquitos! Our son had his two little ones and this was NOT acceptable. We called the front desk and the manager came down in less than 3 minutes (GREAT response time) and promised us it would be taken care of an a "green" manner. We went back to Disneyland and when we got back no more mosquitos AND no smell. Excellent service, some of the cleanest rooms we've ever encountered and a pretty nice offering of a free continental breakfast. (Breakfast during our stay
Manager Response: Thank you for being a Candy Cane Inn repeat guest and know that we DO appreciate your business and loyalty! Again, we are very sorry for the mosquitoes and with the vegetation around the property and throughout the Anaheim Resort Area it can become moist. Please feel free to contact me personally when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: A Place Like This is Why I Love TripAdvisor
Summary: I would never have found the Candy Cane Inn if not for this site. Ranking #2 and being within walking distance to Disneyland, and being a lot cheaper than others, made this an easy decision.  And we were not disappointed. The motel grounds are impeccable, as are the rooms. The staff is also incredibly helpful and pleasant. It was just an all-around good experience. In fact, everyone in our party, we had two rooms (which the staff conveniently placed together, despite us being a relatively late booking), raved about the pillows and how absolutely soft and comfortable they were.  I, though, loved the fact that they run their own shuttle bus to Disney. A lot of the other motels around the area mention shuttle buses but, in actuality, it is the Anaheim shuttle (which you need to pay
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers and staying with us based on other reviews. We do believe in running a very clean, serene property and having an emphasis on friendly service.  Yes, our Exclusive Complimentary Shuttle along with NO parking fees is clearly a benefit for economical travelers. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great property in a great location
Summary: Free parking, free wifi, and free breakfast just a short 5 minute walk from the park entrance.  They offer a free exclusive shuttle just for the hotel but we only rode it once because it was just that close to walk.Many hotels right by Disneyland nickle and dime you with parking or resort fees and some dont provide adequite parking, not at the Candy Cane Inn.  It was a good value for the money.Also the front desk found out we were celbrating my daughters birthday and when we returned from the park there was a personalized card for her with fresh baked cookies.  Great pool area and right next door to a 7-11 and Subway if you need to get something to take to the park at non park prices.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing the opportunity on your recent visit to the Theme Parks. Your comments regarding all of our FREE amenities is certainly correct as we DO NOT believe it is in the best interest of our guests to nickel and dime them with additional fees. I am delighted that your daughter received her cookies and hope her birthday was magical! Warm regards.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel for Disneyland trip
Summary: We recently stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland with our 2 small children.  My expectations weren't that high based on the great rate that we received on a deluxe room.  We were pleasantly surprised!  The rooms were clean and spacious for a small hotel.  The staff was friendly.  The walk to Disney was about 10 minutes.  The hotel provided a free shuttle service, but for us, it was not needed.  The only thing that I would change is the free breakfast.  It was all carbs.  It could use some fruit and some protein choices, but it was included with the room, so we can't complain.  We will return again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with and I am delighted that we exceeded your expectations.  In regards to your comment on our Expanded Continental Breakfast, I am sincerely sorry as we do provide three fresh fruits and yogurt and continue to look at other workable options given the number of guests. Kind regards!

Summary: Yep, we're coming back to the Candy Cane again (our 7th stay, which says it all) in 2013.  Great location, super complimentary breakfast, excellent rooms, and legendary American service, even when we checked in well after midnight after landing from Hawaii. To try and balance our review we've tried to think of something to criticise, but we've never had cause to complain, and being English, believe me we're fussy. We could say that we prefer the ground floor as we then don't have to carry our luggage upstairs - but then the upstairs rooms are quieter...Since discovering the Candy Cane in 1999 we haven't (and won't!) stay anywhere else for our Disneyland visits.  But please don't make your reservation until we have -  we don't want to miss out!
Manager Response: We are looking forward in seeing you once again and certainly thank you for being a loyal Candy Cane Inn repeat guest! Feel free to contact me personally as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations for your upcoming trip in 2013. Warm regards!

Summary: Our recent stay at the Candy Cane was terrific in every way.  The grounds were beautiful and exceptionally well kept.  The hotel felt far removed from the noise and traffic of the area even though it's a very walkable distance to Disneyland and many restaurants and other business.  The room (Room 242-premium) was quite spacious for 4 of us--all adults--and was very clean.  The beds were so comfortable.  We really enjoyed the continental breakfast.  The premium room allowed us to order whatever we wanted from the menu given to us each night, and breakfast was delivered to our room at the time of our choice. We appreciated this convenience.  We were thankful for the shuttle service more than once when our feet couldn't move another step.  The drivers were always so nice, and even
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your kind comments and I know in my heart that our entire team here at the Candy Cane Inn have the same level of care and concern for our guests that I do! Warm Regards!

Summary: I was recently at the Candy Cane Inn this past week with friends and staying there for my second visit.  We love the Candy Cane Inn for the great value, CAA discount, great breakfast, quick walk to the parks and the shuttle bus if too tired, great location to the parks and to grab a quick dinner at the local restaurants .  The pool is great for a break from the hot day at the parks.   The staff is friendly and helpful and a special thank you to Byran at the front desk!   Looking forward to returning again soon!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat guest and know that we appreciate your business and taking time to share your comments with fellow TripAdvisor Travelers. I will share your comments with the team and with Bryan at our front desk as they are great with our guests. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Overall excellent but beware no bed for 5th person
Summary: Booked this hotel as would take family of 5 (us and our three children) in a superior room, and on the back of reviews and location. On arrival found superior room not big enough for rollaway so had to pay extra for larger deluxe room - $30 extra per night but did throw in rollaway. With the upgrade get room service breakfast which was a bonus, room lovely, good location and shuttle helps, lovely breakfast and pool area great. Aside from hiccup at arrival everythimg else was great and would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted that our team was able to rectify the initial hiccup satisfactorily. I am sincerely apologetic if there was miscommunication regarding the bedding of the room and will use this situation for training in clarity and thank you for bringing to our attention. Should you be returning please feel free to contact me personally for rates and reservations as it would be my pleasure to assist. Kind regards!

Summary: This hotel is about 10 minutes walking distance to the front gate of Disneyland if you have small children with you. The rooms are not as large as some newer hotels, but they are adequate if your main goal is to visit the parks. The rooms were clean and functional and the price was better than many of the surrounding properties. There are numerous restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.   If I had to make suggestions I would have two. One would be to offer some more healthy options for breakfast. While the selection of carbohydrate heavy foods was extensive, there were few options other than apples and bananas for those not wanting starchy breakfast foods. The dining area around the pool was unique and quite enjoyable for the start to the mornings.  My second opinion
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. We certainly listen to our guests and added yogurt with our Expanded Continental Breakfast for another protein source and continue to look at other options. Yes, pack and plays have worked well based on the size of our guestrooms and I am sincerely sorry for any inconvenience this caused you and your baby. Our professional pool service company and our in-house maintenance team check and maintain chlorine levels daily to ensure proper levels and comfort ability. Kind regards!

Summary: The Candy Cane Inn is a fantastic place for a family visiting Disneyland & California Adventure to stay.  The free shuttle to/from the park runs precisely on time but the close proximity of the inn to the parks means that your family can easily walk the 1/2 mile should you miss the shuttle.  Internet connectivity could be a little spotty at times and the continental breakfast won't have you writing a glowing review but both work for what you'll need and best of all is they are free.  So you can update relatives on the days activity via the WiFi and the breakfast will mean you and your family can have something in your belly before heading to the park.  Check In / Out is done via the fast & friendly staff at the front and the room was spotless each day when we come back.  If your
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback as we do appreciate your taking time to share. We have continually monitored our WiFi system and in November of last year had a direct fiber lead installed into the hotel which has greatly improved our WiFi. We continue to evaluate system improvements in our ever changing technological environment and will make necessary changes.
