Our team of service professionals truly care about the property, our guests and this is represented in how they act and perform. Thank you again for making our Inn your home away from home and I am delighted that you and your family feel "comfortable" here, that is very important to me. Kind regards!

Summary: This is the only hotel we will stay at when we visit Disneyland.  We've tried a few others in the area, but nothing can compare to the Candy Cane Inn for the value.  What I like best is the location and that fact that the property/rooms are kept pristine.  The breakfast is great, too.  I highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to stay with us and sharing your feedback to fellow travelers on TripAdvisor. We do appreciate your comments and strive to keep our property in a pristine manner at all times. Please feel free to contact me directly when returning as it would be my pleasure in assisting with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: My co-worker and I came down for the weekend to visit Disneyland. The hotel location is great! Completely within walking distance. The front desk staff were very supportive of our early arrival and made a point to get us a room so we could head into the park. We were on the first floor, toward the front of the property. Didn't hear any of the S. Harbor Blvd. noise. The grounds are beautifully maintained. Used the hot tub on one night, no one else around. There are two tubs and a heated pool. Great for soaking those tired tootsies!  The only thing I can find to "mention", not complain about is that the complimentary breakfast is served from 7-9am. Now, I understand that the early times are for the early rising families with kids anxious to get into the park, but there are some of
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and allowing us to be of service on your recent visit. I appreciate your kind comments regarding the cleanliness, maintenance and upkeep of our property as well as service provided by the team. Yes, our pool, spa and kiddie pool are heated year around for those "tired tootsies" and am delighted that you enjoyed. We do listen to our guests and take their feedback very seriously and work to enhance the quality of product and service. Kind regards!

Summary: The Candy Cane Inn exceeded my expectations from the time I checked in unit the time I checked out.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating, the breakfast by the pool was very nice, the free shuttle toDisneyland was great, the heated pool was fantastic and the beds were very comfortalbe. I was there with my 7 year old and 8 month old for three nights.  I had been checked into a second floor room and with there being no elevator I was getting really tired of hauling my stroller and baby up and down the stairs.  I called the second day and asked to be moved to a main floor room.  The staff was great!  I just packed my stuff and went to the pool with the kids while they moved our stuff downstairs for us. We also really enjoyed having the free shuttle to Disney.  We used the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience with fellow travelers. I am delighted that your room move was handled with ease making it easier to navigate with two children. We do appreciate your business and feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance with future rates or reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: I have stayed at the Candy Cane so many times I can't count. I was happy with our rooms, the location, the breakfast and for the most part the service. When I booked the two rooms, they gave me the AAA discount and said to bring the card. When I arrived, a young lady with very short hair, brusquely told me that CCI no longer takes AAA and I would have to pay a higher price than quoted. When my relatives arrived for their room, they told me that they got the AAA discount. So I went to the office and saw a man who was very helpful and friendly. He said that she had made a mistake and that AAA was only unavailable one night of my reservation, due to a conference being in town. He changed it and was very helpful. However, I see on another review from mid-January, someone else had
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Hard to beat for the money
Summary: Stayed here one night to include a Disneyland trip.  Everything was great and I can't say enough for the dollar value.  Free WiFi that worked great and easy to connect.  Free parking and shuttle service to Disney.  The room we had was situated on the ground level and was close to a busy road.  But it wasn't bad and never woke me up.  We basically just slept here and didn't use the pool.  I did check out the pool and it looked nice just didn't have time.  The buffet was just ok but not horrible.  Some of the pastries did not seem to fresh and there was not much room inside.  But this is being a little picky, overall it was a great stay and I would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. All of our pastries and bagels are delivered fresh seven days per week however I have shared your comments with our vendors as we take pride in our Expanded Continental Breakfast. Again, we appreciate your business and feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance on your next visit. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Candy cane inn beats Disney hotels by afar!
Summary: We are still at the Inn and leaving tomorrow. i wish we could extend our stay! We used to stay at the grand Calif but was talked into staying here by friends who swear by this place. I was skeptical at first ( even almost cancelled to book at the grand) but promised that I'd give it a shot. Candy cane is amazing. The staff (esp James) were accommodating as were the drivers. Breakfast was good and not sure why some reviews were complaining. They offer fresh fruit,yogurt,bagels etc...all which one usually eats in the morning. The rooms were clean and house cleaning was spot on. We didn't watch tv one bit but who cares that they weren't flat screen. The walk to Disney wasn't bad but we did take advantage of the shuttle which was very precise.  The two things that left a negative
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and sharing your feedback with fellow travelers. It was nice speaking with you today and I apologize again for the less than hospitabal service your received when simply trying to discard a bag trash. I for one applaud you for bringing to the desk rather than simply placing on the sidewalk outside your door or next to a trash container as this attracts insects. We are image sensitive and care about the beauty and ambiance of our property and appreciate your kind comments regarding housekeeping, breakfast and our team. Please feel free to contact me directly when you are returning this spring as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations.

Summary Heading: Excellent location for Disney, incredible bang for the buck
Summary: I choose the hotel based on Travel Advisor and I'm very pride I did. The hotel is conveniently located for visiting Disneyland and California Adventure, completely family friendly (I stayed with my wife an 11 and 5 year old kids) . The rooms are excellent, super comfortable bedrooms and nice HD TV. The breakfast is amazingly complete and fresh, and you can enjoy it just beside the swimming pool. The only thing I can point out, the only, is the access to internet. The signal was excellent, but for some reason my laptop couldn’t connect. Having said so, I stayed in two other hotels and have exactly the same problem (common denominator of hotel providing internet with cheap, unsecured routers). I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Disney with family.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback and sharing your thoughts with fellow travelers. We do pride ourselves in maintaining a very clean and comfortable property while keeping in mind cost constraints of many travelers in today's economy. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance with future rate or reservation information as it would be my pleasure to assist.

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn 2 years ago and enjoyed the same excellent customer service this month. The park is adjacent to Disneyland yet quiet. The best things about the Inn are the complimentary shuttle, free parking, pool, welcome basket, turn down service, in room breakfast, movie library, micro/ fridge, early check-in, and quick response to service needs. I would encourage guests to pay the few extra dollars for the "premium" room amenities (details are available on the website).  A few simple things the hotel could do to create a more comfortable atmosphere include addition of room slippers, put the bathroom fan and light switch on different switches (it is really loud), upgrade towels to larger size, and replace clothes hangers with ones that visitors can remove from
Manager Response: Thank you so much for continuing to stay with us and providing fellow travelers with your comments. We appreciate loyal return guests and your valuble comments allow us to review and improve our product and service. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance on rates or reservations on your next trip. Kind regards!

Summary: We live in San Diego and decided to take the kids to a trip to Disneyland for two days so instead of driving back and forth from Anaheim to San Diego we decided to rent out a room.  We booked Candy Cane Inn based on the reviews here but were sadly disappointed.  The only good thing I can say about this place is the location and you will pay for that luxury based on the nightly price for a room but from there on it goes downhill.  I reserved a "premium room" and with that came the ability to have breakfast delivered to your room every morning which one day they never even brought to us.  You also get to choose a movie to rent but their selection is very limited and 90% of their stock is in vhs.  The matresses were really old that you felt you would almost fall off the bed if you
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and while we did not live up to your expectations we certainly take your comments seriously. I have attempted to reach out to you with no response to my email, however, I wanted to respond to this review in a timely manner as we DO care and listen to all of our guests. With limited information and not knowing dates of stay we can only generalize and that too can be extremely helpful in our ongoing training. In regards to our Mattresses, I can only apologize that you did not enjoy, however, we have received overwhelming positive comments on our Serta Double Pillow Top Presidential Mattresses that are less than three years old. Our library of children and family movies is something we continually update and while yes I agree many are VHS our players are both VHS and DVD players for convenience of our library as well as if a guest wants to bring from home. Thank you again for your feedback, it assists us in continuing to improve.

Summary: We have been coming here for years.  Its clean, the location perfect, friendly, helpful staff, free shuttle service to Disneyland, pools, free breakfast and other amenities all attract our family to the Candy Cane Inn.  My daughter loves the free candycanes too :)We have absolutely no complaints, and recoomend this place to friends and family. Thank you Jeff, you staff are obviously hand picked and they all do an outstanding job.
Manager Response: Reading your comments reiterates the pride that my Staff and I have working at the Candy Cane Inn.  We believe in ensuring the best of service and cleanliness for all our guests.  We know that you have many hotels to choose from, but thank you for being loyal Candy Cane Inn guests!  The next time you are back to our hotel be sure to ask our Front Desk for one of our famous Candy Cane Inn pens that smell like peppermint!  Hope to have you back again soon!  Warm regards.

Summary Heading: We keep coming back and haven't been disappointed
Summary: We have stayed here many times during the last 8 years. We have tried other places and have been disappointed in them each time and then are upset with ourselves for not staying at the Candy Cane Inn. We will be back many more times in the future.   We did have issue with the wireless internet during our most recent visit which was during the Christmas holidays. It wouldn't connect at any time. We were told that there were issues with the weather, but when the weather was fine, we still couldn't connect. It was a bit of an issue for us.  Everything else at the hotel was excellent! The room was cleaned well daily, although it was cleaned late on Dec. 23rd. We just let the front desk know when we were leaving for the park after that and it was cleaned immediately. The entire staff
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and being a loyal Candy Cane Inn repeat guest. I do thank you for your comments as this feedback assists us in our striving to continue and give the utmost of product and service to our guests. I am delighted that your young ladies are enjoying the Candy Cane Mugs that were in our holiday bag of goodies and you must return next year for the 2011 ornament. Kind regards!

Summary: It has clean bedrooms, that could be larger, in a beautiful surround garden. The place is quiet, even being very near of disneyland, that you can go walking or by their shuttle (always in time). The service is very sympathetic with cookies in the first day and candies the others days delivered to the room. The breakfast is also very good.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us!  I am happy to read that you enjoyed the features and amenities of our Premium room, as well as our complimentary hotel operated shuttle, and complimentary expanded continental breakfast.  Please be sure to contact me if you are in need of assistance with reservations.

Summary Heading: I was happy, and now I am disappointed.
Summary: After a high recommendation from a family who has stayed at The Candy Cane for two visits to Disneyland, and after extensive hotel research and reviews, I called to get a rate quote from the Candy Cane Inn. I was pleasantly happy to hear that I would get a AAA discount, and decided to sleep on my decision before booking.  After making my final decision to book the room for our family trip to Disneyland, I made a phone call to make a reservation. I was completely taken aback by the abruptness of the agent I spoke with on the phone. She was rude, discourteous, and did not honor the AAA rate that I was quoted just 2 days ago. I am very displeased at this point, and, now I am not sure if I will be booking a room with the Candy Cane Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for responding to my email and it was nice speaking with you regarding your frustration and the varied information you received regarding AAA discounts. I once again sincerely apologize for the agent with whom you spoke with and this has been addressed. While I am happy that this has been worked out and you will be staying with us, I am deeply sorry that it took this course of action to address. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: FANTASTIC PLACE - RIGHT NEXT TO DISNEY!!
Summary: We stayed 24th Dec - 1st Jan and what a great place to stay! Grounds we're kept immaculate, breakfast was good just what you need for a start to the day. We had a premium room on the 2nd floor and I had emailed to say could we have a view of he disney fireworks, which the manager did for us, so thank you for that.   Its SO close to the Disney parks, walking takes about 8-10 from door to entrance and thats not speedy walking, didnt use the shuttle bus as didnt feel the need.  Disney parks were SOOOO crowded which you will get this time of year, they need to do front of line passes like universal as its so much better, we went to universal studios twice because of the front of line passes, we got on everything straight away!   The room itself was spotless everyday, so thank you to
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us!  I am glad to read that you enjoyed the holiday amenity we left you.  Also, thank you for sharing your comments with the Trip Advisor Community.  Many of our guests love our exclusive shuttle to Disneyland, but like you, many also choose to walk the 250 yards from our hotel to the entrance of the Disney parks.  When you are ready to book your next trip to Disneyland, please feel free to contact me personally.

Summary: This is a good place for a trip to Disneyland. Good price at $95.00. We were given free early check in at 7am and late check out at 2:45. A normal hotel room but clean and enough room. Good free breakfast (though crowded) and a nice small pool and hot tub. Staff is accomodating. Lots of families. Good size because not too big and next to a market and 7 11. A ten minute walk to Disneyland or a shuttle every half hour. Restaurants a block away in GardenMall.  Bar Louis and McCormick Shmick were good. We will use it again if we return to Disneyland.
Manager Response: I am happy to learn that you enjoyed the proximity of the Candy Cane Inn to locations such as Disneyland, Anaheim GardenWalk, and 7-11.  We are also just 200 yards away from the Anaheim Convention Center.  Next time your travels bring you to the Anaheim area, please contact me for assistance with your reservations.

Summary Heading: Very nice for the price, will stay again, wife even liked it, great location
Summary: We stayed 3 nights during the Christmas holiday season in the standard (smallest) room. Glad we stayed here. We usually stay in more expensive hotels, but we wanted to be in walking distance to take our 2 year old back from Disney for afternoon naps, and the Disney hotels are really very expensive for the holidays, and 2 of 3 are not really much closer to the park entrance.  The Candy Cane Inn was nicer looking than I expected, it was clean, and the staff was very helpful. We wanted to extend our reservation to arrive a day earlier but they were full due to the holiday. I was very pleased that they offered to call me if there was a cancellation. In a few hours, we had the extra day.  The continental breakfast is great, as good as any I have been to, (coffee, hot chocolate,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us!  I was excited to read about our much you enjoyed your stay and how attentive our Staff was.  We at the Candy Cane Inn pride ourselves on the comfort of our rooms and the quality service we provide.  Yes, it is true we may not be a Ritz-Carlton, but we are proud of the features, amenities, and services we provide at our hotel for our guests.  Based on your comments, you were too.  Thanks again for sharing and please do not hesitate to contact me if you are back in the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: If you depend and expect wireless internet don't stay at Candy Cane
Summary: W stayed at CCI for 6 days and overall our stay was enjoyable due mostly to location and value.  BUT if you depend on your internet when you travel DO NOT stay there.  I received about 5 different excuses for reasons why the wireless was down........a recent storm has affected our service.   Hello,  this is LA.  I'm sure nearby hotels are up and running by now.   The only way to connect was right next to front office or sitting in the breakfast area..     Would I stay there again??????  only if I had a written guarantee that the iternet service works all the way back to the Premium Rooms or get a decent discount/refund  back.
Manager Response: Thank for you sharing your feedback.  I am sorry to hear that you had issues with our internet access.  Based on your feedback, I have personally contacted our internet service provider and shared your frustration with them.  They did inform me that due to the heavy rains leading up to your stay, their equipment has been affected.  To ensure internet issues are minimized, they upgraded our equipment and a technician will be onsite to ensure everything is in working order.  I would like to ask for an opportunity to share with you an experience more typical of the Candy Cane Inn.  Please contact me when you plan to come back to the area.

Summary Heading: Candy Cane is convenient, clean, inexpensive and comfortable.
Summary: We arrived at the CCI on December 29 for a 4 night stay.  We're a family of four with two children under the age of 10.  Our main purpose for this trip was to go to Disneyland, and there couldn't be a more convenient way to get there (other than paying $500+ per night at the Disneyland Hotel).  It was a 10 minute walk (exactly) from the property to the bag check at the Disneyland Resort.  CCI is on the same side of the street as Disneyland so there are no busy intersections to cross.  There was also shuttle service (large bus) but we never used it.  I did notice that it arrived and departed on time, though.  The rooms was spacious for us.  Two queen beds on the second floor near the front of the property.  Very close to the pool/lobby and I didn't notice any noise from outside.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments regarding your stay.  From what I read, it looks like you all had a good time.  I did read your comment regarding ESPN and I want to assure you that I will take your feedback into consideration.  Again, thank you for sharing with the Trip Advisor Community and I look forward to seeing you again soon at the Candy Cane Inn.

Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Candy Cane Inn in December. It was our first trip to Disneyland and we weren't disappointed! All of the staff we dealt with were friendly and very helpful. They even assisted us in making transportation and tour arrangements. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. We had a Deluxe room with a rollaway bed, so there was plenty of sleeping space for mom, dad and 2 kids who refuse to share a bed. I loved the convenience of the coin-operated laundry. We had planned to make use of it during our stay, so we were able to pack lighter and return home from a nine day vacation with clean clothes!   Unfortunately, we were unable to connect to the free Wi-fi from our room, even though we tried several times durinig our stay and our computer showed an
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your stay at the Candy Cane Inn.  I was thrilled to read that our Front Desk Staff was so helpful in assisting you make arrangements for transportation and tours, as well as the fact that you enjoyed our exclusive hotel shuttle to Disneyland.  I do want to apologize for the trouble you had with our WiFi.  Based on the feedback of our guests, we are currently in the process of updating our internet equipment.  I hope that when you come back and see us again, you will be able to connect without trouble.  Again, thank you for your comments and I look forward to having you back again in the near future.

Summary Heading: Excellent In room Storage and wonderful cleaning staff
Summary: The Candy Cane Inn came highly recommended by several friends for our family trip to Disneyland.  I have stayed at a nearby hotel in the past, but will stay here again for any future trips to the park.  I was amazed at the under counter storage in our room, which was perfect for hiding laundry, picnic baskets, and extra bags.  The shuttle was prompt every time, and the driver often assisted our daughter with the scooter she was using due to a broken ankle. Our rooms were quiet, there was security around the clock, and the cleaning staff took the time to make extra efforts each day. I would recommend the Candy Cane to families visiting Disneyland, or surrounding attractions. I do have a tip that if you plan on taking the shuttle to the parks, ask for a room near the shuttle stop
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing with us your feedback!  I must admit that the cleanliness of our guest rooms and the service of our staff are two areas that the Candy Cane Inn takes pride in.  I will definitely let our Housekeeping Team know about your wonderful comments!  If your travels ever bring you back to the Anaheim area, please do not hesitate to contact me regarding reservations!

Summary Heading: Nice, convenient place to stay, room was a little cramped though
Summary: Very nice room, but on the small side. Book way ahead if you want the larger rooms. I asked to be upgraded and they never had a room come available even though I booked 8 weeks out. The beds were fine, not too hard or soft. It was a bit noisy, but most of the noise was caused by the shuttle van which was parked right outside our room. (Ask for a room toward the back.) I think the bedding was of average quality. The continental breakfast is pretty good. They serve the typical toast, bagels, sweet rolls, yogurt, cereal and fruit. Breakfast area is quite crowded when the patio can't be used. The location is very good. There are only a handful of motels that are closer to Disneyland entrance. And they have a shuttle that runs to and from the Parks every half hour. Also, there are
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you felt that your accommodations were cramped.  We do offer three types of accommodations, standard rooms that accommodate four guests, deluxe and premium rooms that accommodate five guests.  All our accommodations offer two queen sized beds, but our premium rooms are the largest accommodations at our hotel.  During peak dates of travel, availability may be scarce.  If you have any questions regarding availability or reservations, please feel free to contact me personally.

Summary: This was our yearly Christmas visit to Disneyland that always included the "enchanting" Candycane Inn.  Why do we love it here?         Very close to Disneyland, same side of the street, with beautiful grounds, super clean rooms, updated flat screen televisions, comfy queen beds in every room, quaint shutters on the windows, free parking, free shuttle to and from park, free breakfast, need more?      I love the view of the Tower of Terror from our upstairs room, plus the fireworks each night.  We prefer the deluxe room because it is bigger.  The regular rooms are small, but still recommended.        The only thing we would like to see your place do is carry ESPN, that's it.  Otherwise, see you again next year sometime!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal Candy Cane Inn guest!  It is the loyalty of our guests and their recommendations to others about our hotel that keeps us in business!  Also, thank you for your suggestion.  Please feel free to contact me when planning you next trip to the Anaheim area!

Summary: Stayed at the Candy Cane Inn between Christmas and New Year.  We arrived early so our room wasn't ready but they allowed us to park our car and then spend the day at Disneyland.  The walk to Disneyland is very short and on the same side of the road as Disney entrance.  James at reception was wonderful and very helpful.  I would definately stay here again.  Pool is heated.  Breakfast was fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us.  I was happy to read that you enjoyed your stay and that James at the Front Desk was helpful.  I am sorry that we were not able to check you in early, but we do our best to accommodate our guests with early check-in as lost as rooms are ready.  As always, if the room is not ready, guests are always welcome to park their vehicle and enjoy the area until their room is ready.  If your travels bring you to the Anaheim area, please contact me personally for assistance with reservations.

Summary: My husband and I took our 5 yr old triplets to DL a couple of years ago. Several friends recommended the Candy Cane Hotel but we did not listen....Nightmare staying at the Embassy Suites which required a shuttle service. We booked Candy Cane this time and I cannot say enough great things about this hotel. From the moment we checked in our stay was AWESOME...Walking distance to and from DL. Comfy room that was perfect...They brought a "x-mas" gift which included mugs, candy canes, and home baked cookies. I love this hotel and will definitely stay there from now on. One minor complaint.....the continental breakfast needs a makeover. Appreciate them including it in the rate but need fresh fruit platters and less stale bagels. Much easier to have breakfast in the room vs. trying to
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we are delighted that you have given us the opportunity on this recent Disneyland visit. Our pastries and bagels are delivered daily and I have spoken with our vendor in regards to your comment. We do provide 3 fresh fruits and while I appreciate your comments, cut fruit is not a viable option due to health department regulations requiring us to have full restaurant type kitchen. Kind regards!

Summary: From the moment we walked through the front doors, James made us feel "at home."  We enjoyed our room with a view, the friendly, helpful staff and my husband's favorite, the high tech bagel toaster.  It was a relaxing 10 min walk to Disneyland or a shuttle van to the Park. This was our best trip to Disneyland and a very SWEET place to sleep.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your kind comments regarding your enjoyable stay and James. We do appreciate your business and look forward in seeing you again. Warm Regards!

Summary: This hotel is fantastic.  I knew it was close to Disneyland, but I didn't realize just HOW close it was!  If it wasn't pouring rain, we would have walked to the park.  Fortunately, there is a shuttle to Disneyland that leaves every half hour.  We arrived around noon, and they let us check in early.  The hotel was clean & the beds were comfortable.  We had water and cookies and other little goodies waiting for us in our room.  They brought breakfast to our room in the morning for free.  The only complaint I have is that we requested a rollaway bed well in advance.  They had the beds available when we arrived, but when we came home from the park at night, I was surprised they had not put the rollaway bed in our room.  I called to request it, but they did not have any available.  I
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing me with this valuable information regarding your rollaway bed. We listen to our guests and I have reviewed this situation in-depth with our Front Office Manager. Feedback is always welcome as we can research and make necessary operational changes to better serve future guests. I do apologize for this inconvenience and am delighted that you were satisfied with the complimentary air mattress. Please feel free to contact me should you be visiting again as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Happy Holidays!

Summary: not a rave.  We got there early, flight arrived at 11am so our shuttle got us to CCI around noon.  Staff barely interested in assisting us - it was our first trip, I didn't even know where Disney WAS from there.  Desk clerk told us to come back at 3pm, and offered to store our bags.  I had to ask for directions on what to do from there.  It wasn't crowded, it was just lack of interest in customers.  When we returned after 3pm, we were given a parking pass and our room keys.  Our room was on the first floor, directly under the stairs and across from the ice machine and vending.  No view, no natural light, lots of noise.  Thanks.  I had written  under "special instructions" when submitting my online reservation that t was our first trip.  Evidently that doesn't matter.    The room
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing me with your valuable feedback. I sincerely apologize for the young ladies that were working the morning you arrived. The apparent lack of customer service you encountered is unacceptable and this has already been addressed. In regards to your room placement, you requested a King bedded accessible room and there are only three on property and placed close to the vending area for guest convenience. We have implemented training to call a guest who is requesting something that is clearly conflicting, ie..sunny room that is located next to vending areas. I do thank you for the positive items you mentioned and appreciate your taking time to post your review. Kind regards!

Summary: I can't say enough good things about the Candy Cane! Just returned from another great stay at the Candy Cane. We've stayed here a number of times in the past, and the friendly helpful staff, great service, clean rooms, beautiful landscaping, etc - keeps us coming back. Stayed here again at the beginning of December. Room was clean and presentable, pool and hot tub were perfect, free continental breakfast was good, room rates were very reasonable, etc. I don't know what to say?! If you're going to Disneyland...stay at the Candy Cane, you won't be dissappointed. Everytime we return, it feels like we never left.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for being a loyal and repeat guest, we DO appreciate your continued business and positive comments. We look forward in seeing you again and if you ever need assistance with reservations feel free to contact me directly. Happy Holidays!

Summary Heading: a wonderful place to stay for all the family
Summary: Our family of 9,five from england & four from hong kong, arrived to stay at the candy cane after a few days in las vegas. We had seen this hotel on our last  visit to anaheim & it looked ideal & boy, did we pick a winner. Our 4 rooms, all together, just across from the swimming area was perfect. The breakfast set us up for long days at disney, universal, malls etc & staff booked us a mini bus plus driver to take us to all the places of interest, great to travel together. The rooms where lovely & clean, all staff had a smile & were so helpful.Great to sit by the pool in the evening with a take away & a drink, all together for our annual meet. thank you all for a great nine night stay & we will return.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback with fellow travelers. I am delighted that you and your family had such and enjoyable vacation. Please feel free to contact me when your travels bring you back as it would by my pleasure to assist with room rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: My son and I are frequent visitors to Disneyland and always try to stay at the Candy Cane Inn. The week we spent over Thanksgiving is the third week we have spent this year at the Candy Cane Inn. We enjoy our time their so much that before writing this review,  I booked our stay there for Feb. 2011.    What makes the Candy Cane Inn so special? The rooms are clean, check in is easy, the pool is warm,  and the staff is friendly. What more do you want/need? They have a shuttle which is helpful, there are some mini-marts next door and it is easy to find. For the moer diffic  This trip we attended a concert at the Honda Center. At the suggestion of the staff, we took a taxi instead of driving and parking ourselves. The staff called the taxi on our behalf which took us to the Honda
Manager Response: We thank you for being a loyal repeat guest and sharing your personal feedback with fellow travelers. Word of mouth is valuable and extremely important in assisting folks that are  researching places to stay. Look forward in seeing you in February and please feel free to contact me directly should you need any assistance. Kind regards!

Summary: My husband and I visit Disneyland at least twice a year, and since we discovered this hotel we never stay anywhere else.  It is a short walk from Disneyland, and if your feet are tired you can always take their shuttle.  The staff treats you well, the breakfast is decent, and the rooms are clean.  I like the fact of the extra pillows (and the shuttle).  I really don't have any complaints about the room (since I'm not moving in, just visiting).  The only thing that happened was the maids forgot towels one morning, but it was quickly remedied (and that could happen at any hotel).  I highly recommend this gem of a place.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments. In regards to the unfortunate situation of towels in your guestroom, I remember this and when investigated was found to be an isolated incident. We never put clean towels in the bathroom until completely cleaned and the last task in order to keep clean towels away from the cleaning. The young lady was approached by a guest as she went to her cart, immediately assisted the guest in need and I sincerely apologize for this inconvenience. We do believe in providing ample linens for our guests and therefore place a complete set of 4 Bath Towels, Hand Towels and Washcloths in each room along with the Tub Mat. Thank you again for your business, it is most appreciated!

Summary Heading: Lovely oasis near The Magic Kingdom!
Summary: Enjoyed the atmosphere of this establishment - well-manicured landscaping, courteous staff, very clean rooms and public areas.  Luckily we visited during low season & although the Disney parks closed early (8pm), the crowds were minimal & the ride lines were awesome, short & quick!  Because of the hotel's close proximity to Disneyland, we didn't think we'd use much of their courtesy shuttle bus; boy, were we wrong, & we thoroughly enjoyed the comfort of the ride to & from the parks.  The continental buffet brekky was fine, the laudromat was a great asset too.  The only minor drawback was the size of the tiny bathroom, which included the toilet and tub (the showerhead was great though!).  Although we booked a deluxe room because of the larger room size, I had hoped that the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share with us your feedback regarding your most recent stay.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay, and thank you for the email. At the Candy Cane Inn we take pride in the cleanliness of our rooms and our hotel, as well as being one of the few remaining hotels that offers their own complimentary shuttle.  Please feel free to email or give me a call personally when planning you next trip to the Candy Cane Inn. Kind regards!

Summary: I recommend the Candy Cane highly. The location is so close - 10 minute walk from the main gate of Disneyland. The pool is very small but we weren't interested in using it anyway. The staff let us check in at 9:30 AM on the day of our arrival, and we had breakfast at 6:30 AM on the day we left. Parking and breakfast are included, as is wireless internet.
Manager Response: I am thrilled to read that you would recommend our hotel!  As you mentioned, one of the great features of our hotel is our proximity to the Disneyland Resort.  We are only a short 10 minute walk or 250 yards from the main entrance of Disneyland.  Our normal check-in time is 3pm, but our staff tries their best to accommodate our guests with early check-ins if possible. Thank you for choosing the Candy Cane Inn and we look forward to seeing you again in the near future.

Summary: The rooms were small, but very clean and super nice! We loved the shuttle, the breakfast, and the service! A little bit of luxury, but still close to Disneyland! Would definitely like to stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your stay.  I am happy to read that you enjoyed our hotel’s features and amenities.  Please keep in mind that we do have 3 rooms types, Standard Room – 4 people max, Deluxe Room – 5 people max, and Premium Rooms – 5 people max, each featuring 2 queen sized beds and each a little bigger than the other.  Please feel free to contact me in the future if you need reservations assistance.

Summary: My husband and I took our two kids (ages 11 and 12) for their first visit to Disneyland.  We planned it to coincide with the Veteran's Day school holiday making it very busy. The hotel itself was just fine.  It had a decent pool and hot tub nice for resting after long days at the Park.  The room was clean and it was just a 5-10 minute walk to the entrance of Disneyland.  The hotel offers a shuttle which we used a couple of times when our feet were tired.  I'd say overall it was good for the purpose that we needed it for. - a nice, clean place to sleep, have a free breakfast (yogurt, cereal, donuts, coffee, juice) and be on your way.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments with us.  The Candy Cane Inn is clean, comfortable, and convenient hotel with a great location, complimentary transportation to Disneyland, and other great features.  I am glad to read that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: This is a lovely motel. Great location, right next door to the Disneyland entrance, a short walk from convenience stores & chain restaurants, and very clean, comfortable rooms. Nice grounds, pleasant pool area. Very friendly staff. Perfect for a stay at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity and staying with us on your recent visit to Disneyland. Our staff appreciates the kind comments and yes our location is very convenient to the theme parks, shopping and many dining options. And the Anaheim Convention Center is a short walk across the adjacent corner. Again, thank you for your business and feedback.

Summary: My wife and I and our (now 26yr old ) daughter have been fortunate enough to visit Disneyland from England every other year or so since 1995.  We originally stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, but after staying at the Candy Cane in 2001 we've never stayed anywhere else.  It's all anyone could wish for, 10 minutes form the park, comfortable, clean, quiet, safe and very friendly.  We swapped summer for winter for the last 2 visits, and on our return to the room on Christmas Eve 2009 we were delighted to find Christmas gifts on the bed from the Candy Cane - how good is that?   I just hope spreading the word won't make it more difficult for us to book in future!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat Candy Cane Inn guest. We do value your business and appreciate the kind comments you share with fellow travelers. Please feel free to contact me directly when returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary: We recently traveled to Disneyland/California Adventure for a few days. Booked our stay at the Candy Cane Inn, based on other reviews here. We were not disappointed. You can walk to Disneyland or take free shuttle. Nice pool, continental breakfast, clean rooms, lovely gardens. Fall...not as crowded!! We will stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity of you staying with us and I am delighted that you enjoyed your visit. Yes, fall is a nice time to visit the Theme Parks as the weather is enjoyable and it is certainly not as crowded. Please feel free to contact me directly when planning your next visit as it would be my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Quiet, family friendly and close to Disneyland
Summary: Hotel staff very accommodating. We needed a roll away bed the 2nd night as my daughter and two girls aged 5 & 8 found the queen bed a little tight for the 3 of them. They provided the bed for a minimal charge of $10. Continental breakfast was ample. Shuttle to Disneyland proved very handy at the end of the day when everyone was tired. We managed to time it just right to get the shuttle back to the hotel. Also we were able to park in the lot when we arrived and walk to Disneyland. Only negative was the beds were a little worn, but comfortable. I had to flip mine as it was on a slope!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback. I appreciate your comment regarding our staff being very accommodating and they too read guests comments here on Tripadvisor and are appreciative of them. Our mattresses are flipped on a quarterly basis as per manufacturer's standards and are relatively new. Being a double pillow top can appear to be softer towards the edges as they are not constructed with a firm edge, however very comfortable as many guests have commented on. We do appreciate your business and kind regards!

Summary Heading: What a great place to stay
Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for three days October 6th through the 9th.  This was for my wifes 35th birthday and was a special birthday.  My wife has stage IV  colon cancer and has been on chemo for almost a year.  We visit Disneyland at least a couple times a year and normally stay at the Disneyland Hotel.  With my wife not working because of her cancer we decided to stay off property to save some money.  It was one of the best decisions we could have made.  The Candy Cane Inn was about half the price of what we would have spent staying at the Disneyland Hotel and you got breakfast.  I will say that the Candy Cane Inn is as good if not better.  The rooms are clean and cozy, the beds are ok and the staff is supper great.  I would say the walk to the park is about 10 to15 min
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity and staying with us on your recent Disneyland visit. I am sincerely sorry to learn of your wife's illness and I send my prayers for a speedy recovery. Please feel free to contact me should you need assistance with future rates or reservations as it would certainly be my pleasure to assist. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Enjoyed stay, however Wireless Internet is not available in every  room
Summary: We enjoyed our stay at Candy Cane in.  However, when we arrived, we were told that all rooms had WIFI access, when we couldn't connect, I called the front desk.  They told us that they had to reboot a router in a guest room, and would not be able to do this till the next day.  It did work, if we came down to the pool area. Well we stayed for 6 nights, and never got on the internet.  I told the front about 5 times - then finally gave up and went down to the pool, but nothing was every done to fix the access issue where we were.  When we checked out they apolizgied but gave no explanation.  IF YOU NEED WIRELESS, you may want to reconsider staying here, otherwise you will have to walk to the pool to get access.  Everything else was good.  The rooms were clean and the grounds are
Manager Response: First and foremost I would like to apologize for the lack of follow through with our front desk team. I have researched to find out what room you were in and will certainly discuss with our Front Office Manager to better handle in the future. We continually make modifications to enhance our WIFI connectivity property wide and change access points when necessary. I thank you for staying with us and providing me with this valuable feedback.

Summary: For only 3days staying here, I was quite happy with our stay at the Candy Cane Inn.  Location is good as right next to Disneyland.   The service at the hotel was good and very polite.  However, amazingly  no elevator is provided there and i had to carry all my luggages, such a painful workout ! This honestly push down a lot in term of hotel standard. Especially after a long walking day and u still have to walk upstair.  We had one issue with my room, just one thing missing from the room. Not a big deal. Very clean anyway.  I will rate this 4* if there is lift in this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback regarding your stay. We do listen to our guests and comments such as yours allow us to discuss and implement guest service enhancements. We will certainly assist with luggage and I sincerely apologize if our front desk agent did not offer this assistance. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Once again the CCI has surpassed our standards
Summary: We came in early on a Saturday not really realizing how it was, we tried to check in. However our room wasn't ready (which happened to be the first time in about 4 years) which wasn't a big deal at all. They gave us a parking pass and we went on with our day. Finally around 3 we came back to try again the staff was great as always and was able to find my coupon on file which surprised me b/c I wasn't expecting it. Our stay in general was great and the breakfast was greatly appreciated as well. We didn't really use the shuttle service as we proffered to walk but we will be staying again next December. Thank you for your outstanding service.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and being a loyal repeat guest, we do appreciate your business. We do try and accommodate early check-ins, however during busy seasons and high occupancy rooms this may become an issue with 11:00am check-out time.  I am delighted that you were able to utilize your Rewards Certificate from a prior stay and it is our pleasure to honor. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance with your visit in December. Kind regards!

Summary: I have stayed at the Candy Cane many times over the last 10 years and have always found it to my satisfaction. The rooms have a homey feel and are always clean. The front desk is always accomodating and cheerful and willing to help with anything we need. The free breakfast in the morning is the perfect light start to the day and the shuttle to Disney is nice for when I bring my elderly parents but it is also close enough that I can easily walk if I feel like a brisk walk.  When I make my reservation, they always check with me about discounts to make sure they are giving me the best deal possible. I love the basket of candy canes in the lobby! We love the Candy Cane and highly recommend it to single, couple, family, and group travelers!
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal Candy Cane Inn repeat guest, we do appreciate your business and kind comments. Please feel free to contact me directly when making future reservations as it would be my pleasure to assist. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Another Great Stay, But....tired, sore, feet.
Summary: This was our 6th consecutive stay at the Candy Cane Inn over the last 2 years or so.  As usual, CCI was first rate for a hotel of this class and price range. We opted for Deluxe Room for the extra space this time as the Standard Room we had earlier this year was just a bit small.  In the standard room, the fridge was inside the armoir taking up valuable drawer space (we were there for 5 nights) where as the deluxe room had the fridge placed in a cabinet externally giving more room to put clothing items away.  The Deluxe and Premium rooms, from our experience, are all at the rear of the hotel property so the walk to continental breakfast was a bit longer than we wanted to make so we passed.  The standard rooms that we have had are at the front part of the property so access to
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal return guest and I appreciate your feedback for fellow travelers. Yes, Disney had moved the drop off location for the hotels due to the massive expansion and many wonderful additions to California Adventure. We have modified our schedules to later on nights with the World of Color programs and apologize for any inconvenience. It is that Disney did these without forwarding the performance schedules. Kind regards!

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for a week with our two girls.  It is a great hotel, really well maintained, friendly and helpful staff and a great location to Disneyland.  They have a shuttle but you can walk in about 7-8 minutes.  The beds were really comfortable and they provide free parking.  Would definitely recommend. A lovely small hotel with a nice ambience.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted that you enjoyed your visit. Please feel free to contact me personally should you need rate or reservation assistance for future visits. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: close to disney, clean, reasonable. NO Elevator
Summary: just stayed for 2 days, the rooms are clean, nice decor, but alittle on the small side. we checked in and they gave us a room on the second floor. There was no elevator and my husband had to carry all of our luggage and stroller up to the second floor. not a good start and i had requested a first floor when booking because i had small children. if they told me they didn't have an elevator and i was going to be on the second floor i wouldn't have booked the hotel.  after a long day at disney we arrived back to the hotel and my kids where both sleeping in the stroller. i went to the front desk and said the second floor isnt going to work for us. (earlier before we lugged everything up to the second floor they told me the were completely booked and couldnt move us)  they ended up
Manager Response: First and foremost I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this caused you and your family. I have attempted to reach out to you via email with no response and wanted you to know that I have discussed in depth with our Front Office Manager. We do attempt to honor all requests and I am so sorry that the agent at check-in appeared to not honor your request. It could have also been that it was not noted on the reservation and that is why I seek information to better assist me in working with the team member responsible. Again, I do thank you for taking the time to bring this to our attention as we strive for total guest satisfaction. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel, Great Price and Location
Summary: I was happy with our stay at the Candy Cane Inn. It's conveniently located right down the street from Disneyland and the shuttle from the hotel to the park was quick, easy and always on time. The service at the hotel was good. We had one issue with our room and they immediately fixed it. The pool area was decent and so was the basic continental breakfast. If you're with family or friends and planning to visit Disney then this is a decent place to stay. I would return.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity of having you as our guest. We do appreciate the time you have taken to share your comments with fellow travelers and guests alike. Kind regards!

Summary: Lovely hidden treasure. Great location near the Disney resort.  free shuttle to and from.   Charming and comfortable rooms, very clean with a friendly staff
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow travelers. We do appreciate your business and feedback regarding our property, services and most importantly our friendly staff. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: A quaint hotel in the hustle and bustle of Disneyland
Summary: This is my third stay at Candy Cane Inn and it was as pleasant as ever. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate (good hot cocoa!) and the rooms are always clean. Staff is courteous and the shuttle to the park run on time and are rarely standing room only. The hotel is less than half a mile from the Disneyland entry gates, an easily walkable distance if you don't have small children or older family members in tow. Unlike most of the other hotels in the area, Candy Cane Inn has lovely on property vegetation and is not too big to feel almost like a boutique hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated and spacious.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal and repeat Candy Cane Inn guest. Your business and kind comments regarding our property and service are very much appreciated! Please feel free to contact me personally should you need future reservation assistance and it would certainly be my pleasure to assist. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Ok, so far I'm a little torn. This place...
Summary: Ok, so far I'm a little torn. This place is quaint and cheery upon first look, and our room gave a good first impression. We are frequent Disneyland visitors, but have stayed in only a few places around here as we have lived in the area in the past. I feel I have reasonable expectations when it comes to staying in a motor inn near a popular destination. We typically stay in Hilton Garden Inn, Courtyard Marriott type/level properties. This place has quite a bit more character and has it's own shuttle (a plus). Though the property is older, it is well maintained and the staff are professional.  We are visiting DL and this is my son's first visit. My in-laws are here as well, so we got the deluxe rooms to have adjoining rooms. The rooms are decent sized, though not huge and have
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing the opportunity of having you as our guest. We do appreciate your taking the time to share your comments and I wish that I could have spoken with you personally while you were on property as it appears that you wrote this while here. Our Deluxe rooms that connect are towards the back of the property and that is why you were not as close to the pool and breakfast area and I am sorry if that was not explained to you. I have shared your comments with our management team and if you would be so kind I would be delighted to speak with you. Thank you again and kind regards!

Summary: I travelled with my sister and a friend to Disneyland and stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for a week.  We were thoroughly impressed with the accommodation and the way guests are treated by all personnel there.  They treat you like family and try to make your stay pleasurable. The breakfast that is included in your stay is lovely and a large variety of items to choose from.  They encourage you to either eat in their lovely surroundings by the pool or take your food back to your room - the choice is yours.  The grounds are absolutely lovely, with beautiful plants, flowers and a poolside area and the rooms are very clean and cheery. They also have their own shuttle to Disneyland that runs all day long. However, if you want to walk to Disneyland, it is not too far (only a few blocks),
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to be of service on your recent visit to the Disneyland Theme Parks. Your comments regarding our property, services and our team of service professionals are very much appreciated. In regards to the cookies that I sent to your room, they were just a small token for your inconvenience and understanding. Please feel free to contact me directly should you be returning as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Second Visit and Love this place
Summary: This is our third time to Anaheim and our second time staying at the Candy Cane Inn, obvious really - the place is fantastic and we can not fault it. The location is perfect if you are wanting to visit Disney Land (which we did not do this time) but everything is there including a vast amount of restaraunts and souvenier shops. I have already recommended about 5 people to stay at this hotel and one is still in the US at the moment but has stopped here at the Candy Cane and text me to stay it was cozy and very comfortable and they just loved it. So without a doubt do not look anywhere else, Candy Cane is the place to stay, breakfast is also included in the price and is just perfect for what you need.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I sincerely appreciate your recommendations to fellow travelers. Our location and proximity to the Theme Parks, Dining, Shops and Convention Center is certainly a benefit. Please feel free to contact personally when returning as I would be delighted to assist with reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great Again, Depends on what side you stay in
Summary: Our family has stayed at Candy Cane 6 years in row.  We LOVE that we are so close to Disneyland.  Beautiful reception area, and nice staff.  We have found that if you want the superior rooms you want to stay in the rooms closest to the Disney side.  They seem to be better, and newer rooms.  Our last stay was actuallly not the best, but we were on the other side, bottom floor.  I wouldn't recommend Candy Cane if we had stayed in that room for the first time.  The rooms furthest from the Disney side are dark and a little more dirty than the other side rooms.  You can see the fireworks late at night from these rooms, which is nice.  If you are a light sleeper you will want to stay on the upper level, so you don't hear people running/walking up and down the concrete balcony. The
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow travelers. We do appreciate your loyalty and take your comments seriously. We have discussed your comments with our management team and rest assured your comments have been addressed. Please feel free to contact me directly when planning your next visit as I would be delighted to assist with rates and reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay when visiting Anaheim area
Summary: We've stayed at the Candy Cane Inn a number of times in the past. The roomsare somewhat small, but the beds are very comfortable. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and always well maintained. Parking is very tight if the hotel is crowded. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. The free breakfast is plenty for my daughter and myself.  Our only minor complaint is regarding the free shuttle bus. The drop off location was changed (probably by Disneyland) It's 50/50 now when we decide to walk or take the shuttle.
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty and being a repeat guest. We do receive many positive comments on our Serta Double Pillow Top Presidential Suite Mattresses and we are delighted that you slept well. In regards to the shuttle drop off location, yes Disney has moved the hotel shuttles out to the Silver and White zones. Kind regards!

Summary: Nice little place if you want a clean and comfy bed close to Disneyland. Take the blue shuttle bus which is around $15 per person from the airport and the transfer is around 45 minutes. There is complimentary coffee and mini sugar candy canes in the reception area both of which help to revive those potentially fragile and tetchy spirits flagging at the check in desk after a long haul flight. It is a 10 minutes easy walk to the Disneyland entrance - go out turn left. They can arrange entrance tickets for you at the motel but it is just as easy to buy them yourself at the gate and actually cheaper to buy on line in advance. The pool is pretty and there is also a jacuzzi although we didn't get to use either. A more than adequate breakfast is provided which was efficiently and
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback with fellow travelers. We do appreciate your business and comments regarding our property, service and location. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Cute little motel super close to Disneyland
Summary: My partner and I really enjoyed our stay at the Candy Cane Inn. Extremely close to Disneyland, we walked there and back several times a day over the course of 4 days. Didn't make use of the shuttle at all. Stayed on the second floor, and it was really quiet. Heard no noise from other rooms or from outside. Rooms were very clean, and certainly spacious enough for 2 people. Was great to use the pool as it was really hot during our stay, and it was never crowded. Would definitely recommend this motel to other people and would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted that your partner and you enjoyed your stay. We do appreciate your business and sharing your experience with fellow travelers. Kind regards!

Summary: This was my gf and my second stay at the CCI, a first for my son, husband and parents. We stayed for three nights over Fri, Sat and Sun to spend three days in the park. Again, the hotel was in fantastic condition, the room was extremely clean and the bed comfy. At least as can be for an 8 month pregnant woman. :o)  Both my parents and my husband were impressed with the hotel and would come back in a heartbeat. The breakfast was very filling; there was actually a lot more food options than I remember from our last trip. My two year old thought he had hit the jackpot being able to have bananas, bagels AND donuts in the same breakfast. :o) A little note, if you are going to go swimming, be forewarned that the pool is a little small, but it was always the perfect temperature and it
Manager Response: Thank you for being a repeat guest and we do appreciate your continued business and comments. I am delighted that your mother and friend enjoyed their cookies and little one enjoyed our Expanded Continental Breakfast. In regards to World of Color show times and transportation, we have extended our shuttle service to accommodate folks attending these programs that finish after normal park hours. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need future reservations as it would be my pleasure to assist. Kind regards!

Summary: We were looking for a place to stay that offered king beds. Candy Cane Inn only showed King handicapped rooms available, so I booked one. Upon check in, I was informed that we were "upgraded" to a Deluxe room, that offered a free breakfast in a basket.  My husband wasn't with me upon check in, so I decided to check out the room....very clean, nice room with 2 beds...not a king. I went back to the front desk, where the gentleman explained that they had given the king room to someone "who was actually handicapped".  He had not seen my husband, or myself, before giving the room away.  Folks, beware...if you truly need a handicapped room, which is at the "end of the parking lot", you may not get it.  It turns out there are only 3 King rooms in the entire Motel.  The hotel manager
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I again sincerely apologize for this unfortunate experience. In my telephone conversation with your husband I took full responsibility of the front desk agent and his choice of words in explaining the upgrade you received and offered a return visit. You were upgraded to one of our two queen bedded Premium Handicap Rooms from one of our king bedded Deluxe Handicap Rooms. I am extremely sorry if our front desk agent failed to mention the Premium Room was in fact a handicap room however, your husband was aware and mentioned this in our conversation. Kind regards.

Summary: My husband and I brought our young children (4 and 1) on their first Disneyland trip.  We enjoyed the hotel very much and the free shuttle was a plus.  I'm sorry that Disneyland has practically moved the shuttle pickup out to the road, but it was still worth it.  We also appreciated the continental breakfast that included more than usual.  It was the perfect start and satisfied even my picky 4 year old.  The only complaint I have is that the carpet in our room was dirty.  My children were barefoot in the room, and after 15 minutes their feet were black.  Hopefully they've cleaned the carpets.  Other than that, it was great and I would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing us with your feedback. Yes, moving the shuttle location is a slight inconvenience however, the many exciting changes and additions to the California Adventure Theme Park will be worth the few extra steps. I am very sorry regarding your carpet as our housekeeping team has carpet cleaners on a daily basis and we have recently extracted all carpets throughout the hotel. We look forward to seeing you again and please contact me personally should you need reservations assistance as it would be my pleasure to assist. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Cozy clean place to stay w/ a nice breakfast.
Summary: I really liked this hotel compared to the numerous ones we have stayed at during our visits to disneyland.  It is close to the park (shuttle service provided even though we didn't use it) w/ nice grounds and nice pools.  I really liked the extended cont. breakfast (much better than others).   The rooms were really cozy and comfortable, the beds were soft w/ plenty of pillows.  The room was very clean and had nice toiletries.  The front desk personel were really nice and helpful and allowed us to check in earily, I will def. be back!   Also if you get a room on the 2nd floor facing the park, you can see the fireworks at night.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing the opportunity to be of service on your recent visit to the Theme Parks. We do appreciate your comments and you sharing them with fellow travelers. We pride ourselves in providing an exceptional product, friendly service and a quiet ambiance while being cognizant of price during these trying economic times. Thank you for your comments regarding our Expanded Continental Breakfast and Exclusive Complimentary Shuttle as this adds to our  price value. Please feel free to contact me directly for future reservations as it would be my pleasure to assist. Kind Regards!

Summary: This was our first time stay here. We had heard a lot about this hotel and wanted to give it a try. It was ok. The rooms are clean and nice. We needed a microwave and fridge so we had to get a premium room. The room was great but not worth what it cost. The main thing that drew us to this hotel was there free shuttle. I had 1 small child plus my 80 year mother with us so that was going to really help. The shuttle was nice but Disney has their drop off spot so far away you might as well stay at one of the hotel across the street. The one horrible thing about there shuttle is that it only goes until 45 minutes after the park closes. Well, if you are planning on seeing World of Color, you had better make other arrangements on getting back to the hotel. I went in and asked at the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments. I would like to comment on our Exclusive Complimentary Shuttle service as we pride ourselves on this added amenity and would certainly never knowingly leave guests stranded at the park. We prepare our schedules based on Disney hours of operation and when I learned of the World of Color shows extending after the Theme Parks closing (prior to your review) I immediately contacted our Disney representative who sincerely apologized and we made schedule revisions. Disney has changed the locations of Hotel Shuttles with the massive expansion at California Adventure and elimination of parking and while I have no control do apologize for any inconvenience. I am very sorry that I cannot respond to your other comments as I have not heard back from you when I responded via email and would be more than happy to discuss personally. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Great Stay......Very friendly and helpful staff!
Summary: We just spent three nights here and it was a great experience.  The room was clean.  Roomy enough.  The pool and hot tub were nice for a break during long days at Disneyland.  The beds were a bit too soft for our liking, but otherwise fine with good bedding and extra pillows.  We found the breakfast to be abundant with cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, breads and pastries.  The location couldn't get much better.....just a short walk or shuttle ride to Disneyland.  The staff were all very proffessional and friendly.  I can not say enough good things about Ryan who helped me get a taxi one night to take my daughter to the ER as well as a taxi back to the hotel.  It wasn't a fun experience, but knowing he was helping on the other end of the phone made it much easier.  We will certainly stay
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow travelers. I sincerely hope that you daughter is doing fine and Ryan was there to assist during what can be an unpleasant experience. Ryan is genuinely a sincere, caring and thoughtful gentleman and it is a pleasure to have him on our team. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance with future reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: IF VISITING DISNEYLAND, STAY HERE. VERY FREINDLY!
Summary: We selected the Candy Cane Inn based on the reviews on TA and we were exceptionally happy with our choice. Especially after a long flight from Australia. From my first email (every email was answered) to checking out everybody was so professional, helpful and very friendly. Thank you Marcus, Ryan and James. We booked a premium room so we could utilise late checkout and have the breakfast in our room. The beds were so comfortable and it was very quiet. The microwave and fridge in the room were also very handy. The housemaids were fantastic, our room sparkled it was so clean. The grounds, paths, pool area were also beautiful and well kept. The location is ten minutes walk to Disneyland front gate. The staff are such an assest to this Inn from the Front reception to housemaids &
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity of being your home away from home on your recent visit from Australia. Your comments regarding our team, grounds and services are most appreciated and I will certainly pass them along. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: The Candy Cane Inn lived up to all the excellent reviews here
Summary: Well, it took us long enough, but after decades of visiting the park and staying in almost every hotel and motel within an easy walking distance, we finally decided to stay at the Candy Cane this time, based on all the great reviews it gets on TA. From here on out, it will likely be our first choice of accommodation. We were traveling with our adult daughter and her husband, and they were able to put us up in adjoining rooms despite the fact that we had arrived a bit early, straight from the airport. At the other end of our visit, they arranged a town car to pick us up for our return to the airport, and allowed us a late check-out so we didn't have to sit around the airport for an extra hour. This was greatly appreciated! I loved the attention to detail in the care of the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to the park, and I am delighted that you enjoyed your first visit. Our property does lend itself to be extremely peaceful and quiet and in great proximity to the theme parks, convention center and the Anaheim GardenWalk that offers many shopping and dining options. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance with future rates or reservations and let your son-in-law know that our Candy Cane Inn pens have ink that smells like peppermint :-)

Summary: This was our third stay at the Candy Cane Inn. We loved it so much the first two times that we decided to return to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and it was fantastic! The rooms and grounds are always immaculate, and the flowers are extraordinary.  However, the most important aspect of the trip was the outstanding customer service. Everyone is so helpful, from the lady at the front desk when we checked in to the bus driver. For example, Ryan was extremely helpful in locating the local Weight Watchers meeting for me. I had no idea where it was, but he showed me that it was very close. I got to the meeting with no problem!  I am a very seasoned traveler, and I must say this is the best hotel we have stayed at in any city, including Walt Disney World! We are sure to
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to stay with us and celebrating your 25th wedding anniversary at our Inn. Your comments regarding our rooms and grounds are appreciated; however the personal assistance that Ryan provided you is heart warming. He is a fine young gentleman with a sincere caring nature and genuine guest service. We appreciate your business and look forward in seeing you on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Is Wonderful...Unless You're In A Handicap Room
Summary: Stayed here August 8-12, 2010 with my family of 6 adults, 2 of which stayed in a HC (handicapped room). Let me begin by saying I have given the CC my business in the past and have been completely satisfied and loved every minute.  This trip I had my Mother along who is in a wheelchair. The advertised HC room she was assigned is minimally ADA compliant, at least for a paraplegic.  The toilet was not raised, 'larger room space' advertised wasn't really that much larger than a regular room, and the vanity was covered with plywood from the counter surface to the floor where your feet might go under the counter.  The regular rooms where we didn't need that space were clear and open from counter to floor, yet the HC room where that space is needed was walled over with the plywood.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity during your recent visit and providing your valuable feedback. This input assists us in making modifications that will better serve future guests and improving our facility. Again, we do appreciate your continued business and thank you for your comments. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Inn Shuttle driver Lee
Summary: On my annual trip to Disneyland, I always stay at the Candy Cane Inn. It has everything I want in a vacation hotel plus. It has a great location (safe walk through a park like setting to Disneyland), a beautiful setting (well cared for plants everywhere), a continental breakfast (that you can eat at poolside), a comfortingly homey room with excellent seamless service. But, the icing on the cake is the shuttle that can leaves every half hour (on the hour and half hour) from the hotel, and picks up every half hour (on the quarter and three quarters of the hour) from the parking lot in front of the parks. Since the hotel staff guests see most often is the shuttle driver, shuttle drivers are truly ambassadors of hospitality for the hotel. I have run into a few inconsiderate ones,
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and being a loyal Candy Cane Inn guest, we do appreciate your business! What can I say about Mr. Lee, the "Beaming" smile and his "Friendly & Sincere" nature with all that he comes in contact with...he truly is an Ambassador of our hotel and I am proud to have him on our team. We look forward in seeing you again next year and please feel free to contact me personally should you need reservations assistance. Kind regards!

Summary: Stayed at the peak of tourist season in the hot summer month of August.  The staff was wonderful.  Rooms clean.  The shuttle service is excellent.  Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback. We do appreciate your business and please feel free to contact me directly for reservation and rate information.

Summary Heading: Great place, perfect for Disney visit!
Summary: We selected this hotel based on the large number of positive reviews on Tripadvisor, and were very happy with our choice.  The location is great, a ten minute walk to the main entrance of Disney. The hotel shuttle is also a helpful option, especially at the end of the day when everyone was dead tired from a full day at the park.  We got a room with two queens, it was spacious, clean and comfortable. When you visit the park, you normally spend most of the day out, so there were no major issues to pick with the room. The kids used the pool the day we arrived. The breakfast buffet is decent, always busy though, but it helps to get some food at the start of the day without having to go outside the hotel. In the evening, there were decent options across the street, and as noted by
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you. We do appreciate and value your comments as well as taking valuable time to share with fellow travelers. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: The Best Place to Stay in Anaheim for Families!
