Summary: This hotel is perfect for families and within walking distance to Disneyland. There is a free shuttle (gratuities are appreciated) running every 1/2 hr to and from Disney which is a huge relief for tired feet. The staff are very accommodating, friendly and efficient. The continental breakfast is basic, bagels, toast, fruit, muffins etc but everything was fresh and tasty. The rooms are quaint and the beds are really comfortable. Only one thing we noticed was the carpet in the room was very worn out and needs replacing, however the room was clean. The pool area is very well kept with flowers and palm trees all around with fresh warm towels for guests. There is also a little gift shop in the lobby that sells some handy things besides souvenirs. Next door is a mini mart that sells
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments on TripAdvisor with fellow travelers. In regards to your comments on our expanded continental breakfast, we do receive fresh fruits and pastries seven days per week. Please feel free to contact me directly when returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our stay at Candy Cane; it's a clean, convenient and beautiful environment !
Summary: Our family of 5 (3 kids all under age 12) stayed 5 nights at Candy Cane Inn end of July, and really enjoyed it.  Our room was clean and grounds were beautiful.  The outdoor pool (smaller scale) was perfect for our kids.  It took us about 15 minutes to walk to Disneyland park, but we also took advantage of the shuttle bus a few times (very convenient).  Having a convenience store right next to the Inn was great for replenishing our water and snacks.  Continental breakfast had a good selection of bagels, danishes and muffins, but they also had yogourt, fruits and cereal.  Best of all, we really appreciated the great service from the kind and courteous ground staff, especially the one who brought back our daughter (4yrs old) who mysteriously wandered off looking for our room.
Manager Response: Thank you sharing your comments and I do appreciate our personal conversation this morning. Guest's feedback is very important and assists us in the ongoing coaching and counseling of our teams. Hope to see you again soon and best regards!

Summary Heading: Walking distance to Disneyland - a great choice to stay
Summary: We stayed with our 4 children here last week.  If you are going to Disney it is a great choice (if you want to see other parts of LA Annaheim is not that convenient e.g. it took us over an hour to get to Santa Monica). We could walk to the park in 10 minutes, the rooms were spacious and clean, the breakfast good and the pool deliciously refreshing when we couldn't walk another step. The communal areas are very pretty with lots of plants and were always clean e.g. with lots of towels available for the pool etc. The whole area was much nicer than expected with several good restaurants and a low-key feel. The only suggestion for impoving the hotel would be to have a computer terminal with internet that guests can use. I had to do a bank transation one night and didn't appreciate
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and staying with us on your recent visit. In regards to a business center, our front desk team is more than delighted to assist with directions, boarding passes and other general information on the internet. In addition we do offer complimentary WIFI throughout the property for our guest's convenience.

Summary Heading: Friendly Service, Comfortable and Clean Rooms, Great Location, Overall Wonderful Stay!
Summary: My family of 5, including 3 children - ages 5,3, and 1 - stayed here from 8/16-8/20.  We absolutely loved our stay. We booked a premium room and it was so well worth the extra money. Loved that we had breakfast delivered every morning. So convenient! Loved the welcome basket, free movie rentals, and late check-out.  Nice to have both a fridge and microwave.  Turn-down service was a treat. Our kids loved the pool. The only suggestion is maybe you can do something about the two white covers on the bottom of the kiddie pool. My one-year old son and I kept tripping over them as they were not flush with the pool floor. Ouch! Overall, it was a wonderful stay. Great location next to Disney.  Used the shuttle on most days since it was so hot out. Shuttle driver Lee was very friendly and
Manager Response: I am delighted that you and your family enjoyed your visit to our Inn. I am sorry that your little guy kept tripping over the pool drains. These new style covers were just installed to comply with Federal water safety laws. Thank you again for staying with us and your comments.

Summary: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor after returning from our first Disneyland trip and staying at a Disney property for like $300/night.   What you dont see is when staying at the Paradise Pier, we spent $100 every morning on breakfast for 3 people because our resturaunt had "lilo and stitch" running around. While it made for some of our favorite pictures, spending $300 for "breakfast" across 3 days seems a little much.  Doing my research on Trip Advisor, we found the Candy Cane Inn. I can sit back and smile and go, Yup, this was the best thing about our trip. Clean and very comfy rooms and the air conditioning that would freeze you out if you cranked it down and set the fan to high. (woot!)    It is honestly like two long blocks away from the front of Disneyland. We did take the
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your thoughts and observations from your recent visit. We do listen to our guests and take comments to heart when making modifications in our operation. This will assist us in making a decision during high occupancy periods of the year.

Summary Heading: The second happiest place on earth
Summary: We arrived late, without a reservation and the young woman at the desk was helpful, polite and charming.  We parked right in front of our room which is always a plus.   We thought that being so close to the parking area - which is beautifully cobblestoned - would have been noisy but it was quiet.   The room was clean and clean smelling, average size with a mini fridge.   The beds were comfortable and provided a very good night's sleep.   The full continental breakfast is served from 7:00 to 9:00 a.m. and it is taken down promptly at 9 a.m. so get there early.   Breakfast  comprises of coffee, hot chocolate, apple and orange juices, milk.   Apples, bananas, oranges.   Croissants, muffins (cranberry, blueberry,chocolate chip, bran/raisin).  You can toast your bagels (variety) and
Manager Response: I am delighted to read your comments and thank you for sharing them with fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Your tag line "the second happiest place on earth" is wonderful and gave me marketing ideas! It would be my pleasure to assist you with reservations for your holiday visit and feel free to contact me directly. Warm Regards!

Summary: We have stayed at this inn many times over the years, and have always enjoyed it. This trip was probably our least enjoyable visit. All of the basic rooms were booked, so we reserved a deluxe room. I requested a room close to the front, as my husband is disabled and has difficulty walking longer distances. I was not informed that the deluxe rooms closest to the front were still halfway back the length of the hotel. When I asked if anything was available closer to the front, I was told that all they had was the room we were given. Our room was also right next to the stairs, where some idiot family chose to slam their 8 suitcases, 1 at a time, down the stairs at 4:30 in the morning. Finally, we chose the Candy Cane to make use of their shuttle to Disneyland, and there were several
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I sincerely apologize for the location of your room. Yes, our Deluxe Rooms are located about two thirds back and going to the back of the property. In regards to the shuttle situation during the Major League Baseball All Star Game. The streets being closed were out of our control and we tried to notify all guests with letters in the rooms to plan accordingly. As you noted we did take our small van to assist the guest needing special assistance. Again we apologize for any inconvenience caused by the celebrations throughout the city. Please feel free to contact me directly when making future reservations and I will do everything possible for room placement. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: A Perfect Compliment to the Disney Experience
Summary: Just got back from Disneyland with our 4 kids aged 13 to 27. Stayed for four days in two adjoining double queen rooms. Everything about this place fully met our needs/expectations. The rooms are large, clean and up to date. The beds are comfortable. The continental breakfast while basic is abundant and tasty, and kept spotlessly clean. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and the shuttle service is regular and friendly. We didn't use the shuttle much however as the park is an easy walk from the hotel. The maid service was great as the rooms were kept sparkling without ever seeing the maid (in our room). The pool area while small was sparklingly clean and was never over crowded.  We appreciated the coin-op laundry room to keep the kids in clothes. All in all our stay was
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. It sounds like you really enjoyed your stay. If your travel plans ever bring you back to the area please feel free to call me directly for reservations assistance.

Summary: After a delay with our room not ready at check in time we had a lovely stay. We choose the Premium room and it was worth it. The rooms were a good size and when we entered we had a welcome basket with the yummiest cookies and popcorn to have while we watched our free rental movies. There was also a personalised welcome note. The beds were lovely and I sank into them after a long day a the theme parks. The pillows were also so fluffy and big. The in room breakfast service every morning was lovely and having a microwave was also lovely  to heat meals and bottles for our baby. Our room was on the top floor and it was quite.  The walk to Disneyland was only about 10 mins and wasn't too bad. We only used the motel shuttle once as we found it easier to just walk. the laundry was great
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience on TripAdvisor. I am sorry to learn that you experienced a delay at check-in however, I am happy that you enjoyed your stay. Kind regards and see you again should you return to Anaheim.

Summary: Great hotel for us! We stayed 3 nights, and reserved the larger premium room.. This included the in room breakfast basket, which was wonderful! We just preordered to arrive at the time we wanted to arise. Then ate, and headed to the park.. The room was plenty large for us, and very comfortable.. No complaints. The on site laundry facility was proved very useful. Our walk was about 4 city blocks, closer than some of the Disney parking lots.. right at the nearest corner from the park. Considering the closeness of the park Candy Cane Inn grounds were very quiet, and beautifully maintained. there were restaurants very nearby, and conveinence stores were close as well. Very good choice.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow travelers. I am delighted that you enjoyed your Premium Room and the morning delivery of our Expanded Continental Breakfast. Kind Regards!

Summary: Trip Advisor did NOT steer me wrong with this property!  For about $113 a night (AAA plus tax) we got a nice room, breakfast, within an easy walk to Disneyland.  Save your money and stay here!  They even let me park in the lot before I checked in.  What a nice change from the big chain lodging establishments.
Manager Response: Thank you for trusting TripAdvisor and allowing us to be of service during your recent visit. We do appreciate your business, comments and focus on providing our guest's with exceptional product and service with an emphasis on their budget.

Summary: We stayed at the candy cane inn for a quick trip to disneyland.  What a wonderful place, very clean, comfortable and right next to the park.  I would highly recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow travelers. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Don't let them put you in Room 128
Summary: Upon arrival we were given our upgraded room, which we paid extra for and found that it was a horrible location.  Our room faced a wall so we never got any light and could not see anything outside of the wall and the steps leading to the upstairs rooms.   If that wasn't bad enough it was next to the ice machine. People were getting ice at all different times and  every morning we were awakened by someone getting ice at 6am.  It was also next to the housekeeping rooms where the washer and dryers were located and where  we could hear the housekeeping staff getting their cleaning supplies ready . To get to our room from parts of the parking lot we had to pass by bins of dirty sheets and towels.   When we asked to have our room moved we were told it was sold out and they could not
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with this valuable feedback regarding your experience at our Inn. It was a pleasure in speaking with you personally and I appreciate your time and thank you for returning my call. We learn from our guests and situations that occur, be they positive or one that we can make adjustments to eliminate such a reoccurrence. I do look forward in meeting you on your next visit and I wish you a belated Happy Birthday!

Summary: As first-time visitors to Disneyland, we researched and pondered extensively on where to stay without whacking our wallet. Several people suggested the Candy Cane Inn. Based on their advice, we took the plunge and booked the CCI - and are glad we did. While they offer a shuttle to/from Disneyland every 15 minutes, it is only an easy 5-10 minute walk. The complimentary continental breakfast was sufficient for us (muffins, bagels, toast, yogurt, cereals, etc) to start the day and is always restocked from 7:00-9:00am (none of that annoying "be there at 7:00 or miss out" stuff). Pool is heated with room to lounge around and was perfect for breaking up a day of walking, rides and crowds in the Disney parks. We hit the parks early, walked back to the CCI early afternoon for a couple
Manager Response: Thank you for "taking the plunge" and staying with us, we too are glad you did and appreciate your business and sharing the experience with fellow travelers. Please feel free to contact me personally should you need future reservations assistance as it would be my pleasure. Kind regards!

Summary: We loved this hotel! When we booked, this hotel was #1 on the TA list. As the others said, the location is wonderful! We went back to the hotel mid day (hottest time) for a nap and swim to rejuvenate and return to the Disneyland. We also watched the fireworks from our hotel room, the view was that great.  Granted the rooms can seem small, we had a double bed, but they are beautiful rooms and clean. It's the furniture that might make it feel small, but it is not a deal breaker. The breakfast was continental and plentyfull... my family didn't care for it. We stayed for a week and you get tired of the same thing over and over for the whole week, but you can't beat free. The best thing that stood out for us with this hotel is the customer service. After returning home from our
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experiences at our Inn. We appreciate when guests take their valuable time and provide fellow travelers with comments about our property and services. Danilo, our Housekeeping Manager does a wonderful job in assisting guest's with items left behind. We only charge the shipping cost to return items returned as we are delighted that personal items be reunited with their owner. Please feel free to contact me directly should you be returning as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: Beautiful without draining the bank account
Summary: This was a beautiful hotel and so close to Disney!  I stayed with my 10 year old son and we had a great stay.  The room was VERY clean!! The cost was very reasonable!  The pool was a good size.  All staff were very friendly and helpful!!  We would highly recommend this hotel to others.
Manager Response: I am delighted that you and your son had an enjoyable visit at our Inn. We do aspire to be a very clean, comfortable and friendly hotel at a moderate price point. Thank you for your business as we do appreciate it and feel free to contact me personally if you need assistance with future arrangements. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: The beds were very comfortable, the staff...
Summary: The beds were very comfortable, the staff was friendly and the breakfast was awesome! Very great location and at a very good price
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your comments to fellow travelers. We do get many positive compliments about our Serta Presidential Suite, Double Pillow Top Mattresses. We do appreciate your business and look forward in seeing you again. Kind regards!

Summary: I have only just booked my reservation and I am completly taken by the Candy Cane.  I was quick to book our hotel at first simply because we were so excited about going. However, I had been reading reviews on several hotels and finally I decided I needed to change hotels and stay at the Candy Cane Inn. The reviews and the reservation man (James) that I spoke with were my deciding factor.  He was amazing and I am looking forward to thank him in person for his patience and still being friendly with me after my 8th phone call to the Inn. I have had family stay there before and they said it ws wonderful.  I cant wait to get there and enjoy my 2 weeks in luxury.
Manager Response: I am certainly pleased that you have decided to change hotels and give allow us the opportunity on your upcoming visit. James at our front desk does a great job in assisting guests and we certainly understand that sometimes repeated calls are necessary. Please feel free to contact me personally when you arrive if there is anything I may do to make your visit more enjoyable. Kind regards!

Summary: We took our 13 year granddaughter and 10 year old grandson to Disneyland for their birthday present this year.  Our stay at the Candy Cane Inn was great.  Close proximity to Disneyland so we could walk or take the shuttle, come back to the room for swim and dinner and then go back for the fireworks and light show. The staff was always cheerful and very helpful for our side trips to Universal Studio and Knotts Berry Farm. The breakfast was certainly adequate with several choices of bagels and breads, cereal and beverage.  Thank you again. The Barbers from Kelowna
Manager Response: I am delighted to read that your visit to Southern California to celebrate your grandchildren's birthdays was most enjoyable. Trips of this type are memorable and I am happy that you found our Inn to be a great value. We do appreciate and thank you for your business and wish you many more birthdays to celebrate. Warm regards!

Summary: The Candy Cane Inn is a fantastic little hotel.  What you don't realize, is that it is quite large, but the gardens and surroundings create a very cozy and relaxed atmosphere. From the get go, our stay there was absolutely perfect. The rooms are spotless, the area is beautiful, free daily continental breakfast; it's a five minute walk to Disney - they also provide a free shuttle to the park as well. James, at the front desk, was great helping set up our tour to Los Angeles. If you have a young family  I can't imagine that you could find a better place to enjoy your stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback with fellow travelers. I appreciate your kind remarks about James and the rest of our team. Our housekeepers and gardeners are certainly proud of the property as you can see in the cleanliness and beautiful garden surroundings. Warm regards!

Summary: We had to check out of a nearby hotel because the beds were so uncomfortable. We weren't able to stay at the Candy Cane so we stayed at the aforementioned hotel and I couldn't wait to have a nice nights sleep when we checked into the Candy Cane. The room was clean and the beds were amazing! They were so comfortable and clean. The continental breakfast is an added benefit of the hotel. They had toast, bagels, donuts, cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, coffee, hot cocoa, and juice every morning until 9:00 am. The only thing I would want them to change is extend the continental breakfast until 10:00 a.m. so that people wouldn't be so rushed in the breakfast room. The shuttle to Disneyland leaves every half hour and is a really convenient way to get to the park. You will not regret your
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing fellow travelers with your valuable feedback. I am sorry that we were unavailable for you to stay with us on your first night and that your bed was uncomfortable. We do receive many positive comments on our Serta Double Pillow Top Presidential Mattresses and are delighted that you too enjoy them. Our Expanded Continental Breakfast and Exclusive Complimentary Shuttle to the Theme Parks every 30 minutes are convenient too. Please feel free to contact me directly to arrange your next visit and I will do all I can to ensure that you don't have to sleep on uncomfortable beds. Warm regards!

Summary: My husband and 2 children (aged 2 and 6) stayed here from June 28th to July 4th. We arrived from Australia early in the morning and were able to check in early, which was much appreciated as we needed a nap before heading to Disneyland. We stayed in a premium room which was very spacious. Included breakfast was plentiful. The shuttle bus running to and from Disneyland every 1/2 hour was brilliant (especially at the end of a long day at Disneyland). The staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a small supermarket right next door which was very convenient. This was our first trip to the USA and Disneyland. We are already planning a return trip within the next few years and will definitely be staying at Candy Cane Inn again. Thanks for making our trip a memorable one.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted that your visit to the USA was an enjoyable one. Yes, we do certainly attempt to allow guests to check in early if rooms are available, however during busy times this is not always able to occur. Please feel free to contact me directly when you are planning your return visit as it would by my pleasure to assist with rates and reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: Ace Little Place. The Pool Makes This Hotel A Tropical Retreat By Itself! The Rooms Are Nicely Decorated - But To Unfortunately Make The Review Lose Its Halo, The Bathrooms Were Slightly Cramped And It Was Incedibly Motely (Despite Being The Candy Cane INN) Really Close To Disneyland And With Anaheim Being A Nice Place It Ups Its Shine. Really Good Stay.  Thankyou Candy Cane Inn!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking time to share your thoughts with fellow travelers. We do appreciate your comments and business. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Nice people, great location and thanks for returning what we left behind
Summary: This was our second trip to Disneyland and we had originally planned to stay in one of the Disney onsite hotels. But then some friends who visit Disneyland every year told us we would be just about as close and pay a lot less if we stayed at the Candy Cane Inn, so we took their word for it and decided to stay here. It was a good decision. The staff were welcoming and very helpful, the flowers were lovely, the rooms while not luxurious were spotless and quite comfortable, the breakfast was fine, and Disneyland was so close I'm not sure why anyone would take the shuttle unless they had mobility problems. The customer service continued after we got back home, too. A few days after we arrived home one of our sons belatedly realized he had left his electronic reader behind, so we
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your comments with fellow travelers. Danilo, our Housekeeping Manager does a wonderful job in assisting guests with items left behind. He takes pride in personally assisting guests, packaging and ensuring the prompt mailing of belongings. His attention to detail certainly carries over into the cleanliness and comfort of our facility that guest's such as yourself appreciate. We appreciate your business and I send my warm regards!

Summary: For two years, my family and I had considered traveling to Anaheim from the Midwest in order to see Walt’s original dream.  But, being faithful fans of Disney World, we were uneasy about "the shift"; yet, I wanted my family to have this experience, so we took the leap of faith, and are so glad that we did!   For each of the five times we stayed at Disney World, we always chose an on-site hotel; however, this was not an affordable option for us at Disney Land.  With Anaheim being the third stop on a 16 day trip, we had to choose something affordable; yet, we didn't want to sacrifice quality or leave the "Disney Magic" behind each time we returned to our hotel.  Thankfully, I came across the Candy Cane Inn via Trip Advisor, and felt confident that it would be the right choice for
Manager Response: I am delighted that you took "the leap of faith" and visited the Disney Theme Parks and the Candy Cane Inn. We do appreciate your business and the time you took to write such a detailed review for fellow travelers. We do attempt to provide a clean, comfortable and friendly environment with the budget of our guest's in mind. Thank you again for allowing us to be of service!

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Candy Cane!
Summary: My husband and I booked a room at this hotel based on all the good reviews on here, and I have to say people were right! We are from Phoenix and were in Anaheim for Disneyland for the long 4th of July weekend. We originally had a reservation set up at the Hilton on Convention Way, but as soon as we read about how they charge $15 a day for parking, we said forget it and decided to stay here instead, which was the best thing we could have done. There's no charge for parking and no hidden charges anywhere at all. We arrived very early in Anaheim at approx. 7am. We knew our room wasn't ready yet so we asked for a parking pass, left the car at the hotel and went to Disneyland for half the day and came back around noon. By this time we were very exhausted after driving all night and
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing valuable feedback regarding your recent visit. First and foremost I want to personally and sincerely apologize for the unfortunate incident with your heater. Like in our home, if not used often will create that unpleasant odor when turned on and the smoke alarm is that added bonus, and for that I am so very sorry. We do have a preventative maintenance program that our Housekeeping team "cycles" the units, and your comments has caused us to re-evaluate and increase this frequency. I am delighted that James was able to allow you to check-in early and yes, you are correct we have NO hidden or added charges.

Summary Heading: Excellent Choice For A Disneyland Trip
Summary: Took my family to Disneyland for a couple days and we chose this hotel for the great reviews and the location. We wanted to stay where we would park the car and walk or take the shuttle. The free shuttle worked out great, making trips to Disneyland every 30 minutes. There are also several nice restaurants about a block away, within easy walking distance for all of us.  The rooms were nice, not too fancy but what you would expect for this type of hotel. We stayed on the second floor of the south side of the hotel and were able to see the Disneyland fireworks from our room (with some obstruction). All of the hotel staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful.   My only complaint (and it's fairly minor) is that the continental breakfast was only open from 7am-9am. It would
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity and staying with us on your recent Disneyland Trip. Yes, our location is convenient in regards to walking to the theme parks and nearby dining options. We attempt to be flexible and allow guests in early on "Magic Mornings" and take a softer approach in making guest's feel rushed at 9:00 am however we will certainly take your recommendation into consideration. We look forward in seeing you again and feel comfortable to contact me directly with any questions you may have on rates or availability. Kind regards!

Summary: My family and I stayed at the Candy Cane Inn June 8-12 while visiting Disneyland.  We arrived around 11:00 a.m. so our room was not ready.  The front desk gave us a parking pass for our rent car and told us the general vicinity of where our room would be.  We were off to Disneyland and didn't return until after 8:00 pm.  The front desk clerk, Ryan, was very helpful in checking us in and our room was right by where we parked.  Our room was plenty big enough for the four of us.  Housekeeping did a great job of leaving plenty of towels each day and restocking the toiletries.  Breakfast was fine but we wish there had been bigger trays to carry it back to our room.  (We used the two small ones from the room each day.)  The walk to Disneyland is very pleasant and surprisingly short.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we appreciate you sharing the experience with other travelers. We do attempt to allow early check whenever possible; however with busy summertime travel and requests this is not always available. I am delighted to know that our front desk agent gave you guidance on parking to better assist you with luggage and utilizing your vehicle. Please feel free to contact me directly when returning as it would be my pleasure in assisting with reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Beware  -  Could end up in the worst room on the property
Summary: After booking this room 7 months in advance (deluxe room) we arrived from a long flight to find that our room was  at the back of the hotel next to the service room with the window looking out on a brick wall (felt like a prison cell) on entering the room we found alot of mossies which appeared to be coming from the bins next to the service room.  After returning to reception was told that was all there was even though I had booked 7 months in advance.  Staff not helpful and they were fully booked so didn't seem to care.  Needless to say we left and moved one block down to the Sheraton thoroughly recommed this hotel brillant staff and rooms for only slightly more money.  The only thing the Candy Cane did right was not charge us for the room.   Beware you can not book specific
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with your feedback as we do listen to our guests.  We are a property with exterior corridors and built in a "U" shape. Therefore out of our 171 guestrooms there are 4 rooms that are located in the rear corners. The Candy Cane Inn does pride itself with clean and comfortable accommodations and all of our guestrooms are of the same quality. The needs and requests of travelers will vary from guest to guest and we do our best to accommodate all requests. I am sincerely sorry that due to the time of your arrival we were unable to relocate you to a different room until the following morning. Thank you again for your feedback and rest assured this has been discussed with our management team to better serve future guests.

Summary Heading: Clean, quiet and with a very pretty garden
Summary: We did NOT go to Disneyland. Stayed here as a stoppover before going on into LA.  The rooms were Motel style. 2 story block with one room under and one room over. Formed in a U shaped block with the central part of the U creating Reception, a room where breakfast is served and a nice shady pool, jacuzzi and smal toddlers play pool. Pool towels were supplied and the pool was well kept, clean and heated. Lots of chairs and loungers. These were removed for breakfast so you could eat by the pool and then put back again after breakfast was finished. The surrounds were lovely. Flowers and trees. Plenty of room to park your car. The whole site was very quiet. No road noise and the rooms were big enough. They were all very clean. Rooms had all the usual stuff, fridge, coffee maker, hair
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and providing your feedback about our property and amenities. We do appreciate your comments and while we do practice "green" policies in regards to changing linens, washing guestroom glassware and ceramic cups we need to be cognizant of breakables anywhere close to the pool.  Safety and security of our guest's and little one's is our number one priority however, we certainly take your comments to heart. Warm regards!

Summary: We arrived 1 hour prior to the 3 pm check in time. Our room was not ready.  The woman at the desk said we needed to wait 1 1/2 hours.  She said we could wait by the pool.  At 3 pm I returned to the check in desk and a nice man named James said our room wasnt ready, but he found us another room, checked us in.  We were also inquiring on the name of a pretty flower we had seen, he didn't know the name, but looked it up on line and printed out the info on it for us, which was very nice of him.  The room was clean, beds comfortable.  Nice to have a fridge in room, would have been nice to have a microwave also.  The grounds are decorated beautifully and well maintained.  Never saw any trash on ground.  Quiet, no trouble sleeping.  The breakfast buffet was poor.  Not any protien
Manager Response: Thank you for finally allowing us the opportunity of having you as our guest. I am so sorry that you had to wait for your room however, after checking your dates of stay we were full house. With so many repeat guests and our desire to honor as many requests as possible it often becomes a complex puzzle. I am delighted that James, being the gentleman that he is took time to move rooms to accommodate you. We have recently added yogurt to our Expanded Continental Breakfast to assist in providing protein and it has been well received. As far as microwave ovens, they are in our premium rooms and one is available 24/7 in our breakfast room for guest's convenience. Thank you again for your business, we do appreciate it. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Great stay but attention to detail overlooked.
Summary: This was our first hotel we stayed in for our trip to the USA. After a long 20 plus hours plane trip from Australia with 3 children we finally landed in LA ready to embark on our wonderful first stop...Disneyland. We booked the Candy Cane purely from the recommendations from traveler’s reviews on Trip Advisor. My husband notified Candy Cane that we will need an early check in as we would be arriving around 11am. They promised us they would do their best etc so we were happy with that, nothing was going to spoil our holiday. When we arrived, the front desk lady told us there was no early check in but they could store our bags for us. The wait would be 2 hours and to come back then! OK, so here we are, a baby in a pram, 2 other children and told to go away and come back in the
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I do appreciate your feedback on the less that hospitable service you received from our front desk agent. While I sincerely apologize for this young lady, who is no longer with us, I do thank you for being grateful in mentioning the many others who were friendly and helpful. Also, thank you for responding to my message and providing me information regarding the dates of your stay last August. Even with time passing feedback enables us to train and work with the team to improving guest service and satisfaction. Kind regards!

Summary Heading: No Worries at the Candy Cane
Summary: Other than being puzzled by the name, we found nothing to complain about at the Candy  Cane Inn.  The property is very pretty, with flowers everywhere.  The exterior palette is peach and teal (reminds me of Key West) and the interiors are "tropical" with big prints and soft colors.  Fixtures are old, but clean.  We paid the extra $10 per room and thought this was a good buy--our room was bigger than our travel mates, with more storage room and a modern air condititioner.  The pool and hot tubs were clean and not crowded.  Daily breakfast was well done--juices, coffee, rolls, cereal, yogurt and fruit.  There is a shuttle, but it's not a time saver, just a step saver.  Really, you can walk to Disney faster than the shuttle can get you there due to having to make a U turn to get
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the pleasure of having you as our guest on your recent trip to the theme parks. Yes, our Deluxe Rooms are $10 more per night and the added square footage is nice if you are traveling with more "stuff". The addition of yogurt to our Expanded Continental breakfast has been very positive. Our Exclusive Complimentary Shuttle does save the legs after a long day walking and children get excited as it is their first "ride of the day". Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Great location, a 'pleasure' at the end of a busy Disney Day !
Summary: This is a great hotel interms of location (10mins to Disney Gates by foot) and also offers a tranquil, fragrant escape with a great pool and a fantastic complimentary breakfast.I Its an easy walk to nearby pizza place (delivery and takeaway) a well stocked 7-Eleven and  lots of other dining experiences.   Rooms are a good size (we had 2x queens and a travel crib for our youngest and the fridge also came in handy.  A lovely pool, plenty of loungers and my children loved the 'paddling pool' which meant I could totally relax in the sun.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience with fellow travelers. Yes, our location lends itself to numerous dining options and shopping for gifts, necessities or those forgotten items. Our heated pool, spa and children's wading pool are certainly a hit with the little ones. Thank you again and we do appreciate your comments and business!

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Inn - Best Hotel Experience!!!
Summary: - Wonderful continental breakfast we ever had! - Very clean property and rooms! - 10 minute walk to Disneyland with kids. - A nice place to relax for the day between Disneyland Parkhopper days. - I would recommend to anyone that travels to Anaheim - Plan to go again next May 2011!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your nice comments with other travelers. Please feel free to contact me personally when planning your next visit as it would be my pleasure to assist with reservations. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Convenient. Friendly staff. Small improvements needed.
Summary: I booked a room @ the Candy Cane Inn for my 40th birthday (I gave them this detail upon reserving the room online and also when I confirmed it on the phone 2 days before I arrived). Stayed on my own as family who live in So Cal met me @ Disney to celebrate. The bed linens were clean, bathroom was clean, there was enough comfortable space for someone who is going to be out alot at the parks (which I was!). Staff was very friendly and answered my questions with a smile. They also allowed my family member to park there on a guest pass while we went to Disney on my birthday. Thanks, guys! They didnt do anything special for me for my birthday as in other reviews I had read about people getting birthday cookies etc.  I was given room 157, which was in the rear of the property even
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with feedback regarding your stay. We certainly learn from guest comments and strive to make improvements to better our service and hotel. I would like to wish you a belated birthday and am sincerely apologetic that our front desk team overlooked the comments noted in your reservation about your special day and your knee. I have attempted to reach you by telephone and left you a message as I like to personally reach out to discuss our service opportunities. Items such as a microwave oven, DVD player are in our Premium Rooms and you reserved a Standard Room. Please feel free to contact me directly when you are returning and I would be delighted to assist with reservations. Warm regards and I wish you a wonderful year ahead!

Summary: This was the second time we have stayed at the Candy Cane Inn. We will never stay at another hotel when we visit Disneyland. Much of the staff is the same as two years ago and they are all nothing but spectacular. Very run place that is clean, friendly, and close to Disneyland. By far the best manicured grounds around, almost like not leaving Disneyland! These people take pride in what they do!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us again and we do appreciate your comments about our team and grounds. We do take pride in our property and providing a memorable guest experience. Thank you again and please feel free to contact me directly when returning as I would be delighted to assist with reservations. Warm regards!

Summary: Great hotel, not fancy, but had everything we needed including in-room frig.  We went to see Disneyland, not spend a great deal of time in the room.  Beds were comfy, vanity located outside bathroom.  Kids enjoyed the pool.  I liked the included breakfast for us but would like yogurt or some protein but since there is a frig in the room I can add that myself.  This hotel provides great value for the dollar.  10 minute walk (honest) to the Park.  Hotel has its own shuttle to the park every 30 min but you can walk it just as fast.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to the theme parks. I am so sorry that you were a few days early as we have added yogurt to our Expanded Continental Breakfast as of last Thursday. We are currently testing this value added addition as guests have made comments regarding the including of protein and we strive and enhance our product.

Summary: My 11 year old sister and I stayed in April 2010, we arrived after check in time around 5 and was given a room straight away. Unfortunately our request for the 2nd floor was not fulfilled and there must've been a group of teenagers staying upstairs because it constantly sounded like elephants running above us! To our joy they checked out the next morning. My suggestion is try to request the 2nd floor, if you are a light sleeper the sound of footsteps might annoy you. Another minor issue was our closeness to the pool.. there were kids swimming and screaming at 11pm at night! Who lets their kids swim so late?! The room was big enough for the 2 of us, and my little sister loved having her own double bed which she said was quite comfy. There was a older style TV in the room which
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback. We are a family hotel and, yes children can be loud and sometimes not as thoughtful as one would like as our pool is open from 7 am to 11pm. We have security on property overnight every night to monitor peace and quietness and ask you call if a fellow guest is not considerate of noise being made.  When we book groups we put together with an equal number of rooms up and down to eliminate any inconvenience of others, and require they have chaperones. Again, thank you for your comments and I am happy you enjoyed your visit. Warm regards!

Summary: In all five nights of our stay there was only one young lady that worked at the front desk that was friendly and helpful with our questions. The gentleman that was at the front desk most all days acted as though we were bothering him every time we were in the office. One night we stopped in the office on our way back from DL to see what snacks they had for purchase in the gift shop and the two working the front desk never came out of the office to see if they could assist us. The staff working on maintenance, landscaping and shuttle transportation was friendly and way more helpful than the front desk staff.  We had a Premium Deluxe room and upon our arrival noticed right away that the bathroom had not been cleaned properly and had to have the cleaning staff clean the toilet. The
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I sincerely appreciate the time you took to personally speak with me regarding your visit and items you noted. Feedback is a valuable tool and I have physically spoken with our leadership team on the in-depth conversation you and I had. We clearly missed the mark and did not take advantages provided to recapture your confidence and for that I am disappointed. I do thank you for the positive comment about Kari, our newest front desk agent and other employees around the property. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Very nice staff, close to disneyland, and free breakfast.....AWESOME!!
Summary: I loved this hotel not only because it was a short walk to Disneyland, but also because of the free breakfast in the morning.  They had cereal, bagels, toast, coffee, juice, fruit.  It was nice to know that we didn't have to buy breakfast in the morning and saved us a lot of money.  The staff was very friendly.  If you are looking for a fancy hotel this is not for you.  It has the basic hotel rooms and a little pool.  However, if you are looking for a good clean hotel near Disneyland on a budget then check this place out.  I would stay here again in a second, nothing bad to say about the Candy Cane Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us to be of service and staying at our Inn. We appreciate your taking the time to reflect on your stay and sharing with fellow travelers. Warm regards!

Summary: My husband and I go to Disneyland twice a year, and always stay here.  I can't say enough good thing about the staff, they  go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable.  The rooms are comfortable, a nice place to come back to at the end of the day.  Stepping out in the morning is like stepping into a garden; and the breakfast buffet is a nice touch.  We stay here every time we go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and your positive comments about our property and service. We appreciate your loyalty and please feel free to contact me personally should you need reservations assistance on your next visit. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Inn does not nickel-and-dime your pocket
Summary: What the Candy Cane Inn does not do is nickel-and-dime you to death!  For many years my family has visited and enjoyed the experience of their free breakfast, free parking and free shuttle.  The atmosphere is both friendly and tranquil.  After researching other places near DL, we have never found a place better than the Candy Cane!  Thank you to James at the front desk, Robert for driving and everyone for all their services.  We will see you all again soon!
Manager Response: Thank you for your continued patronage and being a loyal return Candy Cane Inn guest. We do appreciate your comments and certainly believe in no hidden fees or charges and only charge room and tax for our guestrooms. James, Robert and the entire team certainly deserve the kudos and thank you for mentioning this. Warm regards!

Summary: Stayed here April 9-13.  We wanted somewhere close to Disneyland that had gotten good reviews.  The rooms were comfy, but small.  My only complaints about the room were that the left door to the TV armoire wouldn't stay open when watching TV.  I had to put a towel over the top edge to keep pressure on the door.  They advertise free Wi-Fi.  I couldn't pick up a signal we either my laptop or my Itouch.  I even took both devices to the breakfast area and coudn't pick up a signal.  Either the Wi-Fi was broken or it's a piece of crap!  It was about a 10-15 minute walk to the Disneyland entrance.  It wasn't a bad walk in the morning, but it seemed a longer walk at night when we were exhausted!  The free breakfast was average, but good.  We didn't use the pool, but there were always
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us with your valuable feedback, it is most appreciated and we do listen. Guest comments allow us the opportunity to make necessary modifications and I am truly sorry that you experienced the items you noted. We constantly monitor our internet access to ensure the most reliable internet access possible.  We also partner with computer service professionals who are routinely on property to maintain our information systems.  If any anytime guests have connectivity problems, we encourage them to please feel free to speak with our Front Desk for assistance. Thank you again and please contact me directly for reservations assistance in the future.

Summary: My kids and I loved this hotel! The beds were very plush and comfortable. Being in walking distance to restaurants, stores, and shops, the hotel is in a great location. The breakfast was very plentiful and did not require us to go elsewhere. Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity of having you as our guests. Yes, our location is quite accessible to the Theme Parks, Anaheim GardenWalk and the Anaheim Convention Center. I do appreciate your kind comments about or beds, expanded continental breakfast and our team of service professionals. Warm regards!

Summary: We  had booked 3 nights to "do" Disney at the end of our road trip, but we were stranded in LA for several days due to the ash cloud in Europe. Staying here signifcantly helped our stress levels, nothing was too much trouble for the staff (James, you are a gem) and we soon regarded it as our refuge in an uncertain world. An absolutely brilliant choice for a family, big room, free breakfast, REALLY warm pool, laundry room, and yes it really is walking distance to Disney - we couldn't believe people were getting on the free shuttle - it took longer to get on it and park than to walk along the road! Brekkie is basic but you can eat as much as you like, my husband used to take the tray from the room and load up with bagels and coffee and bring it back to the room. Top choice - go
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and I am happy that you and your family arrived home safely. James is our "Ambassador" and does a wonderful job in assisting guests and making them feel at home. Thank you again for your comments as we do appreciate them. Warm regards!

Summary: We arrived at the Candy Cane Inn around 10;am after a long flight from Aust, check in was supposed to be in  the afternoon but they gave us a room early for our convenience. My first inpression was Excellent. Clean right next door to Disneyland, only a short walk to the Entrance. The room was beautiful clean and roomy enough for a family of four. We had room 140 down the back on ground level. The Manager sent us a personal card and cookies the day we arrived which was a lovely surprise. The beds and linen was excellent same with the towells. Our rooms were made up each day which was great. We had comfortable beds so we all slept really well. The bathroom was big enough clean and there was a basin large mirror outside the bathroom. We also had a hair dryer and little fridge. The
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experiences with fellow readers. We strive to be a very clean and comfortable property with a major emphasis on service and ambiance. Please feel free to contact me directly when making future travel plans as I would be delighted to assist.

Summary: We stayed there only one night and was a last minute decision. We called and they had a room available. We have stayed here 4 times in the last 2-3 years and were really confident that we weren't going to let us down. It's very nice knowing that when we want to visit Disneyland that the Candy Cane will be up to their standards every time.   There were two small issues we had that we must not have known about before. After a long day in the park I wanted to come back and catch up on some of the headlines in the days sports and found out that there was no ESPN. And we needed a toothbrush and toothpaste and they were more than the little store next to the hotel.   But checking in was awesome and we were checked in as people were eating their continental breakfast at 9AM so they
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great stay & just 10 min walk to Disneyland gate!
Summary: We just returned today (4/30/10) from Disneyland and had a wonderful time, largely due to this lovely little hotel. Four adults & one 4-year old child in our family group with 2 adjoining premium rooms on the 2nd floor, which was very convenient for us. The grounds were beautifully landscaped & very charming.. it felt like a cozy Inn in Carmel, CA. The rooms were clean & beds AND pillows were very comfy. Both rooms were very quiet. If you go, request a room as far off the street as possible, as this likely cuts down on outside noise. It was quiet inside the building too= we couldn't hear people or plumbing/noise coming from other rooms. The hotel is situated on same side of street as theme parks, so no crossing to get there.  Our granddaughter loved the pool, which is small but
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity of having you as our guests. I do appreciate your comments about the property as our gardeners and the housekeeping team do an outstanding job in keeping the property cozy, clean and charming. Yes, the fact that you do not have to cross any main streets is helpful and extremely safe. Thank you again for your business as we do appreciate it!

Summary: Visiting Disneyland with my three year old (from New Zealand). The location and value of the Candy Cane Inn can't be beat. Friendly, helpful staff, lovely landscaped property including large and baby pools. Shuttle or walk to the Disney property. Completely pleasant stay...highly recommend!
Manager Response: I am delighted that you enjoyed your visit and our property. We do appreciate your comments and business. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Wonderful staff, excellent location for Disneyland.
Summary: I stayed at the Candy Cane Inn with my two children in April, 2010 for three nights. It was absolutely wonderful. The room was clean, the beds were extremely comfortable (great after a long day in the parks...) and the staff at the front desk, the breakfast dining room, and in the pool and gardens were friendly and helpful.  There is plenty of counter space and storage around the sinks and I was happy to have a refrigerator.   We appreciated that the hotel is only a five minute walk to the entrances of the parks. There are no busy roads to cross so it is an easy walk with little ones and strollers. We did take the shuttle a couple of times and the drivers were sweet with updates on the weather and park and attraction hours.  The continental breakfast was served on the patio by
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your feedback to fellow travelers. The Candy Cane Inn has been continually owned and operated by the same family for over 53 years. We do believe in establishing and continuing lasting and meaningful relationships with families as they grow and grow over time. That is one reason that you see many of the same faces year after year and we continue to stay focused on the basics that our guests have grown to enjoy. We sincerely appreciate your business and recommendations to family and friends.

Summary: Our stay at the Candy Cane Inn was very enjoyable.  The premises are clean and well maintained. Breakfast by the pool was very filling and includes cereal, toast, bagels and a range of fresh fruit. The location of the hotel was excellent being a 10 minute flat walk to Disney and a shuttle runs every every half hour and has friendly drivers. There is an ABC next door to stock up on drinks and snacks. Its also a short walk to the Anaheim Plaza and Cheesecake Factory.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I am delighted that you enjoyed your visit. Our location is very convenient with shopping next door and across the street. The Anaheim GardenWalk with the many dining choices is a wonderful addition and a short 5 min walk.

Summary Heading: Just the right Inn for our family's Disneyland vacation!
Summary: We spent 3 nights at the Candy Cane Inn recently and enjoyed it immensely.  The rooms were spotless and the staff was friendly and attentive.  Carla was especially helpful with our reservation and was able to provide the adjoining rooms that we requested.  We booked the premium rooms this time and really appreciated the timely breakfast delivery.  The beds were soft and comfortable.  The grounds are well-maintained and lovely with the beautiful flowers everywhere.  Our family has been coming to the Candy Cane Inn since the early 1960s and we look forward to staying here again when we next visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for being a loyal long time member of the Candy Cane Inn family of return guests. It would be my pleasure in assisting you with your reservations and feel free to contact me directly. Thank you again and warm regards!

Summary: I recently booked a trip to Disneyland for 6 Family Members. We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn, bottom floor, upgraded rooms. It was a great location, friendly staff, and the rooms were spacious and clean. I have read reviews regarding the bed, and yes in my room one of the beds was leaning towards the floor and you had to get right in the middle to keep from rolling out. My whole family had a great time and we had 3 rooms right in a row. We alternated between walking to Disneyland and taking advantage of the Shuttle when our legs would no longer would carry us! We took our bathing suits, but never had the opportunity to use the pool. We ordered breakfast each morning, and it is simple but adequate. One morning I did not receive my paper and one room received someone else order,
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and providing comments regarding your stay and your observations. We certainly listen to our guests and investigate concerns and make product or service adjustments when necessary. The voice of the guest is extremely important to the success of any business and one cannot be short sided and let fall on deaf ear. We do appreciate your business and comments.

Summary Heading: The Candy Cane provided an excellent base for a short trip to Disneyland.
Summary: The Candy Cane hotel was comfortable, clean and very convenient for Disneyland. The rooms were a good size for a family of 4 on a short stay, with all the in room amenities you needed. The breakfasts were simple but filled you up and the heated pool was a real bonus. You could either walk to Disney (and the local shops/restaurants) or get the shuttle bus. Finally, the staff were all very helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your feedback about our property. We aspire to be a family property that is clean, comfortable and cozy while providing exceptional guest service at a moderate price point. Our location is also exceptional and a short walk to almost anything you need while visiting the theme parks.

Summary Heading: Exceptional Inn...Friendly Staff, Clean Rooms and Great Service.
Summary: I stayed at the Candy Cane Inn in April 2010 and will for sure stay there again. The front desk staff (especially Jessica who I spoke with most of the time)  were attentive, friendly and very accomodating. I was traveling with other family members and our rooms were quite far apart and the room they originally gave me was a little islolated. I was not feeling particularly comfortable about having to walk back to it alone at night, so I inquired about getting a room closer to the rest of my family. They were very accomodating, even though they were near full that night . They immediately moved a few things around and got me a room right next door to the rest of my family. I appreciated them going the extra mile as it made my stay much more comfortable. The breakfast in the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we look forward in seeing you on your next trip. Jessica is wonderful addition to our front desk team and is so pleasant in assisting guests. We do attempt to honor all requests and please feel free to let our reservationist know of any you have while making your reservation. You also have a place to note this if making reservations on line and these comments are reviewed by our teams. Please feel free to contact me directly when making reservations as I would be delighted in assisting. Warm regards!

Summary: Our family and friends really enjoyed staying at the Candy Cane Inn.  The rooms were very clean.  The grounds are well taken care of, including the pool and hot tub.  Very close to Disneyland.  We also ordered Pizza in one night from Marri's, it was delicious.
Manager Response: Thanks to you and your friends for staying with us and I am delighted that you enjoyed your visit. Our staff does a great job in maintaining the property and I appreciate your comments. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Too soft bed and if-y maintenance offset great location
Summary: Candy Cane really tries on a number of fronts and it shows. First, it is CLEAN, and the housekeeping staff clearly work hard and are very organized bustling around in the AM. Second, the grounds are pretty and also immaculate. Breakfast is helpful to have provided, and the breakfast room staff is SO nice and helpful. The room decor had been recently updated but there's no getting around the fact that this is an Anaheim strip-style motel. And yes, the location is great, truly a few minutes walk to Disney.  I really wanted to like Candy Cane better given it's loyal following but a number of things detracted significantly, which I'd expect when paying a bunch more than $100/night in Anaheim. The beds are too soft. When we asked for a room with a firmer bed front desk explained that
Manager Response: First and foremost I want to sincerely apologize that you did not receive the 1st floor room as requested or information on our beds. We do attempt to honor all requests and our double pillow top mattresses are so thick that a bed board will not help as with a more traditional mattress. I have sent you an email to see if I could obtain more information, however I am leaving on vacation and wanted to be considerate and respond. Thank you for staying with us and providing this valuable feedback.

Summary Heading: A hotel with charm, location and a guy named Edd!
Summary: This was our third time to stay at the Candy Cane Inn.  It is a charming inn within a short walking distance of Disneyland.  Each time we stay, we find a friendly, capable staff to greet us, a clean room at a great price (including continental breakfast!), and an amiable shuttle bus driver to get us in and out of Disneyland when we are too tired to walk the short distance home from the park.  What more can you ask for?  The best part of staying at the Candy Cane Inn is when you get the privilege of spending a little time with Edd, the breakfast host, whose job it is to make you feel like you are a personal guest of the inn.  He is well-versed in all things Disney with a particular affinity for Ms. Tinkerbell. We simply wouldn't stay anywhere else, we feel too much a part of the
Manager Response: Thank you for continuing to stay with us at our Inn. Edd is a special person who has been here over 24 years and his friendly manner continues to win over guests year after year. The Candy Cane Inn is home away from home for many guests and we are happy to have you as a member of our family!

Summary Heading: Convenient for Disney and shops and restaurants
Summary: This hotel is located on the same road as Disneyland, and is walkable distance to this attraction although the hotel runs a complimentary shuttle service up until quite late at night.  Another advantage is its proximity to a shopping mall with a number of well known restaurants eg Bubba Gumps, Cheesecake Factory, Ihop etc. Again, easy to walk to if you don't have a car or don't want to drive.  There is a useful supermarket next door for essentials such as water and juice. The hotel itself is a pleasant surprise from the usual chains that are around this area.  On two levels, with (free) car park in front, it does at first glance look like a typical motel.  However, the service we received was much more personable and friendly than I have experienced at motels.  The receptionist
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us to opportunity and staying with us on your recent visit. We do appreciate guest feedback as this valuable information assists us in making modifications to products and service. We continually work with our service provider in the improvement of our WIFI connectivity and I thank you for your comments. In closing, I sincerely apologize for the tardiness of your breakfast delivery and will certainly share your comments with our team. Warm regards!

Summary: We spent 3 nights at the Candy Cane Inn and absolutely loved it.  The staff was exceptionally helpful, answering all our questions before they were asked.  A 10 minute walk to Disneyland and CA Adventure, and 5 more to downtown Disney.  We splurged on the Deluxe Room, and it was worth it.  With little kids, the extra room helped greatly, and the breakfast delivery is the best.  Also, you get a 2pm checkout time, so you can freshen up before hitting the road.  I can't imagine ever staying anywhere else.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and recognizing our team of service professionals. It is nice to know that you enjoyed the services and amenities of your Premium room. Warm regards!

Summary: Our family recently returned from a 7 day visit to the Candy Cane Inn.  Another great visit.  The pool and hot tub were much fun.  I liked that the pool was very warm as it was only in the low 50's at night.  The breakfast was great and helped us get to the parks early each day.  Housekeeping did an excellent job each day with our room.  The entire place is very clean and has excellent maintenance.  The place looks brand new even thought I think that it is 40 - 50 years old.  Cost a few more $ than HoJo but the breakfast is worth at least $30/day for our family so I think that it balances out.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted that you and your family enjoyed your visit. Yes, we do keep our pool, spa and kiddie pool heated year round for guest comfort. We do aspire to provide the best value to all our guests. We look forward in seeing you again on your next visit.

Summary: My 6yo daughter and I traveled to Disneyland during Spring break and stayed at the Candy Cane Inn.  I primarily picked this hotel because of the free breakfast and the shuttle.  We booked a standard room which was on the small side but fine for just the 2 of us.  We were upstairs about 1/3 of the way back which was a great location.    The staff was very friendly, especially the shuttle drivers.  The breakfast was fine (cereal, bagels, pastries, oatmeal).  I would have loved to have yogurt to go along with this.  The shuttle was great - always on time and a life-saver going to/from parks.  The pool was heated which was great for that afternoon swim and rest break.     All in all it was a great stay and I would definitely go back.  They even gave me a voucher for a discount if I
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity of having you and your daughter as our guests. I do appreciate your kind comments regarding the friendliness of our drivers and staff. They all work very hard in providing exceptional service and enjoy being noticed. Yes, we do heat our pool, spa and kiddie pool all year for customer satisfaction. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need reservations assistance. Warm regards!

Summary: My friend and I stayed 3 nights and would definitely choose this hotel again.  The continental breakfast is very nice and there plenty of seating.  Our room was very comfortable and the location was great for visiting Disneyland.  Most of all we love the staff at the Candy Cane.  After leaving town, I discovered I left some electronics items in our room.  The staff mailed them to me!  So nice and so helpful!  This is a really great hotel!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I am delighted that you and your friend enjoyed our hotel. Danilo, our Housekeeping Manager does a wonderful job with lost and found and I thank you for recognizing him and other members of our team. Warm regards!

Summary: We stayed 8 days at the Candy Cane Inn while visiting Disney.  Great location, 10 minute walk to the gates, or there is a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes.  The free breakfast got us through the mornings.  The room was big enough that the 4 of us didn't want to kill each other by the end of our stay.  Shuttle staff and Front Desk staff were very helpful.  My kids loved the heated pool, and we ended every night there.  We rented a car to visit some other locations, and the hotel gives free parking which can't be said for other hotels in the area. Great for families on a budget.  Only recommendation is to get a clock outside in the pool area, we tended to lose track of time every night.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and sharing your feedback with other travelers. We do strive to give exceptional product, ambiance and service while at the same time staying focused price value. I thank you for your observation of a clock at the pool and will certainly discuss with the team. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need future reservations as it would be my pleasure to assist.

Summary: We have stayed at the Candy Cane numerous times and have always loved it...  However, we first checked in to a "non smoking" room that had an ashtray right outside next to our A/C vent.  We asked to be moved.  They moved us a few doors down.  (We were gone all day and only in the room at night).  Around 12am my daughters boyfriend awoke and used the toilet.  Awhile later we awoke to discover the toilet valve had stuck and flooded the bathroom and dressing area.  We were told they were full and they put towels down.  My husband stayed in the room the next day with our luggage as they dried the filthy carpeting (the wet towels were black when they took them up) out and we thought fixed the toilet.  Again late the second night, my husband got up to use the toilet and discovered it
Manager Response: Thank you so much for personally speaking with me regarding your recent visit. Open dialogue with a guest is something that I truly enjoy and learn from, then review with the team. I sincerely appreciate the valuable time you took to discuss service opportunities and your feedback and positive nature were simply delightful. We do appreciate the many times that you have stayed with us and I look forward in meeting you on your next visit.

Summary: This was our family's first visit to Disneyland and the Candy Cane Inn.  This hotel has a superb location just a short walk from Disneyland.  We were able to walk to Disneyland in less time than taking the Shuttle.  Our reservation was for a premium room the first night and a regular room the next two nights.  Upon check a premium room was available for all 3 nights so we stayed there.  The room was very clean and the refrigerator was a nice amenity.  The housekeeping service did a wonderful job in the room each day.  We had a number of questions for the front desk staff during our stay and each time their recommendations were spot on and made a friendly, helpful manner.  Our first night the Tooth Fairy needed to make a visit and the lady working the front desk was more than
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I am delighted that you enjoyed your first visit. I am pleased that our front desk associate was able to assist with the Tooth Fairy visit and enhance the little ones experience. I do agree that our location is wonderful in regards to the Theme Parks, shopping and dining alike. Please feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance with future reservations as it would be my pleasure to assist. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: I booked this hotel for its many great reviews and it was great!
Summary: I choose this hotel for our Disneyland stay after reading all the great reviews on TripAdvisor.  I was very happy that I had the same experience as most others who wrote reviews.  The room was perfect for what we needed it for which was pretty much to sleep, shower and change clothes.  The room and commons were clean, the breakfast was adequate with many options including fruit, oatmeal and wheat toast for those of us not on a donut diet, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the outdoor pool water was warm enough to swim in in March.  The free shuttle service was a foot saver.  The location isn't bad even if you end up walking to Disneyland.  All in all, we were very pleased with this hotel and would stay again our next trip.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for allowing us the opportunity and staying with us. Guest reviews certainly lend their experience and give us valuable feedback on areas to review and make necessary changes. I do listen to our guests and that is why I always take the comments posted here personal and with sincere substance. Warm regards!

Summary: My son and I decided to do a last minute trip to Disneyland. We were greatly disappointed when I tried to make a reservation at the Candy Cane Inn only to find there were no rooms available. So I booked rooms at another hotel. The day before departing I checked the website again and there was a cancellation so were able to stay at the Candy Cane Inn. We had an upgraded queen room at the very back of the hotel. The room was wonderful. We were able to walk to Disney and ride the shuttle back. Everything was clean, service was great, and the location could not be beat. We used to stay at different hotels based upon price when visiting Disney but have now become regulars at the Candy Cane Inn. In fact  this was our fourth or fifth multi-day stay in the past 18 months at the Inn.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and becoming a loyal Candy Cane Inn repeat guest. We do appreciate your business and please feel free to contact me personally with reservations. If we are sold out on dates you are looking for I would be delighted to watch our inventory and contact you should something come available. We look forward in seeing you on your next visit.

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn on recommendations of friends and from this site. I booked online, requesting 2nd floor room, and was pleasantly surprised to actually get it! We arrived in the evening and was pleased to note that we could see fireworks from our room. Room was standard and clean. All staff encountered were very friendly. Shuttle drivers seemed especially pleasant, and shuttles were on time (both coming and going to Dland). I felt this hotel was priced appropriately and hope they remain reasonable! I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to serve you and following the recommendation of your friends. We do try our best to accommodate any and all requests we have in advance. We look forward in seeing you again and rest assured we will remain reasonably priced while providing value. Warm regards!

Summary: This was our third time staying at this motel and we love it. We travel to the area all the time. For the last 10 years we have stayed at another neighboring motel and loved it, but after they changed names, they changed how they treated their customers so we searched for a new place to stay. We had heard so many great things about the Candy Cane that we decided to try it. We fell in love. The rooms are amazingly clean. One of the things that caught my attention the first day we stayed there was they were taking chairs out of the rooms and cleaning them outside then putting them back in the rooms. Every time we have stayed there, we have watched the employee's cleaning something...that says a lot for their standards. The only thing that I wished their rooms had were microwaves.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us for the past three visits. I appreciate and listen to guest feedback and sincerely care and respect your comments. The dialogue regarding your stay has been excellent and I look forward in seeing you again in September. Give my regards to that little 10 month old!

Summary Heading: Nicest place in walking distance to Disneyland
Summary: We have 5 kids and we take a trip from Utah to Disneyland each year in the early spring. We like to stay within walking distance. We like to come back in the evening and go for a swim. We like to have a microwave and a fridge in the room so we can have our own food.  We have stayed at most of the hotels within walking distance to Disneyland, and this is the nicest place  by far. The grounds are immaculate, the rooms are quiet. The beds are soft, the pool is warm. (really warm - the air temp was in the 50s and it was still very comfortable to go for a swim).  The staff is nice.  We got two rooms this time, right next to each other, and it worked out wonderfully.   We bought our own food, thinking that the free breakfast would be like all the others, and not very appealing, but we
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience on your visit to our hotel. We do get many comments on the condition of our property and the fact that we maintain the pool to a comfortable temperature year around. We certainly feel that our expanded continental breakfast is delightful and rest assured all of our pastries and fruit are delivered fresh seven days per week. Please feel free to contact me directly when planning your next visit as it would be my pleasure to assist. Warm regards!

Summary: Stayed for 3 nights in a premium room which was worth the extra money. Got a AAA discount(also offer AARP). Noticed online that the price had gone down since I had booked. Called and was given the lower rate. Continental breakfast delivered to room was good. If you wanted more you could walk to breakfast room. Room has frig. and microwave. Walked to Disneyland one day, took less than 10 mins. Took the shuttle the next. Driver was very friendly and helpful. Very clean rooms and friendly staff. Close to restaurants. Gardenwalk Mall has a lot of good restaurants.  Free parking and internet access. We stayed at the San Diego Marriott and had to pay for both.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience with others. We do pride ourselves on having no additional charges for our expanded continental breakfast, our exclusive complimentary shuttle, parking or WIFI at our property. In these tough economic times I am proud to boast we have no hidden fees and will happily lower your rate if brought to our attention that we have reduced rates online.
