Worth it if you're in Anaheim for Disneyland (and let's face it; why the hell else would you be there?)
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your valuable feedback. Your observations are appreciated and I am disappointed that you found our service "offhanded". We will certainly discuss your comments in our front office meeting this week. Thank you again and warm regards!

Summary Heading: Great location - but don't use the Town Car service
Summary: We stayed 3 nights, 4 adults in a Delux Room, even though it had 40 square metres extra we thought the rooms were a little small but great location and excellent breakfast by the pool. We walked to Disneyland several times a day, literally less than 10 minutes. However when we left via Amtrak to LA. we asked reception to book us a cab but instead they booked a town car service. The company they use are a rip off. Firstly, they forgot our booking, then sent an old limo after we thought we had booked a cab van (or so we thought), which had to speed to make our train, as well as us having to nurse our luggage, We made the train but the $20 trip was only $10 in a cab when we arrived. Then driver was rude and didn't get a tip (first for me). Don't use the town car service, book a
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for staying with us and I appreciate your taking time to provide us with your valuable feedback. I sincerely apologize for the lack of genuine care and concern that you received and have started and will continue to research and handle your issue with the Town Car service. This in NOT acceptable and I thank you for bringing to our attention. Warm regards!

Summary: A girlfriend and I stayed here last year while on a trip for a special event at the park. At first I was a little hesitant due to the price but honestly, I wanted a change. I previously liked to stay at the Residence Inn due to their room size, price and buffet, but the my last two visits were sorely lacking. So, I sacked up and decided to try the Candy Cane out after reading so many positive reviews. A huge factor was the fact that I was also 8 months pregnant at the time of our visit.   I can tell you one thing, barring a HUGE family even that requires larger rooms, I will NEVER stay anywhere else if they continue to deliver on the service we recieved that week. The breakdown:  The staff:  SOOOOOO nice. The both of the people we worked with at the counter were super helpful
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us the opportunity during your recent Disneyland visit. I am delighted you enjoyed your stay and found our property clean and well maintained. The comments you made about our staff is warming and it is very nice that you noticed and made mention of their genuine care and concern. In regards to your comment regarding seating for our expanded continental breakfast, we have listened to guest's feedback and have added 12 Bistro Tables and 40 Chairs poolside. Thank you again for your business and please feel free to personally contact me for reservations assistance. Warm regards!

Summary: We have taken our four year old to Disneyland every year since she was born.  We have always stayed at the Camelot as it was so nice to be right across the street from the park.  This year we got fed up with their constant room rate increases and decided to try the Candy Cane Inn.  I am so thankful Camelot raised their prices or we would have never found this little gem of a motel.   Sparkling clean grounds, pool, and rooms.  The rooms are decorated in a way that make you feel like you are on a tropical vacation...light and airy.  Nice breakfast and non-stop shuttle service every half  hour, although we used the shuttle only once because we rather enjoed the short, scenic walk to the park.   To say the staff go above and beyond is an understatement.  We had spent sixty dollars
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us as well as sharing your thoughts and experience. I remember our conversation and am delighted that your little girl has been reunited with her bear. Do not forget to utilize your $10 Rewards Certificate for your stay next April and feel free to contact me directly for reservations assistance. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: My 3 year old Granddaughter gave it a thumbs up!
Summary: This is a great place to stay. Staff was great. Beds are comfy. We took the train there on our day to leave we waited and waited for the taxi,it was getting really close to the time we had to catch the train home. I told the staff and they decided that we had waited long enough and drove us to the train. It is just a short walk to Disneylands main gate. We are planning on going again this year. Guess where we will be staying?
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments and I do remember that morning when I asked one of our team to make sure you made your train. I would enjoy meeting your granddaughter on your upcoming visit and please feel free to contact me personally for reservation assistance. We do appreciate your feedback and the opportunity to serve our guests. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: 10 min walk to Disneyland but shuttle bus if your feet hurt, And a great place to stay too
Summary: Stayed here years ago, before the update,and yes there was candy canes by the driveway if you wonder about the name. They are gone now but not the fond memories of staying here with my family in the seventy's. Arrived early and expected to drop of my bags and head off to Disneyland, surprise! a room was available and we were checked in by the cheerful reception lady. Enjoyed the Breakfast by the pool. The quiet oasis of the inn  after a hectic day. The shuttle coming home when my feet  hurt. Although this hotel may look more expensive than hotels close by they offer   , A good breakfast, a shuttle to Disneyland every 30 min and  parking.   Other hotels may charge for these, check the fine print. Close are 2 good mini marts, food ,drinks eg. and not rip off prices. Across the the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us again...even after all these years and I am delighted that you have fond memories. You are correct in your comment regarding fine print. We do ask that all travelers compare room rates and taking into consideration what they are receiving. We charge room and tax period. No additional charges for our expanded continental breakfast, our own exclusive Disneyland shuttle, parking and we have no resort or any other such "fees". This is very important and I thank you for doing your homework. I do apologize for your safe not resetting and as you stated in addition to room safes we have safety deposit boxes at our front desk. Thank you and we do appreciate your business.

Summary: We stayed one night at the Candy Cane Inn and loved it, the room was large and the bed and pillows were so comfortable. The pool was warm and inviting and the breakfast was great. This is the hotel I will stay at every time I come to disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My sister and I did a "sister vacation" this year.  After spending the night on the train from Lacey, Washington, the bed was heaven.  I am handicapped, so we got a room close to the lobby.  The best convenience yet was the ABC store, and 7-11 stores right around the corner.  The staff was wonderful.  We always had a clean room.  I will be sure to stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I am very happy that you enjoyed your "sister vacation" this year. While mattresses are a very personal item, we do get many compliments regarding our Serta Presidential Suit Double Pillow Top mattresses.  Yes, the ABC Market and 7-11 store next door are convenient as is the addition of the Anaheim Garden Walk. Please feel free to contact me directly when you are planning your next visit as it would be my pleasure in assisting with reservations and do not forget your Rewards Certificate!

Summary: We spent two nights there last week.  The shuttle was very prompt both coming and going. With the hotel so close to the Disneyland Resort walking is a nice option too.  The room was neat and clean. The idea of the sitting areas on the verandas outside the rooms is great, but having a room near one if ou want to go to bed early or sleep late is probably a bad idea as the noise from the conversations tend to carry.  The continental breakfast was great with nice options and well stocked.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Candy Cane Inn. With our exclusive complimentary shuttle it's almost like getting on then getting off...but the ride home after a long day in the park sure is relaxing. This is another value added feature of our hotel as is our expanded continental breakfast. Yes, the verandas are nice to enjoy the outdoors and we do ask our evening guests to respect others desire to rest.

Summary: Wonderufl hotel.  Friendly stqaff, beautiful grounds, comfortable rooms, great breakfast.  Especially loved the option of walking to Disnyland or taking the shuttle.  Will definitely stay here again.  Thanks for a great stay.
Manager Response: I am very excited that you enjoyed your visit to our Inn and thank you for the generous comments. We do strive to be the best that we can be in our market. We are a moderately priced family hotel and work to give our guests "5" ratings everyday. Thank you again for your business as it is most appreciated!

Summary: The proximity to Disneyland is the main advantage of this hotel. The hotel is independently run and not a chain hotel, which is another good feature. We had a premium room, which is bigger than average. The premium rooms are located at the end of the hotel away from the street and are very quiet. The rooms were of a standard quality. Furnishings are average. I didn't like the vanity basin being in the bedroom, I prefer it in the bathroom. There were no blinds or curtains, only shutters & they let in a reasonable amount of light at night. There is a good parking area for cars and it is not confined. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus to Disneyland, which is a great help. The staff are pleasant and helpful. Value for money is reasonable.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we do appreciate your feedback as it assists us in improving our products and service. We are independently owned and are blessed that our owners are original and have been here for over 52 years. Their understanding and constant desire for providing quality is something that I (and I think I can speak for our staff) personally and professionally appreciate. Warm regards!

Summary: Comfortable and convenient hotel for Disneyland. Within walking distance to the park although they put on a shuttle service for the less mobile hotel guests. The hotel rooms are arranged in a courtyard style with plenty of parking. Small swimming pool which would be good for kids to splash around in after a long days queuing Room was very comfortable although felt as if you had to keep the blinds closed to get some privacy from the footpath outside the room door My view is slightly tarnished by my disillusionment with Disneyland but the hotel is good Reception staff came across as a little too plastic but perhaps that is a coping mechanism for dealing with the thousands of park goers
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I appreciate your comments. I would be interested in speaking with you regarding your experience with our reception staff. Comments like this are concerning and we never want to become complacent and non-caring of our guests or their happiness. Thank you again for your feedback and I will review this with our Front Office Manager and his team.

Summary Heading: So happy we booked our stay at the Candy CAne Inn
Summary: We stayed two nights at the Candy Cane Inn, in April 2009 and we could not have been happier!  We were traveling with a toddler and for our family of three the deluxe room was large enough.  (We also had an adjoining room with my parents).   Check in staff was friendly. Both rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained. Quiet  Nice and clean pool area.   Friendly shuttle drivers.   Less than a 10 minute walk to Disneyland. Their breakfast is great...dry cereal, instant oatmeal, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, orange juice, milk, bananas, oranges, muffins, toast, bagels, and pastries.  (I think I listed it all!) Another plus...right next door there is a ABC market and a 7-11. I would 100% recommend the Candy Cane Inn to friends and family!
Manager Response: Thank you giving us the opportunity to have you as our guests. Your comments are sincerely appreciated and I am happy that you enjoyed the services and ambiance of our Inn. Our staff do their very best to maintain a clean and well groomed property. We look forward in seeing you again and I would be delighted in assisting your family or friends personally. Warm regards!

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and extra friendly staff
Summary: We came straight from a long flight to the Candy Cane Inn and was greated by James who made us immediately feel welcome.  When asked he provided us with advice on tipping in America (we didn't want to get that wrong).  The Candy Cane Inn is about a 7min walk to the gates of Disneyland but still they offer a free shuttle bus that runs every half hour.  At first I thought ... why would you want a shuttle bus when you are so close, but trust me there is so much walking that you do during a day at Disneyland (or California Adventure) that you really appreciate the service of the free bus.  The Candy Cane Inn offered a free breakfast service that was excellent.  There was plenty of fresh fruit and a great selection of pastries / breads and cereals.  We never went hungry after
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and your kind comments. One of the most rewarding things a General Manager can receive is positive comments regarding their property and staff.  I sincerely appreciate when folks such as you take the time and reflect on a positive experience. I believe that we can give our staff the "bricks and mortar" but service comes from their hearts. Thank you so much for staying with us and also too think our staff is "top shelf"!

Summary: We booked a seven night stay at the Candy Cane and the hotel staff was very nice, the grounds was sparkling clean and the breakfast was good. I stayed in a room that was next to a room that was being redone. When we went back to the hotel to rest or to lay babies down I was unable to sleep because of the noise. I had a pretty hard time getting my welcome basket for booking a premium room. We paid alot more for three premium rooms and it just wasn't worth that much extra money for breakfast delivery. We did not use the other things offered (bath robes and a news paper) and the rooms are just normal rooms with a fridge and microwave put outside the bathroom. The turn down service was not worth paying the extra money also. We could have easily stayed in a Disney hotel for not much
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I sincerely apologize for your stay not being to your satisfaction. In reading this review I am not sure if you brought your concern of noise to our front desk and were offered to move? If you would like I would be delighted in speaking with you personally and working to restore your confidence in our hotel on your next visit. Thank you again for your feedback as this is valuable for us to improve our service. Warm regards!

Summary: The service at the front desk was excellent, we arrived an hour before check-in and the hotel staff had no problem letting us into the room.  Since the deluxe rooms were all booked, we got the regular room with two double beds. The room had a lot of character, was very clean, and even with a crib, we (5 of us!) still had room to move around.  Breakfast was a little crowded, but it was during spring break.  The food selection was perfect: cereal, oatmeal, bagels, pastries, coffee, juice, milk, and fruit.  The hotel is so close to the parks that my 4 year old twins and 2 year-old had no problem waking in the mornings.  We also took the shuttle a couple of times, especially on the way back, and it runs on-time all the time -with little kids this is a big plus!     I would
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Candy Cane Inn. I do appreciate your comments regarding your stay and our property. We do try and accommodate guests that arrive early and if the rooms are not ready you are free to park and utilize our complimentary exclusive shuttle to Disneyland. We also have our front desk staffed 24 hours per day and therefore you need not return before the park closes at night. Thank you again for your business and we appreciate your recommendations to family and friends!

Summary Heading: Very pleased -very honest with left items in room-very clean
Summary: We stayed at this hotel because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor.  We usually stay at the Disney owned theme parks but did not feel like paying those kind of prices.  What a great value this was. Very comfortable and very clean. Gorgeous grounds...my husband was a little leary of the name but there was definetely nothing cutsey about this place. Later in the day after it had been several hours after check out we realized that we had left some important items in the room (keys, nntendo, etc...) Sure enough the cleaning staff had found our items, turned in everything and the manger jumped right on it and returned our items to it...even without this event taking place I would of been writing a excellent reivew. Free internet-hands down beats the overpriced resort hotels, you
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us an opportunity and venturing away from the hotels in the park. We do pride ourselves on being honest and sincere in the treatment of guest's belongings. This is something that is extremely important and we investigate any and all comments received. I am very pleased to say that almost all times we receive a call later from the "embarrassed" guest that they found the item. In regards to cleanliness, this goes hand in hand with a seasoned housekeeping staff, in that they treat the property as their own. Thank you again for the business, it is most appreciated!

Summary: After reading many rave reviews we booked Candy Cane Inn for our family vacation.  This was a special trip.  Our son's Middle School Band was participating in Music in the Parks-a program where school kids play in the park and compete with other schools. Many Band Parents stayed at this hotel.  The room we booked was a Deluxe-supposed to be larger. I found our room adequate in size but not larger than a normal hotel room. Our room was 240 in a corner by the service supply room with no natural light. The pillows were foam- should have brought my own.  The worst part was we left our room everyday by 8 and wanted to take an afternoon break. Our room was never cleaned before 3:00.  The pool is nice. Grounds are gorgeous. We always walked to the park, but a shuttle is nice.  I feel
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to give us valuable feedback regarding your stay. Pillows are one of those personal items that are hard to satisfy all travelers. During our recent renovations we sampled various pillow types and purchased the one with favorable results. We continually strive to improve service and listen to our guest's comments and make necessary changes. Our housekeeping staff service rooms throughout the day until 4:30pm. I am very sorry if your room was not completed prior to 3:00pm and we are happy to perform these services early or at a specific time. Please simply contact the front desk and they will be delighted to inform our housekeeping team. Please feel free to contact me personally when you are returning and it would be my pleasure in upgrading you to one of our Premium rooms. Warm regards!

Summary: We were unable to get into another hotel that we had booked for 4 of our 5 nights in Anaheim.  My husband and I were celebrating a mile-stone birthday and wanted somewhere very nice to stay - we booked the Doubletree suites.  These are 2 different and equally suitable properties.  For families, groups and those with vehicles, the Candy Cane is the perfect choice.  Close to Disneyland, a reliable shuttle, a pool and continental breakfast are all positives.  I particularily like the closeness to the ABC Mart (good selection of wine and beer) and 7-11 (coffee and snacks) and area restaurants (Millies down the road).  The rooms are basic Motel 6 rooms that are very large and have all the amenities - tv, coffee, etc.  Our room was at the very end under a stairway and quite noisy when
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and I hope that your birthday celebration vacation was delightful. Your title is what we aspire to be..."A Perfect Family Motel". Delivering a quality product, giving our guests service that they come to expect and striving for all 5's while providing an ambiance that differs from our competitors. Thank you again for choosing us and we send you continued birthday wishes!

Summary Heading: Took a chance based on reviews and found it PERFECT!
Summary: We were very satisfied with our stay at the Candy Cane Inn. We were originally going to stay on the property as we have always done in the past, but decided to go with Candy Cane Inn based on the reviews and location.  The staff were very accommodating and friendly. We ran into trouble and our flight was canceled on the way home. The staff made it possible to stay an extra night and did not jack the price up in our time of need, much appreciated!  The inn is approximately a 7 min easy walk from the Disneyland entrance. Located next door to California Disney. Probably the closest place to stay off the property. It was on the same side of the street as the entrance so we did not have to cross over the busy intersection. Their free shuttle does run every 30 minutes.  The rooms were
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us the opportunity of being able to accommodate you on your recent vacation. It is with great pride that we were able to assist you in your time of need. Taking advantage of a traveler during these circumstances is not how we do business or build loyalty. We look forward to having you as a guest on a future visit. We do appreciate you staying with us.

Summary: As a Disneyland Annual Passholder, I have stayed in MANY hotels in the area, from posh to downright lousy. My lodging of choice, when available, is the Candy Cane Inn. I have stayed there 7-10 times, and my stays have always been exemplary.  The property is well maintained and charming, the rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, furniture and bedding is in good condition, and the continental breakfast is the best of any Disneyland-area motel. But before booking the Candy Cane, you must understand, this is a MOTEL. It is not the Hilton. It has two floors with exterior corridors. It just happens to be the nicest motel within walking distance of the park. There is a shuttle, though personally I prefer to walk. It takes 10 minutes to get to Disneyland's turnstyles. As I've said, I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Truly Classic Customer Service in a Classic Inn
Summary: My family (parents and young adults) stayed in the Inn during the Natural Products Expo, but was so surprised with the courtesy and convenience that a once business trip turned out to be one of the best family vacations we ever had. We thought because it had been around since the beginning of Disney that the decor and service would be just as dated; however we were extremely happy to discover the beautiful clean rooms, wonderful staff, and great location (just a short walk to the Disney parks and expo center). We absolutely loved our stay and will continue booking rooms here from now on!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us during the Natural Products Expo. Our proximity to the Convention Center as well as Disney is something that many do not realize. We do pride ourselves on the condition and ambiance of the property. The original Candy Cane Inn was established in 1957 and we are ever changing to meet and exceed our guest's expectations. We look forward in seeing you at next years Expo!

Summary Heading: Love It, Love It, Love It!!!!!
Summary: This is our second stay at this hotel and we have not a thing to add to all of the positive reviews, they say it all!!  It is FABULOUS!  We will only stay at this motel when in the area and recommend it to all!  Thanks Candy Cane Inn for a great, friendly, clean, up-kept  motel!!  It has always added to our vacation!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us a second time and please feel free to contact me directly when you would like to make future reservations. And do not forget to use your Rewards Certificate for an additional $10 off per night on your next stay. Warm regards!

Summary: HERE'S WHAT I DON'T LIKE ABOUT THE CANDY CANE INN:  Um... Um..., I can't think of anything. I found nothing lacking in great accommodations and excellent service.  HERE IS WHAT I ESPECIALLY LIKED:  THE FOLKS The great, friendly staff, every single member, just can't be beat.  Even the other guests staying at the Inn where good sorts. This makes sense since it's hard to be unhappy while staying here. I notice someone a few reviews down gave a bad one for the Candy Cane. They hadn't even stayed here yet! I see that the manager (he's super) has straightened that out and they will be staying after all. Too bad they had to jump the gun with a poor review. I have no doubt they'll love the Candy Cane.  LOCATION Perfect. Just a five to six minute walk to Disney's front gates. My family
Manager Response: Ladies and Gentlemen, you may not believe this but I have never met this gentleman. What he did say about speaking with me is correct and being a seasoned and concerned hotelier, I listened. I worked to get him a room at a more comparable rate as he was a loyal guest and wanted to stay again. To be honest in these economic times I do not blame him for reaching out. For this I thank him, as I do for staying with us and relaying all the kind comments about our hotel and team.

Summary: My family recently went to Disneyland and my sister highly recommended that we stay at the Candy Cane Inn. To sum it up, We couldn't have been more happy anywhere else. This Inn is one of a kind  the staff is very frienldy and very helpful. the manager Chris was just awesome he went over the call of duty in helping me arrange transportation to the Orange County Airport. If we ever get back to Disneyland. We wil be staying here again. Once again great job Candy Cane Inn Staff. Oh and be sure to use the shuttle to the park, the drivers are great too.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I will pass your kind comments on to Chris. He is our Front Office Manager who has recently joined the Candy Cane Inn team and believes in going above and beyond to ensure guest satisfaction. Please feel free to contact myself or Chris directly for reservation assistance.

Summary: Our family of 5 spent four nights at the Candy Cane Inn in a Premium Room.  Loved the premium room, loved the extra services, LOVED breakfast delivered to our door.  The maids are wonderful, the people who do the turn down service are wonderful and the bus drivers are wonderful.  We loved having a ride to Disneyland, that was excellent!  The hotel is beautiful and quiet (except for the fireworks from Disney - which are very loud!!!)  WE never heard anyone above us or around us.  Everything was perfect EXCEPT the safe!  (I saw the other review with the same complaint...so it wasn't just us) Called three times to have someone fix it.  All three times was told a manager would come to do it....guess what that never happened!!! THis was so annoying as we wanted to use the safe!!  A
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback and staying with us. I appreciate your kind comments and have discussed your concerns with our management team.  We do listen to our guests and have implemented additional training on our safes to eliminate frustration such as yours. Again, thank you for staying with us and we do value your business. Warm regards!

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn the night before leaving California. We had a mid-day flight and did not have a working alarm clock in our room, nor did we get our wake up call. Otherwise the room was clean, in a nice area, and was fine for what we needed.
Manager Response: I do appreciate your taking the time to share your comments regarding your stay. I am so very sorry and apologize that your alarm did not work nor did you receive your wake up call. I will share your comments with our management team and have these items researched. Once again thank you for staying with and we appreciate your feedback. Warm regards!

Summary: Our family of 5 adult's and 1 toddler stayed 4 night's last week. We were only planning on staying for 3 night's but decided we needed another day at Disneyland. We all had to move to one Premium room as  they were all booked for Saturday night. Two of the adult's went across the street to The Castle Inn, (yecchhh!)  Candy Cane is so much better! Candy Cane was very clean and comfy. Staff was only ok when checking in, but after that thing's went much better. The young lady working to arrange the Saturday night stay was very,very sweet. I hate that I am not sure about her name, Denise? (I'm bad with remembering name's, sorry!) She said she has been there 4 year's. She was working with another young girl, Sophia? Both had wonderful customer service. Shuttle driver's were great as
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and taking time to respond about your experience. Yes, Wendy is a very nice young lady and has a personality that is exceptionally warm and inviting. I know that she personally was trying to get a second room for you party. In regards to your check-in I am sorry that this was not as warm and inviting. I will personally speak with this associate as our first impression is most important. Thank you again and we look forward in seeing you again.

Summary: We are Disneyland Annual Pass Holder swho for the past 5 years have stayed at the Grand Californian Hotel.  We have heard many great things about the Candy Cane Inn from friends and travel associates so we thought wed break away from the Californian and try this little hotel in May for 9 nights.  First of all I tried to book a 9 night stay in one of the Premium rooms online but their booking engine was not working so I called the Hotel directly.  The lady with whom I spoke with and made the reservations with seemed very rushed and iritated that I had called.  I tried to make a request and she seemed very "put out" and seemed as if she didnt care.  This is not a good way to treat a future customer and I will be canceling my reservation and going back to the Disney Hotels where
Manager Response: I completely concur with your comments and service of this nature is not acceptable and will not be tolerated. I am very happy that after I responded to your email in a prompt and sincere manner that you have decided to keep your reservation at our Inn. Issues of this nature are very important and all that a General Manager can ask is that you bring your issue forward and given an opportunity to rectify the situation. I do thank your for the kind comments in the email as I DO strive to run a "higher than standard" operation. Warm regards and I look forward in meeting you in May!

Summary: Our first stay at CCI, we have always wanted to stay here....as avid travelers to Disneyland, we have stayed in 9 of the Disneyland area hotels.  First impression: Cute, cute, cute...and so quiet!!! Like a gem in the middle of a wild and crazy...theme area?  hehe.....no really, this place was so peaceful, walking around it was quiet..although the screams from California Adventure were just right enough to make us want to head off the Disneyland!! :)  Check in/front desk: Nice people, candy cane pens.  Even though the computers were frozen when we checked in they were still nice and got us up to our rooms quite quickly.  Gift shop: Very minimal, expected some more pool supplies...maybe they were just short of things this week.  Suggest you bring your own floaties/pool toys.  The
Manager Response: Thank you so much for all your kind comments and items that you gave feedback on. Our groundskeepers are great gentleman and I do appreciate they offered assistance with luggage...that is customer service! In regards to the WIFI, we do have throughout the guestrooms, pool area and the breakfast room. We would certainly appreciate any feedback on areas with connectivity as we continually add necessary access points to improve the service. Thank you again for giving us a try and feel free to contact me directly when planning your next trip as I would be delighted in assisting with reservations.

Summary: This was our first trip to Disneyland and our stay at the Candy Cane was excellent. It was very clean and the rooms were large and modern. The free breakfast was well stocked and was a great start to the day. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was very nice also. Our son loved the free wireless internet. The location was excellent and only a 5 minute walk from the park. I think the greatest compliment you can give hotel is that you would stay there again. We will stay at the Candy Cane next time we go to Disneyland. We have stayed many times at Disneyworld properties in Florida and I think the Candy Cane was nicer. Keep up the good work Candy Cane!
Manager Response: I am so happy that you enjoyed your first visit to the Disneyland Resort and our Inn. We do pride ourselves on being a friendly, clean and comfortable property offering exceptional guest service.  Thank you again for your business and feel free to contact me directly for assistance on making reservations.

Summary: This was our first stay at the Candy Cane Inn.  The location is great, an easy walk to the Park.  They have a shuttle every half hour as well.  The staff is very friendly.  Room was a tad small, however it was very clean and comfortable.  There is a basic breakfast every morning, cereal, donuts, bagels, fruit.  Perfect for a quick breakfast before heading to the park.  Overall, a great spot for a family trip to Disneyland.  The only negative is that they don't have high speed internet access, however most people staying there are on vacation so I guess its not that big a deal.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing the Candy Cane Inn and your comments on your first visit. We do have WIFI throughout our guestrooms, poolside and our garden room.  If you had connectivity issues I apologize as we are continually adding access points as we learn of any weak spots. In addition we are more than happy to print boarding passes or directions at the front desk for guests who travel without a laptop. Again, thank you for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel- Premium Room over rated
Summary: Our family of three- 8 year old daughter- stayed at the Candy Cane for a spring break trip to Disneyland and were generally pleased with the hotel. The staff were always helpful, though unaware of a discount ticket agency in the nearby mall, the shuttle was always on time and well used by us, the rooms clean and the pool area well kept and landscaped.   We opted for a premium room and while it came as advertised the value was debated by my wife and I as we walked past other rooms that had open doors and realized they are all very similiar- though the microwave was a bonus- and despite calls and visits to the front desk on three separate days we never did get our room safe reset for our stay.  The late check out was a bonus as we used that to do one more visit to Disneyland for
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing us this very valuable feedback. I sincerely apologize that your safe was not properly attended to as this is certainly not the customer service that we aspire to deliver.  Your concerns will be shared with our team as we certainly strive to provide 5's to all our guests. Thank you again and we do appreciate your business and comments.

Summary: Wow................these guys have been perfecting their act and now blow the competition out of the water. My wife and I always fly from northern CA to Disneyland at least once a year. This year we decided to drive any try to reduce the usual stress of airports and rental cars. This "Motel" offers an upgrade service which costs far less than ANY of the major hotels nearby and their customer service is second to none. With evening turn down service, in room breakfasts, a free timely shuttle and a a great staff, I won't ever stay anywhere else for my Disney trips. Hilton should drop the attitude and learn a lesson from these guys. The parking lot can sometimes get tight but the positives far outweigh walking a few spaces to your romm.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and your comments regarding our Premium Guestrooms. Many guests enjoy the additional features and services provided. Upgraded toiletries, arrival amenity, grind and brew coffee, microwave oven, DVD/VCR player with complimentary movies, bath robes, evening turndown service, the morning expanded continental breakfast delivered to the room and the 2pm check-out time. Yes, parking can be a little tight with so many folks driving SUV's and families however we do issue parking permits and monitor the lot. Again, thank you for your business!

Summary: We just returned from our second stay here and absolutely loved it!  We always arrive a day early just to relax and enjoy the heated pool and kiddie pool (I think that the kids liked swimming  almost as much as going to Disneyland!) Great for families with young children, the rooms have small refrigerators and it is directly next to a convenience store, so we were able to purchase and store milk and other snacks. The rooms are small but we were able to easily put up a portable crib and still have plenty of room.  I love the fact that it is a small hotel and after walking all day you do not have to walk another mile to get to your room.  The free shuttle and  breakfast were a great addition, we took advantage of both of these services daily!  We rented strollers in Disney so
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us for your second time, we do appreciate your business. We try and accommodate all guest requests as it pertains to room assignments. In regards to our Pool, Spa and Kiddie Pool they are heated year round for kids of all ages to enjoy. We do pride ourselves on the fact that we have no hidden fees and all you pay is room and occupancy tax. Our expanded continental breakfast, exclusive shuttle to the Disneyland theme parks and parking are all complimentary. Again, thank you for being a return guest and please feel free to contact me directly when making next years reservations.

Summary: The motel is very well maintained and professionally managed.    Danilo Gonzalez, Executive Housekeeper, personally went above and beyond expectations to promptly return via overnight courier some personal items we left behind in our room safe.  Outstanding service!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and posting your experience on Tripadvisor. Your comments regarding Danilo are most appreciated as he is one of a kind and a true gentleman. He manages our housekeeping department and is responsible for lost and found. He personally calls every guest that inquires about lost and found and goes the extra mile to make sure any forgotten items are returned promptly and safely. Warm regards!

Summary: We were only here one night but won't be returning.  The rooms were clean but the in room a/c unit is just too loud.  We found it very difficult to sleep.  The unit is right next to one of the beds and it makes a lot of noise.  No fault of the hotel, rude customers insist on using the "Beep" on their car alarms at all hours!  The rooms have outside entrances to the parking lot and some people are extremely inconsiderate of others!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I apologize for the lack of sleep you received at our Inn. In regards to the guests beeping their car alarms this is something that we all should be more respectful with. With an outside entrance hotel parking lot noise can be an issue as it pertains to light sleepers. I am sorry that your A/C unit was noisy and if at any time we are notified of such the unit is immediately changed out or we offer to move our guest. If you would like to return and let us restore faith your confidence please contact me personally.

Summary Heading: Loved it, loved it, loved it!
Summary: Great hotel. Next door to Disneyland and walking distance to the exbo centre. James on the front desk is a super star - When we arrived at 8.30am exhausted from Australia he said even if he disn't have a room ready (which he did) he would sort something out for us! He even fixed our travel adapter on another day. Great hotel in a great location. Hightly recommend and may James be replicated at all future hotels I stay at!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us and sharing your experience here. Our location to the Convention Center is something that many do not realize. We are about centrally located between there and Disneyland. James, what can I say about James, he epitomizes guest service and is our Candy Cane Inn ambassador!

Summary Heading: Our Choice Every Year - Always been just what we needed
Summary: We have been coming down to Disneyland for one long trip every year since 2006 and we have always stayed at the Candy Cane. So here is a brief summary of the experience of a family of four (with young children).   As others have pointed out: the grounds are beautiful; staff friendly and helpful; continental breakfast is good; the dedicated shuttle is excellent; and, it is close enough to walk to the parks. One bonus often overlooked is the 7-11 and mini-mart right next door. We have been able to get all kinds of useful things there (snacks and blankets for in the park and scotch & cold beer for after the park).  We have not had any problems to date but from the general behaviour of the staff expect that if we did it would be dealt with satisfactorily.  Yes the rooms are small
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and we appreciate your upcoming return visit. You are so very correct regarding the bonus of our location in regards to shopping and dining. The 7-11 and mini market next door are an added value to say the least. The arrival of the Anaheim Gardenwalk with their vast dining, entertainment and shopping selections is directly across the corner. Again, we thank you for your comments and business.

Summary Heading: Best Value for Closeness to Disney
Summary: Great location.  They have a shuttle but it was only a 7 minute walk for us to Disney even with a six year old so we only used the shuttle twice.  The continental breakfast in the morning is quite crowded but you can take food to your room.  It's very, very good but they would benefit by smaller tables and more of them.  The pool is pristine and quite warm.  The rooms are getting a little run down but it looks like they are starting to renovate them.  There's lots of places to eat down the block and there are two convenience stores next door.  It gets a little loud at night when everyone gets back from Disney and is going by your room to get to theirs but it is by far the best hotel in this location.
Manager Response: Yes, our location is great however we value our guest's feedback to continually improve. This being said we have recently added Bistro table and chairs poolside for the morning breakfast. Our pool, spa and kiddie wading pool are all heated year round for comfort and enjoyment. Thank you for taking your valuable time to share your thoughts and staying with us.

Summary: We loved, loved, loved the Candy Cane Inn. Very clean, crisp rooms. Nice pool and great location. Only a 5-7 minute walk to Disney (or shuttle service available every 30 minutes - during park hours).  Very friendly staff and ok breakfast selection (a little mundane if you are staying more than a couple of days). But other than the breakfast selection - the place is a perfect choice for a trip to Disneyland with the kids.   Oh, and if you need shuttle service to the hotel - we used Transtar and were very pleased. It is a private shuttle (no cramming onto a Blue shuttle), reasonably priced AND they offer free carseats for your kids to ride in during the transfer.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and I appreciate your comments. I too think that our staff is very friendly in assisting guests and keeping the property pristine. Again, thank you for your business and the time you took to share your thoughts.

Summary: I always read the various reviews with a grain of salt.  However, after spending four nights at the Candy Cane Inn with my wife and 2 boys, I can comfortably say that all the positive reviews are right on.   This was our second trip to the Los Angeles / Anaheim area (2/11-2/15/09).  Our last trip was 5 years ago.  This was our first time at Candy Cane Inn and everything about our stay was perfect.  The staff was outstanding, the rooms comfortable, and the shuttle service a great perk after a long day at the park (Please say hello to Fred, the shuttle driver).  Whenever our travels bring us back to Anaheim, we will definitely be staying at the Candy Cane Inn.
Manager Response: I appreciate your staying with us and value your feedback. Reviews are something that I take seriously as they prompt thought for ongoing improvements. We are moderately priced family hotel with an emphasis on quality, service, ambiance and friendliness. I have given your warm regards to Fred. He is a fine gentleman and a valuable part of our shuttle team. Thank you again and we appreciate your business.

Summary: My sister, her eighteen year old son, my fifteen year old son and I stayed at the Candy Cane Inn on January 31st.  We were in town so that the boys could go to a concert at the House of Blues in Downtown Disney.  This motel was the perfect location!  Easy walking distance to Downtown Disney, Disneyland, California Adventure and the Anaheim Garden Walk.  I usually stay at the Howard Johnson’s but decided on the Candy Cane because of it being between Downtown Disney and the Garden Walk which was perfect because my sister and I decided to see a movie at the Garden walk and it is really just about in the middle of Garden Walk and Downtown Disney.  After checking in we walked to Downtown Disney looked around at shops and Disney Hotels, walked back to room then walked to the Garden
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and please feel free to contact me directly should you need assistance in planning your next visit. Yes, the new Anaheim Gardenwalk is right across the corner from us and easily walking distance. Their array of stores and places for dining and entertainment is a fine addition to the Resort Area. Thank you again and warm regards!

Summary: Our previous Anaheim stays were either at Howard Johnsons or Residence Inn near the I-5 freeway. My husband and I decided to give Candy Cane Inn a try since we didn't have the kids with us. We enjoyed our stay. Our standard room was very clean. Though the hotel offered free shuttle, we walked the short distance to Disneyland. The free breakfast consisted of cereal, pastries, toast, milk, juice, etc was enough to get the morning started. The hotel offers free wi-fi which I took advantage of. Next time we're in town, we'll have to get a larger (premium) room for us and our kids. A standard room would be small for a family with three young kids.
Manager Response: Thank you for giving our Inn an opportunity on your most recent visit to Anaheim. I am delighted that you enjoyed our property and stay. Please contact me directly to plan your next visit as it would be my pleasure to provide you a complimentary upgrade to experience our Premium accommodations. We do appreciate your business and I look forward in speaking with you.

Summary: We decided to stay here based on the reviews and were not disappointed.  For 1/4 the price of staying within Disneyland, we were within a 15 minute walk of the Disneyland/California Adventure entrances--we only rode the shuttle if it happened to be there.  The grounds are lovely and the readily visible areas of the room were spotless.  We did find an old lollipop and shampoo containers under the bedskirts though, and as other reviewers have noted, outside noise is pretty readily heard (our room was on the 2nd floor so it wasn't too bad).  We weren't in the room enough to be bothered by it.  We ended up picking up breakfast items from the buffet and eating them in our room, because of the woefully inadequate space in the breakfast area and the cold weather outside, but this was
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing valuable feedback regarding your experience. I personally reviewed your comments with our housekeeping department and apologize for any inconvenience. Yes, we are a family hotel and the second floor is recommended for light sleepers. I am delighted to inform you that our new Bistro Tables and Chairs arrived today and this will increase our seating poolside. Thank you again and we look forward in seeing you again.

Summary Heading: Perfect Location for your Disneyland Trip
Summary: Just returned from two nights at the Candy Cane Inn.  Overall, it was a very positive experience.    The positives: The hotel is within an easy walking distance to Disneyland - although they also offer a free shuttle twice an hour (more about that in a minute....).   Definitely a good value at $129/night.  The room wasn't large, but certainly enough space for the three of us (two adults and a 14 year old boy).  There was also a microwave and a mini fridge in the room, which was very convenient since there is a mini-market next door.  They also offer a free continental breakfast every morning between 7:00-9:00.     The negatives:  VERY loud hotel.  From our room on the first floor you could hear cars pulling up and people entering and leaving their rooms, talking outside, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to let us know of your experience at our Inn. First and foremost I would like to apologize for our associates speaking loudly in the morning and will personally address with our housekeeping staff. In regards to our guests, this is a family hotel and children of all ages can become excited arriving and leaving the hotel. We are happy to place guests on the second floor if they are light sleepers. As for the rain, yes this does place a damper on enjoying your breakfast around the pool and with the birds and greenery. WIFI is something that we continually work on to enhance the signal with additional access points and appreciate your feedback. Thank you again for your comments as we continually work to improve all areas of our Inn.

Summary Heading: What a great location for going to Disneyland.
Summary: For those who gave this place a negative response, I'm really wondering why? The location was great for our Disneyland trip. It offers free shuttle to and from the park.  Although we didn't use it since the park is in walking distance . That was a key plus for us. I felt our room was nice, very clean. With exstremly soft beds. Which I loved. But if you like a harder bed you may not find it there. They have a pool that we would have taken advantage of but had forgotten our bathing suits. And it looked like the pool is heated. They do offer free rental of movies but only in the premier rooms. Which was a bit of a disappointment, but not a deal breaker. I would highly recommend this hotel, and will be coming back on our next visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments as well as staying with us. We do appreciate and sincerely listen to all comments that are provided. This perception is valuable and we must keep an open mind and respond to feedback.  We certainly do want to give the utmost of service and make our guests stay enjoyable. Yes, our pool, kiddie pool and spa are heated throughout the year for everyone's enjoyment. And please note if you bring your own VCR or DVD player we will let you borrow from our library of movies.

Summary: We stayed at this motel two nights in October.  While I thought it was a nice motel, it is just that, a motel.  I would put it on the same level as a very nice Best Western or Quality Inn. If I could rank it 3.5 in Trip Advisor, I would.  Better than 3 star, but not a 4 star.  The room and bathroom were very clean.  The carpet was fairly new, and the shutters were a nice touch.  The bathroom reminded me of my parents’ house – the vanity was the same layout as the bathrooms of the early 1960s.  Not updated, but the layout works well.    Breakfast was nice – plenty of food to eat (donuts, fruit, oatmeal – standard continental breakfast fare.)  The Inn also has gone above and beyond neighboring hotels by allowing free parking and a nice shuttle to Disney.  If you are staying within
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and taking time to post your comment on Tripadvisor. This feedback is valuable and helps in making modifications to services. In regards to our mattresses they are less than a year old and are a Double Pillow Top. We did extensive research prior to installing; however this tends to be an item that differs with preference.  We do pride ourselves in being a moderately priced Inn with an emphasis on service, quality and capturing the enjoyable surroundings of the property. Lastly, when booking with any discount we do ask that supporting documentation is presented at check-in. We look forward in seeing you again!

Summary: This was probably our 20th visit or so. We find it so convenient and the new remodel to the rooms was very nice.  I like the bedding much more than the old heavy comforters and huge decorative pillows.  The room was very clean and employees were always attentive and helpful. We LOVE the shuttle and the current driver is much more friendly and helpful than the driver we had in 2007. He was joking around with us.  The breakfast was nice to start of the day with, too.  The only problem my husband had was that he was looking for an onsite business computer to check out some email from work and they don't have one. I don't know if they have wifi, because he didn't have his laptop. However, they were willing to run off our boarding passes for us, which was very helpful.  They also
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your loyalty and taking your time for this valuable feedback. Mr. Lee, our new driver is very friendly and a good addition to our wonderful team. In regards to your comment, we do have WIFI throughout the property. For our guests who do not bring their personal computer the front desk is delighted to assist with directions or printing boarding passes. As to the Rewards Certificate you were presented with at check-out, these are a $10 per night savings on your next stay and can be used in addition to AAA or AARP discounts. Thank you again for your business, it is most appreciated.

Summary: After researching lodging for my husband's 60th birthday "Second Childhood Tour" at Disneyland, I chose the Candy Cane Inn based on the reviews and its proximity to the park.  We were very pleased.  Having the option to walk to/from Disneyland or take the hotel shuttle was perfect for our group, made up of seniors as well as young adults.  The rooms were nicely appointed, and the beds were quite comfortable.  Everything was first rate, including the plush towels.  As others have noted, the room provided for the continental breakfast is inadequate, and we had to bring our food back to our rooms, a minor inconvenience in the grand scheme of things.  We did have to deal with one "moody" person at the front desk who was less than helpful and seemed put out by our questions about
Manager Response: Thank you so much for choosing our hotel for this very special occasion. Age is only a number and thinking young keeps us young at heart! I am very sorry that you encountered one of our front desk staff that was "moody". This is totally unacceptable and if you would like to expand on the incident you may contact me personally. In regards to limited seating at breakfast, we have listened and taken action. We recently ordered Bistro tables and chairs that will arrive next week. Thank you again for your business and we look forward to your husband's 70th.

Summary Heading: The Candy Cane is definitely is as good as the reviews say it is
Summary: My 2 daughters, my sister and myself all stayed here the first part of February. It was my sister's first time to see Disneyland. My husband had business in Anaheim in July so we had to stay at a different hotel, but when we went to Disneyland then I knew when we came back we would stay at the Candy Cane Inn. We arrived earlier than 3pm, but our room was ready. We were on the second floor so the view was great. The room was very clean and everything in the room looked like new. All the staff there was very nice and pleasant to deal with. The bus driver even told us how nice the family that owns the Inn is to work for and some history on the Inn itself. The breakfasts were great and the even though the seating is limited, there was additional seating at the pool or bringing food
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments and staying with us. Our friendly staff attempts to allow any early check-in possible, if rooms are ready. And, yes we recently completed our entire guest room renovations. This included new wall coverings, carpeting, chairs, and the entire bedding package. We are blessed to have original owners that have been here almost 52 years. They understand that relationships are earned, developed and they certainly give their support and direction in maintaining this pristine property.

Summary Heading: I can't wait to stay here and see for myself!
Summary: I booked this hotel for my daughter and her best friend who were in town to see a concert and to celebrate their birthdays. In the comment area on the reservation form I noted that the girls were here to celebrate their 21st birthdays. When they checked into the room they discovered a card from the hotel and some delicious cookies. What a pleasant way to start their quick weekend. They really thought the room was nice and the hotel very "cute". I am looking forward to MY next trip to this area so I can enjoy a stay at this hotel. Thank you for making their stay a little more memorable.
Manager Response: Thank your for your business and the opportunity to be part of your daughter and her friends special weekend. I am so very happy that their 21st birthday celebration was a memorable one. Whenever your travel plans bring you to Anaheim contact me directly as I would be delighted in assisting you with reservations.

Summary Heading: Candy Cane Inn gets the thumbs up!
Summary: My husband and I took our 7 year old granddaughter to Disneyland for 5 days in late January.  Based on the reviews on Tripadvisor, we booked directly with the Candy Cane Inn, a premium room, with AAA rate = $153.00 per night.  I would agree with the majority of past reviewers that the property is well located, clean and very suitable for a family vacation.  Our breakfast in a basket was delivered each morning to our room, at the specified time, as per our nightly order sheet.  It was okay, certainly fine for our granddaughter, but repetitious after a few days, my husband went to Denny's while we slept in.  The hotel was only operating at 30% capacity, so it was very quite everywhere, certainly no crowds in the breakfast room, on the shuttle or in the pool.  On the weekend, there
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time and responding regarding your recent stay. We do value your feedback as we continue to strive for all 5's. Yes, this is a good time of year as the weather is normally good and the parks are quieter. Our brochures and website are currently being updated as we recently finished our guest room renovations. We did replace the comforters with a lighter and brighter bedding package. This softer feel coordinates well with our new wall covering, carpeting and chairs. In regards to your comment about fruit, we do offer apples and oranges in addition to bananas.

Summary: It was such a disappointment to stay at Candy Cane Inn. We were planning to stay at their Premium room for 4 nights, but ended up staying only one night. The room was not even close to luxury as they claim on the website. It's MOTEL.  The towels were so thin, one of them torn and bathtub had so much hair that wasn't draining water from shower. "Spa Quality" amenities were such a bad quality, I regret I didn't bring my own shampoo and soap. If we weren't so tired after such a long flight arriving from Australia with two small kids, we would have changed the accommodation right away. We told the front desk about the problem and they didn't seem to care at all.   We paid $200 for first night there, and next day we moved to Sheraton one block down Harbor Blvd. They were more than
Manager Response: First and foremost I would like to apologize for responding to this review late. I do read reviews on a daily basis and this must have arrived out of sequence. It was certainly not my intention to ignore, as I do appreciate and review all feedback provided. I wish that I was able to learn of your total displeasure while you were at the hotel, and I deeply regret that our front desk did not react in a manner that was suitable to you. Our intention is to give exceptional products and service to all our guests. Please rest assured that I will personally research your comments and take appropriate action. I do thank you for the time you took to write your review.

Summary Heading: First Disneyland trip for the Kids
Summary: We had friends stay at the Candy Cane Inn and they liked it so we gave it a try.  We found it to be very nice and clean.  The staff members are very nice and helpful and the rooms are nice and clean.  I really can't think of anything I didn't like about the hotel, It does get really crowded during breakfast.  They serve a good breakfast too.  Its close to everything and you can walk to Disneyland in about 5 min and they have a bus that goes back and forth all day long.   It was a very nice trip.  Also you need your own transportation to the airport but they know of a few company's for you to call.
Manager Response: We thank you for staying with us and are pleased that your first stay was enjoyable. I also thank your friends for recommending our Inn as we all respect and trust a friend's referral. Word of mouth is strong and we continually work to build strong relationships.

Summary: What an excellent place to stay!  Myself, my husband and our 6yr old stayed here while visiting Disneyland during the Christmas break.  We stayed for 3 days, then went down to San Diego for 4 days, then came back for 2 more days. Sitting here writing this review, I think back to our stay there and I have a big smile on my face. The room we had was big, had supercomfy beds with so many pillows that I didn't know where to put them all, pull apart trays to place your suitcases on, a mini fridge, a free safe, and many other amenties.  The grounds were spotless and all the gardens bright and well maintained. There was free parking and that was a huge bonus considering almost all the other hotels in the area charged for parking.  Breakfast was included and what a lot of choices to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to reflect on your recent stay at our Inn. I am so happy that we were able to make your stay so enjoyable that you smile when you think about it. Regarding your comment on free parking that is something that we like to stress is that at our hotel you only pay room and tax. We do not charge for our parking, exclusive shuttle, expanded complimentary continental breakfast and we do not have any other "fees".  James and all of our front desk agents are delighted in assisting with rental cars, tours, transportation and other needs. Your comment regarding our maintenance staff is appreciated as we strive to maintain our property in pristine fashion. Please feel free to contact me directly regarding assistance for future reservations as it would be my pleasure.

Summary: We chose the Candy Cane Inn after reading the reviews here, and we were thrilled with the choice. Somehow I expected it to be a small hotel, but, upon arriving, I realized it was a mid-sized hotel with a high-class standard.  We arrived after a long day's drive. After check-in we jumped into the delightfully warm pool and soaked in the clean hot tub. Immediately we made new friends who shared tips about dining and Disneyland. The people in this hotel are so friendly -- from the staff to the guests! It is very family oriented, and our preschooler loved the little wading pool.  The hotel bus taking us to Disneyland was great. It wasn't always on time -- sometimes it was 10 minutes late -- but hey, such is life.   The bus leaves every half hour, and it didn't take us long to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to respond regarding your recent stay at our Inn. We are extremely honored to have loyal and repeat guests that actually make our first time visitors feel comfortable, welcome and at home. In regards to our shuttle, first and foremost I must apologize if you were not informed that the shuttle will actually leave early for the scheduled run (if full) and then return immediately back to the hotel and make another run to the park. As to our WIFI, I thank you for the input. We continually make adjustments and add access points to improve service that is sometimes interrupted due to our location and the park. It would be my pleasure in assisting you with future reservations and you can feel free to personally contact me.

Summary: Everything about this hotel is perfect!! I learnt what it was like to be posh for 2 nights!! Rooms very comfy and clean! Free breakfast was amazing with lots of choice. Very close to Disneyland easy walking distance but if you're feeling lazy there is a complimentary bus. Guys on the front desk were lovely, loved everything about this stay! If I were to return to Anaheim I wouldn't stay anywhere else.but here!!
Manager Response: I am certainly pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us at our Inn. Should you be returning to Anaheim you may contact me directly for reservations assistance as it would be my pleasure. Thank you again and warm regards!

Summary: We stayed at Candy Cane Inn from December 28, 2008 to January 2, 2009 while visiting Disneyland.    We loved our stay!  The room was clean, beds were comfy.  The grounds were beautiful.  Fridge in the room was handy.  This hotel is in a great location for visiting Disneyland, just a quick 10 minute walk to the entrance.   We took advantage of the free breakfast and were very pleased with what was offered.  We definitely filled up and had a great start to our day.  The breakfast room is very small and if the weather had been warmer it would have been very nice to sit outside to enjoy breakfast, which I'm sure is done during warmer times.  We never had a problem getting  a table since we were down for breakfast when it began so we could get to the park early.  The free breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the kind comments regarding your stay at our Inn. We get many positive comments about our new Double Pillow top Mattresses. They are a Presidential Suite and manufactured by Serta. Our guests, young and young at heart enjoy the basket of candy canes and our candy cane pens at the desk even have peppermint scented ink.

Summary Heading: No complaints with candy cane & so convenient
Summary: Our family of 2 adults and 2 children stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for 4 nights in a double/double room.  The room wasn't exactly  huge, but there was a good sized tea/coffee making bench area with underbench cupboards for storage.  Being that we didn't spend much time in the hotel room, it wasn't much of an issue.  There was room to move around the room and there were 2 chairs and a table.  Breakfast was included in the price, which we brought back to our room to eat each day.  It wasn't a huge menu - donuts, muffins, toast, cereal and some fresh fruit and juice.  The kids enjoyed the pool during some quiet time which wasn't too busy.  The best thing about the candy cane was it's proximity to Disneyland.  It really was an easy 10-15 minute walk along a nice tree lined pathway.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing us with your feedback regarding your stay at our Inn. I am pleased regarding your comment on price value compared to other hotels on your California visit. We strive to provide an exceptionally well maintained property and sincere customer service while maintaining moderate rates. Thank you for again for your comments, they are most appreciated.

Summary: Although the rooms might be a bit smaller, they were immaculately clean and comfortable.  The vanity area was huge and separate from the bathroom and fit our family with three women wonderful!  You don't spend a lot of time in your room anyways but they were always done up perfect when we returned.    The property makes you feel you are tucked away & nestled in the trees, very nicely landscaped and secluded, not like some of the bigger chains.  Everything is close, e.g. pool & breakfast area.  The staff were extremely friendly and helped me immediately to confirm tour reservations, etc.  There are even laundry machines on site if you need to do a load or two.  The pool was warm the first night the girls went in but somewhat cooler on the second evening.  Hot tub was very hot.
Manager Response: I am happy that we were able to provide you the hospitality and comfort that you certainly deserve when traveling. Our in-house gardeners are busy gentleman in keeping the feel of the property warm, cozy and serene. In addition to the restaurants you noted, the new Anaheim Gardenwalk, provide many eateries and shopping. This is an easy five minute walk across the corner from the hotel. Thank you for staying with us and we do appreciate your taking time to provide us with valuable feedback.

Summary: We really liked the Candy Cane Inn.  The location was perfect if you are going to Disney Land & California Adventure.  We walk a lot so we only used the Shuttle Bus once, but the driver was very polite, professional and nice (older Asian gentleman.. I wish I knew his name). The room was comfortable and clean.  We had a basic room on the second floor.  Housekeeping did a nice job each day cleaning the room.  Sure it would have been nice to have an elevator, but it's only two floors so it's totally manageable. I think the only complaint with the Candy Cane Inn would be what many others have said:  The breakfast area is way too small.  Seating is for 16 people only and with those 16 seated and everyone else trying to squeeze around all the bodies to get food was tough, but you
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding Mr. Lee, our driver, our housekeeping staff and Dorothy, our Night Auditor. We certainly appreciate this feedback and I am personally happy that genuine care and concern is displayed to our guests. We are currently looking at ways to increase seating capacity for breakfast. In regards to luggage assistance, please ask the front desk as it is our pleasure to have one of our staff assist. Again, thank you for staying with us and we appreciate your business.

Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights in December to visit Disneyland. Easy walking distance to the parks but we used the shuttle a few times if we happened to time it right. Driver (think he was originally from Iran) was very friendly and interested in hearing about the Queen and Prince Charles! (not that we know them personally!) Pool was warm, even though weather was cold. Ample selection and quantity at breakfast although agree that not much space to sit and eat at peak times but we just took food back to our room with no problem (just needed to remember to bring the tray from the room!) . Beds very comfy. Room very clean and quiet. Free parking. Overall exceeded our expectations for a motel-style inn. Definitely good value for money and a nice place to stay. Would recommend it to others.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time and writing this review. We appreciate our guest's feedback as we strive to be a 5 in all areas. I will pass on your kind comments to Robert, our shuttle driver as associates appreciate this too.

Summary: The good bits:  a) Shuttle service to disneyland is good b) Landscaping is good c) Free fast internet  d) Clean and Tidy  The bad bits:  a) Room was claustrophobic. Very non holiday/ non disneylandish b) Breakfast was meagrely spread. c) Breakfast area is so tiny it gets embarassingly crowded. No place to even stand, forget about finding a seat. If you find a seat, no one cleans the table mess for you that was created by the previous occupant. Cleaning was 'do it yourself'. If you dont find seating and consider taking your breakfast to your room, there is a unfriendly sign that says, dont take food to your room (as if guests will sell the excess food in Disneyland).  d) Spa jets pressure was very weak. Half the jets were had no pressure.  e) The early morning cleaning lady makes
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time and sharing your thoughts. Your comments are most appreciated and certainly listened to. We value our guest's feedback, therefore have recently installed 32" LCD HDTV's in all of our Premium Rooms in addition to our upgraded DVD/VCR players. We do provide a library of complimentary movies for guest convenience. I do apologize if you took the sign in our Garden Room as unfriendly; however we have trays in all guestrooms and encourage their usage. It is only noted to refrain from taking and leaving uneaten food in guestrooms to prevent insects while promoting a clean and fresh smelling environment. One last note, guestroom armoires have mini fridges and safes for guest convenience.

Summary Heading: I still love the Candy Cane...
Summary: Passed another great stay at the Candy Cane over Halloween weekend, and was struck once again by how hard they try to provide quality service.  The shuttle is invaluable; It's always on-time and the drivers are nice, knowledgeable, dependable guys.  I like arriving for a stay and seeing familiar faces!    When I arrived on Halloween night, the desk staff gave me a candy bar and offered to haul my bags up to my room for me.  Continental breakfast was good, as usual.  It was very pleasant to eat my bagel poolside on a lovely, warm morning.  When I checked out, I was presented with a ten-dollars-per-night discount certificate to use anytime over the coming year.    THANK YOU again for a wonderful experience.  After over eight years, I still wish I could move in permanently.
Manager Response: We are pleased that you encountered another great stay at our Inn. We are so very fortunate to have a staff that enjoy their work, this hotel and choose to stay with us. When traveling this is important as you feel more at home when you encounter familiar faces. Thank you again and be sure to use the Rewards Certificate, and remember this $10 discount is over and above the best rate...even if you have AAA or AARP.

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn Dec. 14-16, 2008 in a Standard 2-Queen Room. This was our first stay at this property. We booked through the hotel directly, and using our AAA discount received a rate of $102.00 per night, which was very competitive with other properties on Harbor offering fewer perks.   We arrived well before check-in, at about 10:30 am, and were provided with a parking pass and a shuttle pass to use until our room was prepared. The grounds are fabulous, a garden setting, with tropical plants everywhere and a cobbled drive. Very pleasant to be in, as opposed to a typical parking-lot exterior. That being said, parking was conveniently in front of the rooms, and readily available during our stay.   The shuttle drivers were a wonderful older gentleman and a sweet
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments regarding our guest rooms, property appointments, services and most importantly our family of Candy Cane Inn employees. James, at the front desk is our long term expert on the hotel and things to do and places to go while visiting. Mr. Lee, our shuttle driver is truly a welcome addition to the team and an ambassador of the hotel. We look forward in seeing you again and wish you a very Happy Hew Year!

Summary Heading: Could see Disneyland Fireworks from our bed!
Summary: Husband and I stayed for 4 nights from Monday Dec 8 - Fri Dec 12. They accommodated our request for a quiet room away from the pool. Having no elevator to the 2nd floor is not too convenient for international travellers with lots of heavy bags at the end of a three week trip, but we are fit and strong and managed. Someone less physically able should request a room on the lower floor. The walls are also very thin and we could hear the unbridled glee and giggling of a child in the room next door for an extended duration. The bed was the softest we have ever slept on and we will attempt to purchase one now that we have returned to Australia. We could also watch the Disneyland fireworks from our room (in fact, from our bed!) each night we didn't stay for them in the park, which is
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to give us feedback on your recent stay, it is most appreciated. We certainly will assist any guest with luggage and offer should our desk agents see large bags. In regards to our mattresses, they are a Serta Double Pillowtop  Mattress. I would be happy to provide you with the product information. Please feel free to contact me directly at jeffholl@candycaneinn.net as it would be my pleasure to assist you or any of our guests.

Summary: Our family stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for 3 nights in September for our Disneyland trip.  There was remodeling being done, but we hardly even noticed.  The front staff was very accommodating in getting my 88 year-old Grandmother a ground level room, for which we were very grateful.  In all, our party had 3 rooms (6 adults, 3 small children).  The rooms were very clean, with plenty of towels, comfortable beds and bedding.  At times it felt a bit cramped, but that can happen when you are traveling with small children and all of their stuff.    Our children LOVED the kiddie pool...and we loved the hot tub (it was actually hot which isn't always the case at some hotels).  Soaking in the hot tub after a long day at Disney is highly recommended.  The complimentary breakfast was
Manager Response: I am so very happy that your Grandmother was able to enjoy a visit with her family at our Inn. Our hotel is built around many families and their ability to enjoy themselves at a place that they feel comfortable and call "home" with a staff that is caring and genuine. We thank you for your business and wish you the happiest of holidays!
