Summary: I was going to this hotel because I was going to Disney World/California Adventure. I had the biggest feeling this hotel was going to be really bad. When i got there it was the complete opposite. In the lobby there was a shop where you could buy drinks, food... The rooms were cozy and humble, I used to order the continental breakfast in the room while watching T.V, It was beautiful. I am a guy who likes big expensive resorts in the pacific or  Caribbean or places people would love to go to but this hotel is an exception. It felt like home. Coming back in December 2008!!!
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your comments. We strive to maintain the "cozy and quaint" feel of a small and comfortable Inn, while providing exceptional guest service. We do look forward in seeing you this month and if you need reservation assistance please feel free to contact me directly.

Summary Heading: Sweet stay at the Candy Cane
Summary: We recently stayed at the Candy Cane Inn because the Disneyland Hotel was booked.  We love the ambience of the Disneyland Hotel  although the staff are not the "happiest" people on earth.  Anyway, we choose the Premium rooms for the extra amenities and the space.  We had adjoining rooms but not connecting rooms as requested.  I always have difficulty having my requests for connecting rooms honored so this was only a minor inconvenience.  We were absolutely thrilled with the rooms.  The beds were very comfortable, the rooms clean, the little extras were a lot of fun including breakfast delivered to our room in the morning.  Easy parking, easy shuttle.   My sister also wanted to make a point about how professional and friendly the staff was.  She worked in the hotel and resort
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking valuable time to share comments on your recent stay. Our associates appreciate feedback regarding guest's stays as this gives them praise as well as honest perception from our guests. Our Premium Guestrooms are something that "once you try them" you will most likely request on your next visit. Thank you again for staying with us!

Summary: We stayed at the Candy Cane Inn for a couple of nights while we were visiting Disneyland.  The rooms were clean and nicely kept up.  Breakfast consisted of the standard continental breakfast choices - fruit, pastries, bagels, cereal.  The location can't be beat if you're visiting Disneyland.  It was a less than ten minute walk to the main gates.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay at the Candy Cane Inn.

Summary: Due to availability, our party of six chose to spend one night in two standard rooms and three nights in connecting deluxe rooms. For an additional $10 per night per room, we got not only the convenience of a connecting door, but more storage space, including a discrete closet (the standard room did not have a closet per se, just an alcove next to the vanity) and a larger vanity area, which came in very handy when making sandwiches and other simple meals. The rooms were clean and very comfortable, and the hotel as a whole was surprisingly quiet, despite the higher occupancy over the Veteran's Day weekend. The continental breakfast was terrific, and the twice-hourly shuttles a godsend. The combined heater/airconditioner worked very well, and the shower offered very good pressure,
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and are happy that your stay was pleasant. We do strive to maintain a clean and comfortable Inn for our guests. The availability of the connecting doors in many of our deluxe and premium guestrooms is something that many families travelling with families enjoy. Again, Thank you for your comments.

Summary: Close to Disney, this motel style style accommodation is brilliant for families who want to be near Disney without paying the high prices of the nearby Disney Hotels. We had parking for our rental cars and nearby amenities such as restaurants and the 7 eleven next door proved that this was our most perfect choice for our 4 day stay in Disney.  It only takes about 10 minutes to walk to the main gates of Disney. If you are expecting room service and fancy meals, don't come here. The breakfast bar is busy in the morning and very minimal in terms of variety - just right though for your sugar coated day ahead in the park!  The swimming pool was a hit with the kids and very safe. There is a reasonably priced laundry for you to catch up on the chores.   The rooms we had were basic and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time and responding regarding your recent visit to the Candy Cane Inn. We do pride ourselves in providing an exceptional facility at moderate prices. We continually strive to improve our service and I sincerely apologize and appreciate the feedback. I will personally speak with our security gentleman that was less than friendly.

Summary: We spent five days at the Candy Cane Inn in October.  This was our fifth stay at this property, and we keep coming back.   Typically we go to Disneyland once a year with our friends and family.  This past time there were eleven of us total.  The staff is always courteous and quick to offer advice.  They were willing to check all of us in online for our return flight as a courtesy.  The rooms are small, but they are extremely clean and the housekeeping staff does an outstanding job.    The Candy Cane Inn offers a free continental breakfast.  This is a fantastic way for families with kids to keep their food budget at a minimum.  The kids are more than happy with the cereal and bagels, and the adults are happy with the ever-flowing supply of coffee.  Next door to the property is a
Manager Response: We thank you for being one of our "family" of return guests to the Candy Cane Inn. I appreciate your kind comments regarding our team of service professionals, they are a supurb team. Our associates get as excited as many of our guests in welcoming them back "home" for their vacation to the "happiest place on earth". We look forward in seeing you again and wish you a happy holiday season.

Summary: We arrived early on our first day of our stay and planned to just park our car in the hotel so that we can walk to the Disneyland Park.  After telling the staff at the counter our intention, he told us the room is ready and we could check in early.  He was polite and efficient.  The room was very clean and the hotel environment was beautiful.  The shuttle bus service to and from Disneyland allows us to travel back to our hotel in the afternoon for a rest. Our stay in Disneyland was very enjoyable partly because of the excellent service from the Candy Cane Inn.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent a week at the Candy Cane Inn at the end of October, and had a wonderful time.  Friendly, happy staff help make this place great. Rooms are clean and tidy, beds are comfy.  Breakfast was fine considering it was free.  Easy walk to Disney, or take their bus. Hotel was quiet even through there were lots of families. pool area is ok. Lots of restaurants very handy, try Bubba Grump and Cheesecake factory, yum,yum.  Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone, much, much nicer than most in the same price range.  We had a fabulous time and hope to return one day.
Manager Response: Thank your for your comments regarding your stay at the Candy Cane Inn. We too are very excited in the new Anaheim GardenWalk and the many exciting restaurants and stores. There is even bowling and a theatre for the family to enjoy. The best thing is that its right across the corner and an easy 10 minute walk. Many options to enhance your stay without driving or utilizing transportation.

Summary: Second time for the Candy Cane Inn for us. We loved it as always. We were able to check in early. They were redoing the finish on some of the furnitue or repainting the rooms. The smell was a little intense when we first walked in room 274, but quickly dispersed as soon as we turned on the air conditioner and bathroom fan. This hotel is so homey, you never feel you are in the city. While in the room at times we left our door open for fresh air etc... Our first morning we were up earlier than the breakfast started, but the staff let us go in anyway. For a continental breakfast, it is fresh, organized, and lovely. The fruit was truly fresh, not bruised or left over looking. plenty of choice, bagels, danish, toast, oatmeal, cereal, fruits, coffee, tea, hot choc, juice.It would be
Manager Response: none

Summary: Once you arrive and drive into the courtyard, the noise and traffic in the area seem to disappear.  It's amazing how relaxed our family was within the "compounds" of the Candy Cane Inn.  The rooms were very well done, nothing too fancy, but clean and modern.  Loved the plantation blinds and bedding!  Who needs fancy when most of your time will be spent at the parks or in the pool.  There was plenty of food for breakfast, and that was a big selling point.  We had stayed previously at the Embassy Suites South and though it was nice, the breakfast lines were frustrating.  The Candy Cane Inn shuttle was a huge bonus, and the drivers were very friendly and seemed to really enjoy their job.  The Front Desk was very kind and courteous!  The grounds crew and kousekeeping were also very
Manager Response: none

Summary: I love going to Disneyland, but hadn't found a place to stay that I believe provided good value but was also conveniently located to the park.  I've stayed at the Grand California -- nice, but pricey for what you actually get in the room and it's still a bit of a walk to the park and other, "good neighbor" hotels that were either too far or down right dumpy and dirty.  Well, I was very pleasantly surprised by how clean and bright my Candy Cane Inn room actually was.  The entire staff was also very kind and welcoming.  When we arrived midafternoon, a nice gentleman gave us a ride to the park in the van.  The rest of the time we walked because it was so close or took the property's shuttle bus.  The breakfast was OK too.  The staff also realized it was my daughter's and my
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stay at the Cany Cane Inn on a regular basis ( at least 3-4 times annually) and are never disappointed! The staff is friendly and honest! ( I have twice left things behind in my room and had them mailed to me.) I have two small children and they call this place their Disneyland home! We love it and continue to come year after year. Comfortable beds and a yummy breakfast are just a couple of reasons we keep coming back to the Candy Cane. Comparable pricing and just a short walk or ride on their complimentary shuttle is great after a long day at the park. I have stayed at several other anaheim hotels before we found the Candy Cane and now we don't stay anywhere else! In fact we are returning this week for another stay and looking forward to it ! Yay! Candy Cane Inn here we
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Value, Great time
Summary: Candy Cane Inn is truly a hidden gem.  It is a locally owned hotel with all the perks of the major chains.  The rooms were charming and the beds with the down comforters were SO comfortable.  I was pleasently surprised by the choices at breakfast. Bagels, toast, baked goods, cereals and fruit. The staff was very friendly and very helpful.  They recommended a locally owned mexican place across the street that had really good food for really cheap!  The shuttle to disneyland was very convienent, but if you wanted to you could easily do the 10 minute walk.  The place was very well located, clean, and quiet.  In the end I need a comfortable bed, clean sheets and a good breakfast.  Candy Cane Inn definatly provided that and more.  I truly couldn't find one thing to complain about and
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I travel at least 3 times a year and expect our hotels to be comfortable for the expense...and the Candy Cane did not disappoint.  We stayed in a Premium room, based on the other reviews and received EVERYTHING promised. We only used the shuttle once because it was at the front entrance on our way to the Park. The walk only takes 10 min.  We used the pool one day and no one else was around. The weather was hot and the pool was relaxing and cooling.  The grounds are well kept and my wife loved the vines and flowers that adorned the grounds. I loved the daily paper and the breakfast to the room in the morning. The Staff was very friendly and assisted us with any questions we had. We have stayed in one other hotel along this strip, but will return to the Candy Cane
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place was way too small. The pool was too small as well. The service was not there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Last time we stayed at Disneyland, we chose the Annabella and weren't very happy (too far from the park, noisy, didn't give us adjoining rooms we requested). This time, we decided to try the Candy Cane Inn based on reviews from TA.   Pros: The rooms were nicer than I expected. It was much quieter than the Annabella had been (though this may vary from night to night). I liked being able to see DCA from our balcony. The breakfast looked pretty good - we just grabbed muffins and coffee on our way to the park. We walked to the park every time, never took the shuttle.   Cons: The rooms were very small. I don't know if we could stay in a room that small if our kids were any bigger (we have 2 kids under 10 and it was a bit of a squeeze). The pool was very over-chlorinated and my kids
